title: Noisy
comment: I stay frequently at Belvoir Hotels due to my job. I found this hotel in need of renovation. The carpet in my room was stained and needed replacement. There were constantly kids running up and down the hallway on the 3rd floor and the room was recommended to be quiet when we checked in. In the adjoining room there was constant barking from a dog! I don't know why Belvoir would allow dogs on the 3rd floor, or why someone would take their pet to Disneyland? I will not be staying at this property again! Even though I am complaining about the property, the staff were great! Kudos to them!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't let the negative reviews scare you away from this hotel.
title: Why the negativity?
comment: I was nervous about staying here after the negative reviews. Erika checked us in very friendly. Both elevators worked, we had a suite on floor 14 the side were you supposedly can hear the hwy did not hear any noise everyone talked about. Room very clean, restaurant very good,fitness center clean plenty of towels. We had a great week here.

title: Great Hotel with a little disappointment
comment: The hotel was great. Only disappointment was the Concierge person. Unkind and no smile. Her attitude was rude, so it was difficult to trust the information that she has given.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor registration process. Took me 45 minutes just to check in.
title: Business Trip
comment: Waited 45 minutes to check in and then the clerk gave me keys that didn't work. When I went back to the front desk, he told me to get back in line. I refused. Waiters in restaurant seemed to want me to move on more quickly then I was ready. There was trash in the hallway and room was average, at best.

everyoneShouldKnow: Visit south street, 10 mins walk from the hotel
title: Loved it
comment: I ended up staying here because it was so close to so man my things to do in Philly like historical attractions like the liberty bell and also close to a hot spot like south street! The hotel was very nice, very neat, and the fitness center was in great condition and had very good equipment! I'll definitely stay here again, also the staff was very helpfull!!

title: wish list
comment: I know that you are trying to meet the needs of many different travelers. I do wish you didn't offer pornogrophy for viewing.

everyoneShouldKnow: The ease of getting into and out of Manhattan.
title: Customer Service
comment: Daphne at the front desk did an exceptional job. She went above and beyond to let us know about hotel services and details that made our stay stress-free and memorable.

title: Can't recommend
comment: My wife and I have never been so sleep deprived on a vacation. With no air conditioning, we are forced to sleep with the windows open. But it is SO noisy outside your facility, earplugs AND the pillow wrapped around my head did nothing to stem the on-going street noises. I am a Grandbourne Vacation owner, and I will never again stay at your facility. Just terrible.

title: Perfect Place To Stay
comment: Amy Bennett and her staff are great to work with. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quality stay.

title: This hotel has great staff
comment: The hotel staff were great, as were the accommodations.

title: Great Breakfast, great location but that's about it
comment: Room wasn't available at checkin, still being cleaned. Get in room and their is mold in tub ( obviously not cleaned very well). Room has two beds- one rock hard mattress (the floor was softer). I reserved the room for 4 people yet EVERYDAY I had to ask for more towels as they only put 3 in each day. Elevator is about the slowest I have ever seen!!! There is ONE dryer and ONE washer for the entire hotel( there are 14 floors) needless to say it was NEVER open. (we were there for over a week) Front desk staff was hit or miss, some were great others were down right rude. Suggestions would be to have a hotel guest parking lot and one for the conference rooms as every night they had something going on at the hotel and I as a paying guest had to park pretty much in the car lot next door each night. BUT the breakfast was delicious and location (close to a ton of restraunts, mall, major freeways) was great!

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has modern amenities and staff is very professional.
title: Nice Hotel
comment: This hotel has modern amenities and staff is very professional.

title: Great Conference & Great Hotel
comment: The Belvoir Chicago Hotel & Towers exceeded my expectations for the four days I called it home during a recent conference. Kudos to hotel management for a beautiful facility, outstanding staff, and an overall professional operation. I'm looking forward to a return trip in the near future.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's not worth the price stay somewhere else with cheaper rates, bigger rooms, and more free amenities
title: Very Disappointing
comment: The pool was not working. We had made arrangements over the phone over the course of a week to make sure hotel would use credit card on file but when I got there they said u was given the wrong information. For the price of the room there should have been some type of free breakfast instead it was average cost of 22.00 per person as was quoted to me over the phone from room service. Friday and Saturday night the bar closed early according to listing in my room. However, when I called to double check I was told bar closes at 1:30am went down at 12midnight approximately 5 minutes after my phone call and was informed the bar was closed. After that I barely stayed in the room parking was not convenient after a certain point in the night and it proved easier and more relaxing to stay elsewhere. Just was not worth the price and I will never recommend.

title: The ONLY place I'd stay!
comment: SMC is like my home away from home. The staff make you feel like you've arrived at home; they make you feel like you are the most important guest they've had all year-on every stay. I love this hotel-it is warm and inviting, the rooms are always well maintained, and the hotel maids welcome you each day like family. This trip my stay was in the Andrew Jackson Suite-so lovely! This hotel is my answer to any kind of travel to Nashville.

everyoneShouldKnow: location is superb. staff is friendly and remembers returning guests.
title: warm welcome after long absence
comment: I came to NYC for a weekend after months away. The hotel management remembered me in-person from many frequent stays over past years. Less than an hour after checking-in, a bottle of wine, and a bowl of fruit were sent to my room along with a hand-written note from Kenny - the manager on-duty. Talk about warm hospitality from a big NYC hotel.

title: Customer Service at its BEST!
comment: Out of everything that was excellent, I really feel the need to mention Miriam at the front desk. Her welcoming attitude and assisting suggestions were priceless during our overnight stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location for shows and tourist attractions.
title: Handy Location
comment: I stayed at the hotel for the conference I attended in July. The proximity to everything I wanted to see was a great bonus. Shows, proximity to Times Square, subway 5th Ave. made the visit fun.

everyoneShouldKnow: Across the street from the convention center
title: Good hotel in practical location
comment: First room we checked into was dirty and refrigerator was not cleaned out from previous guest. Manager gave us another room, again a dirty refrigerator. Except for an apology no accommodation was offered for this major inconvenience which as a platinum member I would have expected.

title: Mixed feelings
comment: -Place was clean but really worn out from use.

title: Disappointed
comment: My family and I were attending a wedding in Raleigh and decided to turn it into our first family vacation and do it in style. Staying at a Belvoir seemed to be a good start. The staff was very friendly, helpful and professional and the 1st and 2nd floor of the hotel are nice. The rooms are an absolute disappointment and over-priced. We had to have the exhaust fan fixed, the windows are cloudy and didn't seal properly so they leaked air and water. The carpet needs to be professionaly cleaned. The window ledge had water damage and we had to keep our 1 yr old from picking at it and eating the paint. After we checked in, we found out that you will be nickle and dimed to death. All of these are indicators that this hotel has seen it's best days behind it and is headed downhill. The other hotel we stayed at, for a cheaper price, was far better than this hotel. I feel bad for the hard working staff at this location.

title: Castle
comment: I like the value and location. Staff is very helpful. However, mechanical problems and the time to repair were annoying.

title: This Hotel was not very accomodating
comment: From the time I arrived at 4:00PM the room was not ready. The parking was horrible and I couldn't find a space in the hotel parking garage but still paid to park. I would not stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is not downtown, but the $1.00 shuttle makes it well worth it! The views are excellent.
title: Fantastic Weekend
comment: I checked my husband and I in for his 57th birthday weekend getaway. We loved the hotel and everyone was so helpful and kind.

title: God awful Hotel
comment: Other than the front desk staff, this hotel was a nightmare!

title: Exceeded Expectations!
comment: The Read definitely made my family feel at home. Spacious rooms, plus a dash of nostalgia , made our stay very enjoyable. We most assuredly will add this to our travel spots in the future.

title: Trip into the City!
comment: We stayed at this facility for the weekend (2 nights). The hotel and room were very clean and nicely appointed. The staff was very helpful and courteous.

everyoneShouldKnow: Small pool and small hot tub.
title: Small Pool & Hot Tub
comment: The hotel is clean and comfortable. The pool and hot tub appear like they have been cut in half. They are both small, especially the hot tub that is very narrow and only holds 4 people. We had many people from our group staying at this place for a wedding, the location of the wedding was barely outside the 5 mile radius of their shuttle use. Despite the fact the shuttle was always sitting unused they were not willing to take us to and from the wedding location...yet we gave them a ton of business that weekend. No free breakfast, only a menu or $12 buffet. If you don't care about either of those complaints then the hotel is an okay place to stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Will meet all your expectations for a reasonable price.
title: nice area
comment: Everything was great, only little complaint was the A/C system in the room blew out pretty hard on you while in bed. Would stay again. The view from some rooms and the restaurant are fabulous. Good location. Staff friendly, everything clean. Suites were roomy and nice kitchen area.

title: This hotel is not what I expected
comment: Unfortunately we were not happy with the

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful views of the Chicago River and easy walking distance to Lake Michigan.
title: Nice hotel, but......
comment: Accommodations were very nice and location is great. We had serious issues with the elevators where groups of people were literaly waiting in line to go upstairs. Also, I was disappointed in the car valet service. I returned to the hotel after dinner and there was no one on duty. A sign instructed me to go to reception for service. So I had to wait in line. Not the kind of service I expect at a Grandbourne hotel.

title: This hotel has a great location and features
comment: We enjoy staying at this hotel for the nice amenities, pool and exercise and clean rooms.

title: Needs alot of help
comment: Check in took over an hour and I was first in line (checking in at 430pm)

title: Dallas
comment: We enjoyed our stay at this Hotel it was clean and comfortable very busy lobby but thats ok. I had to go out very late around 2am to get some meds and a staff member with out saying so sort of followed me to my room once he saw my room card he was happy. (I like that) they were very concerned with safety. Didn't like that i had to pay 10 bucks a day for internet for each device.

title: THE WORST NIGHTS SLEEP I HAVE EVER HAD
comment: I had booked a room at your Baltimore North hotel for July 27-29. About a week prior to that we decided to come down a day early. I called your hotel to book a room for th 26th as well. I was told that your hotel was booked. I then went on Hotwire and booked a hotel room for that night instead. Once I confirmed the reservation I was told by Hotwire that it was your hotel that I was being booked at. This was of course after I was told by your staff that the hotel was book. The first room we were given for the 26th was a nightmare. There were people hanging out in the hallway until 10:30 at night. When that noise finally died down the room next to us exploded with children screaming and running around the room until 1:00 in the morning. I have never stayed in a hotel that was that loud. It sounded like these people were in the same room as we were. I had my two small children with me and none us go to sleep until after 1:00 a.m. When I checked out of that room in the morning and into our original reservation I told the front desk how disatisfied I was with our room and the experience thus far with your hotel. All I received was a "Sorry". Our next room was nice and much more quiet. However, when we booked that reservation we booked it to include breakfast in the morning. The breakfast was a joke. Unless you got there at 6:00 a.m. there was no food left. We ended up eating in the restaurant the next day and waited 45 minutes for an omlette. I will say we did enjoy the pool, however that is about where our happiness with this stay ends.

title: Great Stay
comment: Thanks to the excellent staff of the Belvoir Tribeca for an excellent one week stay at your hotel. We felt as though we were home for our visit to NYC. Nice to be greeted each morning, front desk was able to handle our needs for faxes and package delivery.

everyoneShouldKnow: Think twice before booking if you are looking for a relaxing stay and responsive service.
title: Less than we expected
comment: Unfortunately, this was our least satisfactory experience with a Grandbourne stay. We had very long waits for bell service both at check-in and departure. I had to call the front desk and remind them I needed help bringing in our family's luggage after waiting outside for about 20 minutes. There were many people there for some event, but they were just hanging out, not checking in or out. We had a similar experience at check-out, with no explanation or apology, and we did not check out at a busy time. The room and general decor were a little worn, but adequate. I spoke with an BPG rep about our experience, and they were very kind in receiving our comments. They even offered extra Starpoints as an accommodation, but those have never been issued.

title: Convention
comment: One of 2000 women attending a convention, I was pleased with the service and location to New York City attractions. I walked to most places I wanted to visit. One glitch was getting the bill split correctly for the four of us sharing a room. The desk person was courteous, but the process was lengthy and cumbersome.

title: Great hotel for Disney visit
comment: We stayed here for a 3 day Disney trip. The hotel is about 3 blocks from the park entrance, but we opted for the shuttle service (adults $10/3 days, kids $2). We ate breakfast sandwiches in the lobby's sandwich shop each day, which also doubles as a small convenience store. We stocked up on small snacks and sandwiches to bring into Disney. The heated pool (and jacuzzi) offered a relaxing break after a long day of amusement park fun. Poolside bar serves appetizers and beer/wine/soda and has a TV. My IPAD was also able to pick up free WiFi service from the lobby while poolside. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous at every opportunity. Will definitely stay at this hotel again!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's near restaurants and shopping malls.
title: Best hotel for the value
comment: We stay at this hotel everytime we visit South Florida. The hotel is near everything that we need - shopping, restaurants.

title: mrs
comment: great location friendly employees great atmosphere

title: Great location and comfort!
comment: Stayed on Club Level and room was fine - not run down as many other reviews have stated. Staff was great - especially valet parkers and restaurant/bar staff. Front Desk was fine but could be a little more "high energy" and friendly. :) Pool area was perfect - right on the river, so wonderful view/atmosphere. Food was yummy too! Would definitely stay there again.

title: Great Customer Service-Dog friendly
comment: I was very impressed with the customer service provided by the hotel personnel. Friendly, considerate and good manners. Very gracious with my dog. Clean and convenient to all Orlando activities. Pool area is beautiful.

title: Better than expected
comment: I had stayed before the renovation and did not think that it would look as good as the pictures on the website. Boy was I wrong. It exceeded it. The pool area is amazing!!! My teenagers had so much fun even enjoying the slide. The outdoor bar/grill was amazing; the food and service was exceptional. The staff remembers you and is so friendly, interacting with us and always smiling. I recommend to everyone. Plan on staying here again and again.

title: This hotel has great accommodations and service
comment: My husband and I spent one night at the hotel and had a wonderful experience. In fact, we are planning another trip there soon since the resort is so inviting and relaxing. We especially had great service at the front desk from Brandi. In fact, she remembered our names and greated us each time she saw us during our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: even though it's a historic facility it was clean and well maintained, and the staff was terrific!
title: Great Place to stay!
comment: Lovely historic hotel and great location allowed a terrific mini-vacation for our family. I found the staff and facility to be exceptional.

title: Really Bad Experience
comment: I reserved two nights with Belvoir at Salt Lake city using points (16000). Firstly I have to say their service is really disappointing. I emailed them about the airport shuttle service about how it works, The only response was the manager would be back 2 days later, but I did not receive any till now. What really surprised me was that when I called to cancel one night due to the change of flight, I was told that the room I reserved was not available. I really don not understand why I booked two nights half a month ago and it became not available to me. At last their representative canceled all my reservation, which means I had to book another hotel. All in all, the experience with Belvoir at Salt Lake City was unbelievably disappointing. I would not suggest this hotel at all.

title: Needs improvement on service
comment: We had a great view (ocean front) but the room never got vacuumed or dusted in our 4 night stay and on Friday one of the shower towels was dirty with some black stains on it. Basement floor stinks really badly, no clue though as why.

title: Home away from Home
comment: Our family stayed one night as a treat for the weekend inside the city limits! The kids loved it, the pool was awesome, the staff was great and the rooms were super comfy!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is superior to midtown AND this hotels rooms are superior to most others in NYC
title: Why pick midtown when you can pick Brooklyn ?
comment: The location of the hotel is actually better than midtown. The hotel was great, we got an upgrade from a staff member on the ball realizing we were in our suite and added two days to a non-suite. As such, I will always stay here if possible and book rooms for touring bands that I employ. The only problem was the non-dairy creamer was bad and no fridge in room. Ask for some cream from room service and get ice, you'll be fine. Make sure you update your GPS, there are many one ways in Brooklyn that try to lead you down one ways.

title: stay in the tower
comment: Unfortunatly our stay in the lanai room was bad, that whole section feels like your staying in a motel. once we were moved to the tower, the rooms were beautiful and thats when it felt like vacation. Would stay here again but in tower only

title: Very slow check-in
comment: The first impression was terrible. It took a half hour to get checked in at the registration desk. It felt like we were waiting at airport security. By speaking with other guest learned it had been that way for several days. This was 5pm. Need more registration clerks. They were too busy to answer questions about the amenities of the hotel. Did eat at the Sports Grill - it was great. Probably won't go back. Many options in downtown Dallas.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay at one of the other Grandbourne hotels if you have the option.
title: Needs work
comment: The hotel was undergoing construction while I was there. The construction began at 7 AM and continued till approx 5PM. This is New Orleans and everyone in the hotel could hear the construction no matter where you were in the hotel. After a night out in New Orleans, the last thing I wanted to hear was hammering and drills.

title: Good hotel but extras are at a cost.
comment: Hotel is located near Disneyland Parks, shopping and restaurants. Be ready to pay for extras, in room internet, roll away, fridge, etc... Hotel has shuttle service to/from the Disneyland Parks at an extra cost of course.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel all around met my expections.
title: Super courteous
comment: The entire staff was very accomodating and knowledgable about the area. The neighborhood felt safe and it was close to downtown shopping area. Plus hotel was near a couple of subway stops. Private car service was available right at the front door.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is ideal! Close to everything and a short walk to Universal Studios. Staff are genuinely kind and they are there to make sure you have a good experience.
title: Exceptional hotel and staff
comment: We were exhausted coming off another trip/flight and not sleeping for 40 hours, and Max at check in was so gracious and kind. He totally took care of us and made our stay so very special! I was here for a conference a few years ago and loved it so we came back to take the kids to Universal Studios (a few minutes walk from the hotel, with a free shuttle out front!). The hotel went through a renovation and is so beautiful! The rooms were gorgeous and very comfortable. Universal was awesome. The breakfast buffet was delicious and our server Maria was so very charming and kind. The whole trip was an A+++ experience! Thank you Belvoir and Max!!!

title: Great Hotel
comment: Very professional yet friendly staff. The club lounge was wonderful. Breakfast was good, but the appetizers were delicious. I had a very pleasant stay and will definitely be back.

title: Service is lacking
comment: As an owner at this resort I am deeply upset in the service that was provided during our most recent stay. The service at the check in/out is extremely slow and not very friendly. The room itself was lacking and to top it off when we checked in, we found a triple X movie in the dvd player.. When we took it up to the front desk all that was said was sorry. I feel that service is extremely lacking. Not sure what has happened but def needs some help. I pay alot of money to have a nice place to stay for vacation.

title: 2 Things Missing
comment: The Belvoir West DesMoines is a beautiful Hotel, with an excellent staff, and very nice rooms. The only two things I missed in my room were a small refrigerator, and a ceiling fan in the bathroom. Thank you for accepting cash for my room and deposit!!!

title: Great Stay in Towson
comment: The hotel was clean and well run. The employees, from the front desk to the dining room to the cleaning staff were friendly and helpful. Great area with shops and places to eat. Would love to return someday.

title: Second Stay
comment: This was my second stay at this hotel because it's near to my corporate office. I was pleased that as a Platinum member that I was upgraded to the Club level. It's a business Belvoir hotel and I like the full service (real) Starbucks in the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location just minutes away from Natick mall and a lot of great restaurants nearby. Also, it is only 30 mins from Boston and the price is very reasonable.
title: This hotel is my choice of stay each time when visiting Boston
comment: I am so delighted when I found out that my room was upgraded to a corner room. I felt special and it made my trip a fantastic stay. This hotel is always my choice of stay not only it mirrors a castle, the room is clean and my son enjoys swimming at the pool each time we were here. Staff has been very helpful and it is a great hotel at a convenience location where it is closed by the Natick mall and surronded by a lot of great restaurants in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: OVERALL A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!
title: BEAUTIFUL HOLTEL/RESORT!!!!
comment: OVER ALL MY FAMILY AND I LOVED IT!!! ROOMS WERE SPACIOUS, CLEAN, COMFY BEDS (PILLOWS TOO SOFT) YOU WOULD THINK BOTTLED WATERS WOULD BE FREE BUT NOPE. GROUNDS WERE GORGEOUS AND FICILITIES AS WELL. CLOSE TO DISNEY AND SHUTTLE VANS WERE CLEAN. ONLY REASON I GAVE 3 STARS IS FRONT DESK PEOPLE A LITTLE COLD.

title: Wonderful surprise!!!
comment: Loved our stay. Husband commented that the king suite was bigger than our first apartment!

everyoneShouldKnow: so close to Sesame - free shuttel
title: What we needed
comment: This hotel was exactly what we needed for this trip. We spent the weekend enjoying Sesame Place and needed a hotel that felt clean, safe and was easy to get to. I felt comfortable letting my two little ones crawl on the floor and the location couldn't be easier for Sesame.

everyoneShouldKnow: location to the Beach volleyball tournament was perfect
title: Awesome location for beach volleyball tournament
comment: Our family had a blast. We travel from the west coast several times a summer to play in the beach volleyball tournaments hosted at the beach. My daughter plays juniors on Sunday and I play on Saturday. Having the hotel so close is amazing. We also are gold members with Belvoir and we got the complimentary late check out that kicked butt on Sunday because my daughter made it to the finals and our day was later than we expected. Thank you for a wonderful weekend.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location, across from the Meadowlands complex
title: Average for Belvoir Brand
comment: Waited too long for check in and check out, especially check out. They had a large group checking in and did not prepare for it. Unable to check out and get a receipt, lines were 5 deep. They also don't answer their phones, which I tried to do after the fact to get a receipt. Clearly, they need to work on the staffing issues.

title: Very disappointing stay
comment: I have stayed at the Birmingham Belvoir many times. I made the reservation as normal through BPG for a club level (17th floor) ateium balcony room.When we arrived, the staff had our reservation incorrect. After speaking again with management and waiting over an hour, we were finally moved to the appropriate room. My reservation included breakfast for 2 adults for the entirety of our stay. However we were not provided the coupons at check in and at breakfast our first morning I had to again speak to management and pull up my reservation confirmation to prove the validity of my claim. Housekeeping left cleaning supplies in the bathroom and failed to restock the toiletries in our room. Valet was confused as to our room and vehicle and therefore getting our car was always a chore. The staff acted as if we were burdensome for the entirety of our stay. The pool was closed for maintenance.

title: Great Location
comment: Went to A Rockies game while we were there. Riding the mall bus woked out great.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are small and inconvenient.
title: Beware !!
comment: The rooms in this hotel are extremely small. If your party is three persons or more, you will find it very inconvenient unless you have a suite (of which there are only 8 in the hotel). The rooms also offer very little storage for your belongings and lack conveniences such as hooks or bars for hand towels and counter space on which to place your necessities. The closets are tiny and a lot of the closet space is occupied by the ironing board. The best thing about the hotel is its location.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are many meeting rooms and it is a good location for large conferences, however there needs to be adequate staff available at registration.
title: Disappointed In New York
comment: When I entered the hotel I was shocked and disappointed at the long line for registration. There was not enough staff available to handle the volume, even though the hotel was aware that there was a large convention coming into the hotel.

title: amazing little hideaway
comment: Wow! Pleasantly suprised at the CLEANLINESS and FRIENDLINESS of the room and entire staff!

title: Great hotel stay
comment: Rooms were well appointed, staff very helpful and friendly, and loved the BPG Club Room with breakfast. This was a great stay, and we appreciate that they allow small pets.

title: This hotel was amazing
comment: The room was perfectly clean when we arrived. The staff was sure to keep quiet when the do not disturb sign was up. When any questions were asked, everyone was quick to help and were smiling and happy the whole time! What an amazing hotel!

title: Great place if you have a bad back
comment: They do not have rollaway cots anymore, but some rooms have a chaise lounge which are very firm but extremely comfortable.

title: nice
comment: no beach small pool you have to fight for chairs

everyoneShouldKnow: Its convenience to everything in Myrtle Beach
title: vacation stay
comment: This hotel was better than staying at a time share for our purposes.

title: Highly Recommend
comment: Was met with a smile by the front desk clerk. Found my room to be very clean and well-maintained. Didn't use facilities as my trip was short and there was no time . . . hopefully, I'll be able to do so on another trip.

title: The Hotel is warm and accomodating. The staff was very professional.
comment: Thank you! We had a wonderful time and loved the lounge up on the 6th floor. The staff was very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its beautiful ,clean,and best for any occasions
title: The hotel is well planned.
comment: I love everything about the hotel ,my family don't want to leave the hotel,my family next vaccination will be use in the hotel.I recommend the hotel for any occasions because the hotel is well planned with great equipment and features .

title: Great Hotel
comment: The room was excellent. Front desk staff was very friendly and accomidating to my needs.

title: awesome comfort and service
comment: spa like comfort in the rooms and excellent service from everyone

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect Platinum Amenity points to post properly
title: As a resort it's a great property but....
comment: I own 3 timeshare properties with Grandbourne. When I am in Orlando on business I like to stay at SVV if at all possible. The extra room in the villas makes it easier to spread out and work than if I was in a regular hotel room.

everyoneShouldKnow: The General Manager has a presence that makes you feel welcomed and secured in your lodging choice.
title: Comfort & Quiet
comment: The room was comfortable and warm welcoming. I was at peace. I woke up very refreshed from a peaceful nights rest and pleasant staff in a quiet environment.

everyoneShouldKnow: Take advantage of one of the interesting nearby restaurants.
title: okay overall
comment: Room was fine, hotel lobby and elevators showing some wear. Staff and service generally good (especially housekeeping) but lunch service in restaurant was unreasonably slow (20-min wait for a sandwich and then only when I complained). Overall okay but could have been better.

title: Great Stay!
comment: Wonderful room and location. View was spectacular, room clean & comfortable.

title: They make it easy
comment: All the staff try to make it as easy as possible for you to stay here. Love the shuttle service to Disneyland. Never a wait at night when everyone is tired. They send as many shuttles needed to pick you up. Greatly appreciated.

title: Not as good as other Disney Resorts
comment: Was not happy that hotel did not offer complementary airport transfers for conference attendees and that there was not shuttle transportation to all theme parks (must take water taxi to some parks).

title: Excellent customer service, clean rooms, great dining choices!
comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night getaway at this very clean hotel. The customer service was excellent. Their promptness with room service and 'special' requests was outstanding. Rusty's breakfast buffet was superb! The view of the beach and pool area from my room on the 6th floor was fantastic!

title: Great Service, Outdated Rooms, Overpriced
comment: First I would like to say that the staff were great for the most part and very friendly and accommodating when you needed anything, although the check-in staff can be a little more friendly and greet guest with a smile and welcoming salutation instead of "can I help you". I thought the room rate for this hotel was overpriced and I consider it to be a 3 star hotel. I was there for an event 0n the evening of July 28, 2012 for which the group rate was outrageously high for one night, I feel I was robbed. The group rate especially for the event and the organization that gave the event at this hotel was very excessive due to the fact that most of the people there were from the tri-state area and not tourist. The rate should have been no much less per night, the organization which I dont want to name can clearly pack this entire hotel if the rates were better, Im coming to an event here in December but if the rates arent cheaper Ill stay at home which is only 15 minutes off the expressway. I have stayed with this organization at other hotels in New Jersey and Wilmington Delaware and paid much less per night for the same type of and/or holiday event. One thing I would like to say also during the time of the even there was lady with a radio who looked to be in charge and a young man also with a radio. These two persons were working their butts off. Everywhere they were needed, anything that they were able to help they were there and they looked to make sure everything was running as smooth as possible. I give both of these people BIG TIME PROPS, they were very nice and friendly even if under pressure you couldnt tell because they always had a smile on their faces. I wish I knew their names (Caucasian stocky woman and thin African American young man) to put in this feedback but Im sure you know who they are. My room was the downer for me. My room looked as if someone was sleeping in my bed before I got there. I actually thought I was mistakenly placed in an occupied room. It was very un-appealing and un-inviting. The towels in the bathroom were folded but thrown on the towel racks and I had only one wash cloth and I didn't even have one of those small boxed shower caps. I was very disappointed with this. I know Belvoir to have great hotels but this one has not changed very much over the past 10 years. It was actually better when it was the under another name. I figure in time things will get much better.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff at this hotel is amazing!!
title: Awesome experience from first moment to the last
comment: From the time we pulled up until the time we left, the staff at this hotel was amazing!! They were so friendly and helpful. The bellstaff and concierge went above and beyond when the pool had to close due to an infant getting sick in it. They made arrangements for us to use another poll close by. They gave us perfect directions to everything otherwise we would have been lost. we will definitely stay here on all future trips to Atlanta. They were so nice to my children asking them what all they did each day.Our trip would not have been near as much fun without the staff of this hotel.

title: Nice weekend get-a-way
comment: Me and My husband love the Belvoir in Old City. We usually go to Philly for a short weekend vacation. The hotel is modern, clean and the staff is nice and friendly. The hotel is walking distance to the shops, restaurants and the pier. We love nightlife and you will surely find some only 3 blocks from the hotel.

title: A great Staff!
comment: The hotel was typical of what I expected, but the staff was exceptional. Everyone was accommodating and courteous. We arrived late and the room type we booked was not available. They made arrangements to put us into two rooms for the night and move us the next day. The following day, everything was taken care of. We called for some extra towels and linens and received them in a matter of minutes. I could go on and on...

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is friendly and considerate.
title: They really care!
comment: From the moment we arrived the staff let us know that they wanted us to feel special. Though the place was buzzing, we were checked in quickly. We ordered room service the first evening and about 30 minutes after its arrival, we received a call asking if all had been cooked to order and if they could help us with anything else. Our server at the hotel restaurant was also quite considerate and was excellent at anticipating our needs. The second morning we were there, he asked my daughter if she would like the ... that she had ordered the previous day. Remembering her order was a real "WOW" for her.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is close to the beach only a two block walk or a five minute drive.
title: Good Hotel and Area, Horrible Parking situation
comment: The hotel was beautiful and clean. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfy. Even though we had to wait an extra hour after initial check-in because our room still was not ready. Parking on the other hand was horrible. Its sad they make guests pay $8 per day for parking in a garage like that. Overall the hotel was great but the parking was horrible.

title: nice time
comment: had a ladies weekend and we all enjoyed it very much. the location was great and the rooms were nice and cozy.

title: Dissapointing
comment: This turned out to be a very small facility. Really small lobby and restaurant where service wasn't that great. The description of room gives an impression that high speed internet is included but it is not. The much advertised internet in the lobby times out in 15 minutes. There is a club room available for I got an email to upgrade but the staff informed me that the only way to use the club room is to collect points.

title: food, elevators and staffing disappointing
comment: took exceptionally long time to check in they had only 1 -2 people doing check in. the elevator bank that i needed i was on 44th floor was running exceptionally slowsthe club room which i have used before was disappointing, bare minimum amount of food and replaced very infrequently coffee machine not working

title: Very clean
comment: Great location! Even with renovations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Back stairs leads you right to the gym.
title: GREAT STAFF, FRONT DESK, RESTAURANT STAFF
comment: I have been a loyal Grandbourne guest since 2006 and I am a lifetime GOLD member. I have been to every single type of property from Belvoir Resorts to new W's in Paris, France. And by far, this may be the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It is not the rooms, although always clean. It is not the amentiies, love the reese's peanut butter cups in the lounge. It is the staff! I could go on and on about the staff from the maintenace team to housekeeping. But the employee of the year to me is El, the bartender. He is alwaya attentive to my needs and the needs of the other patrons. He is alway polite and makes me want to get out of my room to enjoy the bar of the hotel. An amazing guy.

title: Helpful manager
comment: My son has severe food allergies and we are careful to stay where we can prepare his food. Leilani, the manager, was sympathetic and arranged for us to have a clean, empty refrigerator and a microwave free of charge. In our experience, this was over and beyond. We were very pleased with the room and had a terrific view of Waikiki - wow (and I'm jaded, having lived here for 10 years). Very well done, Belvoir Waikiki.

title: Great experience!
comment: The staff were amazing and helpful. This includes the front desk as well as the valet and the shuttle drivers. We were traveling with our handicapped child and they went out of their way to assist us. Great experience!

title: Belvoir big surprise
comment: Our guaranteed check in time was at 3 PM, but when we arrived (from out of state), they told us that the rooms weren't ready and they will call us when they were. We received that call at 4:30 PM. Included in the price of the room was nightly desert and mornings breakfast- both running out of food leaving us waiting around in the morning without breakfast. One of the elevators was being repaired so out of service for the week. This was very unacceptable for a Belvoir, and especially since we stayed in a much lower priced hotel the days before this and never had a shortage of food or rooms not being ready issue.

title: Hotel Can Do Better Than This
comment: Room wasn't ready by 3 p.m., then the staff failed to contact me via cellphone or text when the room was ready. Room seemed to have been hastily cleaned. Finally, incorrect car valet charges appeared on the initial bill I was presented.

everyoneShouldKnow: No different for a platinum guest. Below moderate level of service.
title: Dont feel like a Platinum in this hotel
comment: There is no lounge, no check in/out fast track for Platinum/Gold member.

title: Classy hotel
comment: This is a very nice hotel very clean and comfortable service was good

guestFrom: New Orleans Lakefront Airport (NEW), 6001 Stars and Stripes Blvd, New Orleans, LA 70126, USA
title: Improve the housekeeping standards
comment: The hotel was overall ok, but I had continued problems with cleanliness. The room and bathroom weren't clean when I moved in. There was loose candy (not mine) on the floor near the window, a disgusting clump of hair stuck to the shower wall and sink when I was getting dressed, and last but not least, a spider living next to the sink! I was there on business, so I was rushing out the next morning, and I was sure that when the housekeepers came, they would surely take care of these issues-- not so! Everything was just as it was before I left the room. I had to call the front desk for someone to come, and wait for and hour...

title: Standard Belvoir in good location
comment: Lobby is nothing special, and it is under renovation, so I hope it improves. There is only one small door at the front to get in. Check-in was okay, but no mention of upgrade (I'm BPG Gold). Room was decent and good size. We didn't get offered free internet even though both of us are Gold. We used our ipads in the lobby and were told at check-in that lobby is free. However we were charged. We had to have them take it off at check-out which was no problem. Staff was friendly. Great location.

title: Easy stay
comment: Great welcome. Friendly staff. Helpful. Comfortable clean rooms. Quiet hallways at night.

title: Weekend at the Dallas Belvoir
comment: Stayed 3 nights over a weekend to attend a conference. Service and staff very good. Parking was a challenge. None of the electronic cards seemed to work correctly in the kiosk at the gate. Food and service was excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: the gratest and cleaniest I have every stayed in .. I am ready to come back!!!!
title: The best stay ever
comment: I recently stayed at the Belvoir in Atlanta from 7/24/12/-729/12. The best stay ever ,very clean rooms, exceptional staff always ready to lend a helping hand. The only downfall was the pay for parking, but I am a country girl and was not use to the big city scene. I will go back again in a heart beat... and yea pay for parking also.

title: Sheration Hotel and Marina has great ammenaties
comment: We had a great time during our stay at the Belvoir Hotel and Marina. We made use of the pool, and all the water toys at the marina such as kayaking, paddle boarding and power lounging. The hotel is in close proximity to most anything you could want to drive to in southern CALI. My only complaint was the heated pool "really" wasn't heated. We were in town for my stepson's graduation from MCRD which was extremely close to the hotel as well, including the airport which was only across the street. We will be staying at the hotel in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want to sleep, do NOT get a room overlooking the lake.
title: Do not recommend if you're looking to get some sleep
comment: The hotel has boats that start running at 7am and end at midnight, which is wonderful for the guests wanting to go to bed late and be up early. If you're wanting to sleep in, you can forget it! These boats run every 20 mins and blow their horns several times when they dock and leave the dock. It sounded like angry cab drivers in New York City!

everyoneShouldKnow: Kid friendly with lots of kids activities.
title: Great place for families
comment: If you have kids, this is the place for you. Come for a weekend of fun and sign your kids up for the lego adventure weekend. Start Friday off with an ice cream social for the kids and smores when the sun starts to set. Saturday wake up, eat breakfast and drop the kids off at lego adventure at 9:30am and pick them up at 3:30pm. While they are having a blast, the moms went to the spa for a massage and facial, and hung out by the private pool, while the dads went golfing. Saturday after you pick up the kids, spend some family time by the pool and watch the Saturday night movie by the pool. Sunday wake up get packed and head out to the pool for some early morning fun, before checkout at noon. Did I mention they have a kid activity every hour by the pool, or close by. Great weekend for everyone, we had 4 adults and 6 kids ages 4 to 10.

title: This hotel has an excellent location
comment: Great service, room, service, and locations.

title: Not worth the price
comment: My biggest problems were with housekeeping. Had to request additional linen each day. Room cleaning started before I checked out and items were thrown in the trash when I returned to the room. The view from the pool area was not very nice (trash storage). Some of the front desk staff didn't appear to want to be there.

title: Excellent accomodations, but hidden charges
comment: The staff was very friendly. The room and amenities were outstanding. However, upon check-in I was surprised to learn that there would be a $10/day + tax charge to each room for the use of local/long distance calls, two bottles of water and access to the fitness facility. There was not an option to decline.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient, quiet, great food on premises, comfortable and pet friendly!
title: Pet friendly
comment: We had a fantastic stay. The room was really nice, the bed comfortable. The pool was also perfect, and the breakfast was delicious. It was really perfect and we will be back.

title: Great location but room quality is below average
comment: The Belvoir chicago towers has a great location close to Navy Pier, restuarants, shops, and attractions. I was not impressed with the quality of the room and particularly the bathroom.

title: great hotel
comment: Hotel was great better than i expected!

title: Clean and inviting
comment: Hotel is beautiful. That is NOT a dolphin. I think it's too bad that you use a dolphin fish for your logo but use the name dolphin. The signage to the Dolphin is not good either.

everyoneShouldKnow: Previously, I have always had a good experience at this hotel.
title: Housekeeping
comment: I have been a frequent guest at this hotel for many years. I stay here approximately a month out of the year. This is the first time that I have found a need to complain about housekeeping.

everyoneShouldKnow: Felt very welcome, was a nice stay. Located near the medical area we had early morning appointments at.
title: Great Hotel
comment: Loved the hotel, pool was very nice. Only problem, programing for tv did not show Texas Rangers game.

title: good Hotel
comment: Good comfortable stay No issues

everyoneShouldKnow: Front office staff are very accomodating;
title: Bell Men & Front Desk Staff
comment: I arrived and my taxi driver would not unload my luggage - your bellmen stood and watched as i got my luggage out the back of a van struggling with the door and did nothing to help. NOT IMPRESSED.

everyoneShouldKnow: The front desk staff is excellent, but the sales staff need to work on their banquet skills.
title: Reunion
comment: The needs of my family runion were not met. I was very disappointed with the banquet set-up, with the food for the meet & greet and with how we were treated. The staff at the Belvoir did not honor their word. We were told that we had the banquet room, which was an actual meeting room for 12 hours only to find out we had it for 3 hours. We were also told that someone from my group saw and approved the room, which was a lie. We were not pleased at all.

everyoneShouldKnow: Central in Indianapolis; possible to walk to University, did this daily, takes about 20 minutes
title: Downtown hotel
comment: Excellent place for staying in Indy. Close to many museums, places to eat, conference center and stadiums. Staff is friendly and willing to help. Because of our gold status we received lounge access, which is great as there is free continental breakfast and during the day you can get drinks. Even if you have to pay an extra $ 10,- it is worth it. Pool is quite small, Fitness room very small, but they were re-doing this, so in future this might be much better. Overall, a good choice for staying in Indianapolis, we would stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location. Within walking distance of boardwalk, outlets and casinos.
title: Poor bed making
comment: We have stayed at this hotel many times and never had a problem. This last stay our only complaint was that the bed was made haphazardly. We called the front desk and they had housekeeping up in a reasonable amount of time. The housekeeper acted appalled at the way the bed was made, stripped it and stated over. She apologized several times. Other than that we had a very enjoyable time and will return soon.

title: Great location!
comment: The hotel itself was excellent. Clean spacious rooms and a great location. My only complaint was check-in, We arrived on a Saturday and the line was very long. I thnk they should have had more employees working. Everyone was very kind and apologetic though and the rest was great!

title: Unclean
comment: Hotel was nice but came back 2nd night at 11PM and room was not cleaned! We had to leave room so it could be cleaned and we weren't offered anything, not even a drink!

title: The rooms are 3rd rate.
comment: Althoug the lobby and atrium are impressive, the rooms leave a lot to be desired. The bathrooms are very small and the furniture is old and uncomfortable. Not up to Belvoir standards.

everyoneShouldKnow: GOOD PLACE TO RELAX FOR A FEW DAYS
title: Very happy
comment: We loved our stay at this Hotel. It was very clean and well maintained. Loved the pool area and outdoor bar . Next time I come here I will bring my golf clubs, course looked very well maintained. Also enjoyed the peaceful native Indian music played in the halls of the resort.

title: Great location and 5 star facility
comment: Stayed here for the first time and will no longer stay at the other Disney resorts as this is my favourite. The rooms were clean and had great air conditioning. There was never a problem getting chairs at the pool.The staff were always helpful and courteous. The 24 hr. restraurant was great. Loved the location and easy access to Epcot, Hollywood studios and the boardwalk. Very big hotel so we learnt to get on the buses at Boardwalk , because by the time they got to the swan and Dolphn, many of them were full.This is the best choice for the best price, hands down!

title: So tired
comment: Overall professional staff and facilities, but regretted not coming a day earlier. I arrived on Sat. around 12 and while I didn't assume a room would be ready , I was disappointed by how events unfolded. The hotel was fully booked and I was asked for a contact #. I checked after a few hours and there was still no room available. Finally, I checked again at 5 p.m. and was given a choice to wait an undetermined amount of time for my room or take a different, but available one. I decided to take the room that was ready. I would have really appreciated an update at some point instead of having to check myself with no phone contact from staff for 5 hours. Also, I wonder if there was any increased staffing to accommodate the full bookings and turn rooms over more quickly. Also, the elevators seemed like they were running way too slow for the number of guests. These things marred what would have been an otherwise great experience. Summary - great staff and hotel during most times, but avoid when hotel is busy/full.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location to san diego attractions
title: worst place to stay
comment: Carpets are extremely dirty,

title: Top location and great staff
comment: This hotel has a great location for visiting the sites of N.Y.C. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I wish the Starbucks was truly a Starbucks. There should have been one more chair in our room. Everything else was outstanding and I will visit this hotel again.

title: Best Features Over Other Hotels
comment: Our stay at the Belvoir Lake Buena Vista was excellent. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. The view of the courtyard and pools was amazing. We had the "Green" option of not having room service and keeping our privacy, which we chose and got compensated for.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't look for Sheaton quaility at this hotel
title: This hotel is not up to Belvoir standard
comment: The web photos are misleading, the lobby is remodeled and up to date but the rooms are dark and old. The d飯r in the rooms reminded me of seeping in a morgue. The rooms also had a damp smell with cigarette smoke even though its a smoke free hotel. The bathroom shower head was coming out the wall and it was infested with ants.

title: Decent stay
comment: The room was great, comfortable bed. The hotel as a whole was lacking (bar, restaurant, snacks, etc). The lobby is weird. But you can't beat the location and the bed was dreamy!

everyoneShouldKnow: This Hotel has two Tower! Take the MarinaTower!!
title: Don't take the Bay-Tower!!
comment: Hi!

everyoneShouldKnow: that it stinks and is expensive. Totaly over-priced.
title: worst EXPENSIVE HOTEL EVER
comment: The clock didnt work

everyoneShouldKnow: You should not schedule a lot of outside activities until you see everything the hotel has to offer.
title: What a place!!!!!
comment: I REALLY enjoyed my short stay here. My visit was for a conference so I didn't get to take advantage of all the wonderful things this resort had to offer. There is SO much to do, the staff is WONDERFUL, the rooms are great and the location is excellent if your planning on visiting Disney multiple days during your stay.

title: great hotel
comment: I enjoyed everything about this great hotel

title: This hotel is centrally located
comment: This hotel is centrally located, internally attractive and confortable rooms.

title: Don't bother
comment: I stayed at the Walt Disney World Dolphin for a business conference. The room had a musty smell. The sheets didn't fit the bed. The a/c didn't work properly. The bed & pillows were hard as rocks. Overall the staff didn't seem concerned about the guests. Other than Richard at the Bell Desk and the Front Desk staff, I didn't get a grunt in acknowledgment. I felt totally out of place. The food was mediocre except for Shula's, which was magnificent! If you are looking for staff that treat you with respect and exceptional rooms... Don't bother with the Dolphin.

title: Room
comment: Not the best view from the roon, the ice area had no lighting. The room discribe at reservation was not the same room assigned.

title: Great stay at the transformed Belvoir
comment: My family including a seven and five year old boy stayed for about a week at the resort. Fortunately we were here when most of the renovations were complete. The concerns of past reviews with noise and disorder were not an issue during our stay. When arriving, the front desk was pleasant and helpful. Elizabeth was great and even knew my name when I needed a key to the room as I locked myself out. The biggest draw for my family is the pool facility. Having two energized boys the zero entry pool, water spouts, whirlpools, and of course the water slide kept them entertained when we got back from Disney. They also have a LCD projector and in the pool area show movies. We saw the Olympics in prime time on a few nights. They also have a good assortment of food and drinks at the bar at reasonable prices. As for the room we got a standard two queen beds. It was a decent size and was recently renovated. Another bonus is the shuttle to Disney Parks. We used in mainly in afternoon/evening as we wanted to arrive early in the park. Service was good and we were one of the first stops on the way back to the hotels.

title: The hotel overall was good
comment: Truth is, upon checking in and going to mu junior suite my wife and I walked into the bathroom and found long hair on the floor and the garbage was full and smelly. It was a corner room so the wifi only worked by the door. I notified the front desk and was moved (with no courtesy of upgrade for what happen, wife was little disgusted by what she saw)

title: Disastrous hotel stay
comment: I was so looking forward to my trip to Key West, FL....it was my first BPG stay and I was excited. I made the reservation initally as only 2 nights then decided to call back and check availability for a 3rd night. Luckily, there was availability so I changed the reservation to 3 nights. I was told that the reservations would be 'linked' and I wouldn't have to move, etc. To my surprise, I received 2 separate email confirmations for the reservations a week or so prior to the stay. When I arrived, the person checking me in said there were 2 reservations. She proceeded to tell me nothing about the hotel, the area, or offerings of the hotel. When I get to the room, I look down and there are Fritos or some such snack on the floor at the door. I was flabbergasted. There were ants or some insect crawling around near the sink under the microwave. The comforter which was folded up in the closet was filthy. The cushion on the chaise in the living room was filthy....it had what appeared to be punch or something red. This is why I attempted to spread the comforter over it. On Monday morning, I received a bill under the door. At the pool, I ordered a fruit plate. The fruit (some of it) didn't smell/taste fresh. The dining room seating (outside) was not clean. Where my daughter and I sat, hair was all over the couch. Some of the towels were overly worn. There was dust/dirt on the base boards in the room. I purchased tickets for a tour and the trolley either left without us or never came. I never got an explanation but was not charged. Upon check out, I had to struggle with the luggage cart and luggage. I was never asked if I needed help. I was not asked how the stay was, etc. The trip was ruined upon check-in. I am skeptical about myBPG membership and shudder to think about future vacations. The first vacation was nothing short of disastrous.

title: Needs Improvement
comment: First time visit. Disappointing, waited almost 20 minutes to check in, asked for adjoining rooms to interview, 408 and 410 are not adjoining, front desk said nothing they can do, couch and chair padding was terrible, you could fall into ! Cleaning room people arrived at 6PM, I asked for them to come back in a little bit, they said they could not, asked for a drink at the bar, bartender, left, come back 15 minutes later, asked for my drink, left again. I did too !

everyoneShouldKnow: Best location ever. Walking instance to all many sightseeing. Great location!
title: Ascend Gala Dinner Service was disappointing
comment: I had such a wonderful time and enjoyed every moment during my stay with your hotel until we went to the gala dinner. The waitress was rude and impatient. Although we understand this is a quite large event to manage, a bit smile on the face and a responsive answer could make a huge difference. It was clear that the waitress was not happy to come to work to begin with. There was no smile from the beginning. When we simply asked for hot tea, she seemed distrubed by this request and it took 5-6 follow ups to make this happen. It was unbelievable how rude she was during this period, she would cut off you when you were trying to friendly remind her and eventually threw the tea pot to the table and left without even asking everyone who would like to have the tea. I was shocked and quite disappointed. I hope this is one instance off and Belvoir will be able to show that not only it can serve all guests well but also it can handle big events like this well.

title: One Night Stay
comment: We stayed one night at this hotel to check out the area. The location is very easy to access, the grounds were well kept and the staff met all of our needs. The only recommendations we have are:

title: Nice View
comment: I love the view (Lake Michigan and Sear Tower behind my room). Also, the staff are very friendly.

title: Adequate
comment: Average place. Clean and friendly. Breakfast buffet OK

title: This hotel is in a great location and was very comfortable
comment: This hotel is in a great location for visiting Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm and several nice California beaches! The rooms are very spacious and accommodated my family of four with plenty of space for the kids to play and relax. The beds are very comfortable and the room was nice and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful even when we arrived after midnight. We will definitely stay here again when in the Anaheim area!

title: Fair
comment: I requested a king bed, however, only two doubles were available. My room had a foul odor and the sheets/bedding smelled funky. Lighting very poor with one light not working

title: Nice getaway weekend from MIA
comment: Great location and amenities... Room was clean and everything worked..

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs some sprucing up in several areas!
title: Very disappointing experience
comment: No internet was available until the evening and no alternative offered. Turns out my room had water damage that gave it a bad must/ mold smell along with 2 dead cockroaches in the bathroom. Also the walls were warped. If you get coffee in the Club Room the concierge advises you to microwave it for warmth as they have no way to keep fresh coffee warm. Small gym smelled from the pool chlorine next door

title: 7/31/12 stay
comment: I had a pleasant experience.

title: Awesome Hotel and Staff
comment: We had a breakfast meeting at the hotel and the staff and service we received were amazing. The resort is beautiful and the view from our hotel rooms was beautiful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't be mislead just because you are staying at the Belvoir. They will put you in a little hotel thats part of it.
title: Unhappy
comment: Waited a long time for the shuttle at airport. Was excited when getting to hotel, little did I know the real hotel was about half mile away and very small.

title: Great service
comment: A great place to stay. Comfortable rooms, good amenities, shuttle service was good.

title: Hotel need some improvements
comment: 1) The outdoor pool was dirty and had some disgusting odor in the air.

title: Bad Timing
comment: The room was comfortable, but..

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is good and bad...good in that it's away from the main rush of the boardwalk and there's a parking facility right there, bad in that the surrounding neighborhood on the parking lot lot side is a little dicey...but that's all of AC.
title: Belvoir Atlantic City
comment: Hotel was very nice, staff was extremely friendly and helpful, loved the homage to Miss America pageant. My only wish is that the bathroom have an exhaust fan!

title: Was late to meetings due to missed wake-up call
comment: This hotel was average compared to other Grandbourne properties. I was 15 minutes late to my morning meetings due to not getting my requested wakeup calls. Alarm clock was not easy to program so requested wake up call but did NOT get it.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's so wonderful to stay in a suite, and personnel is so friendly
title: This hotel has great suite
comment: Club room us great, and the personnel is so friendly and helpful

everyoneShouldKnow: Food is good and not overpriced. Great Hospitality
title: Great people and food
comment: The staff was very engaging and positive, all wanted to help and ensure a great stay. We spent a lot of time at pool, and the staff out there was very pleasant and wanted to help. The club staff was equally engaged and helpful with restaraunt ideas and entertainments ideas. I was very impressed with food quality and reasonable cost. Whole family enjoyed our stay and I loved location. Pool is a little small, and a beach boardwalk would be a nice addition, but I did not mond the walk to ocean.

title: all expectations exceeded
comment: The staff is very friendly, and can answer any questions you have about Manhattan. The hotel rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean. You couldn't ask for a better location, the ferry to Manhattan picks you up at the hotel and is a very short 5 minute ride (no need to drive anywhere), the view of the city is priceless.

title: Caring Staff
comment: During a difficult family emergency, I stayed at the Sheration Detroit Novi for thriteen days. The Staff was wonderful in helping me as I continued to extend my stay. Everyone went out of their way to assist me. I have statyed at this property many times before and will certainly stay again when my travel bring me back to the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very difficult to find especially at night. Once you find the hotel you have to drive to aother street to get into the parking garage
title: Noisy
comment: Was awakend at 5:30 with traffic noises. Alarm was set for 7:15 so I was very tired all day at my conference.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenience and high standards for personnel
title: Accommodating staff
comment: Despite my ignorance in reserving a room for the wrong date, the desk clerk very graciously found a ground floor room very convenient to the restaurant and lobby for me and my companion. Since the purpose of our stay was for my frind to go to a 6:00 AM appointment at the Tucson Medical Center, the desk clerk gave us the same rate we had booked online.

title: additional credit card fees
comment: unfortunately, my credit card was declined because the additional credit card fees exceeded my limit by a few hundred $$. I had to change from a four night stay to a two night stay and ended up moving to another property that allowed me to prepay up front. Other than that, everything else was fine.

everyoneShouldKnow: Warm, caring and hospitable managers and staff.
title: The Transformation
comment: The Belvoir Kauai Resort has been fransformed from a great resort experience to an even greater resort experience.

title: Perfect location for all attractions in Arlington
comment: We really enjoy our recent stay at the Belvoir in Arlington. We had an excellent time enjoying the pool, food, drinks and close location to Ranger Ball Park. Once we parked our car we never had to leave the parking lot again since they offer shuttle buses or trollies to all locations we were visiting...

everyoneShouldKnow: It's close to downtown attractions and the staff is friendly.
title: The staff was friendly
comment: The staff was very friendly. I was always greeted when I entered and exited the hotel. The housekeeping, baggage and door staff was very friendly and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: that it has really bad experience been in that hotel.
title: problems with the hotel
comment: I had many problems when i was in the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The great staff at the hotel
title: Belvoir Hotel in Kauai
comment: The hotel met most of our needs. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very curteous and helpful. It had a business center, fitness room and two pools. There were not too many options for dining but there were a lot of restaurants close to the hotel. We dined some at the hotel and the rest went outside. Overall we really enjoyed our week at this hotel. We would recommend it to anyone.

title: Hotel registration was so slow!
comment: First day i checkined, there was a long line for the preferred guest line, i guess that was ok, because it was monday and everyone was checking in. Second day, I left my key in the room so i went to front desk to get an extra one, again, there was another long line and there was no one working or even standing at the preferred guest desk! so I have to literally wait 15 mins to just get an extra key to enter my room.

title: Great Hotel
comment: This hotel is the best BPG hotel on Disney property. While the lobby can be loud and overwhelming, it is more up to date, cleaner and all around nicer than the other hotel. Plus, the people who work there seem a lot more competent.

title: Wedding was excellent at this hotel!
comment: Every staff person we dealt with was exceptional and did all they could to make a very special occasion seem even more special. Except the billing or accounting department. It took 2 days before I got to speak to someone regarding a billing mistake make to the bride for a room. On day three I got a returned call finally from the first person, who knew nothing of my dealings with his office the day before. I am still waiting to receive the email which will let me know the corrections were made. This is the only issue on an otherwise perfect day.

title: Instructor
comment: I had packaged candy in my room and later found ants in my room next to the candy.

title: Comfortable and functional
comment: On par with business-oriented Belvoir standards. Above-average BPG recognition off-season.

everyoneShouldKnow: You dont get what you pay for!
title: Horrible experience!
comment: We clhecked into the hotel at almost midnight. We were assigned our room and went to begin getting ready for bed. Once we were in the room for about 30 mins I called the front desk complaining about the temperture of the room. A maintenance man came up and said he reset the air conditioning assured me that all was fine. At 2:15am we called the front desk again telling them that we were burning up. Another maintenance man came in there and told us the room temperture was 78 even though we had the air set on 65. He tried to fix the air conditioning. Another maintenance man came up and we were told that we should call the front desk so we could move rooms. So I did....now this is 2;30 in the morning not very convenient at all to be dragging our luggage down to another floor and once again get all the beds set up. We had to use a pull out to accomodate us. The room was stuffy when we got in there and it took a good 30 mins for it to cool off. When I spoke to the girl at the front desk she told me that they had a complaint about the air conditioning previously. I was shocked to hear this...when you pay $260 a night for a room you expect to be given a room that is in working condition. I was very disappointed with this hotel as a whole.

title: Excellent staff and support
comment: I received excellent support from the hotel staff and my stay was very enjoyable.

everyoneShouldKnow: My car stayed parked in the garage the entire stay. We walked everywhere. It's a pretty busy hotel so don't be surprised. Lots of people moving around, shopping, eating, enjoying the pools and beach
title: Absolutely loved our stay!
comment: Staying at the Belvoir Waikiki was a mini stay-cation for us; a little treat to my daughters before back-to-school Monday. This property was so nice and intriguiging. It was a great experience for myself and the kids. While different from Belvoir at Keauhou Bay, we like experiencing variety versus the same thing all the time. Keauhou Bay was very quiet Waikiki was very busy, lots of people moving around, shopping enjoying the property. We loved both experiences. Waikiki is within walking distance of everything. Location was GREAT! We ate at all 3 restaurants at the hotel. The breakfast buffet at the Kai Market was awesome and so was the price! It's such a great incentive for kids under 12 to eat free. We enjoyed the Pineapple soft serve at the coffee shop. My kids loved the pool and the beach. We had a deluxe oceanview room where I got the most amazing pictures! I have NO complaints whatsoever. My daughters are 7 & 4. They have gotten to know and LOVE the Belvoir and I'll be sure to stay with Belvoir where ever we go. Thanks for giving us such great memories :) Mahalo!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convenient if you are attending an event at the fairgrounds.
title: We'll Be Back
comment: We stayed for Jazz Fest West in July. I found everything to be at or beyond expectations. This hotel was very convenient to the fairgrounds. Room was fine, bar & restaurant was good. We will be back next year.

title: Columbia Cool
comment: This is my first time staying here so didn't really know what to expect.

title: needs help
comment: Dirty, rundown, poor service. Not at all what you expect when you stay at a Belvoir. Super disappointed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff are EXCELLENT! Accomodations are EXCELLENT!
title: Excellent hotel
comment: Had a great time. Great staff! Beautiful hotel. Best on the beach! MUST STAY!

title: Accomodations June 30 through July 2nd
comment: I am a BPG Gold 3 * Elite and had three reservations. Two reservations were for June 30 through July 2, and one reservation was for July 1 through July 2. This was the weekend of the storm in the area. My party was there for a funeral and I was very disappointed to arrive and have no room. I was not given any consideration for my BPG status and had to find accomodations elsewhere for June 30th. Apparently my rooms had been given to others the night before.

title: Housekeeping Needs Some Work
comment: The housekeeping staff were really not attentive to the number of towels that needed to be replaced each day of my stay. I started out with two sets of towels and as my stay progressed I was sometime left with only one set of towels. Also I was disappointed that the pool was being serviced/repaired in the middle of one of the hottest summers on record...that was a true bummer!

title: Business or sightseeing
comment: Excellent A/C unit a litle noisy

everyoneShouldKnow: don't stay here if you want Internet service
title: This hotel has no reliable Internet
comment: I spent 5 days here and could never get on the Internet for more than 5 minutes at a time. I would call the front desk, they would transfer me to tech support, tech support would feed me a line about how they would take care of it, and that never happened. The only way I finally got reliable Internet was to beg for an ethernet connection and even that went down for an hour.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great food, staff, and very clean!
title: Great Stay, Great Vacation!
comment: My husband and I recently visited Virginia Beach and chose to stay at the Belvoir Oceanfront Hotel. We loved it! The hotel was very clean and up-to-date; you could tell it had recently been remodeled. Our room was small but cozy and we were not disturbed by anyone next door to our room. The staff was very friendly and met all of our needs. We visited both pools; they were kept in very nice condition and were refreshing after being in the heat. I would recommend the restaurant at the hotel, the staff there was very pleasant and the food was great! Overall our stay was perfect and wed definitely come to the Belvoir again!

everyoneShouldKnow: IThe hotel has potential but I encountered a few problems.
title: A few annoying problems
comment: Stayed 3 nights.

title: Great Location
comment: I work for Grandbourne and just wanted a staycation with the wife--Perfect and close to work.

everyoneShouldKnow: The reservation department does not know what is included in the rates such as free parking, free breakfast & free Wi-Fi. Three different customers including myself were misinformed of the amenities.
title: The reservations department provided wrong info
comment: I selected this hotel because I read positive reviews. However, I did not have a positive stay. When I made my reservations, I was told that my stay included free parking & free breakfast at the gov't rate. When I checked in, I confirmed that information with the front desk staff as well. The next day, I went down to the eating lounge & found out after the fact that breakfast was not included & I ended up paying a high price. As i was paying, 2 other families came in for the free breakfast & were disappointed when they found out that there was no free breakfast because they too, were misinformed. The plug outlet in my room was not properly screwed in the wall & it sparked when I plugged in my phone charger. No mini fridge in room for the water I brought with me & the smoke detector went off at 530am in my room for no reason.

title: hotel room was outdated
comment: the room i had was very outdated, smelled of smoke, dirty bathroom with missing tiles and stained carpet.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is convenient and the staff is helpful.
title: Great hotel ! Wonderful city !
comment: Four of my gal pals occupied one room and believe it or not we are still friends and speaking to each other. It was tight, but not impossible. Your housekeeping staff made sure we had enough towels etc. and took good care of our needs.

title: ATL
comment: Attention to customers very low!

title: Great Service and staff
comment: I highly recommend this hotel, the staff and service is always top notch and accommodating

title: Orlando 2013
comment: Perfect remodeling of this place!

title: Great Location, Poor Staffing, A bit run down
comment: Check in and check out was very difficult, as the front desk was not staffed properly, a poor choice by the management. The rooms were comfortable and somewhat clean, they are showing there age. I was recognized as a Platinum member and provided with an upgrade and access to the club, which was very nice. Great location for Meadowlands activities.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly and helpful staff - obviously well trained in Grandbourne's outstanding hospitality service
title: A Great End to Our Trip to NE
