comment: We stayed here three years ago for a wedding. It was great then so we decided to finish our NE vacation trip this summer by visiting Portsmouth. This stay was as great as the first. Friendly, helpful and well trained staff makes the stay here great. Recommeded!

title: this hotel hsd exemplary service
comment: hotel under renovation. large group check in was difficult but staff was most apologetic and customer focused in terms of offering water, popcorn and baggage storage...lines were long

title: Belvoir is Great
comment: the buffet could be better. It is to expensive for what you are offered

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location; easy access; comfortable rooms and very good banquet service.
title: This hotel has great Interstate access
comment: This hotel was selected for our family reunion weekend stay and banquet. It had great access to the interstates, shopping and dining. The kids loved swimming in the onsite pool. The king sized suite we stayed was spacious with a great view looking out toward I285. The banquet food was very tasty and the hotel staff was very attentive. Our only complaint we with the slow speed of two in-service elevators; the third one was didn't work. Overall, we enjoyed out stay and would stay their again.

title: Front Desk Unprofessional & Unhelpful
comment: Called downstairs to borrow a pair of headphones so I could go to the gym. Guy at front desk unknowledgable, unhelpful, and plain rude.

title: Luxurious and serene
comment: One of, if not the Best, most comfortable stay I've expericenced. My family was treated very well. Looking forward to our next stay....Continued success..Blessings

title: Unhappy Anniversary
comment: My husband and I booked a room excited for our one year anniversary. He's in the navy and got leave to go back to our home town to celebrate. We live the city so we thought the Belvoir would be perfect.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to AC sights and action.
title: Belvoir AC
comment: Excellent accommodations and facilities - we have no negative comments, but for the long walk from the self-parking area reserved for hotel guests to the hotel lobby. Excellent location for ease of access to AC Expressway, shopping, casinos and beach.

title: Very comfortable
comment: Close to airport, good shuttle service to and from same. Clean and comfortable rooms. My stay was very short, but met my needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, staff tries hard to meet needs
title: Check-in
comment: While the associates registering guests were polite, I never saw enough staff to keep the lines down. Wait time for rooms to be ready varied from 0 to 5 hours. Waiting to get into my room meant that I was not as prepared as I needed to be for meeting with the hotel staff about our convention. I stayed behind the power curve all week as a result.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff, the A.C and the free internet was excellent.
title: Great A/C and free internet
comment: From prior reviews we were somewhat concerned about the A/C and the speed on the internet. I don't know if it was our room location or not but both the A/C and the internet worked great for us.

title: Comfortable
comment: The rooms are spacious and bed are very comfortable.

title: Good location but noisy!
comment: Disappointed with the hallway noisiness during the night; sheets were starched so crispy that the sound actually woke you up!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is accessible to everything, friendly, clean, and quiet.
title: Quiet, Safe and Accessible to Everything.
comment: I must say the downtown Belvoir met my expectations and more. Since I was travelling alone I was a bit anxious, but this hotel put me at ease immediately with their friendly service, room upgrade, great concierge, and its other many ammenities. Try their wonderful restaurant District-you will have a great meal!

everyoneShouldKnow: Centrally located and near the French Quarter
title: Rennovation Blues
comment: My son and I stayed at the hotel before our cruise and then for three days after it. During the week, the building rennovations created havoc in the hotel and among its staff. The registration desk had been moved as well as the Bell station. I had requested an early preparation for my room when I left the first time, but that request was lost in the shuffle. We had to cool our heels in the bar and informed they would call us as soon as a room was ready. Three hours passed and even the bartender apologized for the delay. Finally, I went back to the registration desk and they had a room waiting for us, but nobody called to let us know. Poor service for such a well-known hotel chain. It waisted my BPG points.

title: Week End Family Reunion
comment: Rooms well appointed, however bedside tables a bit small and withouyt drawers. Pleased to have an extra box of tissues , which is unusual in most hotels.

title: Great experience
comment: This was my 2nd stay here and as the first was great all around. Great location, service and value.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel makes one feel at home.
title: This hotel has great features
comment: The location is excellent. It is within walking distance of dining, theater and easy transportation. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The beds are sooooooo comfortable especially after a long day of sightseeing.

title: Restaurant
comment: The hostess was not accommodating and had an bad attitude in the rum fire.

title: A lot to be Desired
comment: I was very disappointed on check in to find out that internet access was not complimentary. I have been to many Belvoir properties all of which internet was included. It was also very hard to believe that when I went to take a shower there was no soap, shampoo, conditioner nor lotion. I have come to expect a certain level of service and Belvoir properties and this property did not live up to that.

everyoneShouldKnow: How much that the entire staff and management exceeds the guest expectations in every aspect of the stay.
title: A Most Memorable Hotel Stay
comment: The day before I moved to my new home in Lewiston, NY, my stay at Belvoir At The Falls was a welcome to Lewiston that I will never forget! Stay began with a preregistered check-in and had assistance with my luggage into a most lovely king executive suite. The Belvoir At The Falls valued this BPG member with exceptional recognition. The king executive suite on the BPG floor exceeded my expectations for both cleanliness and amenities. The carpet was freshly shampooed upon my arrival, and later on that evening, a beautiful welcoming amenity was delivered to the room. Both TGI Friday's and the Jade Room for breakfast the next morning provided me with outstanding cuisine and service. The BPG Club Level had a most wonderful evening reception with many wonderful wine and food selections. No other hotel anywhere has ever provided me with a more personalized level of service from Guest Services to Food and Beverage. The Housekeeping was exceptional in that the room was equipped with every amenity one could want and more. Most importantly, I felt extremely valued and appreciated due to my previous business at Belvoir At The Falls. A special thank you to the entire Belvoir At The Falls staff and management for a welcome to Lewiston, NY that I will never forget for the rest of my life. For a most memorable stay that will always exceed ones' expectations, stay at Belvoir At The Falls because the entire staff is completely dedicated to total guest satisfaction! The staff truly cares about the guest as an individual, not as a folio number! The king executive suite had most beautiful furnishings as well.

everyoneShouldKnow: You don't have to leave to have a good time everything is there.
title: This hotel had the best of everything.
comment: The room was excellent, comfortable and privacy was respected. The hotel had everything needed to have a wonderful vacation and not have to leave the premesis. All resturants were excellent and the service was refreshing. I felt like I was the most important person and the staff was so friendly. Love the vacation and will be back again!

everyoneShouldKnow: If you're not sure what to do or where to go... ask Jerome! He is a great help!
title: Great Hotel!
comment: We attended a conference in Atlanta from 7/27 thru 7/29. The hotel was conveniently located and wer enjoyed being close to the downtown area. One of the bellmen, Jerome was exceptional! He was friendly and took an active interest in our being satisfied hotel guests. He is a real asset to your staff!

title: good location
comment: We love the location of this hotel. We stayed here a couple of times before. It looks like they are going through some well needed updating. Although the room was a nice size and the beds were comfortable, it had a bad smell to it. The carpets were dirty too. Staff was very helpful and friendly. One area of improvement is to have more than one washer and dryer available for all your guests. It was almost impossible to do your laundry there.

title: THIS HOTEL IS AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!
comment: Ths hotel is by far the BEST that I have ever had the pleasue of staying at. My family and I went to Hurricane Harbor for a little get away. We stayed here and LOVED everything about it. The staff were awesome, the shuttle was awesome, the room was awesome. We have tickets to the Cowboys vs Giants game in Oct and we have already booked our room for the Belvoir, You cannot go wrong by staying at this hotel.

title: nice stay, but...
comment: Our recent stay started off great and I honestly would have rated higher EXCEPT for my discovery of the incredibly filthy bathtub drain when preparing for my night's shower after a 8-hour road trip...tub draining very slow...saw floating hair in water...looked in drain and pulled out a golf ball sized wad of hair PLUS a button, 2 disposable razor blade shields, and bath soap wrapper...which made me wonder about the housekeeping staff's attention as well as whoever inspected and passed the room...I find it hard to believe they would've not noticed the slow drain and bothered to check for the reason. Disappointing.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location; bay view rooms offer a wonderful view.
title: Great location; much needed renovation
comment: The hotel is located right off the marina & is centrally located to Downtown, the Gaslamp District, and the various amusement parks. We stayed one night, which was more than enough; unfortunately the hotel is in desperate need of a makeover: the paint and wallpaper were chipped and peeling (especially in the bathroom) and the carpet worn. Also the cleaning of the room was subpar: some type of brown liquid had been previously splattered in the bathroom but left untouched, hair was in the bathtub and on the shower walls, empty cans were in the closet - the list could go on. Had I not been using my Grandbourne points, I would've left and requested a full refund.

title: Awesome vacation
comment: The Belvoir was awesome! The amenities were great. My kids and i were very welcomed since we entered the parking lot. It is at a perfect center location to all of the San Diego attractions. We will definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: nice location and nice rooms w. great views
title: nice hotel but missing amenities
comment: the pool/spa were not working and our floor ice maker was not producing ice. The club room was nice w. the young male attendant doing a great job.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and newly renovated hotel rooms. Also, very friendly staff.
title: Lounge Changes
comment: Very disappointed in changes made to the lounge. Shorter hours and less quality food seemed to be driven by cost savings although the staff says they were trying for consistency with other Belvoirs. Being a frequenty traveler and having stayed at many Sheatons, they missed by a mile. As a platinum member and frequent traveler, use to look forward to unwinding in the lounge, Now it opens too late in the morning for me to have breakfast and a lot of my food favorites are gone (no hot horsd'oeuvres in the evening and no freshly cut fruit in the morning for eample).

title: Belvoir, New Orleans
comment: The hotel is undergoing construction and that makes things a little less convenient. I was there for a conference and this was the alternate hotel. The first night, I did not receive conference information for the next day under the door. When I questioned the front desk, they said we are not a conference hotel. I went to the conference officials and they confirmed that the Belvoir was a conference hotel and the following nights the material was available. I think it is important that the staff recognize when the facility has significant events

title: Just Okay
comment: I stay at Grandbourne Brand Hotels a minimum of 3 days a week and this stay was least impressive. Staff was not very friendly or helpful, which is unusual for the chain. The hotel is in a great location. I attended a wedding at another hotel and the staff there was MUCH nicer and more helpful than the staff at the hotel I was staying at which was disappointing.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean, new, air conditioning works well, club lounge has a good breakfast.
title: Excellent by Grandbourne Platinum Standards
comment: Excellent hotel by Belvoir Grandbourne standards, had all of the Grandbourne Platinum amenities including free wireless internet, club lounge open all day with an excellent breakfast and great service, good air conditioning on 90+ summer day. The lobby is new and well put together. The only negative was the congested traffic we experienced in front of the hotel at mid-afternoon getting our car from the parking garage and then trying to pull in front of the hotel and get back in traffic. As a Grandbourne member, familiar with other hotels in NYC and a elsewhere, I recommend this Belvoir for the reasons stated above.

title: Great location but disappointed
comment: No fridge space, storing bags at hotel costs $, no free wifi in room, no coffee jug, pool is shared with another hotel diagonally across the street.

title: Lounge quality is failing
comment: I stay at this hotel on a weekly basis for the past few months and I have felt that the quality of amenities in the lounge is falling at a quick rate. There used to be fresh fruit and hard boiled eggs available at breakfast and also two hot dishes available in the evening. Breakfast has now been relegated to bread, bagels and toast, and in the evening just cheese and crackers. I expect more for Platinum level amenities, and I have to say I am disappointed in the lowering of quality available to the Platinum level customers. The lounge is one of the reason I stay at Belvoirs, and I have to admit I am disappointed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel for business and personal travel!
title: This hotel is very convenient - -
comment: Hotel is right of interstate and has plenty of parking. Very easy to get to downtown and back on Route 89. Rooms are very comfortable and quiet. Always a great value too!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't count on good wireless connections.
title: People great, but facilities not
comment: First off, the staff was great! But...

title: Poor service
comment: We had a company rate that is $100 less than the rack rate that wouldn't be honored. The attitude and rudenesss or the phone staff only made an unacceptable situation worse.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is super friendly and cheerful!
title: Belvoir
comment: Friendliest staff I have ever met!

title: Food/Service only Downer
comment: The late check-in after flying across country was the most enjoyable part of our one night stay. Room as expected. However, breakfast in the morning was dissapointing. Service was nonexistant and slow when anyone was around. The food I guess is what one should expect, below average at best.

title: The rooms in this hotel are below normal Belvoir standards.
comment: I was originally put in a room on the fourth floor adjacent to the external exhaust fans outside which shook the pictures on the walls and were extremely noisy. I was moved to another room but had to accept two smaller beds instead of the king bed I wanted.

everyoneShouldKnow: Have a drink at the bar, many great personalities there.
title: A Great Place to Stay
comment: Clean facility, good operating elevators, nice restaurant and bar, with safe and ample parking.

title: Right on the beach!
comment: This hotel is located in the right place! I would recommend this hotel to everyone. We had great walks at night on the boardwalk and there are some great places to eat on the street that the hotel is on. We just parked the car in your lot and walked everywhere. We had a great time! Can't wait to come back!

title: Very cold Pool
comment: We were traveling with kids so the pool was a must for us. We were told during the reservation process that the pool was heated. On our 9 day trip this pool was the coldest, we were unable to swim at this hotel. Also on our travels this was the only facility that had a life guard at the pool. Because of the temperature he had nothing to do.

title: Check In
comment: Overall this hotel was good. My one gripe was that checkin took over a half hour. The clerk kept saying the computer was slow but the five other people behind me got checked in pretty quickly by the other clerk.

title: Great Hotel
comment: I have stayed at this location many times. It is clean, comfortable, the staff is great. Excellent value. I always have good service. Love the pool, deli, and restaurant. Room service breakfast is awesome, delivered 15 minutes after ordering! But my favorite is the park shuttle. So convenient to take to the theme parks, every 1/2 hour departures. We just park our car and enjoy the rides! We'll be back!

title: Good features, but needs improving
comment: This hotel has a very nice lobby and courtyard, but a few things were, in my mind, discouraging. The rooms were not as clean as they should be; most need a good cleaning and some others need renovating (tiles, carpet...). And the other thing that caught my attention was the lack of free Wi-Fi in the rooms, as it was only availible in the lobby. In the rooms, it cost approximately $10 per device. But other than those inconveniences, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

title: Our outsanding stay!
comment: We had an outstanding stay at the Belvoir Columbia South Carolina, on 4-5 August 2012. The staff is very pleasant. During Check-in and "especially" during our Check-out the morning of the 5th, the front desk personnel and managent staff were outstanding. We love this hotel. This is our place to stay in Columbia!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: You need to pay more for resort fee and parking fee.
title: Resort fee and parking fee
comment: The hotel room is okay, AC vent needs to be dusted, showed curtain needs to be washed, but overall is not too bad. I was surprised in addition to the $12 resort fee, (even I don't use their pool and internet service, I still have to pay it), there is another $12 parking fee. That's just another way the hotel gets more money. If you go to Legoland, this hotel is a good choice.

title: Belvoir downtown Raleigh
comment: Staff well trained & facility is clean. However, I have stayed at this hotel several years in the summer & the room temperature is uncontrollable. You can set the thermostat at 78 & freeze during the day or 70 at night and burn up. Apparently there are issues with the AC design. I have mentioned at each stay (conference) & the staff & engineering have not been able to correct.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay here, if you have to make sure you rent a car you will come out way cheaper.
title: Wizard of Oz
comment: The location of this hotel looks like a tornado hit a took this Belvoir and dropped it in the middle of no man land. There is nothing around it in walking distance(NOTHING). So you think the hotel would take that into consideration and have a good shuttle service, nope they have a transportation service that may or may not answer the phone if they do it will be $12 each way to get you to civilization. Front desk help was very rude in particular Lindsay the food staff was Outsanding and were probably way too talented to work at this dive. This hotel does not deserve to be any part of the BPG family, not the service level I am use to!

everyoneShouldKnow: great location, easy access to transportation
title: ed/hilda sd vacation
comment: great views, convenient to all locations, comfortable rooms, access from room to vehicle was easy. check in staff was good, check out staff not very friendly; however would stay again

title: Great Stay
comment: We enjoyed this hotel very much when we visited Phila. I have stayed here several times, and will continue to stay here.

title: Wonderful
comment: Great Hotel, Restaurants, Starbucks, We had a wonderful stay.

title: Highly Recommend for Business Stay
comment: Clean, quiet, and most importantly, super comfortable beds.

title: Disappointed
comment: I have been accumulating my miles for a special event for many years.. It finally came time to use my miles. I requested something special or something to recognize that it was a honeymoon for my granddauhter. They promised me they will take care of the situation and will do something ,they noted it in the reservations. Absolutely nothing was done, no congratulations, no wine, no sign nothing. Just a grouchy lady checking them in at 3:00 am because their flight was delayed. I am disappointed with BPG.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location for downtown events. Rooms very much needing an update. Also need to be cleaned.
title: Room was unexceptable
comment: My room was not up to standard. The carpet was dirty and the air conditioning could not get the temp under 78 degrees. It was very uncomfortable.

title: Great Location
comment: This is the 2nd time my family and I have stayed at the Belvoir Bucks County Hotel on vacation. Sesame Place is right across the street, and the hotel offers a free shuttle van throughout the day to the park (which is GREAT because parking there is not free). We arrived early, and I went to the front desk to let them know we were there, but that we'd be leaving our vehicle in the parking lot and heading over to Sesame Place. To my surprise, our room was ready, and we were allowed to check in then (SO much nicer than having to leave everything in the car and drag it in after a full day with 2 children at an amusement park at 9:30 in the evening)! The woman at the front desk gave my boys rubber ducks for the bathtub, too (not expected- very sweet).

title: Enjoyed my stay
comment: I really enjoyed my stay even though I was there for a night. I slept like a baby, the bed was great and so were the pillows. I will be back

title: Not so good
comment: I tryed to make hot water for tea with the coffee maker and a putrid brown liquid came out. The carpet and bathrooms are very outdated, as well as the matresses. This place is not worth the rates they charge.

title: Slept Well In Seattle
comment: Great location, just blocks from the Pike Street Market and the typical downtown attractions! Didn't use the $5/day green savings (for not requiring daily room service), but still liked that we saved water and electricity. Great stay for a conference.

title: hotel features
comment: Had a nice stay but thought WI FI service

title: Hotel Looks Beautiful BUT...
comment: Hotel is beautiful and comfortable. Housekeeping is excellent. My issues with this stay are two. 1) I had trouble connecting to the internet in my room. I let the front desk know 3 times, and I talked to the tech support 4x. It soon became obvious that no one could help me. The 5th time I spoke to the front desk in person. That shift told me to talk to the next shift. When I did that, I was told that they didn't know there had been a problem, and that I could use the computer in the office center, which timed out every 45 min. I was trying to work, so that was annoying. Also, I was staying at the hotel, because my husband was running a 100 mile race, and I couldn't check on his progress, without the internet. I would think that since this race is an annual race, and runners and their families were staying at the hotel, the staff would do everything it could to be involved with this community activity. I only received an apology once from a front desk staff who happened to overhear my complaint. So, that is my second issue, lack of communication and followup. This hotel is supposed to be a resort, but it looked better than it functioned.

title: Great Resort To Stay and Relax.
comment: My family and I had a great time the 6 days we were at the resort. If you sit at the restaurant to have dinner or by the pool to enjoy the sun, you get with a warm family treatment that makes you feel very comfortable.

title: This hotel has great features.
comment: We loved the ocean and how clear it was.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a good exercise facility
title: my worst stay so far
comment: I have stayed at this hotel for the past 6 months, and I'm a plantinum guest. Each week, I have to reiterate my preferences for a room away from the elevators/ice machine. In spite of this, there seems to be no communication mechanism with the management to ensure that a frequent guest most basic request is met. This regularly causes me to be moved to lower floors because the change must be made at check-in. I have never had such a hard time getting a basic request met. If this is how the chain is operated, it won't take much longer to lose my loyalty.

title: Wonderful stay at this hotel
comment: We had a wonderful time during our stay with the anniversary brunch at your hotel - delicious! The room was clean and inviting. I was impressed that you even provided a small bath scrungy to use with the gel. Thanks for that.

everyoneShouldKnow: Thought the price was high for a conference for math teachers. The hotel is very nice, though.
title: Great place to stay
comment: The Belvoir Atlanta is a very nice property. The staff is ALWAYS around and ALWAYS ready to be of assistance. The food was delicious and the presentation was excellent.

title: Rug
comment: Our room #528 rugs are in need of replacement. I would not walk bare feet on those rugs.....they were were stained and felt "unhealthy". Also we stayed in room #526 and felt the same way.

title: Amazing
comment: I went for the attractions, and found it hard to want to leave the resort!

title: Hotel Location
comment: We have stayed at this hotel for the past 5-6 years when we go down to see the Rangers play. It is a great location for the Rangers as you can walk to the ballpark

title: not a bad hotel for the price
comment: Have made several trips to this location over the past month and will be making several more. The hotel is ok overall. Last visit a huge group of kids for the youth conference were staying at the hotel and were running all through the halls. Asked several staff members about doing something about this and none of them did anything. I feel that as a business traveler it is important to be able to get work done and be well rested for my work day. Staff does not seem well trained. i will be staying here again as this is a preferred hotel for my company but if my experience is the same next month I will be asking for a change. The location and remodeled rooms are great. new pool chairs and tables are badly needed.

title: Family Getaway
comment: Staff was very nice & helpful! Room was very clean, which comes from someone who is very picky about room cleanliness! It was a standard hotel room size & bathroom size. We could hear music from somewhere outside even though we were on a higher floor, but we didn't mention it to the front desk because we were so tired from our day that we fell asleep quickly. The cafe restaurant downstairs was overpriced & not very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: You will need a car to see the island as there isn't too much around the hotel
title: Great location but room outdated.
comment: The Belvoir on Kauai is undergoing much needed renovations. We were disappointed to find out that our "ocean view"room was in the old section across the street. Our view included many telephone lines and just wasn't what we anticipated. The room itself was "okay", but felt outdated. The staff was welcoming and very nice. We would come back to the Belvoir if we could be guaranteed a more updated room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't trust the reservation you make by phone!
title: No room at the inn"
comment: I made a reservation 7 months in advance for a convention I was attending. Upon arrival I was told that my reservation did not extend through the date I had requested.

title: Everything we needed
comment: Great service, accommodated all our needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Internet access in the room is only available at extra charge in the room, and complimentary service is poor in the common areas.
title: This hotel has room for improvement
comment: Being the Belvoir I expected better; many of our group had trouble with room key programming, the hotel keys to the safe were misplaced every time and many safes broken. One day dirty towels were left on the counter by room service. Internet access is below modern expectations.

title: Awesome atmosphere
comment: One and only problem, too many groups of kid sports teams were there at a time. They overtook the hotel, pools, jacuzzis. Suggestion, have an adult ONLY pool and jacuzzi. Kids were even in the bars!

title: The shuttle bus driver was excellent
comment: Driver understood hostipatilty.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Bay Tower is not part of the main resort.
title: Review of Bay Tower
comment: Its hard to give a review when youre comparing apples to oranges. The Belvoir Bay Tower is about to mile down the road from the main hotel resort. Make sure you understand that the Bay Tower is not part of the main complex. The pool at the Bay Tower is not heated and small, the restaurant was hardly ever open but the bar did serve food. The staff were great, rooms clean but you had to walk to get to the main hotel resort. We felt isolated and left out of this unique resort . So remember the Bay Tower is not part of the main resort.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff was very helpful and seen to all my needs, they treated me like a king.
title: Perfect
comment: This hotel fit my needs perfectly. It's location couldn't have been better it's just a few minutes drive from down town, across the street from mall and the Cobb Galleria convention center. I'd not only stay here again I'd reccomend it to my friends also.

title: Service
comment: Belvoir does it again. Best service by far.

title: Average
comment: Honestly, had better experiences elsewhere. Ok for people literally just passing thru. Wasn't that impressed. Front desk can use additional help as they have 2 people at night but only 1 in the morning...? Valet car was never parked overnight and just sat in front of hotel all night. End of the world, no, but c'mon...

title: Very nice hotel
comment: very nice, would recommend to anyone staying near DC area

title: Great Location
comment: We love to stay at the Belvoir Boston Hotel because of the great location. We can walk to Fenway and the Prudential Center Mall is just a walk through a hallway on the second floor. This time we discovered the "Top of the Hub", 52 stories above Boston for a meal or just a cocktail with an amazing view. Of course the view from our room was also wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not bad but way over priced
title: Not worth the price
comment: Over all this hotel was ok but just not worth the money. I was there in a conference group rate which was still over priced so the regular price is out of this world for what you get. It was really just a lot of little things that made the price just not match the quality of hotel the Belvoir is supposed to be. For example I had to slam my door every time I shut it in order to get it to close (rm 605), my toilet seat would not stay up which was very inconvenient when I had to pee. I brought food for my meals to warm up and there was no microwave for me to do that. They charge $20 to have one brought to your room no matter how long the stay. Again I understand all of these examples are just small but they are the type of things you would not expect to see at a Hotel that you pay that much for and one that has a rep like the Belvoir. It was not bad you just dont get what you pay for.

title: Perfect
comment: We stayed for Freshman Orientation at Drexel University and was extremely impressed. The location was perfect, within walking distance to the campus, the rooms were clean comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. I didn't get a chance to use the fitness facilities but will make it a point to during our next stay as it is well equipped and inviting. We will definitely be staying here every time we visit our son during his college career.

everyoneShouldKnow: GM does not respond to complaints even from corporate!
title: Communication and Response
comment: Employees MAKEUP excuses for bad service! GM not responsive even from corporate communication! I contacted corporate who immediately contacted hotel and the Manager on duty was going to call me? Seems like a huge communication problem-no response!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is below even the most moderate expectation.
title: This was a disappointing stay all the way around
comment: I was told there was "free" wireless internet. When I arrived I learned this meant in the lobby. As a business traveler it is essential that I have internet access IN MY ROOM. I was told that I would receive "free" breakfast. When I arrived I learned this meant for only 1 person and there were two of us staying. I will say that the staff in the restaurant were very well trained and were friendly and efficient. The food was delicious and presented well on the plates. The front desk supervisor was argumentative and difficult. I asked to see the manager twice but she refused to let me see him, pointing to her badge and to the fact that it said "supervisor". The furniture in our room was beat up. The electrical outlets were in poor condition and most did not work, as a I learned after plugging my phone in all night in one of the outlets that did not work.

title: Best Downtown Hotel
comment: Stayed in another 4star. This was much better: lobby, breakfast buffett, rooms, and it had a roof top pool! Valet parking was a little slow to fetch auto.

title: Nice stay but room mix up
comment: Rooms were nice but we ended up divided into two rooms, making it difficult with young children. Staff tried to help but I wish we would have had the room we expected to have.

title: Good job
comment: The staff and the room were excellent. Loved the Starbucks coffee in the room and the morning paper.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its within walking distance to Old Towne and the rooms are big and quiet!
title: Great Hotel
comment: Other than the Lemon flavored Water Jar falling off the table in the lobby during check-in the stay was great! Always is....

everyoneShouldKnow: Sound issues have occurred every time I've stayed here (3 or 4x in 2 years)
title: Could've been 5 but for the noise
comment: If it weren't for the high-pitched whistling soulnd that woke me 4 times in one night I would have given 5 stars (I think it's when someone turns on the cold water - in another room or on another floor). If you want sleep this is not the best place till this issue is resolved.

everyoneShouldKnow: its in a great location! even though its NJ you are actually only 20 minutes from central Manhatten. The ferry ride is a treat.
comment: fantastic facility. excellent service, particularly from the check in team. Always personal and attentive. Well done Lincoln Harbour and see you again soon.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and Club Lounge very disappointing
title: Club Lounge is Disapppointing, service not great
comment: Stayed at this location 2 years ago and upgraded to have lounge use and it was a very good value, food was good. This year food was a major disaappoinment with very basic items everyone was complaining. My wife had a scone from Starbucks and several guests asked how she got that. Staff told us theyhad to cut back as what they had was above corporate standards but room prices were not cut? Overall service at the hotel was slow or requests did not happen, asked for a shower cap several times told would be right there never came.

title: Great hotel
comment: Very impressed with the renovations. Rooms looked fresh and new and very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

title: This hotel had some problems.
comment: To whom ever it may concern,

everyoneShouldKnow: Small rooms, didn't care about my platinum status, wall A/C next to the desk - too noisy to work, low number of TV channels compared to other hotels, no washer and dryer for long term stays. This hotel shouldn't be part of Grandbourne. I will never be back.
title: Low end Belvoir
comment: Small rooms, didn't care about my platinum status, wall A/C next to the desk - too noisy to work, low number of TV channels compared to other hotels, no washer and dryer for long term stays. This hotel shouldn't be part of Grandbourne. I will never be back.

title: NICE HOTEL, RUDE CLUB STAFF
comment: GREAT HOTEL, BUT CLUB STAFF WAS VERY RUDE TO MY SON, TIME FOR SOME STAFF TO RETIRE OR GET A JOB THEY ENJOY, TALKED TO FRONT DESK STAFF, BUT THEY WERE NOT INTERESTED IN MY FEEDBACK,,,,WILL NOT STAY THEY AGAIN

title: great location
comment: the staff and rooms were excellent. for a trip to NY the location was great. keep up the good work

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a convenient location to the offices in the Northwest Houston area.
title: Multiple stays
comment: I've stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions and the staff is always consistent, friendly, and thorough. Nice convenient location to local offices restaurants. And the airport is only 35 minutes away.

title: Great Vacation Location
comment: My family and I used our Grandbourne points to stay at this property for summer vacation. The location could not have been better. The room was freshly remodeled and the Club Lounge was comfortable.

title: Great Service
comment: The staff at the OKC Belvoir are excellent.From check-in , valet, food service on the club level, this staff is there to please and be very helpful with any need.

title: Family Stay
comment: Just completed a stay here, booked through Allegiant Air. We arrived around midnight and our rooms were available, we even had a suite for one of our rooms, and both were on the top floor (not sure if this was because of BPG status or not, I called Belvoir beforehand to get confirmation numbers). The night front desk attendant was very helpful. We really enjoyed our stay, there's a lot to do, the facility is well maintained, family friendly and fun. Would definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: location is perfect, staff are great but the rooms are really small
title: great location
comment: hotel is in ia great locatios but the rooms are very small specially for a family of four

title: Honeymooner Happy!
comment: The Belvoir downtown Waikiki was fantastic. I went there for my honeymoon, wanting the 'over the top' experience for a few nights, and it was exactly what we were hoping for. The staff was more than accommodating, the breakfast (we had vouchers for the buffet) was unbelievable. The pools/hottubs/hammocks etc. were always pretty busy, but they were amazing!

title: This hotel was perfect
comment: Great location, clean rooms, attentive staff

everyoneShouldKnow: They have a concierge that will help you get tickets and give advise about anything you might like to do in the area.
title: Excellent Hotel
comment: The Belvoir is the best place to stay in LA. The pool and restaurant are incredible. It is close to everything and has a shuttle to Universal Studios. The staff is superior and the rooms are amazing. I received an email prior to my stay from the manager and I responded with a request that they met.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is a great place to relax and to enjoy yourself.
title: The hotel is so beautiful!
comment: The Belvoir Wahwah is so nice! We were greeted by a very nice person at the front desk. (Lisa) We had asked for a special room with extra amenties. She was aware of all the items and gave us a very nice room. The lobby is so well maintained and beautiful. Just wanted to sit and relax there all day! Thanks for a great stay!

title: Below Expectations
comment: I stayed at this hotel as part of a group. When we arrived to check in there was an issue with payment. The front desk staff would not listen to us as we tried to explain the situation and gain clarification. The staff continued to talk over us and was clearly not listening as we tried to learn about the hotel policies. It was not until we revealed our organization's affiliation that we began to be listened to. All guest should be treated with respect regardless of affiliation.

title: Awesome Hotel
comment: Had a great stay! The staff was very attuned to creating a relaxing atmosphere and they hey were great! The room was clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Belvoir Phoenix
comment: The hotel was very nice and comfortable. The only down side was that I ordered a pizza from room service that was really awful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access to restaurants and shopping
title: Comfortable stay
comment: Staff was great. Room was comfortable

everyoneShouldKnow: nearby many places to eat and go shopping
title: sesame place first time
comment: staff was wonderful and so helpful. the shuttle between hotel and sesame place is fantastic running all day.

title: Worst Grandbourne Hotel Experience
comment: Check-in process was unorganized. Non-sound proof room. There was a bar and grill that played loud music until late night hours. Management lacked attention needed to address and quickly resolve concerns. The hotel seems to be very unprepared for handling large groups all at once.

everyoneShouldKnow: Find another hotel. Competition may be what is necessary to get owners/management to upgrade.
title: Belvoir in name only
comment: Computers were not working at check-in causing long delay. No separate check-in for BPG Platinum members. Access to Club Floor by room key in elevator but the key readers in both elevators were inoperative meaning I could not get to my room unless accompanied by a staff to walk up to the top floor and personally call the elevator. In my room the TV was not working until maintenance came. I stay at BPG hotels more than 60 nights a year and mostly Belvoirs. This is my second time at this hotel in about 18 months. The first stay was disappointing. This one was unacceptable. The hotel is well out of date and right in the flight path (noisy). To top it all off, the fire alarm went off at 5:30 am. When I called the front desk I was told that they did not know where the problem was but to "stay in your room." I told them to check the kitchen since breakfast service starts at 6:00. Sure enough. That's where the problem was. In 10 minutes the alarm was silenced -- but I was awake. Nice staff cannot make up for poor operations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Check volume on tv before ordering a movie?
title: Great stay, slight tech problem
comment: Great staff, great welcome, no issues with my two cats, and very responsive to questions and requests.

title: Work/Play in SEA
comment: Great hotel and location for work and play. Only negative comment is lack of water and coffee available in the lobby.

title: bad rooms
comment: The TV didn't work in the first room and there was a spider in out bed. Then the room they moved us to was way smaller. The bathroom was tiny and the A.C. didn't work. For the price we had to pay it was ridiculous. Wouldn't recommend to anyone. Worst hotel experience I've ever had!

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent customer service, very clean rooms, newly renovated, convenient location
title: A Pleasent Stay
comment: We spent 3 nights here. We were very happy with the staff at the hotel. They were very pleasant, knowledgeable and responsive to our needs. For example, the iron in our room was not functioning. A call to the front desk and I had a new iron brought to the room within 15 minutes, very impressive! The room was very clean and in good condition, newly renovated I believe, although a little small, but this is expected in NYC hotels. My only complaint about the room was that the closet was a bit difficult to manage, it is not designed to allow for many hanging clothes. Also there were no drawers in which to store clothes. The closet had just a small table with 2 shelves in it. It would even have been better if it had drawer fronts on it. It was fine for a short stay but for an extended stay the lack of drawers would be very frustrating. The full length mirror is awkwardly place in the closet which my wife found frustrating. The room had a 42 inch T.V. which was nice. The area around the hotel is generally safe, during the day I had no concerns, but I would be a bit more alert if walking late at night on Fulton Mall in the immediate area of the hotel. The hotel has good interior security and requires a room key to access the elevators. There are 3 nearby subway stations and allowed easy access to multiple lines. The only downside of this location is the difficulty in getting Taxi's. We got lucky that a taxi had been coming down Duffield street as we were leaving the Hotel, but getting one is hit or miss. It is not like getting a Taxi in Manhattan. So if you are late for something and need a taxi expect to either walk a few blocks or hope someone is being dropped off at the hotel. There is a roof top club at the Hotel that is just above the club floor. I appreciated that the staff accommodated our request to be moved down to a lower floor (22 rather than 25) I was willing to trade the club level for the assurance of a good nights sleep on the preferred guest floor. It was very quiet and we were never disturbed by the music. There are many nearby restaurants in the area as you head west towards the Heights.

title: carpets
comment: the room carpets did not meet the level of cleanliness that i come to expect from Grandbourne brand hotels. They had some deep stains that made the room unpleasant.

title: Conference
comment: I recently stayed at the Belvoir for a conference with my work. Staff was great, room was clean and comfortable. Loved the stay!!

title: I would definitely stay here again
comment: I stayed here while attending a conference at the Convention Center. The hotel is very conveniently located close by. My room was very nice and the staff very attentive. Overall, this was an excellent stay and I would definitely choose the Belvoir Downtown again if I return to Phoenix.

title: This hotel has great features
comment: Easy access to highway & various shops.

title: Needs help
comment: The location of the hotel is excellent and the front desk is very helpful. The first night I stayed at the hotel, my room was dusty, bed wasnt made, and the bathroom clearly had not been cleaned. I called guest services, they sent someone to clean it but they only brought a microfiber cloth. I asked for a room change (broke out into hives and started sneezing) which wasnt able to happen that night but they were able to accommodate me the next day. The second room was better but clearly dusting and vacuuming is something the hotel needs to work on. For someone with horrendous allergies, a clean room on a business trip is very important; I cannot go into for a full day of meetings with hives and sneezing all day.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be Prepared to spend the extra money to park your car in THEIR parking lot.
title: Be Prepared!!!
comment: We visit Disney World often, as we live on the East Coast of Florida. This was our first visit to the Dolphin Hotel, and our last. They charge for everything. It was $15.00 per night to park, plus $14.99 for essentially 2 bottles of water. There was no remote to the TV, one was brought to us after we called and waited for 30 minutes. The Wi-Fi was not very good, only one bar. It is not very "kid" friendly, and is NOT a Disney property.

title: Why not?
comment: I do not understand why you charge so much for something so simple and small as internet access. Internet is a necessity in the modern world. Why not providing free Internet access for all rooms, as Belvoir does in other locations?

title: Daughter's IPAD
comment: Hello,

everyoneShouldKnow: great location, great club room attendant
title: Great stay, good location, good staff
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir Harborside in Portsmouth on August 4. We had no problem checking in and the front desk was very attentive and polite despite how busy it was. The room was clean and you cannot beat the location of this hotel. I do have to single out one particular member of the staff. This was the club room attendant. She was very personable and polite and kept everything clean and running smoothly, she was also very professional. As we watched her interact with other guests you could see that others thought the same. We have stayed here before and experienced the same kindness. I believe that her name was "Vivian". I would recommend this hotel to others and will stay here again.

title: The hotel is average.
comment: Should include shuttle service and free parking.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are traveling for business this is a poor choice to stay. Thumbs up if you want a place to party.
title: This hotel is loud
comment: I was disappointed that my next door neighbors loudness kept me up all night. I called the front desk twice and went down once during the night to report. The multiple guests in the room next door woke me up at 1 AM and were still having loud conversation at 4:45 AM. The hotel did give me a free breakfast and moved me the next night, but I should have been able to sleep after the first time I called and the loud guests should have been moved.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great! Club is very nice!
title: 3 night stay on Club floor
comment: We enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir Downtown Denver hotel very much. The room had great views and was very comfortable. The location was just what we wanted one the 16th St. pedestrian mall but also within easy walking distance of the Capital Building and other interesting buildings. There was lots to do right outside the hotel door. The Club was very nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: The room was hot at night.
title: Staff was friendly, Facilities were ok
comment: The staff was nice. The ice machine on my floor did not work and was not fixed during my 4 day stay - I even called the first day to let the desk know. The room was hot at night - every night.

title: Alexandria Review
comment: The guest room was spacious and nice. However, the bathtub did not drain well and the AC was not super cool. Food from Room Service was not at all fulfilling or flavorful. During my stay, the cable service was not working for all channels and while staff responded quickly, they were not able to fix the problem.

everyoneShouldKnow: Huge Pool and lounge and family friendly.
title: Very Nice Belvoir
comment: This is my third stay at this location for business. Really nice property with a spacious and comfortable room. HUGE TV and terrific bed. Club lounge was well stocked and staffed. ..... Disappointing that this time the fitness center had a dirty floor and exercise mats as well as a towel left on the floor in this area.

title: Excellent visit
comment: Texas Wind 2012 used your hotel as base and that was a great choice. Our room was excellent, convenience was great and conference was outstanding.

title: Comfortable rooms and great staff
comment: Beds are comfortable and rooms are spacious. Restaurant wait staff is excellent. Location is great - you can walk to the nearby mall and several restaurants.

title: Great hotel
comment: This was my second stay at this Hotel. The check in staff was very friendly. I had my 8yr old son with me and when we came back to our room that evening there was a note to him with a free movie and popcorn. He was so excited to have that personlaized to him. It was a great touch. Also our TV wasn't working correctly and wasn't able to be fix but they offered us free movies to make up for the in convenience. I would stay here again!

title: Great Stay
comment: Loved the room and friendliness of the staff! Great pool and play area for the kids.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very unassuming and understated.
title: Good stay
comment: The beds are very conducive to a good night rest. Overall it is a very comfortable and clean hotel. Staff are well trained. This has been my hotel of choice in Pasadena- 20 nights in the last 2 months. The only downside is if you are an avid swimmer where the pool temperature is low and 40% of the pool is less than 3 feet deep.

title: It'll be delivered right away - NOT!!!
comment: I was not very happy with the service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location to do all things in Seattle!!
title: Seattle in July
comment: Great hotel, perfect location, close to everything, nice workout facility

title: Great hotel with excellent staff
comment: Highly recommend great staff

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location but don't be fooled. It is below expectation service, staffing, cleanliness and no BPG recognition. Plenty of other nice hotels in the same area, with competitive rates, that will treat you better.
title: BPG Recognition? Not at this hotel!
comment: When I arrived at the hotel I was told the hotel was "full" and finding a room with my bed preference would be difficult. I had a reservation in advance and was surprised at this given I was an BPG member. When I got to my room in the "older" wing of the hotel, I noticed a person was sitting on the room patio. It was a cook with the hotel, and his entire grill/cooking set-up with chaffing dishes, outside my patio door. There was a party about to take place directly outside my door. As a business traveler with an early meeting, I immediately requested a room change. It took approx 20 minutes before a new key arrived for my next room. When I got to the next room, the AC was broken. While the room was quiet, and hot, it was also dirty. There were stains on the carpet and the fabric of the shower curtain. There was hair on the bathroom floor and what appeared to be a blood stain in the drain area of the tub. At this point it was getting late, I was on my second room, and I was ready to eat dinner. The person I was traveling with, also an BPG Gold Member, checked in with similar room problems. We both decided to stick it out for night and grab some dinner before it was too late. When we left for dinner, we discovered that when they transferred our rooms, they did not move our parking validation to the new room key. So we could not exit the parking structure. We rang for assistance and were first interrogated over the speaker phone by the attended. When he realized we could not get out of the parking structure with our current keys he came out to meet us. He was rude in responses to us and told us to "take it up" with the front desk people to fix our key. When we returned from dinner, we stopped at the front desk and told them what happened in the parking garage and advised about the rude employee. They said they would fix it and re-keyed us. In the morning when we went to check out, they tried to charge us twice for parking! After explaining what happened the night before the front desk person actually asked me how my stay was.. I told them dissapointing. Not once did she ask if there was something that could be improved or even tried to get any further information. She just handed me my receipt. The entire stay with the hotel was a dissapointment. I recently joined BPG membership and aquired an BPG AMEX credit card. I am a member of a competing preferred guest program. This experiece does not even come close to the same quality as similiar programs.

title: Very Nice
comment: The staff was very nice. the hotel was very clean. It would of been nice if it was nown that there was a place to use free internet for the guests of the hotel.

title: Great Service
comment: Arrived late and in a rush for a meeting. The check-in was fast and staff very helpfull with luggage. Had a nice welcome drink and snack to grab on the go at front desk. Room was close to Club Lounge which was great. Snacks were great in lounge, but the food offering were a bit lacking for example the muffins were not tasty and the evening food was only red meat.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel caters to your needs
title: Met my needs
comment: This hotel was great for my family reunion. My family members enjoyed the hotel and the amenties

everyoneShouldKnow: Great views of San Diego Bay and Coronado North Island.
title: Stay 21-24 Aug 2012
comment: Some check-in confusion occurred when we arrived at Marina Tower and were directed to Bay Tower. House keeping in Bay Tower was spotty: never changed out dirty glasses and last day received no bath towels but 10-12 wash clothes instead. Scott, bartender at Tapatinis was very professional. Rebecca at Bay Tower bar was excellent. Thanks.

title: Definitely would come back
comment: We booked Club Level room at Belvoir Waikiki for a week in July so our our room was on the 30th floor with full ocean & diamond head views. Club Level was an excellent choice since we barely spent extra money on foods/drinks . People who works at Leah1 Club Lounge always provide great service with a smile . We'd like to thank Stanley-our daily host at Leah1 & Rosemary-our house keepper for making our trip more pleasant & memorable. See you next year. Mahalo!

title: Front desk
comment: It was the first time I stayed at this location and found the front desk to be very helpful and knowledgable about the area. Also the shuttles to the airport and metro were very helpful and efficient..

title: We loved our room and the view
comment: We we very pleased with our room and location and pleased that we could use public transportation to get to old San Juan. We would stay again

title: Great Hotel
comment: Great stay. Everything was wonderful!!

title: Exceptional Service
comment: Our visit to the hotel was exceptional. From the front desk to the banquet staff, the service was positive and professional.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hope you get lucky because if you dont you will regret staying there.
title: Poor service and room
comment: I was given a room where the chair was soaking wet as if a large glass or bottle was spille din it. When I went back down they gave me a room with bad air conditioning in hot DC Weather. I gave in and kept it as I was afraid what was waiting for me in the next "wonderful" room I would be given. Of course they gave me $20 dollar off coupon for their bar or restaurant even though I told them it was of no use to me. I had plans for dinner and would be departing before the restaurant opened in the morning. All in all really unique brand of poor service.

title: Friendly Staff
comment: I found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. My trip to OKC was for three days, but for some reason, I could not book the third night via the internet. The front desk was very helpful to secure that third night for me. From the doorman/valet parker to the restaurant staff, they exhibited the values and mission hotel staff should represent - customer is job 1. Unfortunately, one of the bartenders seemed like a grouch. Perhaps this guy needs to work in a another part of the hotel for a change!

everyoneShouldKnow: The dining room food was good, at least the food that was serviced at breakfast.
title: This hotel has a nice bar area and dining area.
comment: The Belvoir front desk staff was very helpful, and so were the bar and dining area staff. Although I only spent one night, I enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to friends and stay at The Belvoir the next time I visit Miami.

title: Nice!
comment: Even though the hotel is under construction, we never had a problem with it. Signage was great on getting to where we needed to go. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. The room was very clean and spacious. Only complaint is charging for internet. Really now a days...internet is cheap! Parking is $15 per day but the package I booked it was included. That was great!! Looking forward to coming back once the remodel is done.

title: Very disappointing
comment: Usually, Belvoir hotels are very consistent - very clean and taken care of well. However, this hotel did not meet expectations at all. The carpet was stained and sticky and the room was not well-maintained.

title: Enjoyable stay at the hotel
comment: The hotel was clean, comfortable, the staff is great. Excellent value. I always have good service. After a long day at Disney land the beds in the room were great. the hotel shuttle to Disneyland is the best. The fire works view from the hotel is excellent.The food service was very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you stay at this property; your vacation will be memorable.
title: Outstanding Vacation Experience
comment: The Belvoir exceeded our expectations in all catergories. The suites are beautiful, spacious, and offer great views of the ocean. The front desk was very courteous and helpful during our stay. We received BPG recognition, and was very pleased how the front desk made sure our stay was extra special. We could walk to many shops and restaurants; the location is great. We have traveled up and down the East Coast, Florida as well as the Caribbean, and would definately stay at the Belvoir Virginia Beach again.

title: Review
comment: The hotel was below our expectations. The room was clean and service fine but both the furniture and carpeting need updating. The service was excellent. The rates we paid were discounted and we would have been definiteoy disappointed if we had been charged full price.

everyoneShouldKnow: It' is in a good location for access to the city
title: From West Texas
comment: This is a nice hotel, and the staff was great. The room was hot, and the temperature could not be easily adjusted. Getting in and out of the parking lot with a room key was also difficult. With that said, this is still a good place to stay,

title: Location
comment: Perfect place to stay to see a Tides game. Staff was helpful and friendly. Room was pleasant and clean. Will return.

title: could have been cleaner
comment: Mildew smell in bathroom. Filth on light switches. Trash along woodline of parking lot. Junk left on floor by elevator for 3 days. Remote not working. Baseball size bird dropping on window.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very helpful and freindly!
title: Staff great
comment: Staff was helpful and friendly.

title: The Staff was Great
comment: The Staff was great The food at the Club was excellant And most of all from the Maids to the front desk people were respectable from now on when I am on my way to Myrtle Beach I will be staying at the Belvoir Richmond Park South

title: Thanks!!
comment: Thanks so much for the great stay. Only thing that would be better is if there was a continental breakfast served.

title: Very comfortable
comment: The front desk staff at this hotel extremely courteous and professional. The hotel is very clean and the beds are oh so comfortable. It is very convenient to use the "sky walk" over to the mall. Highly recommend this site.

title: Pretty, Clean but Small
comment: My friend and I wanted to stay outside the typical tourist area- and the Belvoir Tribeca was our choice. A cute hotel- but do not plan to stay in your room for any length of time. The space is too small- there is 12" between the bed and the desk and as an Interior Designer, I cannot believe their design team did this. I love small spaces, but this was over furnished. Upgraded to the club- which was worth it for the internet- though I was a little disappointed that cocktails were not included in the happy hour like other hotels in NYC I have visited. Staff is great and accommodating.

title: BPG Gold benefit
comment: As an BPG Gold member I have always either had a room upgrade or at least afforded use of the Club Room. I understand the Belvoir Harrisburg Hershey Hotel was packed during my stay, but I was disappointed that I wasn't allowed Club level privileges.

everyoneShouldKnow: They are nice & treat you with respect.
title: Great features
comment: We very much enjoyed our stay at the hotel all the staff from the hotel check in to the waiter/waitresses in the restaurant, to maintence & yes we did have to call as we messed up the AC. Still they were very nice. Thank You for making our business trip to Dallas less stressful.

title: Check in a problem
comment: Hotel management needs to allow BPG guests to check in promptly instead of telling them to get in the back of a long line.

title: Marcus Evans Conference
comment: Bed linens were stained when we arrived.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very Good Locationa nd excellent staff
title: Room Comfort
comment: Everything was fabulous except the thermostat is for show. Putting it down to 65 and still was not cool in the room

title: Fix the vending machines
comment: Vending machine on 3rd floor would not take money; the one on 9 floor took the dollar bill, but didn't give soda, returning 20 dimes; the one on 4 floor took the dimes, but didn't give soda or money back. Had to go to first floor front desk to complain and got the soda from a resturant on second floor. I just wanted a coke, but spent over 30 minutes. Also one of the two elevator constantly out of order and the swimming pool is really small.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a great location if visiting the Fair or the Waterpark
title: Great Hotel
comment: Our hotel stay was great. The room was nicd and roomy. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Hotel Thoughts
comment: The bath tub was all chipped . Took a while to check in staff standing around chatting . Then you charged me $20 for an up grade. Being a gold member did not think you needed to jab me the extra 20, more principle then the money.

title: Very convenient spot
comment: Whenever you travel a distance it's always good to know that your hotel destination will be comfortable and pleasant. The Belvoir at Hauppauge met that all the way. It also helped a great deal that the hotel was located in such an easy access area to the roads and highway. The staff was also very pleasant and helpful.

title: Expectations met!
comment: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this beautiful hotel. The staff was superb! Everyone was kind and friendly. I ate breakfast and dinner in the City House Restaurant and they were attentive and friendly. I look forward to coming back and enjoying a longer stay.

title: The best customer care service
comment: The hotel is amazing, But the service was better. Just feel the pool area should stay open a little bit longer since it's the summer.

title: Nice room, poor service
comment: Front desk service was awful, waited for 20 minutes for the person talking on the phone to acknowledge me. Once off the phone acted like I just showed up, no sorry for making you wait or anything of the sort. The next day, different person working the desk same long wait. Need a backup front desk person for when the line gets long.

title: Awesome Hotel!
comment: I have stayed at many hotels due to my work (lifetime Grandbourne Gold member) and I will have to rank this hotel among the best of the best!

title: Great, comfortable room
comment: We stayed here with our 2 young boys and found the staff to be friendly and accommodating, the room was spotless and well laid out, the bed was very comfortable, nice sized fridge, and the boys had fun swimming in both the indoor and outdoor pools. The location was great, being close to the Columbus Zoo which we visited, as well as a lot of restaurants and a Graeters Ice Cream.

title: 1st time, not the last time!
comment: 1st time in Chicago and at this hotel. Couldn't have been better. Location was perfect, so close to Navy Pier and Mag Mile. Everything I needed and wanted to see were within a short walk. View from my room overlooking the river was superb. Facility was clean, professional and elegant. Definitely would stay here again next time I'm in Chicago. Thank you!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great locations to airport and H&H Ranch for Reunions!
title: Handling large groups
comment: Hotel was host to 2 very large separate events. The hotel was not staffed to handle that large of crowds from front desk, bell service, carts, maid service. Maid service only place 1 set of towels each day, did not empty trash, long lines for checkin. But the staff keep their cool and was very helpful in resolving all issues, but it was frustrating. Bell service also should not allow people to take the carts, they should escort to ensure carts are returned timely.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly.
title: Calm in the midst of storm
comment: Large Conferences are alway hectic and unsettling as you familiarize yourself to your surroundings. The staff at this hotel was helpful and friendly. The meeting rooms were convenient. A very enjoyable experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: I will never stay at another Belvoir Hotel.
title: Director, Educational Foundation
comment: Remind me to never stay at a Belvoir !!!

title: Skip this Hotel while Under Construction
comment: The hotel was an absolute zoo. Construction was everywhere and the hotel was booked solid. I wouldn't pay over $100 per night until the construction is done. The room I had was very nicely renovated and it should be a nice facility once the work is complete. Until then, choose one of the 100+ other hotels in downtown NO.

title: Can I bring the bed home with me?
comment: This is the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! The room was a bit small, but very clean. We had problems with the toilet not flushing, but spoke with a building engineer who was able to fix it in a timely manner. Staff was very professional!

title: Comfortable stay in a very nice hotel
comment: Stayed at the Belvoir Anchorage for 3 nights as the host hotel for a conference. Was very pleased with the room - very comfortable bed, good selection of seating options (desk, easy chair, etc.), easy access to HVAC controls. Appreciated having a mini-frig in the room and a green option for housekeeping (fewer linen changes). Also having an ATM in the hotel. was handy. Staff - from front desk to restaurant to housekeeping - were all very friendly and helpful. Fitness center is very nice. Gorgeous view from the cardio equipment! My only complaint - no pool (but the website is clear about that.) Conference facilities were also very good. Rooms are the right temp, little noise carryover, nicely appointed.

title: Love this Belvoir
comment: So convient here ,love the pool and gym!Thanks for the great room upgrade>

title: Great stay!
comment: Outstanding stay! Only one "below expectation:" It would have been nicer if the itemized bill was delivered to the room for my review before I checked out. Everything else was great!

title: review 1
comment: There were some areas that could have really used improvement but other areas were excellent. I was surpised the service was not better however the food was phenominal.

title: Great location
comment: Downtown location is convenient to business and leisure activities.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great downtown location. Convenient to shopping & restaurants
title: indy1
comment: Wish room had a small fridge

title: great housekeeping staff
comment: With the quality of this hotel; nothing was free except room coffee. Its very sad that you have to purchase the internet in this hotel. Yes they have computers in the lobby but guest stays on them without a time limit. Also the price of the hotel food and drinks were expensive and the quality of food wasn't impressive. I think the hotel ocean side and marinas views were awesome. That's why the price is the way it is. Yes I would come back. The housekeeping staff were the friendly folks in San Diego. I really enjoyed talking to them. They need a pay raise

title: I was treated like a queen at the Belvoir
comment: The Belvoir made us feel like family as soon as we stepped out of the cab from the airport. Paul, the bellman, was exceptional!!! We had a small problem with the room and were immediately given another room and access to the lounge for continental breakfast and all day drinks and snacks. Wow, it was fabulous! The breakfast buffet was scrumpuous. The checkout was easy. Thank you to everyone at the Belvoir, we will be staying with you in July 2013,. See you then!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very good location close to Miami Airport
title: This hotel is not well organised
comment: When we checked in the staff forgot to bring our bags. We went to eat dinner and the bags were still not in our romm when we got back. The air condition in the room was not possible to change, it was very hot in the room.

title: Complimentary Breakfast
comment: We really enjoyed our stay. This is my first time to have complimentary breakfast (one time) at Belvoir.

title: Great Service
comment: Great place to stay. Service good. Rooms Clean. Easy access off hwy.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff strives to make your stay a great one.
title: GregoryS
comment: We attended a conference and this hotel was enjoyable and the staff was very attentive. Very helpful and courteous. Rooms and facilities were excellent and location to downtown as well. I would recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel with the exception of the A/C unit being loud
title: great value hotel at Bellevue
comment: Overall, one of the better Belvoir experience i have. Convenient location and i think the property is just been remodelled because the carpet and furnitures looks new.

everyoneShouldKnow: too expensive, not worth the money to stay here. Try a cheaper hotel that is closer to downtown.
title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
comment: Horrible experience with staff, and hotel. More specifically, the cardkey to parking didn't work nor did staff fix it, voice mail on phone didn't work properly, internet slow, staff didn't respect privacy sign on door, toilet too loud, I was put in the extra hotel, not the main hotel and I had to walk 10 mins with all of my luggage after flying 5 hours, no signs to tell you where things were like alternate entrances, hallways too dark, location not close to downtown, TV setup too cumberson to enjoy, room arrangement was not enjoyable

title: Good generally, but mixed
comment: Liked room, club lounge, pool, and most employees. Did not like one employee who was very unhelpful.

title: Pet friendly hotel
comment: Nice location, clean, and friendly staff. Our room was very nice and quiet considering it was facing the city and not oceanfront.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very busy & noisy & not so clean
title: Nope, not again
comment: I originally booked this room months ago & called the hotel to specifically reserve a bay view room. I was told absolutely no problem & they supposedly put a note in the system. Upon checking in, the front desk states "we are at capacity & no longer have bay view but we will give u a marina view". Grrr.. Then when we get into the room the couch has white spattered disgusting looking stuff all over couch as well as long blonde hair on it. I call the front desk to complain & they send up a maid with sheets. Placing them over couch & chair- BUT the sheets have stains too! Walls had handprints on them. The lamp in room has a clear base, it looked like it had never been cleaned! The drinking glasses were smudged not clean. The cords from snack case were sticking out all on floor. TO TOP IT OFF, it was extremely noisy from other guests very late at night/early morning & we could even hear the flushing of toilets from other rooms! This room was over $150 & I've stayed at cleaner $40 rooms in Vegas than this! PLUS, parking was $22?!!! & then we had to wait for parking attendant each time we wanted to leave or come in because our room key would not work on the "automatic gate". I will NEVER stay here again!

everyoneShouldKnow: You feel as if you are in your own tropical world, very private and absolutely beautiful!
title: BEST VACATION EVER!
comment: The Belvoir Kauai Resort is absolutely wonderful! I have vacationed on Oahu, Maui, the Big Island but never have been to Kauai. It was beautiful. The resort had everything you could ever want. We spent our days laying on the gorgeous beach, swimming in the ocean, tanning by the pool, eating wonderful food & enjoying tropical drinks. The beach is amazing, not crowded, one of the best beaches I have ever been to. The grounds are exquisite, so many places to relax and take in the scenery. We had a garden room which was wonderful, waking up to birds outside, VERY comfortable beds, loved it! I would recommend this resort to anyone! The staff is so helpful, friendly & outgoing, they make you feel very welcome. Weather was perfect. We will return to the Belvoir Kauai again & again! I can't wait to come back...we didn't want to leave.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff was very helpful and freindly no matter what time it was!
title: This hotel has a great staff!
comment: Due to confrences that were going on, the hotel was full and the rooms weren't ready at 3pm. Front Desk staff let me go ahead and check in then offered a free drink or appetizer due to the wait. Thank you so much!

title: Remodeling
comment: Scores low mostly due to remodel. Hopefully this will improve once rennovations are complete.

title: Not so Happy Experience
comment: We did not get our money's worth. Bad beds and coffee. Had to talk to 3 people b4 we can address an issue and took about an hour to get it resolved.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in a great location, close to all Pittsburgh has to offer. Definately the place to stay when in Pittsburgh
title: This hotel is a geat place to stay
comment: my son's recent wedding was at the Belvoir and we were totally pleased. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast in the dining room was a little pricey, but we recieved plenty and it was very good. There was a large group of family members that came for the wedding and stayed over at the Belvoir and all were pleased. Lastly hats off to the events staff they were excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location for business or pleasure in historic area.
title: Great historic location
comment: Very nice fourth floor (top?) room. Some odd noises at times. In otherwise lovely bathroom (shower only - which is fine with me), while standing at sink, I'd hear a noise like rattling from left-hand side of wall. When I put my hand on the wall, it stopped. When I removed my hand, it resumed. Very odd. Couldn't hear noise in other parts of room, though. A few small, nonthreatening insects in bathroom. A/C was loud and vent was pointed right at the bed. Had to be sure to turn away from it when sleeping. Convenient Hertz car rental desk in hotel.

title: Teacher
comment: the check in took to long with 3 conferences going on and had only 2 attendents to check in people. Also the room was not the cleanest

everyoneShouldKnow: Great home base, but wireless will cost extra.
title: Surprised
comment: After reading a less than flattering review, I was expecting to put up with what ever I had to for a short time. What a pleasant surprise.

title: Great stay at Belvoir Suites Key West
