comment: All of the staff were professional, courteous and friendly, starting with Check In and all the way to checking out. We were impressed with the consistent, friendly service we received from the Concierge, All Shuttle Drivers, as well as food and beverage staff. Only one Housekeeper was rude and late in cleaning room. Overall a wonderful experience in a picturesque setting.

title: sherton fll beach
comment: the location is good but the parking is way expensive than should be !!!! even the self parking make no since for hotel guest

title: Hotel has good location
comment: Hotel has a perfect location right near the beach and International Market Place, and has a nice pool but rooms are old and could all stand remodeling!

everyoneShouldKnow: centrally located. comfortable beds. well appointed rooms.
title: Belvoir meets needs
comment: centrally located, comfortable bed and well appointed rooms. We moved over to the Belvoir from a LoDo area trendy type hotel where we had a terrible stay -- the bed was broken, provided no support, rooms dirty -- so we left that for the Belvoir and the Belvoir proved to be old reliable providing us with a quality stay.

title: Great Location
comment: Location was great, staff was very helpful. Would definitely return and recommend to friends.

title: The hotel was delightful.
comment: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Not a great area
comment: The hotel was fine. The room met our needs for the night. Trying to find a restaurant within walking distance of the hotel will be a challenge. We ended up taking a cab. At check in I asked about a Platinum upgrade to a suite and was told immediately that all suites were sold out. When we got to our room I looked at BPG.com and noticed several categories of suites were for sale. I called the front desk and again asked about a suite and they "found" one for us. The club lounge breakfast was subpar to all other Belvoir's I have stayed at. No hot options. Only fruit and cereal.

everyoneShouldKnow: THAT THE HOTEL IS VERY CLEAN AND NEWLY RENOVATED
title: VERY IMPRESSED FROM THE LAST TIME I STAYED WHICH WAS WHEN IT WAS Belvoir SAFARI THE RENOVATIONS LOOK GREAT
comment: I WAS WOWWED BY THE RENOVATION

title: Wonderful
comment: The staff was amazing. They were knowledgeable, professional, helpful and courteous. Charles was on the front desk when we checked in and nobody could ask for a better man. He went out of his way to helpful by doing things like getting us directions to for the next morning. The self-parking was as easy as it can be and just two right turns away without ever going off the hotel property. When we checked out the bellman walked us to our car in the parking garage and loaded our bags for us. It cant be any easier than that. We had two connecting rooms and they were amazing!!

title: Loved the beds!
comment: Best night's rest of my entire vacation! Very friendly and helpful staff, absolutely loved my stay at this hotel!

title: Belvoir Hotel & Marina
comment: Hotel was in a great location of town. Bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly and ready to assist with anything. Food was great but could carry more types of beers at the bar.

title: disinterested staff
comment: The check in was slow and tortuous; the staff were disinterested and frequently took phone calls which slowed the process; they were unconcerned about the low strength wifi signal in my room (one actually said "what would you suggest?"); they refused late checkout (though the chamber maid said I could stay til 2pm); they overcharged me twice for items bought from the lobby shop. In short this is a hotel coasting on the fact that it is well placed and popular so it doesnt need to provide good customer service.

title: great for short stay
comment: Hotel is located in downtown great location, service and staff excellent.

title: Nice, But.............
comment: Nice Facility and the staff was great.

title: great place to stay
comment: hotel met all our needs and expectations

title: Amazing customer service
comment: My husband and I came to the Dolphin to celebrate our anniversary. Upon arrival we asked if there were any king size bed rooms available. The woman that checked us in upgraded our room for us since we were celebrating. After arriving back in our room after being at Disney for the day, we found that six chocolate covered strawberries had been delivered with a bottle of champagne with a note from the front desk staff. It was a wonderful surprise. We will absolutely be returning to stay at the Dolphin.

title: Great hotel
comment: This Belvoir exceeded our expectations! Was way newer then expected. I love the Belvoir bedding ! Room was beautiful, cleAn and comfortable. We were there for a wedding . Don't know if we would ever get back to Syracuse . But we love Belvoirs.

title: Awesome
comment: I am in the lodging business and that has unfortunaly set my standards for any accomodation very high. I have to say I was impressed. I would have to start with chek in. the Front desk(Denisse) was very professional and very Helpful. The room was very clean the beds were comfortable and the room ammenites were adequate. Had a little problem with our lock when we got there it was taken care of immediately. Maintenance even followed up with us to make sure it was working properly.. wow someone who cares. I would definetely reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting the area. Thank you for an enjoyable stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: close to everything, short drive to the beach, Broadway at the Beach or most attractions
title: great place to start the week
comment: love the wide open windows looking over the city, it was raining when we arrived with lightning, the view from the room was fantastic

everyoneShouldKnow: Great price for a Belvoir flag hotel
title: Great location, greatest price
comment: This is my second time at this location and was great to find a nice deal directly from Belvoir. Because of this I was able to accumulate points in my Grandbourne Preferred Gust Account.

title: Un happy guest
comment: Have stayed the last few years but for what ever reason this year I was not please during my three day stay my bed was made but was lien was not change the floor was not clean had a problem at check in I was asked to put up a $50.00 holding fee. which I was not told when reservation was made.I must say that management was helpful when I voice my concerns.

title: Hotel has everything you need
comment: We had so much fun at this hotel! The kids loved the pool! This hotel is very close to Disney's Boardwalk and this was the first time we had visited there. We are definitely going back. The hotel was very clean & the staff was very helpful.

title: Great and comfortable
comment: This was one of the best Belvoirs I have ever stayed in. Met some friends for a weekend of cards and the hotel provided us with a salon to play all weekend! The club room - clean and comfortable. Room was very nice and the bed was great! Will definitely return again!

title: Far exceeded our expectations: fabulous amenities
comment: We were super pleased with EVERYTHING. All the packages/specials are incredible. We took advantage of the Birth Year Special and couldn't believe the deal we got! Awesome modern spacious room, indoor and outdoor pools, really nice fitness center, Starbucks coffee bar, on-site dining options and very pet friendly. We will be back!

title: Lovely stay
comment: We went for a wedding. The staff was wonderful. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was a wonderful weekend.

title: Comfortable
comment: Overall it was very comfortable. I selected to not have my linens changes but I didn't expect the coffee/water not to be replenished. I thought they would at least tidy up the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: The self parking is located behind the hotel and costs $15/night
title: Decent Hotel
comment: The rooms are comfortable and amenities are decent. The front desk is slow to check people in (took me about 15 minutes in the platinum line just to get to the desk for check-in) and the self parking is not obvious to find. There is no sign to let people know self parking is located behind the hotel and even the self parking will cost you $15 a night/per car.

everyoneShouldKnow: They have areas of opportunity to be great.
title: this hotel was convenient to the places I needed to go.
comment: First of all, let me complement the front desk staff. They were friendly and very engaging.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful hotel with extremely friendly staff
title: Very Nice Hotel
comment: Beautiful hotel. Comfortable clean rooms, our room had a beautiful view of the city. Good restaurant and nice bar area. Friendly helpful staff. Conveniently located to downtown entertainment district. Parking is $25 nightly but that is typical for downtown Nashville. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Summer Excursion
comment: Quiet rooms, great views. Had driven to ABQ and found the hotel easy to find and convenient.

title: Hotel Stay
comment: Upon arrival, the clerk (orential man) was rude, argued with me that I did not have a double room. Had I check my confirmation it would have shown king. My confirmation showed DOUBLE!!! Card to the parking lot did not work. DeDo was the only good thing about this hotel. He was very helpful. Room card would not work, parking lot cards not working. Dedo was polite and moved us to another room. DOUBLE..however the AC never worked properly. Room would not cool. I would not recommend a stay there

title: Small room!
comment: The staff was very friendly and the hotel had been nicely renovated however this could not make up for staying in the smallest hotel room I have ever seen in north America. The furniture was oversized and you could barely walk around the bed. Looking at the fire escape plan we had been put into an extra small room. The regular rooms would have had about an extra 4' and would have still been very small.

title: Good stay bad experienca
comment: We were pleased with the hotel overall, however the Bar located inside the hotel is not acceptable. The staff, 4 of them let us sit there for 15 mins before seeing to our needs. Tha bar was empty except for me and my wife. Got a round of drinks and that was the last we saw of our server. we asked one of the other tenders to close us out a they said they could not, we had to wait for our server who was on break. Another 15mins later we left. the bill was 18.00 dollars and with tax should have been 19.21, but the bill showed a 15% tip added and it was neither earned or deserved. I asked the front desk about it and they stated that the bar was not supposed to add tip without knowledge.

everyoneShouldKnow: Althought the location was great, the rooms were below quality.
title: This was hotel was not up to par
comment: This hotel was expensive, the door to the closet fell off when I opened it. The dresser was missing a handle, the lights did not work, not plugs to plug them in.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are going for quiet time don't go it's too noisy. Pool is very small to do laps. Very deceiving in the pictures.
title: Comfortable rooms
comment: The pool size was deceiving. Very small & there was too much noise with kids in the pool. No supervision and kids went in the gym all wet. No security to watch for children running around when their parents don't watch them. The room was nice put the hotel was too noisy.

title: Excellent Hotel in NYC
comment: This was a great hotel to stay in. The location is fantastic, just a few blocks from Times Square and a few blocks from Central Park. You can pretty much walk anywhere from here. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the bartender makes a mean margarita!

everyoneShouldKnow: The building is split between the Plaza and Tower. The Plaza has the front desk which is staffed. The Tower building has no desk or staff. There seemed at times that people from off the street could just enter the building and hang out. There is security for the elevators (card swipe to guest floors) but no security for this building.
title: Security
comment: The building is split between the Plaza and Tower. The Plaza has the front desk which is staffed. The Tower building has no desk or staff. There seemed at times that people from off the street could just enter the building and hang out. There is security for the elevators (card swipe to guest floors) but no security for this building.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Excellent Hotel, great bed and decor

title: Great staff
comment: Friendly and accommodating

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff goes out of their way to assist you!
title: services
comment: We were attending services in Lakewood for the first time.. and the Belvoir dropped us off and picked us up so we would not have to worry about parking! Great service! Greatt experience! Great Birthday! Thank you.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very old and not comfortable
title: Hotel is terrible
comment: This is an old and awful hotel and is far and far and away the absolute worst Grandbourne hotel I have ever stayed at. The hotel is very old, the walls are thin and the air conditionioning did not work properly. I was there for a wedding and I know several guests (including myself and my wife, the groom, and the best man) who did not sleep well because the a/c would shut off at night, leaving the place very humid, and would make very loud noises which would wake us up when it went on again. On top ofthat, the TV did not work, the sink was backed up, the bathroom smelled, and the fridge stopped working. I won't be staying here again.

title: Great Hotel with special offers!
comment: Great rooms with offerable offers.

title: Great location and facilities. Entire staff was very accommadating.
comment: Totally enjoyable. Did not receive five dollar voucher for no housekeepping on Saturday.

title: Service needs improvement
comment: Extremely long lines and lack of recognition of BPG status and fact that my daughter's wedding brought over 25 rooms to the hotel for a weekend.

title: Everything needs improvement
comment: During this stay, my key card malfunctioned twice. On the first occasion it took the hotel 45 minutes to correct and deliver new key. IN meantime, missed a meeting. Twice the pool / gym area was without towels. They failed to respond in over an hour on 7/31. My hallway had walls with peeling wallpaper, stained areas, and carpet was unravelling and in very poor condition. The meeting rooms for my conference were FRIGID and terribly uncomfortable but my room was able to maintain a constant temperature and was continuously humid and uncomfortably warm. The room staff did a fine job however. Pool area does not have adequate seating and the pool area is not well maintained. Trash was constantly visible and not collected and soiled pool towels were not picked up and clean towels were not restored. The gym area itself was small and did not provide amenities such as TV for news, cable, etc for the ellipticals and running machine. Several ellipticals were not operational.

everyoneShouldKnow: located in front of convention center
title: luisG
comment: The hotel is well located, just in front of the convention center. The cleanliness of the hotel rooms and common areas needs to be improve. The fitness center is a pretty much a tredmile.

title: Nice, but Noisy
comment: The hotel was beautiful and the room was well kept and comfortable. The only issue was that the walls of our room seemed to be really thin. We did not arrive until after midnight, but could not sleep for a couple of hours as we clearly heard the argument in the room to the left and a small party to the right (Including when people spoke at a regular volume). I did speak to the front desk around 2am and I am grateful as it was much better after that.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beach is great, but be prepared to walk. I reccomend a cart to take items to and from the beach.
title: NICE RESORT BEAUTIFUL BEACH
comment: The beach is beautiful. Staff was excellent. Resort is good. Needs a few updates on carpeting in hallways, but otherwise great. We tired to brew coffee and the coffee maker was broken, but a quick call to guest services and in 10 minutes we had a new one.

title: This hotel was amazing!!!
comment: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a vacation. We purchased our stay on Groupon for a very reasonable rate. We stayed in a Deluxe King Suite. We were blown away when we walked in the room. Living room, bedroom separated by french doors, bathroom with whirlpool. My husband said this is what he wants our master suite to look like if we ever build a house. I would strongly recommend staying here!

everyoneShouldKnow: Service and staff are horrible. Shuttle bus takes FOREVER, you can walk to the hotel from the airport faster!!!
title: Complete Letdown
comment: Do NOT stay at this hotel. It was a complete letdown. I travel for a living, and stay in hotels, both foreign and domestic, 3, 4, 5 nights a week. When I can, I try to stay in BPG hotels because of the wonderful costomer service, and because I know I will be staying in a nice, clean, safe environment. This stay started off by waiting an hour and a half at the airport for the shuttle bus. When it picked me up at almost midnight, it was so full of other people who had been waiting just as long, that I was the last person it could hold. The driver had to turn away approximately forty other people, a lot of them families with children, to pick up later. This was just unacceptable. Then there was only one person working the reception desk, which slowed check in down to a crawl. I landed at ten p.m. and it was around two thirty a.m. when I finally got to my room, which wasn't all that great. The next day when I attempted to check out, the reception desk was understaffed again. I had to wait to check out because I never got my usual bill under my door and needed a hard copy for business reasons. After waiting behind a lady for almost half an hour, a group came in off a shuttle bus and someone came from the back to help them, but ignored me. Then, when the lady in fron of me was finally done, the girl behind the desk ignored me to wait on a girl who just walked in and rudely cut right in front of me. When she finally got to me and checked me out and I asked for a hard copy of my bill, she complained to me why didn't I just use the one from under my door? Really? I asked to speak to the manager, who of course was unavailable. BPG/Belvoir should take their name away from this hotel before it ruins their reputation.

title: Great location but missing a few things
comment: Wish there was a fridge in the rooms. Shocked to find that you had to pay 9.95 per device per day to hook up to the wifi. The resturant was good but the breakfast was wayyyyy over priced. $5 for a cup of coffee four of us just having eggs and toast with a few home fries came to over $70.00 the Buffet was 25.00 a person. The facility was nice and clean. It is in a great location for many attractions. The doorman/valet was very nice and a hard worker.

title: average
comment: I killed a bug in my room. I had to walk through the pool deck and up four flights of stairs to my room. They charged $9.95/day/DEVICE for internet - outrageous.

everyoneShouldKnow: PERFECT LOCATION FOR A PERFECT TRIP!
title: GREAT TRIP!
comment: OUR STAY WAS GREAT..... WE REALLY ENJOY THE DOWNTOWN AREA & THIS HOTEL MADE IT A GREAT TRIP!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Some rooms are very far from the elevator. If you have ambliatory problems, this is not the hotel for you.
title: This hotel lacks
comment: Everything is extra. No wifi, no refrigerator in the room, no microwave. Costs are inflated in the gift shop. I needed to buy some tylenol, apririns and some malox tablets and the cost was almost $40.00. They were small bottles. When I inquired about the cost the sales lady rudely grabbed the items from off the counter and said nothing. I bought my medicine elsewhere for 1/3 the cost.

title: great location, great service.
comment: The location of this hotel is great. Only a few blocks from pikes market and the monorail. Upon my arrival, I was greeted by the desk clerck and acknowledged as a Grandbourne member. I asked if the had a suite available and she upgraded me to a fabulous suite. The room was nicely decorated and so were the bathrooms. The lobby was open but the lounging area was somewhat hidden, but nice none the less. The club lounge was large and comfortable, with the best evening food selection I have seen from a Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking downtown is difficult, take advantage of free shuttle.
title: Beautiful Resort
comment: Wonderful place to stay with shuttle service to downtown. Breakfast buffet needs an upgrade. Opens at 7:30 but hot food not ready til 8:00 and just average, but pricey. Rooms are large and comfy.Pool is relaxing.

everyoneShouldKnow: That it offers a lot for the price you pay.
title: This hotel has a lot to offer
comment: Great staff, and the hotel offers a lot for the price.

title: Hotel was very clean.
comment: I had made a reservation for my wife and I and another couple. At check-in there was several members of staff so the line moved quickly. It was after 3 and the staff member said the rooms that I had ordered with a king bed was not available. All were gone. I had made the reservations a month ahead. We had to ask if we could have some compensation by having free parking. Hea gave us $10 off. Then the nice room had a view of a wall. I made reservations through the hotel and not priceline and feel a little cheated. That being said. The bed was comfortable, the air worked great, nice tv, and nice bathroom.

title: Nickle and dime you to death
comment: The hotel was nice, got a special rate with a trade show (still high in my opinion), however, parking was $21.00 per day, no special deal if you were a guest. It's located down town so I can see charging for parking for random people off the street. Half of that rate for room guests would have been acceptable. Internet was $15.95 per day as well. Who charges for that in now a days? I'm a frequent member of another large hotel chain and I get free parking, internet, happy hour drinks and breakfast.. - I was a little shocked since I have not stayed at a Belvoir in a while. Guess this hotel chain really isn't for the business traveler.

title: Very accomodating
comment: The hotel was beautiful and the staff went above and beyond to make our stay there a pleasant one. The only issue we had was we couldn't seem to get the room cooled down to our liking.

title: Great Hotel/Great Value
comment: This was a upscale hotel that offered a great value. The place was absolutely crowded with class reunions, weddings, etc.

title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
comment: As soon as I checked in I was told that without the physical credit card that we reserved the room with we were unable to check in. This was an employer reserved room. The bathtub had a very slow drainage. By the time I was done showering I would be practically taking a bath. And the sink also had slow drainage. The restaurant service was very slow.

title: Great Stay
comment: This BPG Hotel has the best staff ever very friendly.

title: Recent Stay
comment: I was very impressed with the attractiveness of the hotel and especially my room. In fact, my cousin decided to move over to the hotel from another where he was staying after seeing my room.

title: Comfortable Stay.
comment: I was visiting this hotel during a convention I was attending. The hotel recognized my BPG status, which was appreciated. The rooms were always cleaned and restocked. The front desk associates were always helpful. My only complaints would be that the restaurant always seemed to need more staff and they also needed to be more knowledgeable about the menu, the bar had a very limited liquor selection, and Starbucks seemed to not have an actual close time which was rather frustrating. I am also an employee of Grandbourne and Starbucks did not seem to want to accept my food and beverage discount unless I pushed the matter, then they took down my name and room number, this seemed rather unnecessary and a little frustrating for me.

title: Friendly
comment: Great location and friendly, helpful staff!

everyoneShouldKnow: a lot of walking between rooms and elevators
title: Review
comment: Noise from air conditioning unit over bathroom sink made loud noises whenever on - which in the heat was constant and sleep was difficult even with the door to the sleeping rooms shut.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has doors out to the 16th Street Mall. Great environment and fun.
title: Enjoyed my stay
comment: Had a great experience inside and outside my room. Staff were great.

title: THIS IS A GREAT HOTEL
comment: Location was great, I attended the Wilmington River Blues Festival and it was just a two min. ride to the hotel. Clean rooms, good food and great customer service.

title: Nice hotel could be great
comment: Check in was quick and precise. Alyssa was very accomadating and took care of my needs then called after i got to the room to make sure everything was to my liking thank you Alyssa great service. Overall room was comfortable, spacious and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. The only thing keeping this experience from being great was the elevators where extremely slow and the area outside of them was hot and humid. Also when i called down and asked the front desk agent Ivory the hours of the restaraunt she told me the standard hours and failed to mention that it is closed saturday afternoons which forced me to drive off property to get dinner. Very inconveniant when you walk down expecting to dine in the Hotel restaraunt.

title: Great location
comment: This is a great location but the overall experience was a little disappointing. Our room had drywall damage in the bathroom and mold on the ceiling. We did not have enough towels and called for more but they never arrived. Also the ice machine was not working on our floor. I expected more from this level of hotel.

title: not maintaine
comment: I have been staying at Grandbourne hotels for many years. My daughter is a Grandbourne staff member. I realize that you are independantly owned. I can't belive that one elevator was out of service. on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. At your prices, I find

title: Staff was top notch
comment: The staff was very friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: too pricey for what you receive
title: don't stay here
comment: when we had to move to another room & the air conditioner did not work we told the front desk of this at 7:45-52a.m. & when we returned that evening NO one had looked at it and we were told by the front desk that NO mention of this had been made-don't call me a liar and if something doesn't work why did you not move us?

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is prompt and friendly.
title: Good Hotel
comment: There were a number of activities during my visit. The staff seemed to handle most of them well. Things were a little backed up at the entrance and the parking lot was full but everything else was fine. The food was great! Request were addressed promptly. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Two room suite was great! And no resort fee!!
title: Good location
comment: Hotel has recently been remodeled and looks great. It is an older property but definetly fit our needs. We had a suite which was really nice. Check in staff was great and even offered us some rum punch to quench our thirst -nice touch! Don't bother with the breakfast buffet - order from the menu.

title: Terrible Experience
comment: I was very disappointed with my recent experience. The staff was unhelpful and unapologetic and provided an unsatisfactory solution to issues with my reservation. As a Grandbourne member, I expected more from this location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its clean and grounds are lovely and lush.
title: Great feature is location
comment: Our family vacation with Belvoir was excellent! We checked in early and housekeeping was top notch. Interior design was very nice, great job on remodel. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Look forward to our next vacation with Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, recently renovated and looks great.
title: Renovation has come along nicely
comment: I stayed at this hotel a few months back right in the middle of their renovation. There was a lot of construction which made the stay a little difficult. Not a big deal, and I definitely wanted to stay again to check it out. I contacted the hotel the night before my arrival and they were able to secure a reservation for me and were happy to do so, so kudos to their front office. Check in was a breeze and I was put on the top floor, which is the club floor. The room was very large and was clean. AC was quiet, which some people can be concerned about. About the only item that could be an issue is that bathrooms are pretty small...the door actually opens up and brushes against the toilet. For me, I was not concerned with this, but it is worth noting. The club room was very nice and I wish I had more time to hang out there. I grabbed a couple of wings and a beer and went back to my room before heading out for the evening. Wings were good, beer was cold, worked for me. I didn't check out the pool or eat in the restaurant, but it all looked very nice. I definitely like the lobby and bar area and will check that out the next time i'm in town. Will definitely look to book here next time i'm in Omaha.

everyoneShouldKnow: That it is Very Clean and the staff are very polite and helpful.
title: The Hotel was beautful and spacious.
comment: i loved the staff, and the room was perfect and "VERY CLEAN" i would visit soon once again.

title: Five Dollar Credit Housekeeping
comment: I was very disappointed that when I chose to participate in the green energy program by foregoing new towels and sheets for one night that housekeeping did not even make up my bed with the used sheets and take out the trash. A $5 credit is not enough to compensate for all the money that the hotel is saving on housekeeping by not providing any service to my room.

title: Overall pretty good.
comment: We stayed there Aug 1-4 and had a great time. Pool was awesome for the kids, and the Club floor amenities (breakfast etc) were really good. It's a busy place, so sometimes the lines at check-in etc can be long. Parking is a challenge, as they seem to have trouble regularly with the room cards not working properly to open the gates. We would stay here again next time.

title: nice but a little expensive
comment: The overall condition is good, but it is a little expensive.

title: OK
comment: This hotel met what I was looking for. Comfortable beds and clean overall. The fitness center was great, lots of equipment. No in room mini fridge which was a negative thing in my opinion.

title: Noooo
comment: The bathtub was very gross along with the blankets on the bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Walking distance to Navy pier and multiple great restaurants.
title: The hotel staff made us feel at home.
comment: Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was fantastic. We also enjoyed relaxing in the lounge with a glass a wine after a busy day in Chicago.

title: Too Long to Wait for Room
comment: This is our go to hotel in NYC. It is centrally located and meets our needs. However, this trip was a disaster. We arrived at 7:00 p.m. and was told our room wasn't ready. No huge deal and we were given a complimentary breakfast. We came back at 11:00 and there still wasn't a room available. We then sat around until midnight. We go the room discounted. While I very much appreciated what the staff did for us, with young kids and not being able to get into a room until midnight, this is unacceptable. They blamed housekeeping. But honestly, all they had to do was tell housekeeping to clean a specific room. Again, the staff did what they could, but to wait until midnight with young kids to get into a room was ridiculous.

title: Not worth it !
comment: Loud noises (construction??) at 5:30am Both morning we stayed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Enterance is Hidden in the middle but great location!
title: Great Location
comment: Great location! One block from Fisherman's Wharf. Was expecting Hotel to be nicer and rooms to be bigger for being a Belvoir and for the price.

everyoneShouldKnow: The area is under alot of construction, and can be tricky to get to with the alternate routes.
title: Better focus on demand
comment: While I had an enjoyable stay at this Belvoir, there were problems with shuttle services. Either the vans were filled to capacity or too small, especially during the evening and dinnertime. We found ourselves hunting someone down to provide another shuttle. It would be helpful if the shuttle ran more frequently during busy times.

title: Had a wonderful stay
comment: We were in town for the convention of Jehovah's Witnesses, and our stay was wonderful. Hotel staff was very accomodating. Only wish our room would have had a fridge. Also the spa was booked and the times they had available were not convenient for us. The pool and whirlpool were great!

title: very comfortable
comment: Room was excellent. Two nice big chairs for watching TV. Excellent room service.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location, facility, and its operations are outstanding.
title: High-quality staff/service
comment: On 30 July, I came to the Belvoir hotel in Dallas for a conference with the EEOC. While at the hotel, I received great service from the Belvoir staff. I have limited sightlegally blind and, thus, I appreciate assistance from supportive people. As I was checking-in to the hotel, I asked the clerk/reps for an easily accessible room -- that wouldnt require too much navigation for me to locate it. The front-desk reps were very responsive and facilitated my request. They were friendly and gave me additional information, verbally regarding the hotel layout and other important features on the premises. Also, a concierge provided particularly helpful and quick services; for example, she expeditiously got new washcloths for me, plus she patiently answered my other questions, and she carefully gave me verbal directions to some nearby points of interest ... enabling me to enjoy some of the local offerings there in Dallas. Several of the banquet staff also assisted me, as they informed me of all the beverages/nourishment available during the conference sessions. Some staff, in a few instances, kindly brought the selected hot tea and food back to my table. The friendly service was impressive to me. Good work deserves recognition. These staff well represent quality service, congruous with the Belvoir reputation. I was also personally assisted by a manager; when I was needing to get back to my room on the 4th floor, I asked a person near the elevator, who happened to be a manager, for assistance with the elevator, and he quickly helped me. He shows exemplary leadership. The North Olive Street Belvoir hotel staff demonstrated genuine care which is highly commendable. Please relay my gratitude to them all for their excellent service. Thank you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful facility. Located in a great area (especially for shopping).
title: A Successful Family Reunion at the Belvoir
comment: Our family could not have chosen a better Hotel for our Family Reunion. Although the self-parking was a little diffcult to deal with, our overall experience was absolutely wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Terrible that there is no laundry for long-term custormers. Even basic hotels have a couple of washers and dryers. Wifi should be free.
title: Expected more
comment: Room was comfortable and staff was nice (cleaning staff was great). However, other hotels in the area offer lockboxes and mini-fridges in the rooms at no charge. I thought the internet service was slow for the amount it cost (~$11/day). It was not feasible to pay for this long-term (I stayed 2 weeks). I bought a wireless modem and it was faster than the hotel wifi. There are no laundry facilities on premises which was a big surprise - the cleaning service they offer is expensive. Had to find a local laundomat to wash clothes twice while I was there. Overall, I was not impressed - wish I would have stayed at a different hotel near DFW. Won't stay at Belvoir again.

title: Enjoyed stay
comment: My family really enjoyed our stay in the hotel. The staff was so polite and always greeted us with a hello followed by a smile. If your interested in the nearby attractions this is the place to stay!!!

title: The size of the suite.
comment: The suite was roomy. You can see the pool from the rm.

title: Good/pleasant stay!
comment: After a 5 hr drive all I wanted was to check in and rest/refresh. The room(s) were not available and made to wait in the lounge.

title: Great Location...Great Hotel
comment: We recently went to a wedding in Boston and stayed at the Belvoir Boston, we were so pleasantly surprised how much there was to do in and around the hotel. We walked to Fenway, took the T downtown, and could walk to many resturarts and bars! We had a short stay but because of the location and great accomidations we were able to squeeze a lot in!!! BTW hotel resturant had the BEST clam chowder!!!

title: Great location, price and hotel!!
comment: We were very pleased with our stay!! The fitness center was top notch and the staff was so nice! We will definatley be back!!

title: Three star for front desk and four star for the rest (August 3-6 stay)
comment: Booked three nights at this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are great! Beds and bedding are perfect!
title: Excellent weekend
comment: Each year our organization has an event in Wilmington. Belvoir Suites is our hotel of choice, along with a majority of friends. I love the suites. The beds and bedding are to die for! God bless the staff for accommodating our very large group for the weekend. It's always perfect for me.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location of the hotel is in the heart of waikiki, with tons of things to keep busy with.
title: Shearton Waikiki
comment: This hotel is in the heart of Waikiki with many things to see and do. Location is great

title: GREAT HOTEL & STAFF.
comment: OUR STAY WAS VERY GOOD OVERALL. WE WERE IMPRESSED WITH SERVICE AND FOOD IN YOUR RESTUARANT. ONLY NEGATIVE WAS THE THINNESS OF THE TOILET TISSUE.

title: I like your internet availabliity at N/C
comment: Just a great place to stay

everyoneShouldKnow: The pool looks a bit weird
title: expected something more
comment: The hotel is really nice on the outside but the elevators are old and rickety and slow. The icemachine was really loud, soda machine didn't work. Around 230am the vent in the bathroom started making a clicking loud noise, I called the front desk and was told that maintenance wouldnt be in until the morning and a note will be left for them to come to my room, the noise stopped abt 545 and maintenance NEVER showed up. The continental breakfast was horrible.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is great for those who love the beach!
title: Great!
comment: We enjoyed the location and the ease of getting around the hotel. The staff was great and accommodating. It is very spacious and clean.

title: Excellent remodeling
comment: excellent work on the remodeling project. Big change from my last stay. My family was impressed and would like to come back. I hope you maintain the facilities or continue improving. Does not like the fact you allow dogs or pets that can cause bad odors and damage carpets. I love pets but I do not agree they belong at this newly renovated resort.

title: Remodel and Location are Terrific!
comment: Needed a hotel close to the airport and this Belvoir was recommended by my sister who stays here occasionally when traveling internationally. The staff was so helpful in securing a terrific corner room, the courtesy shuttle driver was very cheerful on an early morning trip to Ohare, and The Club Room offered a delicious assortment of breakfast and early evening treats! I even enjoyed an outdoor meal at Harry Caray's,(just behind the hotel) and walked around the business park for some exercise while visiting. Thanks!

everyoneShouldKnow: good location, Nice bed, fluffy pillows. Above all friendly staffs.
title: Comfortable stayed
comment: The staff are very friendly, they make you feel at home. From the registration, Lounge and housekeeping . The lounge have excellent, varieties of foods, fruits and drinks. Definitely I'm coming back to stay in any Belvoir again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are spacious and very comfortable!
title: Great for Jazzfest West attendees
comment: Great location, service, staff and atmosphere! My husband and I have stayed at this hotel for the past 5 yrs while attending the jazz festival. The hotel is perfect in every way!

everyoneShouldKnow: Proximity to airport, walkway along the marina
title: Great hotel overall
comment: The front desk allowed me to check in early around 11 am rather than 3 pm, which was great. The room I got in the Lanai Building was a bit old and not-so-clean, so I requested another room and received one in the main building which I was very pleased with (especially the beautiful view of the marina and sunset). The front desk was again easy to work with. I wasn't a fan of the $22 parking, and there were a lot of issues using my room key to get in/out of the parking lot, but otherwise this is a good hotel to stay at, especially because it's near the airport. All the employees I interacted with were polite and professional.

title: Concierge unhelpful
comment: My questions for the various concierge I spoke to were specific, but centered around normal tourist attractions. Their answers were broad ans unhelpful and in one case simply wrong. Thank goodness for smartphones. They seemed unhappy to be there and eager to pass me off as quickly as possible.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best location by Water and Mag mile
title: Awesome Location!!
comment: Despite I found this hotel on Expedia for much cheaper per night, Belvoir matched the price and gave me the same price. Hotel was beautiful inside, lobby and there's a Stabucks!! YAY!! The parking fee was outrageous ($38 daily for park and leave/self pay) but really there is no need for a car. Everywhere is too expensive to park and you can pretty much walk anywhere downtown. Plus taxi drivers are nuts there :) We had a wonderful stay and will be back to this hotel again, best location!!!! Close to everything!! Thank you Belvoir!!

title: Professor
comment: The front desk rep . who checked me in was very bad presentation for this nice hotel.

title: Belvoir Hotel Perfect Location
comment: I loved this location! You have everything you need right at your doorstep! The hotel was beautiful and was everything I wanted and needed for a great get away!

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is wonderful from reception to housekeeping.
title: wonderful experience
comment: We stayed at this hotel for a family reunion and found it to be an excellent hotel. The lobby and living room were spacious and the hotel staff were wonderful, my requests were met and exceeded by an attentive staff, even though the hotel was obviously full and they were quite busy.

title: Overall Great but Checkout Disapinting
comment: We stay at this hotel a few times a year and my family and I like it very much and will continue to stay there. However as a Platinum member and regular at the hotel I was disappointed when I asked for a 1.00 pm checkout was refused and then asked if I could have a 12.30pm checkout was also refused. I understand that the hotel is busy but you cannot tell me that if I vacate a room by 12.00 pm it is going to be

everyoneShouldKnow: Most of the staff is VERY attentive!
title: Most of the staff was STELLAR!!!!
comment: There were some stellar staff members who ensured a wonderful stay: Jude (Front Desk) Mike, Baharu, Trent (Shuttle), Keith & Chad (Food and Beverage) Kata (graveyard shift front desk), and Jeff (maintenance) just to name a few who were AMAZING! Unfortunately, there was an incident with housekeeping not cleaning my room one day. Kata @ 11:30pm helped me to change the sheets and clean my room. I informed the general manager, on his answering machine, with no response from him. I felt that level of service was unacceptable. He NEVER returned my call nor offered an apology for having a "long-term guest" (ME) doing the housekeeping duties. I stayed there last year for 2 weeks and did the same this year (had a 2nd reservation). I will miss the staff that ensured that my stay was pleasant, but management needs to get on board and make sure they are in touch with their guest. Because of the General Manager's response, or lack thereof, to me, the rating for this site is low. Unfortunately, I will NOT be returning to this hotel. If I wanted to clean my hotel rooms, I could have used my time share!!!

title: Lovely Hotel
comment: We spent 3 nights at the Belvoir. The hotel was very nice. We were on the 11th floor and had a great view of the harbor. The hotel staff was friendly and very accomodating. We were in the Marina Tower and the rooms were small but very nicely decorated. I would recommend this hotel. The only negative was that the food and beverage prices were higher than expected.

title: Great Hotel and Location was Perfect
comment: Wow - my family and I really like college towns and when we are travelling, like to stay in or near one. Well, this hotel's location was amazing and right near Iowa's campus, located near restaurants, shops, and had a great pool. The only two things that we wished that it had were free internet service and a breakfast that wasn't so expensive, especially since we had to pay to park and we had two children.

title: great hotel
comment: this hotel was wonderful. One added feature that needs to be done is to provide a microwave in the club room. Everyday the "hot food" served up there was COLD and there was no way to heat it up.

title: Very nice resort.
comment: The resort was very nice and I loved the fact we were so close to epcot. However, our room was connected to a room full of kids that were making alot of noice at 11:30pm when my husband and I were trying to sleep. I guess the parents were across the hall getting a good nights sleep. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary. The fridge did not work and spoiled our food and the maids came at 5pm to clean our room the first day and 9:30 am the second day. We would come back just not happy with our room this time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great downtown locations with conference center right there!
title: Bed size change
comment: Requested king size bed after finding 2 queens in room. Very nice about changing and managed to do it - THANKS!!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not worth the rate or the points used to stay
title: Overrated
comment: This is not a category 4 hotel , dont waste your star points. The staff was indifferent and in no way helpful. I had to call three times to get on the internet when they could have told me a simple instruction the first time. They were annoyed that i had to call about it at all and basically gave me any answer to get off the phone. The couch looked like it was taken from the curb- ripped and stained. we wouldnt even sit on it. I wasited two hours for a roll away bed to arrive after seeing that the pullout bed was brokenmen and unable to be slept on. IT arrived at 10:45PM. When it did i had gone down stauirs for something. I returned to the room to find a hotel employee had let himself intop the room where my husband and three year old were asleep in the bedroom. Totally unaccaptable. I had to wait 2 hours to go to sleep they could have waited 5 minutes for my return to set it up.

title: Excellent Beach Front Hotel
comment: Easy beach access, convenient to restaurants, shopping, and entertainment. Rooms are spacious and updated with beautiful views of the ocean. The lobby is tranquil and always smells great! Didn't use the pool (prefer beach) but it's very nice with a new poolside bar. Elevators get a little crowded at peak check in/out times. Staff is great!

title: traveler64
comment: location was perfect for event we planned

everyoneShouldKnow: The front line valet & check-in employee's are rude, unfriendly and treat you like they are doing you a favor letting you stay at this hotel!
title: Won't pay us to Park? We'll steal your car!
comment: The Belvoir at Miami airport has one motto, $$$$$. We arrived in the evening of 8-5-12. We attempted to park, check-in and get our own bags ourselves. We were told where to park so as we didn't block the front door so we could unload. But I soon found out that If you don't want the bell hops and the valet thieves to help you when you check in, your treated like road kill. I went inside to check -in, they demanded the keys from my wife and just took my car without permission and parked it 1/2 of a block away. Leaving crying kids and upset family standing there. When I came out and asked where my car is they pointed in a general direction and said they had more important customers to take care off. When pressed they then said that my car was in the way so they moved it, It was were I was initially told to park it, out of the way of the front door but where I could still get my bags. Turns out I was talking to the so called valet supervisor (a sad commentary on Belvoir's personal) I finally got upset, only after I made a scene was able to get my car back so I could unload it. There was only one Belvoir employee that was of help. I'm sorry I did not get his name. Was was a large person 6'5" or so, a person of color. He was wonderful and helped calm the situation,

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfort to go to the Disney Parks
title: Excellent!
comment: Exceeded my expectations!

title: Comfortable and convinient
comment: The location of the hotel is very convinient. As we are foreigners we needed a lot of help and the staff is warm, helpful, friendly, met all our needs. The facilities are a little bit scarce. It does not have separate dining room for the guests of the hotel, does not have a swimming pool etc.

title: unsatisfactory
comment: We were given two rooms on the BPG floor; 6th floor.

everyoneShouldKnow: No microwave or fridge in room. No WiFi in room.
title: High School Reunion
comment: I was very disappointed in this hotel and the lack of ammenities. No microwave or small fridge in room and no wifi in room. I have stayed in a lot of other smaller name hotels and got a lot more for the money. Definitely overpriced for what you get. In drastic need of re-modeling. They showed us a room that had supposedly been re-modeled and aside from the fact that the rug didn't have any bumps in it, it really didn't look much different than the ones that had not been re-modeled.

everyoneShouldKnow: A few minute shuttle from the aiport, plenty of free parking, sufficient fitness room, indoor/outdoor pool and gas/convenience store next door.
title: Friendly, Caring Staff, decent facilities and Genuine Apologies
comment: Have stayed at the Belvoir Charlotte Airport Hotel twice and its price, facilities and service are right if you need to stay near the airport area. Staff is always nice and caring (in the North Carolina way). Facilities are good. Executive Room floor with lounge. I had a problem with the room and when I brought it up with the front desk, they apologized profusely and immediately offered a very suitable token of apology. As an BPG Platinum, I was recognized and treated appropriately.

title: Entire Hotel Needs an Upgrade
comment: Located in Downtown St. Louis, this Belvoir seems as old as the rest of the city. As BPG members, we booked a suite but all they had available was a "suite" with a king-sized bed and a pull-out couch in a standard sized room. The TV in the room was a small boxed set - something I haven't seen since the 90s. You have to pay to use wifi in the rooms, which is really unacceptable in this day and age. The free continental breakfast in the club lounge was unimpressive; no hot breakfast items, instead were a small selection of hard, frozen bagels, muffins and other carb-heavy items in their place. Front desk staff were not friendly and borderline rude. The entire hotel really needs an upgrade and I am glad that we used only points for this stay, because I would not recommend this Belvoir to anyone.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location on the runway of the airport
title: Belvoir San Diego
comment: From the start it was a horrible experience as it took 45 minutes to check in. My rate somehow changed and front desk had to call BPG to verify so another 15 minutes lost. Got checked into a room that was not cleaned all the way so we had to change rooms which took another 90 minutes. Got told us they were out of extra pillows and when we wanted to use club lounge in morning it was so full and out of food we just left. Very very sorry we picked this Belvoir as our experience was a nightmare.

everyoneShouldKnow: How wonderful the service and staff are ... a great experience beginning with check in and ending with check out.
title: Fabulous Hotel Experience - ALWAYS
comment: We have stayed at this hotel every year for the last 3 years as we drive to and from the midwest to Phoenix. The staff is ALWAYS friendly and helpful. The room is ALWAYS ready and clean and nicely appointed. The service is ALWAYS wonderful. There are a great many hotels in this area to choose from and we will always stay at this hotel for all the reasons above.

everyoneShouldKnow: Can't manage with large volumes of guests!
title: Very Disappointing- Dropped the ball this time
comment: I've stayed in this very same hotel before at the same time of the year and had a good experience, however, this time i had a very poor experience. I come to Chicago annually for the Lollapalooza music festival. this year, I stayed at the Belvoir for the second time, the room was great, however, the service was terrible. I requested bath gel as I always do and didn't receive until my last night there. I spent a lot of time trying to reach guest services while the phone just rang and rang, the operator even stayed on the line with me. Also, the towels weren't changed when the room was cleaned. A request for bottled water took forever. I don't think i'll be coming back next year as its evident that the Belvoir couldn't manage the volumes of guest due to the concert and soccer game that weekend.

title: GREAT STAY.
comment: THERE WERE 4 IN OUR PARTY, THE MINUTE WE DROPPED OUR CAR OFF EVERYONE ON STAFF WAS WONDERFUL.THE HOTEL WAS BEAUTIFUL AND WELL KEPT,ALL UP TO Belvoir STANDARDS.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's lovely with a very nice lounge to gather in morning or evening.
title: Belvoir Seattle
comment: This very central and convenient location was perfect for our Seattle stay. The room provided a quiet respite from our city forays. The carpet could use a bit of attention, particularly since I like to get on the floor and do my morning yoga routine. Otherwise, the facilities and staff attention were suberb!

title: Family Fun
comment: I took my wife and married daughter for a weekend get away. The newly renovated hotel was a pleasure and all of the staff were extremely polite and helpful. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Wonderful Staff, Location, and Atmosphere
comment: I stayed for only one night in a gorgeous suite here. I used an upgrade request, and boy, did it pay off. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was very accommodating, and the whole look and feel of the hotel was spectacular.

everyoneShouldKnow: The meeting rooms are quite comfortable and more than adequate for conferences.
title: this hotel needs some improvements
comment: My room on the club level was old and dated. The ceilings are peeling, the bathrooms are old. I never had enough towels and had to ask for additonal towels each day. I found the maid cleaning my room even though i had a "DoNOt Disturb sign on the door while i was working out.

title: Understaffed
comment: Understaffed in all areas, from the front desk check-in, to valet parking attendants, bellmen, and housekeeping. Long line at check-in. We took our own luggage to the room because it would have taken a long time for the bellman to be available. In particular, room housekeeping was delayed. We were there for a wedding party and other guests (including the mother of the groom) were not able to get rooms immediately on arrival due to the rooms not yet being ready (already around 5-6 PM). On the day of the wedding, our room was not cleaned by 4 PM, and we needed fresh towels so we could get ready for the wedding, which was to start at 5:45. I must say that the garden for the wedding was lovely and the room, food, and service for the reception were very good.

title: Overall a pleasant experience
comment: Overall, a nice property. Close to the highway and airport. Stayed there for work. However, there was one hiccup. There was dried blood stains on the bed sheets and the bedding. Obviously it did not come from me. The hotel staff promptly changed the sheets. Thats all I can ask for. Will stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very pleasant hotel and well located in Salt Lake City
title: Pleasant Stay
comment: After a long day of flight travel I spent a very pleasant and relaxing evening at the Salt Lake City Belvoir. From airport pick-up, hotel check-in, fine dining and a delightful room my entire experience was just what I needed at the end of my day. Slept 11 hours very well in the comfortable and quiet room. I would definitely return for another future stay.

title: Great conference features.
comment: It was an great facility, easy to find my way around. The only thing that could have been better, was the room temperature...the conference rooms were way too cold.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's the most convenient to LAX. No stops between the hotel and the airport.
title: Why plastic
comment: This is a full scale Belvoir. Why plastic glasses in the rooms? Other than that, it's always my first choice hotel at LAX.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very, very professionally dressed and well-mannered.
title: An Excellent Stay...
comment: What was the most memorable part of my stay at the Belvoir was its hospitality, and willingness to accommodate my every need. Even though I needed to check in early, they made every effort to fulfill my requests, including a corner room!!! Bravo!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not expect free internet in your room... this a pay service.
title: Best night of sleep at a hotel.
comment: I normally do not sleep well away from home, but I slept surprisingly well.

title: lunch
comment: I had the pleasure of dining in the hotel's restaurant. My meal was a lovely experience, from the welcome of the hostess, until I left. My server was professional and knowledgeable;the food fresh, well prepared, and tasty. I'm looking forward to my return.

title: This hotel was Great!!!!!
comment: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Although there were a couple of minor hicups, the overall stay was good and convenient for my needs. The sliding doors didn't work in the room but it was okay.

title: Love the location. Love the Resort.
comment: Since this Resort is centrally located, we don't waste our precious vacation time hopping from bus to bus. The grounds are fabulous. The food is fantastic. The staff is amazing.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff are rude and the rooms smell bad. Staff are unwilling to correct mistakes THEY have made
title: Staff needs training!!!
comment: Foul smelling room (633) Complained to front desk the next morning and we were told that when we returned from Disneyland we would be in room 625. Returned to hotel at 1am and were told we did not have a room. Staff were unwilling to lend any assistance (Edgar) and we had to return to the same foul smelling room. I RECOMMEND YOU STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. I paid via BPG points and I will be demanding a return of the points spent.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are so many rooms, they are not all close to the elevator's and if bringing the family, plan on a long walk to your room.
title: good location
comment: Nice reception area that can move people very fast. I really do not like long waits when I,m checking into a Hotel. Staff very personable. Room long, long way from the elevator's.Room was clean tile was very sticky asked one of the room service ladies we saw in the hall if she could wipe the floor but she did not understand our request. Bed's clean but 2 reular size beds in a room that holds up to 4 people? Could have been at least 2 queen beds.Pool cloes's too early , should be open till 11 during the summer month's but closed at 9. Overall, nice clean hotel, will come back again and again.

title: Reservations
comment: Your policy requiring a new room key for each comfirmation number. If someone at check in would have said something regarding the key would have been nice. We left our room on Saturday Aug 4th early in the day. Didn't get back to room until 1:00 am. COULDN'T GET IN ROOM. My husband had to go down and get a new key. I find this unacceptable. I think you need to look at your policy. There was 50 rooms booked for the wedding. Most of them had the same problem. Concerned Customer!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds and room are very comfortable.
title: Very comfortable bed.
comment: I slept like a rock which is unusual because hotel beds are typically not that comfortable. I think you need to do something about the emergency alarm being set off by the ventilation system. I did not appreciate being woken at 5:30 am on 8/5/12 for an emergency that wasn't. it also wasn't very organized as far as where to gather and when we could go back inside. I am also very sure not everyone exited either.

title: This hotel has great features and a great location
comment: Great location, resort fees are pricey and well as pool bar beverages.

title: Perfect!
comment: Everyone went over and above what I ever expected to make our stay fabulous. They kept the lounge open a bit later for muchies and the pool was fantastic. This will be our hotel of choice whenever we are in Atlanta! Thanks a bunch, staff was great!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's dog friendly, clean and there's NO pet fee!!
title: Great price and dog friendly!!!
comment: This was a beautiful facility, so comfortable and quiet. We didn't have a fancy view, but it was very accommodating for our two little dogs. We were stunned that there's NO PET FEE for this property, could not believe it at all! The rooms are beautifully furnished and decorated, and don't have a pet odor at all! There's also a great pet area past the pools, there's a hammock to relax on and totally feel like vacation! This property is also conveniently close to Sea World, Old Town and the minutes from the Gaslamp Quarter in San Diego. We will definitely be back and will definitely recommend this property to anyone we know headed to San Diego!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds are excellent! So comfortable.
title: An employee at the desk was not accommodating or truthful.
comment: When a party of four checked in, we were given rooms on the first floor, in an area that was directly next to the parking lot doors. The rooms were musty and in no way reflected the standards expected of the Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: If the hotel has several large parties you should let other visitors be aware. I would have requested a room far from the noise or another hotel.
title: This hotel is great for big parties.
comment: I was not very happy with my stay here. We had been on the road for 8 hrs and needed to be back on the road at 6am for another 7 hour drive the next day. The hotel had several big parties that went

everyoneShouldKnow: Amazing customer service...they make you feel like it is your home away from home!
title: 5-Star Service with the Belvoir Chicago
comment: If you are planning a visit to Chicago, you need to consider staying at this hotel. You would be hard-pressed to find a better one with excellent service in all areas. The staff are so personable and make you feel as if they are there for just you. If you need anything, they respond to your request immediately. It is located close to Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue (the Magnificent Mile) which afford you the opportunity to be within short reach of many sights and restaurants famous in the City. The Club Level is definitely worth the upgrade. You will not be disappointed. One of the staff there, Connie, remembered my husband and I from our last stay 5 months ago! The Belvoir's General Manager, Rick, sets high standards which his employees attain with ease. I love this hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: My room was a good size, and very comfortable. Linens were clean and fresh. Complimentary in-room coffee and water was great and so were the comfy bathrobes.
title: Great location, reasonable rate... great stay.
comment: The location couldn't have been better. 2 blocks from Harvard Sq. and campus. Walking distance to all bars and restaurants. The room was clean, the housekeeping staff did an excellent job of respecting my wishes when I didn't need the room cleaned. The staff was friendly, informative and accommodating. My only complaint is that breakfast in the dining room is a little pricey even by today's standards, but the food is good.

title: Couldn't ask for much more
comment: Everything was great. Wouldn't change a thing.

everyoneShouldKnow: I would come back again,it was very nice.
title: Great Stay
comment: I enjoyed my stay. I was looking for a romantic hotel for a birthday celebration. The room was HUGE. The floor was extremly quiet as I heard no foot traffic.

title: Hotel is great for family or a getaway
comment: Hotel standards were above average, food was great and well put together, hotel staff was extremely helpful and curteous. Loved the pool and the environment, would defenitly come back.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Very close to the airport--Comfortable room. Amazing pillows. The Club benefits are nice--evening appetizers, cocktails, cookies and lemonade in the elevator foyer in the afternoon. Just nice touches that are appreciated. Staff is very helpful and very customer conscious.

title: Great stay
comment: The pool and lobby makeover was fabulous. The room and bathroom was clean. Very comfortable King size bed. The only thing that could have been better was the weather.

title: Get rid of the minibar and add a fridge !!!!!!
comment: Nice Hotel with a great location but the rooms need to be renovated and the minibar needs to GO.!!!! A small fridge would be better .

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't stay and check your bill
title: Mrs. Ford
comment: To many problems! and a lot complains

title: This Hotel Is TERRIBLE!
comment: I am a few stays away from lifetime platinum status and I travel ALOT. This used to be a great property and I haven't been here in the past few yrs.

title: Great location, friendly staff
comment: We stayed in a junior suite and loved having the extra space. We have stayed here before because it is so close to La Jolla Shores without being overpriced.

title: Relax and Restore Balance
comment: The Ice Spa is a MUST visit. Multiple treatments will allow you to take advantage of the beautiful lounge view. This is Anchorage's ONLY true DAY SPA. Spending the day there was wonderful and the perfect thing for a busy go go go mommy to relax with .

title: Perfect location for visiting Syracuse Univ.
comment: Great location for visiting Syracuse Univ. Parking was convenient.

title: Very poor experience
comment: We checked into the Belvoir due to a very early flight. Staying at the airport would allow us to get a fair night's sleep prior to our 6:25 AM flight to FL. Instead, due to a 'trash compactor' malfunction, the fire alarm sounded at 2:15 AM. We evacuated both rooms for nearly an hour. Given that we had to get up at 4:30 AM, there was little sleep. The 'personal' hair in the bathroom were not a welcome sight as well. No oppology from the staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: They remember and take good care of their regular guests
title: Like Coming Home Again
comment: I have been a regular guest at this hotel for more than twelve years and they always treated me great when I was a Grandbourne Platinum level guest. Following an injury and job change I wasn't able to maintain my Platinum level but the staff here treats me the same way as I rejoin the work force and work my way to Platinum for Life.

title: 2nd Time Here
comment: This was our 2nd trip to Sesame Place and 2nd time staying at this hotel. Everything was great. Free shuttle to and from Sesame saves you on parking. Room was clean, staff was friendly. Would stay there again if we go back to Sesame!

title: Room Below BPG Standards
comment: Roome badly in need of renovation. TV did not work despite a request for mantenance

title: Very comfortable...
comment: Very convenient. Quiet and comfortable.

title: Many improvements needed
comment: I made the reservation in February for a 3 night stay in August. I specifically noted a midnight check- in due to late flight from Honolulu. Upon arrival at midnight, I was told that my reservation was no longer available. Offered a Murphy bed or 2 double beds. Finally, the night manager gave us a room for the night and then relocated us to regular room requested for day 2 & 3. Reduced rate by $40, but still very, very dissatisfied. Shower did not work unless lever was held. We did no find staff helpful or pleasant. Will never stay there again. Too bad, because I had stayed there fifteen years earlier and had pleasant memories.

title: A gem of a hotel
comment: We loved this hotel! So family friendly and convenient in every way. So close to DC w beautiful drive and jogging paths along the water and situated within blocks of the loveliest shops. We were so pleasantly surprised upon arrival to find out that we were upgraded to the hospitality suite. Excellence in hospitality from The Club Room am breakfast, free access to laundry machine and the fact that they allowed my daughter to bring along her bunny/cage-we will certainly be returning.

title: Great Stay
comment: Great hotel in more ways than one--great location, staff, rooms, and service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Give the Belvoir out, you"ll be glad you did.
title: Excellent Staff
comment: I checked in late and night and was pleasantly greeted. My BPG Platinum status was also recognized. The following morning I had egreat service in the restaurant. The service was very attentive and welcoming. My only regret is that I couldn't stay with you longer!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The location and how easy it is too find. Big and bold. Beautiful hotel.
title: Location is Fabulous!
comment: We came in on friday around noon, and our room was ready for checking in. The room was comfortable, and very clean. We had time to settle in, and get ready for our big day, and night on the town!

title: Good Overall Stay
comment: The room was clean and well appointed. Desk and Club chair were comfortable. The plumbing was bad. Sink would not drain and hot and cold reversed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Just a few minutes from Disney. The value compared to Disneyland hotels was unbeatable!
title: Great hotel for disney trip
comment: The hotel was nicer than we expected. Shuttle service to disney ran like clockwork to and from. The pool area was really nice. The beds were comfortable and rooms were spacious. Couldn't have been happier with our choice!

title: Excellent Place to Stay!
comment: Location, Cleanliness, Staff, and Comfort were all great!

title: Great Stay
comment: The staff were so friendly I felt like we were long time friends. Really outstanding. This hotel is beautiful. The place to stay when your in Stamford, CT

title: Hotel could be great, but needs improvement
comment: My room was listed as a suite, but it was TINY, way smaller than a standard room. Room wasn't very clean upon arrival. Hotel has some things it needs to work out and once it does, can be a great hotel. Pool wasn't heated and was super cold, even too cold for the kids to want to go in. Everyone around the pool was complaining and commenting on the pool temperature, very odd.

title: Below Disney Standards
comment: Not what I expected from a DisneyWorld Hotel. Have stayed at several and this one I will avoid in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: spacious rooms & the AC blocks out all noise from the hallways
title: one of my favs
comment: I loved this hotel. we stayed on the club floor and the rooms were spacious and quiet. the view was beautiful. it was one of my favorite Belvoirs

everyoneShouldKnow: Its been upgraded with nice amenities
title: A good overall stay
comment: They have diffenently put money into the place. The pool area is very nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is within walking distance to King Street and a close drive to the DC area. Parking is at a cost everywhere and at every hotel. The Belvoir's fee is $20/night to park, but I feel if the rates are reasonable for the hotel (which this had when I booked), it's well worth the $$$ for the underground parking garage.
title: Second time stay
comment: This was our second time staying at the Belvoir in Alexandria. After our first stay I had a few small issues, which were virtually non existent during this stay because obviously the management listens and tries very hard to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We came from NJ with extended family from Washington State. We had two rooms on the same floor. Both of the rooms were comfortable, spacious, and clean. Pool was closed for one day when we went down, which was not the fault of the hotel but someone who allowed their small child to swim in it without a proper swim diaper. They had to thorougly clean and shock the pool for everyone's health safety. Lifeguard was great to have but really should keep a better eye on the pool. One guard had headphones in and was on her computer while parents were allowing their small children in the whirlpool, and others were throwing a ball back and forth between the pool and whirlpool. . During our last stay, the lifeguard was so good, she wouldn't allow my 13 year old in. The sign specifically says ages 16 and up. Not only is it a safety hazard for small children to use a hot tub, but it makes it less enjoyable for the adults to use.Only suggestion I have again is to remove the non gratis water from the rooms because this is the second time we got charged for water that we didn't drink. We brought water from home but I think if the maid sees empty water bottles in the recycling pail or garbage, you get charged. If water is available for sale in the vending machines on the floor, there really is no need to put it in the rooms.

title: Great location
comment: This hotel is literally right on the beach, away from the tourist commotion. very quiet, clean hotel, with everything you need within minutes.

title: This hotel provides outstanding service!
comment: Terrific, professional service in every area.

everyoneShouldKnow: trully worthy of its Disney distinction.
title: Swan Flying Above and Beyond
comment: I had a confirmed reservation at The Swan using the Starhot rate but when we got there, we were moved to The Dolphin, when I expressed my disappointment because I already was at The Dolphin and wanted to check out The Swan, I felt Michelle (or Melissa's) sincerity in the apology and went to upgrade my reservation into a Suite and comped the night including the parking. The front desk staff at The Dolphin (bryan/richard) were so pleasant and cheerful trully worthy of a Disney recognition. However, the food service and quality at Picaboo cafe needs to be elevated. No fork and knives available at 11 a.m. on that visit, the wait period is so long and the food prices needs review coz it is expensive even with the Starhot discount.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place to stay if traveling with pets, especially dogs!!!
title: Dog friendly.....
comment: We were delighted with the facility and the surrounding area. Traveling with our Chocolate Lab it is important that there is a place to walk her comfortably and safely. This is one of the BEST we have had the pleasure of visiting. Thank you!

title: Lori
comment: Needs a little work on the shower and tub. the floor of the shower, tub was warped. Would love loved a better view, but that was okay. location was good. Add non dairy creamer for coffee, or soy for cereal!

title: Poor from the start
comment: The bad experience started by getting a front desk person that could care less. She never recognized me as an BPG member which I get in all other BPG hotels. I'm sure that's why she put me in a terribly designed room next to the elevator in a half-empty hotel. By the time I realized the elevator would keep me up all night it was too late to move. Very disappointed in the lack of care. I will not stay here again.

title: Peaceful and relaxing
comment: The Sherton Norfolk Waterside was a delightful experience. The staff was welcoming, check in quick and efficent, everything clean and fresh, and although I was working it was a relaxing experience overall. Harbor view was a great bonus!

title: Always a pleasure!
comment: This was my second stay at this hotel. Came in town for the Rod Stewart concert and it was really crazy at check in time. The customer service was exceptional, professional, and friendly. I recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. Thanks for the outstanding experience.

title: Great Hotel, Great View
comment: The View from our room in the Bay tower was great!! We're from Phoenix, so a water view was very nice.

title: Fantastic Service
comment: Having travelled extensively, I was very pleasantly surprised to find the hotel staff to be excellent in every way. They were friendly, and helpful. They attended to my every need. It was a very pleasant stay.

title: Nice Stay!
comment: Came in for just a quick nights stay, and had a very nice experience! The room was very nice, comfortable and clean. Checking in was easy, the hotel had everything we needed, if we wanted for the night. I woiuld recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in the area!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff was very friendly and made you feel comfortable. Also, their business center and usage of computers was very easy to make use of.
title: Hotel location
comment: For my use, the hotel was in a perfect location. It was close to the GS Parkway, so I was able to conviently get to the NJ shore, and close to the NJ Turnpike, where I was able to visit other locations I had planned on seeing.

title: great staff
comment: the staff was very courteous, informative, and accomodating. We were treated great! the staff deserves recognition. We would recommend this hotel and if we are this way again would stay here.

everyoneShouldKnow: The peacefulness and home feeling you can "feel" and enjoy!
title: Best Stay We have EVER had!!
comment: We have completed several travels in and around the United States. This is the BEST Resort we have visited on any stay anywhere! The people were and are very friendly and make you feel like you are at your own home! The Resort itself is very relaxing, inviting, and intoxicating with rich native scenery. Before coming to the Islands, my wife said she would not want to stay here, but after the visit here, she told me that she would not mind coming back here to live. That is the best compliment I think because my wife does not change he mind very much.

title: Great location!
