comment: Everyone was helpful especially concierge! I love the outdoor fire pits. It would be nice if they have free Internet access at least for Grandbourne guests and a room with better view if u r Grandbourne guest.

everyoneShouldKnow: When we checked in we requested adjoining rooms the hotel was fully booked but the front desk staff never said "no" they did some checking and offered us an alternative. They really know how to treat a customer.
title: Had an incredible experience
comment: From the time we pulled up at the valet service to our check out our experience was amazing. We were welcomed at check in with a glass of wine and fresh cookies for the kids. We met all of the mangement team at the managers reception. The room was amazing the service was outstanding. At the managers reception the hotel manager overheard my 5 year old neice say that she did not like the appetizers and he had a pizza prepared by the kitchen staff just for her. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends. The staff impressed us at every turn.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great outdoor pool, great floor plans, great room service
title: Great rooms, unique floor plans
comment: An overall great hotel! Great rooms, food, pools, service!

title: Check in and valet
comment: They are very rude and unprofessional frontbdesk and valet !! Room service and cocktail lounge a+

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice, huge rooms. Upgraded linens and towels.
title: Frequent business traveler
comment: This is a great hotel for a great price in the Galleria Area.

everyoneShouldKnow: It met our needs for shopping all within walking distance.
title: Happy
comment: Everything was great about the hotel, except didn't like the charge to keep our luggage in storage till we were ready to leave later that night.

title: Staff was very friendly
comment: The room was a bit small but we had two double beds - my sister's room had a king and it seemed a little bigger. The only complaint I had was the price of the wine at the bar. My sister and I went down to have a glass of wine and the bill was $62 including tip. My glass of wine was $15! We each had two glasses so I was shocked at the price. Other than that, I liked the hotel.

title: Great place to stay!
comment: What a fantastic place to stay! The hotel is convenient for all conference needs and located in great area of Phoneix.

title: complete lack of follow through by staff
comment: After unpacking in our room, we discovered that one of the beds was very wet. As we peeled back the covers, the wetness increased. It seems that the previous occupants had spilled something on the bed and that housekeeping had simply put dry sheets on it. The mattress itself was very wet and that wetness was seeping through the sheets and blankets. We called the front desk and were told to repack our belongings and come down to the front desk for another room assignment. The second room we were given was much smaller and without the amenities of the first room. I went back to the front desk and after much discussion they finally agreed to put us in a room that was the same quality as the first, but with two dry beds. We were told that a bellman would help us move our things since we'd had to move our things twice already. After waiting for 20 minutes we finally had to do it ourselves, as we had plans for the evening and couldn't wait any longer to get into our room. In all, check in took over an hour and a half. I was told that we'd be given 2000 star points to make up for the hassle, but those have not been credited to my account despite my calling several days ago to inquire. Also, in the room shuffle and the extra packing/unpacking we had to do we lost the top of an electric trimmer. I reported it missing Sunday at checkout and was told that I'd be called by Monday at the latest with information. By Wednesday I had still not been contacted so I had to follow up with the hotel. The woman I spoke with said they would look for it one more time and call me by the next day. As of Saturday morning I have still not heard anything. This lack of follow through is simply appalling.

title: Preferred guest recognition
comment: I hav been staying here for 4 years on a regular basis. Was excited about room renovations but have to say that less than a year after renovation, rooms are already showing a lot of wear and tear. And since renovation, I haven't received any of the upgrades that I used to get. Get the feeling that mgt is trying to squeeze every dollar they can get to pay for expensive renovations. Treat your loyal customers well, there are many good hotels nearby.

everyoneShouldKnow: Sign up for the package that includes the parking and the guest club.
title: Excellent Experience
comment: Our stay at the Belvoir Society Hill was far beyond my expectations. It was wonderful. The staff was very courteous and the room comfortable. The large pool was a big hit with my grandson and his cousin. The guest club was an awesome feature. It worked out so well for my family.

title: healthy food options and nice staff
comment: I was pleasantly surprised by the healthy food options (oatmeal, fresh berries, soy milk, sauteed veggies) that were offered. I also enjoyed my own personal coffee maker with starbucks coffee in my room! I also enjoyed how housekeeping didn't show up until later in the morning. Nice, clean hotel.

title: FG
comment: Great hotel! Great Location! Great personal service and recognition. The renovations are terrific.

title: The good and the bad
comment: The beds are heavenly. Great location. My only negative feedback, was the fact I booked the room online (booked for 3 days). I ened up only needing the room for 2 days and they wouldn't give me credit for the one day I didn't use even though I let them know about the cancellation a week ahead of time. Therefore it cost me approx. $164. They wouldn't budge on our pleas to please refund our money.......very disappointed........

everyoneShouldKnow: Not run to the standards of other high end, upscale Grandbourne properties. Platinum BPG Members will find it a letdown. Also, certainly not comparable to the other upscale "Disney Run" properties. My advice, don't worry about using or receiving BPG Points/Rewards, spend the money and stay at the luxury Disney Properties. VERY UPSETTING!!
title: Disappointing Experience!
comment: I have stayed at the Swan or Dolphin for years. This past visit was sub-par vs previous trips to Disney. From having to basically beg for an upgrade to the room prior to check in, to inferior restaurant and room service food. The concierge was rude and not helpful in ANY way! Valet parking was super slow, and on more the 3 occasions we called, waited 15 minutes, got down stairs and they hadn't even left for the car. Could go on and on. SAD!

title: Beautiful, modern, clean
comment: This hotel exceeded my expectations. It was very modern and clean. The bathroom was updated and spotless. The room was very cozy. The location was great located by lots of mid-scale restaurants and shopping.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a video poker room there but it's hard to find
title: Great people
comment: The staff makes this place from the bellman to the bar to the front desk. I stay her many times a year and am always treated well.

everyoneShouldKnow: Busy hotel. Commonly used by school trips. Scaled back services in Club Lounge.
title: Recent club lounge changes for the worse
comment: I have stayed many times at this hotel as a platinum member.

title: As Nice As The Hotel Is, The Staff Is Even Better
comment: An "Above Excellent" rating is needed for the staff at this hotel...they are incredibly on top of everything. From the time you check in to the on site restaurants to check out they are helpful & friendly. The hotel is beautiful, well maintained, and in a great location. Always a highlight of my extensive travel.

title: Old not very clean rooms
comment: The rooms were not very clean. The interior was very old. The bathroom was dirty and extremely dark. We were glad that we only slept in the room. This was by no means a four star experience. I have to really think hard before choosing Belvoir again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is not on the beach, but was only a short 7 minute walk. The upgraded deluxe rooms give you a wonderful view of the ocean. There is no outdoor pool, but over the summer who needs one when you have the Atlantic Ocean just minutes away!
title: Excellent Stay
comment: This hotel went above and beyond my expectations! I was welcomed with huge smiles and greetings from the Front desk staff who seemed very pleased to be checking me in! I was upgraded to an Oceanview room since the hotel wasn't full, and both the room and view were magnificent! The Belvoir beds are AMAZINGLY soft and comfortable, I was not ready to get out of it the next morning! We were only here for 1 night, just a pit stop on our way to Charleston but I could have stayed in this hotel all week! The staff was super friendly and courteous during every encounter!

everyoneShouldKnow: Professional staff, hotel comfortable, clean with many amenities
title: This hotel is quality
comment: I've stayed several times and always have a great experience

title: Watch the checkout time
comment: Official checout time is 11am - pretty early. Despite having been assured the night before that I could have a late checkout until 1pm without penalty, front desk the next day did not respect the promise. Not good.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff worked hard to make our stay better.
title: great stay in mid summer
comment: I came to this hotel with my expectations in check because of reviews I had read. The hotel exceeded my expectations in most respects.

title: Two stars for front desk and three stars for others
comment: Overall experienced is a mixed stay.

title: great experience
comment: this hotel was very clean and a wonderful resort to stay in, it had a game room,that was great for the kids and the restaurants food down stairs was really good and the bar was plus.when i travel to Anaheim in will always stay here. I actually left another hotel that night to come to this one because the other was not up to par.

title: not pleased
comment: was treated differently..check in was selective and delayed also wasn't greeted the same as other guests & wasn't made aware of the hotel amenities...overheard about computer, pool, spa, etc from greeting of guests who checked in after

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location, under renovation?, currently not worth price.
title: Disappointing Experience
comment: Great location, easy access to all the sights of San Diego. Was @ Hotel for 9 nights. Pool/ hot tub were good, front desk personel were nice. 4 days into stay, they closed our floor, so had to move to another room, very inconveinent. The new room on Grandbourne Preferred floor. The hallway carpet had waves in it. Stumbled twice on it. IN the 9 nights there, we had to request the correct number of bath towels 5 times, after that we just took towels from Pool area. All the guest I spoke too at pool had same probs. They have 1 fast elevator, 1 painfully slow. Like I said, location great, but not worth what they charged!

title: Excellent Location
comment: We really enjoyed our stay in an ocean front room in the quiet Building One. We loved the location of the resort and it is beside a great beach. The lobby area has a very relaxing, welcoming atmosphere. Hoping to return soon!

title: Not impressed with my stay...
comment: There was only one person checking in guests when we arrived so it took about 10 minutes to register my 2 rooms My son and wife were looking forward to a very good breakfast and were very dissapointed. Hard boiled eggs instead of scrambled. No cereals except oatmeal. No waffle maker. I have had better breakfasts at a far less expensive hotels.

title: disappointed
comment: Lack of staff resulted in poor service at breakfast, room was not cleaned until after 6 PM on second day. Coffee bar attendant in lobby extremely unhelpful.

title: Great location
comment: Hotel is ideally located near the pedestrian mall with shops, stores, bars/ restaurants, movie theater, as well as the Capitol bldg etc. Room was in need of some help in terms of the AC and curtains were somewhat stained. Good selection of channels on TV when I was in the room

title: Great Stop Over Stay
comment: We arrived late (around midnight) from the airport. Very helpful staff got my family checked in and up to our room quickly. Nice rooms and great lobby. Also nice club level lounge we used to get a late night snack and then coffee the next morning. Very close to the Alaska Train station where we departed to the next day.

title: This hotel is a great value
comment: You cant beat the Dolphin for its location and value compared to the Disney Resorts. It along with its sister resort has a great selection of dining options.

title: Preferred lounge needs work!
comment: Tables and chairs in preferred/club lounge need to be matched. Tables are too high to be able to comfortably eat when seated in lounge-type armchairs. A booster seat for adults would be a welcome addition. I moved my food over to the coffee table, where now the chairs are too high to comfortably eat.

title: great hotel in excellent location
comment: We are now going back every year for few days to enjoy Portsmouth and Ogunquit.

title: Great Location near Harbor
comment: I had a great time staying here. The only thing I didn't like was the front desk staff needs to be more clear on info. about the hotel plus more friendly attitude and the beds were hard.

title: Service
comment: the sevice by staff was excellent, they advised us re: trains into New York and times of shuttle service.

title: Nice hotel
comment: The hotel was very clean. Had a problem with noise in the room next door. Called down to the desk & it was taken care of immediately. Only drawback were the 2 "ladies of the evening" that were walking around just outside the property. I had a very nice stay there. We are planning on staying here again next year for our conference.

title: Club Level
comment: With the amount of BPG required for one night stay, Gold Members should be allowed access to the club level and free internet not have to choose one or the other. I have stayed in numerous BPG hotels, used less points and got more. I was disappointed.

title: Service Is Very Good
comment: The hotel is nothing special, but the service was very good. I left my car keys in the room and the staff found them and sent them fed ex next day service. I will return to this hotel for that reason alone.

everyoneShouldKnow: No airport shuttle. Must pay for internet.
title: nice, clean great location.
comment: Hotel was very clean. Friendly staff, well located. Had great views from rooms. Food in restaurant could have been better.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a beautiful hotel in the perfect location
title: Great Stay
comment: I was in ChicagO for a week for a conference and this hotel was a home away from home. The staff was great and the hotel beautiful.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location makes it easy to find. But plan to travel outside the hotel for the evening meal.
title: Dallas Belvoir
comment: The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was cramped and the electric plug location unhandy. The room attendant accidentally picked up a gift bag with a card and gift and threw it away. The director of housekeeping was most apologetic and did give me complimentary breakfast for my stay. Breakfast was fantastic but dinner menu is very limited and expensive. The staff was very friendly. Yes I will stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean, convenient and in an excellent location.
title: This Hotel is well located and has great ammenities
comment: The Belvoir Downtown Denver is in an excellent location and has great ammenities. Including underground parking, fitness center, business center, clean, comfortable rooms, adjacent restaurants, bars and a coffee shop. Located on Denver's 16th Street Mall, two blocks from the State Capital and three blocks from the Colorado Convention Center; you'll not find a better facility or location in the Mile High City.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a Great place and location and the price is right!
title: AWESOME!
comment: I stay in over 25-30 hotels a year across the country..between 3 kids in National travel soccer programs and work related travel this was by far the most excited i've been about a hotel stay! The staff was great during the various adjustments i had to make due to delayed flights. The room and ammonites were Top quality! the room was modern..the hotel grounds was inviting! ..either i missed the fitness room or this place could use one, but considering the weather was so great it's ok!...Thanks!!! will def stay again!!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location downtown Fort Worth with easy access to Arlington and Dallas.
title: A great Cattle-Town experience
comment: Arriving one would expect the hotel to be noisy, being that close to main rail links and major roads. But the walls are thick and the widows well insulated, making for a very quiet, comfortable and relaxing stay.

title: Tis hotel has everything you need
comment: The location of the hotel is super and the rooms are very clean. Staff is very friendly and when you have a problem they solve it immediately.

title: Very Old
comment: The renovations were done very cheaply. This Marina building is about 3 years away from the wrecking ball. The only great thing about the room was the view. It was most spectacular. The WiFi was intermittent and most often very slow. It was not worth 9.95 a day. Not mentioned anywhere was, additional charges of 9.95 for each device that you have. They assumed we had an iphone or ipad, so they automaticaly charged the 9.95 twice on the bill. We only had a cell phone without internet connection, so they did credit the charge. We would have been much better off paying more for a room and not so much for the extras.

title: Perfect Stay
comment: For my husband and I this is the perfect place to stay. The location is one of the best in the entire Walt Disney World Resort area. The rooms are comfortable and most have wonderful views. Everything you need is there,gym,places to eat from quick to fine dining.Our favorite thing about the Dolphin is the pool area. We could go and stay there just for the pool!! We will be going back!

title: Reasonable price and dog friendly
comment: This hotel had everything we needed right on site. An adequate gym ( weights would be a nice addition), restaurant , pool, and large room. The dog area out back sure could have used some shade. Summer heat made it unbearable. Rooms were showing their age some but the bed was comfortable and tv was very nice. Biggest negative was the distance from the interstate. But overall a good hotel.

title: Friendly staff
comment: The entire staff at this hotel were very friendly and accommodating. Conveniently located between the main routes and Franklin Street, this hotel is clean and relaxing with a modern decor. We travel to Chapel Hill at least twice a year and always look forward to our stay at this hotel.

title: great location
comment: My husband and I spent our anniversary weekend at this Belvoir hotel. It was the perfect location because all we wanted to do was shop, relax and eat. The hotel is close to the St. Johns shopping area, which has all the stores and eating places. We were able to relax in our club level room. The hotel staff were friendly. The rooms are spacious and the complimentary food was a plus. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointed with Green Program
comment: We opted for the Green option of not changing the towels or room service for our 3 day stay and were supposed to get a coupon for the option. We hung the card on the door, but didn't get the coupon with our final bill under the door on the day of departure. We had to go to the front desk and ask for it. Then we learned that you can only use it in the hotel for credit on food purchases and even more disappointing to learn that it expires on the day of departure. Pretty inconvenient to say the least and somewhat misleading language is used on the card promoting this service. It doesn't make it clear what the limitations are and you could a lot better to insure that guests know what to expect if they elect to use this service. I thought I could use the $10 in coupons for use in "other" venues, only to learn that they had to be used in the hotel on the day you depart. I did not want the other option of points for your chain as I don't usually stay at Belvoirs. I doubt that I will stay at another either and thank goodness for Facebook and Twitter to make sure everyone knows about our experience and our disappointment with not being able to get any satisfaction in addressing this problem with your staff.

title: Great Hotel
comment: The Club Lounge was well stocked.

title: Comfort & Location
comment: Perfectly located on the 16 th st corridor... above average eats and lounges on site. Rooms spacious and clean

everyoneShouldKnow: Terrific location in heart of historical nd restaurant area
title: Terrific location for seeing historic Philadelphia
comment: Society Hill is where Philadelphia began. Walk out the front door, turn right, and most of the important sights are about 10 minutes away. start your historic adventure at the Visitors Center, and even get tickets there when you need them . Many sights are free. The concierge staff does a good job at the hotel. If you qualify for the Club Floor, the breakfast has healthy choices and the staff there is great, but in a four day stay, the one computer was never fixed. Couldn't understand that problem and the lobby ones were hard to use. Put in password, and then could never get off the sign in page. Staff great. Had a very odd cab ride from hotel to airport. Asked to use credit card, driver got angry and said "cash only", and turned off meter and said , "then don't pay" and was worried for entire ride. Better ask right away if credit card is "ok."Very odd. Gym needs total equipment upgrade. Sure don't advertise "Westin workout". Staff was excellent and printed boarding pass and other info as requested when lobby computers weren't working correctly. Also, was told to take a cab at night as a woman traveling alone by a local merchant after shopping at Macy's which is 11 blocks away.

title: FAMILY
comment: My stay here was an unexpected surprise.My friend ask me to come down and work with him. He brought me here to the Belvoir. The staff wat helpful from the beginning,as a matter of fact they may need chiropractors because they bent over backwards to make my stay here as pleasent as possible.Everyone beginning with the front desk whose smile and daily cheerful greeting made for a pleasent start of the day ( a special shout out to stanley) to the maids, the dining room staff and the valet squad.My stay will last 30 days. So far the two and ahalf weeks I've been here I feel like part of the Belvoir family Thank You.

title: I was made to feel very welcome
comment: Overall my stay was excellent. The staff are very friendly. The wine tasting was a little confusing - price per tasting but when I got another tasting it seemed to be full price ? But other than that everything was excellent.

title: Room Not Ready
comment: Our room was not ready until after 4pm the day of our arrival. The front desk informed us they would locate our party when our room was ready and they did not. We were told our room would not be charged for the daily resort fee due to our inconvenience, but we WERE charged.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location. Easy access to main attractions and ease of getting in and out of the City.
title: Nice surprise
comment: I called 6 hotels before I called the Belvoir. Couldn't find a room in Philadelphia. I was very pleasantly surprised. Great location, friendly staff, large comfortable room. I was there for only one night, wish I could have stayed longer.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful view, friendly staff. Warning! Do not place your card key next to your cell phone. It's a LOOOONNNGGG way back to the front desk!
title: Beautiful vacation!
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir Kauai for five nights and thoroughly enjoyed it! Although driving & having fun around the island we loved coming back and relaxing in the jacuzzi before our night was over. Truly a spectacular place to stay! We were upgraded to a partial ocean view and the pool was right underneath us. Thank you!

title: Great Getaway
comment: Clean rooms, tons of things within walking distance and free buses depart to all Disney locations from hotel. Very well maintained grounds and pool was awsome.

title: Family visit August 2012
comment: Unfortunately, the pool was closed for maintenance work. It would have been nice to know this when making the reservattion or if it was posted on your website. The staff was very apologetic and upgraded our room for the inconvenience. All other aspects of the facility and service were above expectation.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is perfect for couples or families. The food is good, the grounds are nice, bike rentals make touring the city so much fun, and the beach is wonderful and just across the street!
title: This hotel has lots to offer!
comment: We have stayed here three different times over the last 16 years. The location across from Smathers Beach makes it very special. The hotel offers a great pool, and excellent food is available at the pool, dining room or open deck area. The rooms are spacious and have decks to sit out and enjoy the view. The hotel staff is always helpful and friendly. There are bikes to rent and the concierge will schedule a variety of activities such as snorkeling, deep sea fishing or watching dolphins. The hotel provides a free van to downtown and return to hotel as well as airport transportation to and from. The van drivers are always chatty, friendly , prompt and they drive safely.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is like a convention center and impossible to keep clean.
title: Worst Hotel Experience
comment: This is the worst hotel stay I have ever had at a Grandbourne, or any property. First, if you arrive by airport shuttle, you are dropped off in a bus depot, which is a short block with stairs from the reception area. No assistance, no signs, just stairs & crowds. Next, I went to my no smoking room only to find the entire no smoking floor and room to reek of cigarette smoke. Finally, my next room, which was ocean view on a high floor, had ants crawling in the bathroom and nightstands. While all staff were extremely nice, I was not allowed to move again because I moved once before and the hotel was full. I am seriously considering closing my BPG account.

title: Family Vacation
comment: Nice hotel, good location and great pools. Wifi service was free but poor when I compare it to other resorts I've stayed at.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location (can walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, cable car turnaround and Safeway grocery is across the street).
title: Great location!
comment: This is a great location for seeing the sites in San Francisco!

title: Well done
comment: Your staff was great. Our room was upgraded that made the trip more special. It was our first trip to Hawaii. The dining meet our expectations and more. The staff are very friendly and helpful to any questions we had. The location was very convenient.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel shuttle to Disneyland is a great service.
title: Old-time charm
comment: This hotel has a very friendly and warm atmospher. It is not the typical rectangular hotel structure. There are many alcoves and garden areas to rest, relax and get away from the mainstream if desired. The rooms are spacious. The in-room refrigerator is super convenienence. I strongly recommend this hotel, especially if you are going to Disneyland.

title: Dirty
comment: Filthy rooms, generic toiletries, no sink on a wet bar as well as no refrigerator.

everyoneShouldKnow: Club lounge drink is not free, so be be aware that you need to pay, not like other lounges.
title: My experience
comment: In general is a good hotel, consider the location and rate. The only compain I have is the club lounge where drinks are chargable, which is very strange.

everyoneShouldKnow: People here really care about making sure you have a great vacation.
title: WOW Best Vacation Ever
comment: We recently spent two weeks in the deluxe oceanfront rooms. Everything about our stay was perfect. We really enjoyed our balcony overlooking the ocean. The beds and linens were top of the line. However, we would have appreciated fitted bottom sheets! The lady that took daily care of the room (Priscella) was super helpful with our questions and needs. The staff at the front desk was so welcoming. (Tracy in particular) The Rumfire resturant was beautiful and had great meal choices. We loved the buffet breakfast. Watching the sunset from the dining room was a perfect way to end the day.

title: beautiful hotel
comment: Thank you for making us feel so special during our stay. Your staff is friendly and professional!! Our room was amazing, the view was spectacular! And hope we can get this same room again, on our next stay!! We were blown away!! I woke up at 2am in the morning to stand by our window and look at the incredible views for at least a half hour while my husband was sleeping. I was in heaven in the clouds!! Thank you all for making our stay wonderful!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Less than expected but perhaps okay for a Disneyland area hotel. (Not nearly as acceptable as similar accommodations for Walt Disney World).
title: Dirty bathroom and shower didn't drain
comment: I took my daughter to Disneyland as a graduation from High School gift and was quite deflated when we viewed and then experienced our accommodations. Stains on bathroom floor, spiders in bathroom and guest room, stains on ceiling in bathroom, stained carpet,unsure if duvet cover changed with every guest as well as down blanket...gross. I felt a little more than embarrassed to use the accommodations provided.

everyoneShouldKnow: Quality far less than expected for Belvoir
title: Staff very warm and friendly at less than acceptable hotel
comment: Though they were absolutely fantastic, then staff friendliness and warmth could not overcome the more than well used hotel.

title: Would not reccomond
comment: Pool was closed, couldn't get the Olympics or the football game on the tv. Hotel has the worst cable I've ever seen, if they have any at all. Slowest elevators, just a terrible place to stay and would not reccomond this hotel...

title: Beautiful area
comment: Though the front desk wasn't manned with enough staf, the young lady did her best to get our room as quickly as possible. The Spa staff were excellent and Marianne gave an excellent massage. They have a great special 20 minutes for $20, We enjoyed our 5 day stay and will be back. The only negatives were the prices at Quinns. Food was okay but dessert was overpriced and tasteless. Needless to say we went elsewhere the rest of our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is the perfect location, so close to everything!
title: Excellent Location
comment: Overall, a pleasant stay in the City by the Bay. This hotel was conveniently located to Fisherman's Wharf, buses, cable cars, shops, and restaurants.

title: Loved this hotel!
comment: I loved this hotel! Everything was perfect from check-in to check-out. The staff is amazing and extremely helpful. As always, the comfort of the room was as close to home as you can get!

title: Good hotel downtown
comment: Easy location to get to. Near a lot of activities.

title: very welcoming staff
comment: Can't say enough about the help here. Everyone i dealt with was very helpful ! Room was clean and comfortable. Shuttle to Amway center for a concert too ! I have only the best to say about my stay !

title: Nice room and excellent staff
comment: Rooms are clean and beds are great. The staff where ever the department are outstanding. Brian does and excellent job with the food for large groups and the front desk always recognizes us even when it been 4 month since the last time we were there. They are all just down right nice people. Thank you for a great stay. Marion

title: Potential disaster
comment: My husband has been deployed and this was our first time in a long time that we had been able to take a family vacation and for some reason our rooms were not booked the way we had originally booked them, then we had to move rooms twice. The hotel was extremely full, due to teen sports teams playing the weekend we were there. The staff was very accomodating, which made our potentially disasterous vacation, bareable. Upon going to our rooms the halls were a mess, not due to lack of staff doing their job, but due to the lack of consideration of the team coaches and parental guidance. Once these issues were reported, it was fixed immediately. It is very unfortunate that we have to deal with this type of behavior when coming to a hotel that we expect to get top notch service from, especially when being an owner member. The staff did try their best to accommodate us to the best of their ability but we still feel a bit slated in that we didn't get the full feel of the family vacation that we expected to get. Hopefully next time this doesn't happen. I guess check and make sure there aren't any sports team events going on when you plan a vacation!!

title: This hotel has everything you need
comment: large rooms, sofas, refrig., indoor parking, indoor pool, very quiet enviroment and the breakfast included is very good.

title: Great Service, Great Location
comment: It's right next to Washington U and Delmar Loop. Staff is very helpful and gracious enough to upgrade us to club level with access to the lounge which provides great evening snack (pasta, bread stick and salad) and morning breakfast. Wonderful experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: clealiness ready to assist a place you can call home
title: the hotel have great feature
comment: excellent, we will come like the price especially

everyoneShouldKnow: Do your meetings here. You will be pleasantly surprised!
title: Perfect Meeting location!
comment: I know, you wouldn't typically think of a Waikiki beach resort as a place for meetings, but this was the PERFECT place for a meeting. Our entire team, customers and suppliers were focused and energized in meetings due to the location. Then, after hours, there was VERY relaxed networking in a casual environment. The service was well above expectations (and I'm picky), the views were incredible and you can't beat the location.

title: Expected more from a resort
comment: I stayed here for a conference. It was an acceptable resort, but could use a little updating, especially carpeting in halls and rooms. While there are signs posted that shirts and shoes are required in the lobby area, I saw a number of guests strolling around just in bathing suits, which was rather disgusting.

title: Everything was great.
comment: Everything was great. Pool area could use some sprucing up.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ask that a refrigerator be provided if you wish to have one
title: August get away
comment: I recently stayed sat your hotel. I came during a time when you were having what I can only suspect was a much needed facelift at your entrance. I would have rated the hotel excellent based on the staff. There were only two disconcerting things about my stay. #1 a room that runs 200+ a night probably should have a refrigerator in it. #2 I was under the impression that having ponied up the extra bucks for a club stay, I would be entitiled to free long term parking at the hotel. My bad if I misinterpreted this and since I now know that this is true I won't spend the extra money to upgrade the stay in the future.

title: Great BPG Recognition
comment: I finally made it to Gold status and was very excited to be staying at my first Belvoir with my new elite status. I was recognized upon check-in and received an upgrade to a FANTASTIC room! I love the Belvoir bed and amenities and was not dissapointed at this hotel. The Club Lounge staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and the breakfast was good.

title: Wonderful Platinum Suite Upgrade
comment: Platinum members get suite upgrades, and I got the upgrade of a lifetime, to the Presidents Suite.

everyoneShouldKnow: Big rooms, great bar/club for after-partying!
title: Great experience
comment: Came in for a wedding and really loved this place. Great room; lots of space, nice amenities, comfortable bed/pillows...Overall a very nice, new hotel. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Would definitely stay here again and might start using Belvoir hotels to see if they're all this nice!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect luxury, be prepared for unavailable amenities one would expect.
title: Great start and promising moments
comment: No upgrade available, but room had a nice ocean view. Bathroom barely big enough for one person to turn around in. Downstairs for the wine flight-amazing! Off to Catch 31 with great reviews thinking we would eat the next day at Belvoir. Breakfast offered a decent buffet at a decent price, beach time was lovely. Late checkout only extended our time by an hour so we asked if there were shower facilities that would allow us to spend time at the pool before we left. The shower we found is ONE shower in a unisex combined bathroom within the indoor pool area. I ended up walking through the hallways with only a towel to find so where I could get dressed after I briefly showered in this bathroom that would make a homeless shelter look sanitary. The main restroom near reception had three? doors locked. Apparently regular and thorough maintenance of the restrooms can't be handled? 20 minute elevator waits too. Terrible planning and staff planning. We left and went elsewhere to spend quite a bit for lunch because my husband was so fed up. Such a busy place, I was surprised that the entire inside dining wasn't available until 4:30 . Proper staffing and using common sense could have brought more money into the hotel and certainly would have provided a better experience for us.

title: Resolved an issue
comment: The family and I had a nice time at the Belvoir. Proximity to City Walk and Universal Studios is excellent. Hotel clearly gets a lot of traffic and is slightly worn but overall, worth the money. We had one issue, addressed it after we returned home and Sam (front desk manager) handled it promptly and professionally. I was impressed and appreciative. For that reason alone, we would go back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access, big pool, friendly staff, clean rooms and allows our small dog to stay with us!
title: Satisfied guest
comment: We appreciate the quality of the hotel and that we can bring our small dog.

title: Stay somewhere else.
comment: The Belvoir corporation should be embarassed by this property. 1) The rooms do not have a closet but instead an alcove with a waist high bar. There is no place to hang dresses and front desk does not care. 2) Maid service is spotty at best. They do not clean the rooms daily. 3) No one picked up the room service tray for over 24 hours. The prior day's tray was still there when I checked out...it could still be there for all I know. 4) Room service is always expensive but $29.68 for 3 pancakes and 2 slices of Bacon? 5) Service is poor in the restaurant. Had to wait 15 minutes for the hostess to flag me down and point to a table. 6) Lastly, I confirmed that I could have a package shipped to the hotel. I was assured that a proces was in place to notify me at delivery. The next day I went to the desk twice and was told it had not arrived. The second day, was told the same thing but then the clerk checked in the back. Package had been delivered the prior day but process was not followed. They did credit me the $10 fee on my bill. But should they really be charging to accept a package? You complain and the front desk folks just shrug.

title: Wonderful staff
comment: I stayed at your hotel last week when my flight back home was cancelled due to weather. I was so impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff from check in, to meals to check out. Thank you for making a stressful situation so wonderful.

title: great location
comment: If visiting harvard great location staff was great

title: Not clean
comment: I had to spend one night here for a work related event. I had checked in and went to my room. Before getting to my room, just walking the hallways gave me the vibe that it was not clean as there was trash on the floors, etc. I went in and found the room be equally as dirty. The sheets and blankets had stains, etc. speaking with my colleagues the following morning, their rooms were in similar condition.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great value for the money...should easily be rated a 4 star hotel
title: Right in the heart of downtown
comment: This hotel was within a short walking distance from major shopping areas, multiple upscale and medium scale restaurants, as well as the local venues for both concerts (the reason for our most recent stay) and various hometown sports teams. The hotel had a very modern, lovely decor, with an understated elegance. We were located on the Club Level, and enjoyed the manager's evening complimentary cocktail hour, as well as a refreshing continental breakfast. The parking was convenient-although we normally use the valet service, we were unable to park at the hotel entrance due to two large coach buses blocking the area. We were given a complimentary parking permit, as my husband and I had driven in from different areas of the state, and required two parking spaces during our stay. The staff were very courteous & accomodating. We will definitely stay at the Belvoir again!

title: Not so good service
comment: As a BPG member, I prepaid the Club room, When I arrived, the hotel gave away my room and placed me on the regular based room. The staff did non tell me they are overbooked at the time check in. I had to argue this with the staff. As a frequent business travel, I will not recommend this hotel location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean & friendly but looks like 1980's in terms of decor!
title: 20Th Century Hotel Caught in Time Warp
comment: This is a great hotel if it was 1980, but it IS the 21st Century. Everyone uses the internet and WiFI, so why are we charging $9.95 a night to use it in your room?! Oh, thats because its only free in the lobby.Doesn't everyone want to print out a Boarding Pass? How about a print station kiosk in the lobby. I went to print out my boarding pass on Friday August 10 at 630AM - the printer was "out of order" At 5pm, it was still out of order!!! Decor - a la 1980

title: Location, location location
comment: The staff was exceptional beginning at check-in. The room was large and comfortable and the view was excellent . All for a reasonable rate.

title: The hotel has not improved.
comment: I have been coming to Vermont for the same conference for 15 years running. Most every year I have stayed at the Belvoir, but this year I decided I could not do it again. At the last minute I decided to stay one night to see if any improvements had been made. I was not impressed. I have photos of the hallway by my room on the club level. There was laundry outside many of the rooms and the club lounge was not manned during open hours. The carpet still has not been replaced (going on 10+ years) and the same level of attention is given by the staff (no sense of urgency). I have never been to a hotel where there was more apologizing by the staff than at this property. I could continue, but suffice it to say that I will not be coming back.

title: Staff at the Hotel
comment: I stay at this hotel on a regulart basis. I want to personally achknowledge Greg the night manager who is so focused on Customer Service and has always done an excellent job insuring I am taken care of. Jerry and Joe are the Bellman who go out of their way to help not only with my needs but also to any of the colleagues who also stay at the hotel. These 2 men are hard workers and great representatives of the Belvoir Family

title: Leak
comment: Bathroom leaked water from ceiling tiles.

title: This hotel is very well located
comment: Very convenient Hotel, and very helpful staff. I specially like the lounge.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location to Legoland is walking distance
title: Food and service was excellent
comment: The staff was very friendly and knowledgable when I arrived and the check in process was fast. The food quality at the hotel restaurant and room service was excellent.

title: Vinny1
comment: This is my preferred Hotel in the Houston area. The rooms are great the staff is more than helpful and accomodating. Nancy and Jose in the resturant treat you like you are in their home and call you by name when ever you walk in. Mary the night attendent at the front desk is another gem at this Hotel. You will not be disapointed.

title: "happy Camper"
comment: My stay was just great. Attention from the restaurant to the front desk to the extremely comfortable bed, was five star.!! As a U S veteran, the staff was even more pleasing. ( which was not something that I brought up.) Would return in a heart-beat.!!

title: just relax---your at a great hotel
comment: everything at this hotel was focused on the persons stay.i give this hotel a good recomend because they deserve it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient, but the customer IS NOT their primary concern.
title: Pillows great, Cleanliness okay
comment: Bathroom toilet bowl black mold around inside cover...Concierge floor lounge does not have any bar facilities, but eggs included in the continebtal breakfast was a nice addition. When ordering room service the phone rang forever. Valet van service to the airport poor. Several people waiting and they would not deploy the other Van just sitting there. Had to wait 25 minutes for next schedule trip.

title: Excellent rooms, location
comment: Front desk person Mathew went an extra mile to help me . Very correct, attentive.

title: Lovely Hotel
comment: I've stayed at this hotel many times and each has been a pleasure. My only complaint is that I missed the cleaning staff's only attempt to clean my room because I slept in. I thought they'd try to come back in the afternoon but they didn't.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pay the little extra for the evening view.
title: The view from the 18th floor at night is spectacular
comment: The view from the 18th floor at night is beautiful. The bedding was extremely comfortable. What I found odd was the mixture of what can be great about a Belvoir Hotel vs. it had some contrasting features. The carpeting was a bit old, and the toilettres were lacking. The room was odd mix of old and new. Would like to see some areas upgraded. It was clean and quite, will stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Cleaning staff are rude and there was a bug in the bed.
title: Sleep interrupted by unfriendly staff
comment: I checked into this hotel very late in the evening due to plane delays. The staff was welcoming, even at such a late hour, and I went up to my room for a few hours of sleep. The next morning, at 8:30 am, there is a loud knocking on the door. Since I was tired, I tried to ignore it and go back to sleep. A few minutes later, there is another demanding knock on the door. When I open the door, it is the cleaning person, asking when I will check out. Now, 8:30 is in no way close to the checkout time, and I was not delaying her job by trying to get my rest. So my response is that I don't know when I will be checking out. She then demands an estimate of when I think I will be checking out. After a late night this was the last thing I wanted to deal with at 8:30 in the morning. After that encounter I begin to get ready for the day, since I was alerady awake. After about 20 minutes out of bed, I see a huge bug crawling where I had just slept. Not my idea of a friendly or clean hotel, and I will not be visiting any time in the near future.

title: television not what it should be...
comment: I was mildly irritated that the Fox News channel was not available. It was "overdubbed" with a redundant broadcast of CNBC.

title: Reunion stay
comment: Our high school alumni had a reunion at the hotel. Everything from the room to the meeting facilities was great. Staff was great and had a good attitude. Had a problem with my room that they quickly sent a repairman for. When he said it would take a while they moved me to a new room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be very careful about reservations and transportation.
title: Good hotel
comment: Great housekeeping and front desk.But the management messed up shuttle schedules and reservations for many attending the pen show including me

title: Beautiful View
comment: The Belvoir Waikiki has taken advantage of their location and allowed for all of their rooms to have a beautiful view of the ocean or pools. I could sit on the balcony of the room all day and never be bored!.

title: Loved my stay here.
comment: We stayed here 8/9-8/10 of 2012.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are no tubs shower is so high you can't reach it pool looked like a hehab facility
title: Ms
comment: The bathrooms made me fel like I was in a hospital the pool area was the pits

title: Not a quality Belvoir hotel
comment: We were really disappointed when we pulled into the driveway of the hotel. It did not meet our expectations of what a Belvoir hotel should be. The outside of the hotel looked dingy and the lobby looked more like a cheaper hotel than a Belvoir. The room was small, but seemed clean. Until we went to the bathroom and it smelled bad, like moldy or old towels. We tried to air it out but the smell was still there the next day. The parking lot was covered with construction material. One morning, there was a random wet towel outside our balcony door. No idea how it got there.

title: Met expectations
comment: I've stayed more than a dozen of times at this Belvoir and always been treated well. First room had issues so we changed room and were welcome to the usual Belvoir standards.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great; staff go out of their way to be helpful; and room service is outstanding!
title: Frequent Guest
comment: All of your staff from check-in to checking-out bend backwards to make the stay pleasant and meaningful. They are very helpful. The facility is bright and cheerful. It's clean. The beds are very comfortable making for a good night's sleep. The room service was outstanding - great food & service! The addition of the "Business Center" was a plus. I cannot say enough good about this hotel...it is GREAT! Highly recommend it!!!

title: Club Lounge top notched
comment: This hotel is in a great area of downtown Denver. The service is great and the Club Lounge is one of the best I've experienced at a Belvoir in the US. The continental breakfast in the lounge was amazing! I'm very picky about my fruit and every single piece of fruit was perfectly sliced, perfectly ripe and no blemishes. The rest of the Club Lounge continental food was perfectly arranged and well presented. Great job to Belvoir on this one!

title: A pleasure
comment: Always a pleasure to stay at your location. Have been doing so over 12 years now.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location of this Hotel is outstanding, easy to get around, shopping, business, etc
title: Hotel is a easy location
comment: My experience with the Belvoir has always been outstanding, I have one request placing items in the bathroom could be expanded, also many other Belvoir Hotels provide points for those who go GREEN. This Belvoir does not.. Everyone likes a little reward when asking them to recycle or reuse the bedding and/or towels. Just helps out with the efforts that Belvoir is promoting.

title: Great time, but too short.
comment: From check in to check out we were treated very graciously. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us. This is the first time that we have stayed at your Belvoir and we hope to do so again the next time we travel south on I-81,

title: DTW
comment: Staff was helpful but not very knowledgeable about point stays! Took two desk clerks 20 min. to check me in!

title: Great Stay
comment: I frequent this hotel for business and find the service consistently good. The staff is always pleasant, my room is clean and comfortable and I have a nice time while I'm there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Located 10 mins WALK from Universal Studios but there is a shuttle.
title: last minute vacation
comment: Decided to take a last minute vacation to Universal Studios. Since we had never been we thought staying here would make things easier for us. It was PERFECT! Great hotel, staff, work-out room, AND the price was decent! We will stay here again on our next trip to Universal Studios!

title: not happy with stay at hotel
comment: the young lady that checked me in was not friendly.my room smelled like smoke.

everyoneShouldKnow: WiFi is NOT free in the rooms.
title: Excellent value in a great location
comment: The stays at the Belvoir West Des Moines Hotel have always been pleasant and enjoyable. It is clean, comfortable, and friendly as well as close to many amenities.

title: Free Wi Fi in the lobby only--ugh!
comment: Most of the day and the evenings the guests of your exclusive hotel are huddled in the lobby to use their electronic devices. Wi Fi is available in the rooms, but for a fee. Your nickel and dime policy provoked me enough that I would not choose your hotel in the future.

title: Outstanding rooms and work out area
comment: Everything about this hotel is nothing but the best from the rooms, food, and especially the friendliness of all the staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, but needs some serious upgrades inside the hotel.
title: Electrical Upgrades Needed.
comment: I spent three nights at the Belvoir Downtown Denver and each morning, had to call to have the power in the bathroom fixed, sometimes having to call several times. All but once, I had to wait over 10 minutes for a response. Electrical power needs serious upgrading.

title: Poor Experience
comment: Room was on the 11th floor and appeared had not been used in some time. Dust, smell was not expected and remotes to tv had to be replaced.

title: This hotel is convenient to Tampa International Airport
comment: The hotel was clean but the air conditioner was a bit noisy.

title: Excellent and Friendly Staff
comment: This hotel has a great location, clean and classy environment and a very accomadating staff.

title: Reused plastic cups
comment: The plastic cups in the bathroom were wrapped in plastic, but not sealed. They were slit down the side. It appears that the cups were simply placed back in the plastic wrap and tucked in at the top. Gross.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to six flags, ranger and cowboy stadium.
title: Conscier Lounge
comment: This is one of my favorite Belvoir hotel. The location is unbeatable, the staff is great. Both Karla and Vickie in the lounge are the best attendants I have ever encountered.

title: Joe Kuhn
comment: Outstanding event. Randy and Hotel did a great job in handling our event. Thanks for providing outstanding service.

title: fantastic
comment: The staff is outstanding. Especially Colleen from the clubhouse. Thank you Colleen.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location close to Metrocenter and lots of resturant choices
title: Great overall stay
comment: Your hotel and resturant staff were exceptional always friendly and ready to help great breakfast at an even greater price

title: Good location for mountain access
comment: Stopped in Denver on my return from the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally, wanting to do a little riding in the mountains before heading home. The hotel was able to accomodate my need for truck & trailer parking. The location near freeways on the west side of town made access to the mountains quick and easy, and kept me out of traffic.

title: This hotel has great service
comment: Room, restaurant, and other staff services were among the best that I have experienced. Everyone was friendly, and accommodating. Thank you!!

title: Great hotel
comment: I loved the hotel. My only complaint was the pillows were to thick. Would prefer feather.

title: HIdden Gem
comment: Be surprised by a "resort type" facility at hotel prices

title: Not clean
comment: I would not suggest this hotel. I am unable to give details why due to review guidelines, which is crazy. Can I just say that I will be contacting the hotel directly. Service/staff was not acceptible.

title: great
comment: this was our first trip to disney and picking a hotel blindly is a little scary but the walt disney dolphin was great and we don't ever plan to stay anywhere else when visiting mickey mouse!

title: Great Customer Service
comment: Service excellence is clearly top priority at this hotel. All of the staff were warm and helpful.

title: Could have been so much better
comment: Hotel could have been so much better. Great location, beautiful lobby, clean room with a great view but the staff just doesn't get it. I waited longer in the Grandbourne line at reception than non-members. The desk clerk and valet were surly. At $50/night for parking can I please have a smile? Room service good and the staff woman in the Club was very nice! But I asked for help with an internet connection and the hotel operator was surly. Fortunately, tech guy was great. Fitness center too crowded!

everyoneShouldKnow: Badly in need of renovation, or better, demolition
title: Not ready for prime time
comment: A fire alarm went off at 5:30 am. The staff appeared totally unpreapared to deal with it. They didn't bother to tell the hotel guests to return to the building after the alarm was determined to be false. No one could figure out how to get the elevators re-started. so my wife, with a vascular condition, had to climb 5 flights of stairs to get to our room.

title: Great Airport Hotel
comment: My recent experiences in hotels near major airports has not been great but the Belvoir at the Portland airport is the exception. We were met by a greeter when we entered the hotel and the staff went out of their way to meet our needs.

title: Total relaxation
comment: All we wanted was to "get away & relax". The pool was excellent for exactly that. Beautiful pool area, with food and drinks by the pool. Quiet atmosphere, even with small kids there. We walked to Disneyland in the evenings for dinner. I only wish there were a way to separate rooms for families w/ small children. Otherwise, we loved our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great view of Disneyland fireworks show.
title: Great location and pool area
comment: We made last minute plans to go to Disneyland and were lucky enough to get a room at ther Belvoir. Great location and the pool area was wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Become an BPG member, it really paid off for me on this visit.
title: don't miss this experience
comment: This was my second visit to Wild Horse Pass. I liked it so much the first time that we stayed there the evening before attending a conference in Phoenix. What stood out for me, this time, while I was waiting for someone to assist me at the front desk, a valet came over to see if they could assist - and indeed they could. I really appreciated their effort.

title: Despicable reservation policies
comment: While this hotel is a nice facility and the working level staff are friendly and competent, the reservations policies - while legal - are despicable.

title: Awesome staff
comment: I was only in Dallas for one night on August 10th. I was more than satisfied with everything about the hotel, but I was totally impressed with the staff. The two young ladies at the front desk at check-in were two of the best I have ever dealt with. While maintaining a professionalism that was impressive, they were also able to put the guest at ease and made them feel welcomed and important. The staff the next morning were just as friendly and professional. Either you do a great job in hiring or your hospitality training is off the charts. Or maybe it is both. Great Job!

title: Great location
comment: Just steps from the beach without higher hotel prices. Good place for families. Steps away from shopping and eateries or enjoy food discounts at hotel. Staff helpful but could have smiled more.

title: Belvoir Hotel, Crystal City.
comment: My wife and I, along with my grandson just returned from a four day vacation in Washington. After an eight hour drive, we checked into the Hotel around 3:00PM. I was very pleased with the greeting we received by the Hotel staff, especially, by the person (who's name I don't recall) that check us in. He was extremely helpful in pointing out places of interest. The Hotel is nicely located, and very close to the Metro station, making for easy access to the D.C.area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Unclean and house-keeping never came in 2 days.
title: Disappointed bride-to-be
comment: I booked 4 rooms for 8 of my bachelorette party girl friends and myself, and all of us were extremely disappointed in the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: You will not be disappointed! Don't concentrate on just a pool unless your going on a "pool trip"! There are so many positives here!
title: An Excellent Choice To Stay Here
comment: We were hesitant after reading some not so positive reviews. DO NOT get all caught up in reading those negative reviews,like I was about to! But rest assure,we're 100% glad we did not go by those,we went ahead & we had a first class stay here. Being an BPG gold member & owners of 2 villas in the USVI,we made a fabulous choice & will stay here again (and are looking forward to it!). We had to stay close to home and chose the AC Sheration (and glad we did). It's clean,cheery and is sure to satisfty you. As for the parking,it's well worth the small fee considering that you're in AC & parking is at a premium everywhere in the city. We stayed club level (what an added treat),& staff throughout the whole hotel treated us excellently (as well as superb BPG recognition). As far as the pool goes,yes,it is small & needs a little more attention,but if staying here in the summer,you have the whole Atlantic ocean at your doorstep! Well done & looking forward to another stay in the near future!

title: Great Trip!
comment: Hotel/rooms are clean. Staff is friendly and attentive. The kids loved the pool and waterslide. The grounds were well maintained. Attractive lobby and rooms were nice. Flavored water in the lobby was a hit. It's the little things, you know? Hotel is a great value! We would definitely stay at the S.C. again.

title: Hotel service and amenities are outstanding
comment: The hotel is great -- top to bottom. The service all the way around was outstanding, the location could not have been better and the amenities were great. My only request is that you include dressers with drawers.

title: Great Hotel
comment: This hotel is wonderful. Great features like the boat to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Beautiful lobby and rooms, beds are extremely comfortable. Only problem is the transportation to Magic Kingdom. Horrible! Bus was always late...we walked to the Swan and took the bus from there, The Swan and Dolphin should not be on same bus route as Boardwalk and the Beach club!! It would also be helpful to have transportation to and from the airport.

title: Belvoir San Diego
comment: Great Hotel. Staff very freindly and Courteous.

everyoneShouldKnow: That service is quite poor by Belvoir/Grandbourne standards.
title: Did not honor their promises
comment: Very disappointing - not to the usual Grandbourne standard. I arrived at about 2pm and they had no appropriate rooms available at that time. After a very, very long wait (so long she gave me a free parking pass on the spot!) the woman at reception said that as I was a Platinum member she could give me a room (with two double beds) on a Club floor later in the day. She took my details (including my credit card) and I left my phone number - she she would call me once the room was ready.

title: excellant stay
comment: what a great hotel--brought my family in from az before cruise had 4 rooms every thing was excellant-- would highl recommend

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful facility and very nice rooms
title: Nice hotel
comment: The room was beautiful and bed was very comfortable (great pillows). The bedside lamp didn't work. There was toothpaste splatter on the wall in the VERY small bathroom. Internet costs $9.95 (I'm used to free internet). The Pepsi machine nearest my room dispensed HOT (not room temperature) Pepsi which tasted awful - I reported this twice.

title: Excellent and would stay there again
comment: The staff bent over backwards for me and were extremely friendly. The facility was exceptionally clean and the room I had was huge. The fitness room was on the top floor and had a window overlooking Busch Stadium and the Arch. I would definitely stay there any time.

title: The Place to Stay
comment: Outstanding visit to your wonderful Hotel . Everyone was top notch and I had the best sleep ever. I will certainly be back the next time I am in the area!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for the town night life and day time sights
title: Great location
comment: The hotel is in a great location, very clean and nice staff.

title: This hotel has a good location
comment: We were given a room, which we found wasn't as yet cleaned, so we walked all the way back to the desk. He did apologize and we did not blame him for it, so were issued another room. This one was cleaned. We did find, however, the carpet was filthy. We even saw what looked like BLOOD SPOTS on the way to the bathroom. This was disgusting and needed to be remedied. The hotel was quiet and could have been a very, very nice hotel and stay except for the really dirty carpet. I must add that there were alot of spots and was certainly not to our standards. The hotel is in a wonderful location and we were expecting better in carpet cleanliness.

title: No pillowcases
comment: Imagine reaching your hotel room after 12am, with conference starting at 8am. Imagine looking at 2 beds, 8 pillows, 0 pillowcases. Look outside your window and look directly into a flood light. I decided I could deal with the light, called for pillowcases, which I received within 10 minutes. No one is perfect but it was late.

title: Perfect Location
comment: The hotel is located a few short blocks from Times Square and the Broadway shows. The subway is literally right out the door and can take you anywhere else in the city you would like to go.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can swim after 11:00pm, if you are quiet
title: A wonderful place to stay in Paradise
comment: Just wanted to say that I am glad I didn't put too much into what people have written about this Jewel of the South of Paradise. It was easy to get to and from Duval Street and the rest of the Key. The Front Desk Staff was awesome!

title: Great Stay
comment: We upgraded to the club level. Food was excellent. Enjoyed the dinner fair as well as the hot breakfast the next morning. This is a great value and saves gas and time trying to find a restaurant. The indoor pool was really nice too. I would suggest that in the king suite the bathroom should be larger. It was cramped and didn't have enough space, only had a small glass shelf over the toilet and a regular sink. Location is great, easy access from the freeway.

title: My short stay was wonderful!
comment: Our room was all we expected and more. It was very clean, roomy and comfortable. When I laid down on the mattress, I fell asleep immediately and slept all night. Room service was quick and efficient and my breakfast was delicious.

everyoneShouldKnow: It should not have the banner of Belvoir, not even Four Points!
title: Service is everything, but NOT here!
comment: I stay here on a regular basis and always overlook the poor demeanor and shape of the hotel. Why? because sometimes service matters and up until today that has gone out the window. Maybe it's because the friendly faces I see during the day were NOT here to greet me. Instead I am greeted by incompetent staff that screwed up a few basic requests. Not only am I a Platinum member, but an Ambassador and I am truly disappointed in the lack of comprehension on the hotels part to fix a few minor details that would have gone a long way in keeping my future business. Instead I feel compelled to write my first ever review of a BPG property and it sadly can't be a good one.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service is poor. Rooms are not clean.
title: a very poor experience
comment: The first room I was given smelled and the carpet was wet. There were few staff, room service did not answer. Service in bar was sloppy.

title: don,t stay here
comment: this place sucks for the price that was charge excepted more from a five star hotel

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay at another BPG Property in the area
title: A dated hotel with disinterested staff
comment: In many years as a platinum member, I have never experienced such an awful check-in process. Unfriendly valet parking attendants followed by simply the worst service that I have ever received during the check-in process. I did complain to the manager who rewarded me with 500 BPG Points and seemed more interested. I wasn't really looking for the points - just an assurance that the rest of my stay would be enjoyable. Rooms clean but dated and cramped (in BPG room, not offered upgrade - oh well). If the rates are similar at the other Grandbourne properties in the area, then opt for another hotel

title: Check in staff was great
comment: Arrived early, they found us two rooms same floor, quiet room for adults, check in was quick

title: THIS HOTEL WAS OK
comment: COULD BE BETTER WITH BREAKFAST & FOOD ON CLUB LEVEL

title: hotel needs better upfront peope
comment: the person that worked the evening i arrived there was not a good employee. I had the room next door having a party starting about 230am and I called the front desk and they had the security go up there to quite them. they did get quite for 15 minutes then they got louder and louder and i called downstairs again and she they were drunk and i said remove them. Well she didn't do anything to quite them. the next morning i went downstairs and spoke to the manager on duty and he moved us to a different room. Those drunk guest should have been moved and or been thrown out of the hotel.

title: Friendly Staff
comment: Good hotel. Helpful and friendly staff. Central location. Guest rooms need updating.

title: Love me some Belvoir TRIBECA
comment: Greatblocation. Nice rooms. Great staff.

title: Very nice
comment: Room was very nice, bed was great . Lighting in bath room poor. Hard to do makeup in this light . No refrigerators or safe. TV and movie service was great. Meals very good

everyoneShouldKnow: Pet Friendly ! It was so nice seeing such well behaved pets on the premises - yet my room did NOT smell like any animal had ever been there. Grounds are wonderful for walking - love the ducks/fish/turtles in the retaining ponds - relaxing!
title: Great Hotel - great prices
comment: The beds were clean and comfy. Even though we were in the room odd hours (sleeping from noon until 5pm) the managed to clean it nearly everyday between 6 a.m. and 11 a.m. - without being asked for special attention. My only complaint - only 2 elevators. While we were there for a swim meet, there was also a softball tourney in town - so the hotel was fully booked. The floors were quiet - you'd never know - except when you needed to use the elevator - especially swim meets - when everyone is leaving at the same exact time. Oh, and stock more fridges - we had to go out and buy a cooler !

title: Recent business trip
comment: Great improvements in the club lounge - Dessert is a great addition in the evening and a hot entree in the morning!!

title: Needs work
comment: Room 1328: At first glance, everything seemed to be fine. But, when I started taking my shower, I noticed a yellow stain on the bottom of the tub near the drain. I turned around and then noticed discoloration of the grout lines along the back corner of the surround. As I was drying off, I notice the paint was peeling from the inside bottom of the bathroom door. And, the exhaust fan was noisy and only marginally effective. Finally, for the first time in my life of many hotel stays, my wife and I got stuck in the elevator.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff and it is at a good location next to ihop and applebees.
title: This hotel is at a great location, great for weddings and meetings
comment: The rooms needs some updates, eg carpet needs to be change as well as the facet in the bathrooms. The bed was clean and comfortable and was well made.

title: Bad
comment: I was taken out of the pool with my children bcause of a special event taken care that same day without notice. I am an BPG Gold member, and the party at the pool was for a BEER a kid outsiders.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wifi and internet speed is extremely slow! Still using dialup??
title: not up to Belvoir standardt
comment: The internet speed is too slow! My trip is business related, the WiFi speed is soo bad and hardly get any work done. Especially at the lobby I needed to print out boarding pass, it took me more than 20 min to log in the hotel desktop and get it done. Worst internet speed I ever encountered in any hotel!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is easy to get to many LI areas from this location. Ask for something they will help you get it.
title: Hotel staff went above for us.
comment: Had some issues with the room at check in. Then pool and hot tub were not working- and was just overall upset with the fact that noone knew that it wasnt working when we checked in. Room issuse was resolved by Dean, he did a great job,. Pool was fixed by night time- thanks to maintenance. And Sal made wondeerful omlettes on Saturday morning. So by the end we were very happy- and will go back.

title: Location
comment: Great location to TCU , moving in our student and downtown. Love shuttle ! Walls are thin with noisy neighbors, but the main doors don't slam and the air flow can be turned up to drown out noise. Very nice staff. We will be back for a third time this coming Sept.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Very nice hotel to stay at. Extremely clean and comfortable. On the corner of 16th steet mall so everything you could possibly want is right there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location and very generous rooms!
title: In town for a wedding
comment: This room far exceeded our expectations. We were from out of town and were able to check in early - thank goodness because we had more time to enjoy this incredible value. The decor is excellent and the size is amazing! 3-4 people could easily stay in these rooms for a short period of time. The lobby and surrounding areas were very, very nice and the staff was nothing less than professional and courteous. We were only there overnight, but I wish we could have stayed longer!! I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Belvoir again!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Get-away if you want to stay put
title: last minute sneak away
comment: We had a fantastic time at the Belvoir. More than we usually pay, but it was worth it. The staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. Parking was an issue with various conferences being held, but other than that it was all good and very enjoyable.

title: Great, helpful, friendly staff
comment: Great hotel in great location. I definitely recommend it.

everyoneShouldKnow: When it comes to feel and decor, it's not the W but it is very nice and nothing is wrong with it.
title: Exceeded Expectations
comment: I used BPG points to get a room and I am an BPG Gold Member. They automatically upgraded me to an Executive Suite! I was quite impressed. It was huge and very clean. The staff was very friendly. Parking was quite pricey though at $29 for Valet.

title: First Disney stay
comment: The Dolphin was ok,I wouldn't recommend my friends to stay there. When we arrived, there was 1 person working behind the desk, check in took 45 minutes, nice first impression. The room was average at best, I've had better rooms at non resort hotels. The construction was noisy during the day, hammering during the afternoon. Access to Epcot, Hollywood Studios and the Boardwalk was easy with the ferry. I wouldn't recommend the resort restaurants, except the Fountain. We ate at Shula's the first night, save your money, Texas Roadhouse has better steak. Everytime we flushed the toilet, it came close to overflowing, real nice! The in room internet is poor and the complimentary items are available ONLY if you ask for them.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and comfortable room. Great housekeeping personal.
title: Check in and internet
comment: When we checked in on Tuesday the July 31 at 2;30 you had 1 and then after a long time in line another person came to check us in. We were in line for entirely too long and the line never moved. We should be able to access the internet in the room and in the lobby without paying $25.00

title: Restaurant Experience
comment: We had a great experience your property is to be commended on a job well done!!! However, my only concern being from a Resort Property as well, was that the waitstaff in the restaurant were having very open procedural conversations on the floor as well as, one of them was also eating on the floor. It didn't change my expierence, it was excellent, but was unprofessional! :)

title: first time
comment: Was very happy with the hotel. Great location and very clean

title: Nice Hotel
comment: Everything was nice, restaurants were great. There was minor repair issues such as a lamp which was not operable all week, and small items that happen with maintenence.

title: Good staff, mediocre breakfast
comment: The staff was responsive and friendly. The breakfast in the Club Lounge was mediocre, at best. The selection was limited, and the taste of the food was so so.

title: The larger the hotel, the worse the experience
comment: I spent a week at the hotel for a training event. The cleanliness of the hotel left so much to be desired. While I understand that everything is bigger in Texas, the number of huge bugs throughout the hotel (both alive and dead) was unacceptable. One of our participants found bugs in her bed; another found a used condom in his (and after repeated requests, FINALLY got his sheets changed -- not just remade).

title: View
comment: Since we paid for a view of NYC, we would have expected that, instead we had a tree in our window. Was slightly dissapointed in this.

title: AVERAGE
comment: The beds are by far the best part of this hotel. VERY COMFORTABLE!

title: One of the nicest hotels I stay at
comment: We stay at this hotel every year for the function that we attend. It is one of the nicest hotels we stay at. It is always clean, and like new, great and comfortable bedding, and great location. Also easy to get to!

title: My Stay
comment: This hotel has a great location!! You can get many types of food nearby and even an IHOP around the corner. Everything was great except I just thought the room would be a bit bigger. Overall i most definitely recommend this hotel!

title: NICE HOTEL
comment: EVERYTHING MET OR EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS!!!

title: ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC
comment: STAYED WITH FOUR PEOPLE IN AN OVESIZED DOUBLE ROOM AND EVERYTHING WAS BEYOND EXPECTATIONS!!!

title: Great hotel
