comment: Loved the location -- walking distance to Sundance Square, employees were always helpful, friendly, and attentive; rooms were very nice and clean, restaurant had wonderful food, there was a coffee shop in the lobby which was awesome, internet in the lobby was very convenient. Overall great experience at this hotel.

title: excellent stay
comment: We stayed in several hotels on this road trip and none compared to the quality and service of this hotel. We had dinner late in the restaurant and got fantastic service, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was very courteous. Thank you for a great stay for my family.

title: Bad customer service
comment: I would not recommend this hotel. I am BPG platinum and have stayed here a few times. Something has changed.. I called the front desk for 15 minutes on 2 occasions( after 10 pm so not busy) and they never answered.. Club lounge lady on Sat morning was very rude and not helpful.. Don't believe the 7 am opening time.. If you do reach the front desk, they are not wanting to help either..

title: lifesaver
comment: You guys saved our vacation! the desk people were super helpful and after a glitch with our original accomodations absolutely bailed us out big time! Your staff was the best, and we really enjoyed our vacation.

title: Poor customer service
comment: We checked in immediately after exchanging our vows at our wedding and I was very disa ppointed with the set up of our room. I paid extra money to have champange and strawberries already there and they weren't. Also, we waited 30 mins. to get extra towels the next day. Among other things that went wrong I would never stay at this hotel again.

title: Gem of a property
comment: I loved all the southwest decor and boulders!

title: Exceptional Staff
comment: This is my hotel of choice in LA. The room, amenities and food were all superb, but the thing that always stands out to me the most is the exceptionally friendly and helpful staff throughout the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and a good view of the airport.
title: Friendly staff members
comment: I really enjoyed my stay, everyone as good customer service and greetings with a smile. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the waiter, Club level is just great, looking forward to visiting again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location in the heart of the Denver 16th street mall.
title: Bathroom Fixtures.
comment: Bathroom fixtures need attention; both toliet seat and sink fixtures are loose. Room 649.

title: Staff goes the distance for guests
comment: Great Location. We were close to many attractions and we actually walked to most of them. Staff was friendly and very helpful concerning any of our questions or concerns. We had a particular request and staff member researched it and found a way to accommodate our request. Room was very nice with great view and appropriate amenities. I plan to bring my family back on my next trip/vacation

title: worn out room
comment: Our hotel room was worn out, with rumpled and ripped carpets, chipped furniture and walls, and a sticky carpet.

title: We were very pleased by the friendliness of the staff
comment: The beds were not very comfortable but that is a personal preference

title: JUST A GET AWAY
comment: EXCELLENT SERVICE; GREAT ROOMS

title: Great Stay
comment: Front Office Mgr-Sam sent a nice email prior to arrival welcoming us to the hotel. She also offered what she could do to make our stay most enjoyable. Our resvn was for a King, but we wanted 2 Beds b/c we have 2 kids. When we arrived late at night from a long trip from San Fran, we were greeted by 2 very friendly front desk agents. They made us feel very welcomed and had arranged for a room with 2 beds and an upgrade to the club level. I was recognized as an BPG member. This short stay was memorable from prior to arrival until departure. Kudos to your Front Office team! Great Job! Plus we enjoyed Universal Studios :)

title: One night stay
comment: Had a Concert at the Tampa fair grounds only stayed one night. The room was very clean and staff was very helpful.

title: Outstanding customer service
comment: The front desk staff was friendly, helpful, and attentive at absolute peak rush hour. Very impressive and much appreciated.

title: Amazing Service, Great Attention to Detail
comment: Welcoming, accommodating and incredibly comfortable, my stay for 4 days was great! Convenient location to airport, beaches, and business, this Belvoir took care of all my needs and exceeded expectations in wonderful ways. The concierge lounge was terrific and so worth the extra money with a beautuful continental breakfast++ and a great place to come enjoy hearty appetizers and a glass of wine at the end of the day. Service was top of the line. A don't want to miss is their restaurant Papparazzi where we had the most delicious tasting menu filled with fresh contemporary Italian dishes presented beautifully and paired with amazing wines. A great run hotel with top level service in every way!

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Since the remodel, this hotel has taken a giant leap forward into comfort and convenience. I especially appreciated all the additional power outlets by the desk and the night stands for all of today's digital devices. It saves not having to crawl under a desk or move a table around to find an outlet. This was a very much appreciated feature from your remodel. The room was also extremely comfortable and it just felt like "home away from home". The only negative is that the hot tub by the pool was small, only holding 5 people max. However, when we used it, only 4 could fit and then it was tight. Hopefully in the future the hot tub could be made larger. Thank you for a great stay!

title: A bit disappointed
comment: The 1st disappointment was when we found out there's no jacuzzi. The bathrooms are very small and leaves very little room in the shower. Staff is not very friendly. The housekeeper "cleaned" our room and didn't even pick up the scattered newspaper from the floor. I'd say all you're paying is the convenience of the location.

title: Did not stay where I booked
comment: I was under the impression that I was to stay at the Belvoir Marina where I had stayed before. When I arrived I was told that I was staying up the road at a former Ramada. No restaurant..no bar..no Grandbourne floor..no club lounge..a postage sized pool badly in need of rework. No amenities whatsoever. But, I paid top dollar and was told if I wanted to enjoy the things that I had paid for such as a restaurant I had to walk 10-15 minutes. Not a good way to treat a long time member of your "loyalty" program

title: Great service
comment: The concierge, Paula, went above and beyond to help us with renting a car including a Belvoir discount. Everything was lovely.

everyoneShouldKnow: you don't need a car drive, just park it and walk.
title: This hotel has a wonderful location
comment: I really enjoyed the stay here, we were upgraded to a suite at no extra cost and when we walked in, my husband felt like he was on top of the world...the location is perfect for a downtown area. We were able to walk everywhere. The park was is walking distance and very beautiful downtown serenity.

title: Great stay in SLC
comment: If attending any event in downtown Salt Lake this is a great location, solid amenities, good food & bar, and a fair price. 5-6 blocks to anything.

title: I would not recommend
comment: Service was terrible for level the Belvoir should be at. No help with bags when I arrived, though 5 bell men went by me, and it was obvious I was struggling. Our room was never vacumed any of the 4 days we were there, there were no towels at the pool. We called for help with our many bags when leaving waited an hour, late for our final meeting, had to do it ourselves then found out you dont help with bags. Not enough help in the area to store our bags on our last day (you knew we were coming why only 1 person to help hundreds of women?)

title: Awesome Location
comment: The location was great along with the shuttles to all the Disney parks was a great benefit. We also took advantage of the Extra hours at the parks for staying here. The buffet prices were reasonable for being on site. The hotel was clean and smelled great. Highly recommend.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in a good location near resturants, shopping, the trolley station, and other activities.
title: This hotel is in a good location.
comment: We booked this location because it was close to Qualcomm Stadium, but found that it was also located near resturants, shopping and the Mission Valley Trolley station. Everything was in walking distance but if needed we utilized the hotel shuttle. Mel our shuttle driver was very helpful and friendly!

everyoneShouldKnow: They often offer incredible discounts that allows a modest family to feel deluxe!
title: Extra magical stay
comment: It had been several years since our family had stayed at the Dolphin so we were excited about the opportunity to return. We had such an awesome experience the previous time we were worried we might be let down. Well, no need to worry. Our stay was equally as incredible. There are so many outstanding features at the Dolphin. The choice of pools is amazing. It doesn't matter what age you are the Dolphin has the perfect pool for you. Small children? Zero entry and a slide. Teens? lap pool and lounge pool. Adults? Bring me a mai tai please, I'm sun bathing! For food you can go economy and stock your cubby with bread peanut butter and milk, you can eat very reasonably at the Fountain or Buffeteria or you can live it up at one of the fine steak or italian restaurants on site. Our maid service was fantastic. Though you can choose to skip the maid service for BPG points. Personally I love returning to a fresh room! For those who say it lacks the "Disney" feel i disagree. On our last morning we walked to the early morning entry for epcot, road Soaring and Mission Space, took the boat over to Hollywood Studios for their opening, returned to the hotel for an afternoon of lounging and relaxation at the pool and capped off the evening by walking to epcot for supper, enjoying illuminations and then taking the monorail to magic kingdom for the extra magic hours. How much more Disney do you want?! Everyone was wonderful and helpful. Our view was awesome. Every morning i woke just a bit early to enjoy a cup of the starbucks coffee on my balcony. I hope I can return again someday.

title: Disappointed with the room condition upon check-in
comment: We checked in at 1am and found the bathroom toilet seat had not been cleaned.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel does not know what customer service is!
title: Terrible service- our room type was given away at check in
comment: I made this reservation through BPG using my points with a room with 2 beds since we were travelling with 2 children. I called the hotel day of arrival at 8pm to confirm bedtype and notified them that we are arriving after midnight since we were driving from San Francisco. When we checked in at 1:45am, John the night manager said that we have a reservation for a King bed, I said no, we reserved a room with 2 beds and told him that I called earlier today to ensure this is in place. I showed him my confirmation indicating 2 double beds. The only thing he could say is that they are sold out and he cant do anything. Obviously they gave away my room to someone else and my family and I were inconvenienced especially arriving so late. Everyone was tired from the trip, and we had to wait for a rollaway to be sent up to the room. There were only 2 bath towels in the bathroom. My husband and I had to squeeze in a King bed with one of our kids. The thing that was most disturbing to me was there was NO empathy given by the night manager, no emotions whatsoever, and he was absolutely not sorry that this happend. He did not give a sincere apology and did not offer any solutions. He said that he would move us to a room with 2 beds the next day. Well this is just another inconvenience for us. The next day when we called the front desk to get an update on the room move, the agent did not even offer assistance to move our luggage to the new room, instead they just sent the keys up and we had to move our own luggage. This hotel does not understand what customer service is. There was no service promise whatsoever. Very dissappointed!

everyoneShouldKnow: You need to drive to each of the facilities. There is no shuttle to the pool, fitness center, main lobby, etc.
title: Unexpected Disappointment at Belvoir
comment: Not one person at the reception desk could find our reservation and it took over an hour to locate my confirmation number. They were not going to allow us to check in until I located information that should have been stored in their hotel system. I received an e-mail confirmation number...certainly the hotel should have been able to find it.

title: Great accommodations, great hotel
comment: We enjoyed our stay. Room and pool were above expectations. Only downside was your charge for internet access in the room, although computers were available in the lobby at no cost.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very friendly staff but dissapointed as an BPG Gold member that internet was not included.
title: Comfortable bed
comment: The bed was very comfortable as well as the pillows which made for a nice sleep away from my own bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a daily charge for parking.
title: Anchorage Belvoir
comment: Stayed at the Belvoir Anchorage Hotel & Spa in August for a business conference. Room was very nice, staff did excellent job cleaning room during stay, all staff courteous at check in/check out. I especially enjoyed the 24hr fitness center. The view over the city made this special, and I appreciated not paying extra for this facility.

title: Overall good hotel
comment: The hotel was nice and met most of our expectations. The only problem was at check in when the computers went down and it took them a very long time to manually check guests in. Staff was very cordial in these circumstances.

title: The pool was out of commission!
comment: Nice renovations, friendly staff, perfect location. We spent very little time at the hotel, but were so very disappointed to not be able to jump into the pool after a long day on busy tourist feet. I honestly think compensation is due. The lack of working pool far outweighed the construction underway in the entrance.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel, great location. Below average Club Lounge breakfast.
title: Great hotel poor Club Lounge
comment: If visiting Disneyland this is a very nice hotel. A short 10 min walk takes you right to the entrance of Disneyland. This is a family friendly hotel; and with all of the families staying at the hotel, the rooms are still very quite.

title: Great hotel for a DC vacation
comment: We had a wonderful time for the 3 nights we stayrd at this hotel. We were greeted by very polite and helpful staff. It was our first visit to the DC area and found this hotel to be comfortable and convenient to downtown DC, the monuments and Arlington cemetery. Our room was spacious and clean with great views of Washington monument. We had delicious appetizers and drinks at the lounge. Thank you.

title: Nice older hotel
comment: I have stayed at this hotel solo on business and with my family. It is a very clean hotel, with many things to do immediately around the hotel.

title: Nice downtown hotel
comment: This is a nice hotel right in the heart of Downtown SLC. Like many Belvoir's this is an older hotel that has had a nice remodel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Food cost and Internet access too costly to used daily
title: Nice Place to Stay
comment: This is my first stay here. The rooms are nice and comfortable. Since I don't travel alot on business I am not privliged to the "Club" level and am seriously disappointed that a Belvoir Hotel would charge $9.95/24 hrs for internet access. I guess it is like the airlines charging $25.00 for one bag checked. Not impressed with the Front Desk. They lost my Co's info to charge room and called room my first night even though I had confirmation that it was prepaid.

title: Cot and Pet
comment: The availability of a cot made our stay more comfortable---pet friendly policy a PLUS!!!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Watch the sunset from the Point.
title: A Perfect Kauai Experience
comment: This is our second stay here and we think the multimillion dollar improvements made a great hotel only more perfect. We love the new pool area, the wonderful beach that God gave the hotel, and the great staff. Everyone smiles, cares, embracing that wonderful Aloha spirit. The food was good, the drinks strong, and the garden area with fire pits serene and beautiful. Not sure if there is a better location to see the sunset. Also well located to walking to shops and restaurants. We will be back...hopefully soon.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service and attention to detail
title: Exceptional hospitality
comment: I was here on business for 3 weeks. I can't say enough about the service and friendliness of the staff, from the front desk, engineering, waitstaff and club level lounge associates. I was treated great, my room was well maintained and I couldn't of been more comfortable. I was able to take advantage of the club level, the pool/jacuzzi, and the lounge. I also have to add, Armando was awesome. He was consistently trying to recitify the internet challenges that you faced and was always pleasant and helpful. A shout out as well to your front desk associates, every morning and night they were so pleasant. I would highly recommend your hotel and look forward to coming back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to get off the train and walk to this help
title: Stay with all 4 of us was perfect
comment: From the time we arrived, to the time we left - it was a complete pleasure to stay at this hotel. It was not 5 star so i was not looking for that but for the Belvoir brand, pricing etc it exceeded my expectations.

title: This hotel is like no other I have ever been.
comment: This was the second time at the Belvoir Kauai. Both experiences were great. The atmosphere is low key and unpretentious. The staff is experienced, very professional, and humbly sincere. We love the pool, beach, location, atmosphere, (music at the pool) and the people that work and stay at the Hotel. I no where like it. We love the breakfast buffet. Did not eat at Rumfire but thought the menu was not as good as the one we remembered from last visit. Otherwise, the place is flawless.

everyoneShouldKnow: You will have a great time in a beautiful location.
title: What a great hotel!
comment: I attended a conference for several days and the hotel was excellent. Great rooms, attentive staff, things to do, golf, great swimming pools and the desert views. A great place to stay and I will go back again.

everyoneShouldKnow: on the hill right next to the Air Force Memorial.
title: great view from our room of Washington, DC
comment: great room. but not sure why they didn't spot clean the bad spot on the carpet in our room. room 1012. also got upgraded using points to us the Club level only to find out they were closed on the weekend, no mention on website of that surprise, hope we can get compensated with some points put back to our account.. Great service other than that especially the airport pickup.. oh also pool was closed, can't believe in the middle of summer, oh well...

everyoneShouldKnow: Great to stay at if your are in the area.
title: Close to Six Flags
comment: The only thing i have an issue with is the wifi internet. We could not get online and informed the front desk about 3x and they said they would send someone up but no one ever came up. The pool was down for maintenance. The food was pricey. Other than that everything else was great.

title: Great Appearance and Clean
comment: This is a beautiful hotel, and I would recommend this hotel to all my friends. The hotel rooms are clean with good all around views of the Atlanta Hartsfield-Jackson Int'l Airport. The hotel offers lots of fun things to do, and has easy access to the highways that lead to the city center of Atlanta.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be prepared to be shuffled down the street to the auxillary location.
title: There is ALWAYS the bait and switch.
comment: When I book a room at this location I always get switched to the auxillary located down the street.. It is ALWAYS a fight to stay in the main building no matter WHAT I DO. My husband fights me as well. He is tired of the treatment and wants to stay somewhere else. But I guess I am a glutton for punishment, because I keep insisting on staying there. I hope next time if I call the Manager in advance, as he suggested, I will not have this problem again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The views and sunsets are PHENOMENAL!
title: Great hotel
comment: The location cannot be beat! Great views out to the Gulf of Mexico and the bay from the room, the board room, and the work out area.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service is excellent starting from making my reservations by phone to the efficiency of all the staff I have met.
title: This hotel remains my favorite
comment: I enjoy my stay at the Belvoir Hotel . I appreciate the courteousness of the staff and cleanliness of the rooms.

title: Beautiful rooms and courtyard, but...
comment: In my reservation request, I asked for a quiet room away from pool, elevators, vending and ice. The check-in person proudly informed me that they had a room for me overlooking the pool. She was so crestfallen when I told her I didn't want to be near the pool, that we took it anyway. The room actually had a view of the koi pond, a little away from the pool. The first night was very quiet, but the second night included children running and yelling in the courtyard after 9pm and before 8am the next day. On looking out the window at the beautiful courtyard in the morning, 6 different dogs were out on leashes "doing their business". The courtyard is absolutely beautiful, but don't step on the grass. The room was very clean, comfortable and beautiful. We had a pleasant time in the hotel bar, breakfast in the restaurant was fast and adequate. This hotel is near my family member's home but I will not stay here again. Expensive, noisy.

title: liked this hotel
comment: The rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff was nice and helpful

title: Over and Beyond
comment: I can't imagine staying at any other Hotel. The staff went over and beyond to ensure my stay with them was what I was expecting and more. They were friendly, prompt, and took care of my needs. I would recommend this Hotel to everyone and anyone. On a scale of 1-10... They are a 100. I shall stay here in all my future stays. Thank you Max and staff for everything.

title: Room Facing Road !
comment: Room 2602 is facing the road and it is very nosy (cars travelling sound) even in the middle of the night ! I guess may need more 'sound' insulation to prevent this issue !

everyoneShouldKnow: Nobody cared if we were there or not and didn't bother to ask about our stay!
title: ok but not wonderful
comment: We arrived early to check in and they called when the ro rooom was ready, a nice

title: This hotel was great
comment: This Hotel exceeded my expectation

everyoneShouldKnow: this is a huge hotel, yet I was treated like I was their number one vip.
title: great costumer service
comment: when I got to the hotel I was already having a horrible day, delay flight, l trafic, and to top it all off the airline lost my luggage, I was in Dallas and my luggage in Houston. I was crying with frustation when I spoke with Natalie in guest service. After listening to me screaming at her for about 10 min about my room being too hot and not having towel in my room. She was so calm and put me at easy, For the first time that day, she was the only person that did not gave that empty speech full of "I am sorry". Instead within a few minutes Arny was at my room fixing the ac, Lupe from housekeeping brought me towels, robe, slippers, dental hygiene products, femenine products, deodorant... everything a need until I receive my luggage. She kept checking up with me until my luggage was deliverd to the hotel. Within 10 min Natalie solved almost all my proplems. For the next few nights Natalie helped me with wake up calls, computer problems, biling problems, ice, laundry, etc. I know she doesn't work 24 hrs a day, but sure it felt that way, because every time I called, she was there to help. I will never be able to thank her enough for what she did for me thughout my stay, specially right after my check in. She when she was able turned my day around with few gesture of kindness. I also can not forget Rita at the concierge, she was very sweet and helpfull with all of my questions about the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is excellent. Wonderful downtown area.
title: Breakfast
comment: Loved the breakfast buffet.

everyoneShouldKnow: On-site parking is a bit expensive
title: Conveniently Located
comment: The Belvoir Gunter is conveniently located across the street from the Riverwalk, staff are polite/helpful, and the facility is well-maintained.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location, walking to the beach froom the beach....
title: Best people great renovated hotel
comment: Everyone was great, friendly and acoomodating, Charles the f&b manager, Michelle at Dos Caminos, the front office and housekeeping staff were awesome!

title: Airport hotel
comment: Convenience location and great staff.

title: Disappointed
comment: I was very disappointed in my stay this time around. It was a waste of my points. The room had beer bottles in the recycle bin. I requested towels since the room only had two and my sister and I did not have enough to shower. The towels never arrived, I asked again in the morning, still no towels. I would say, this is my last time staying at this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: br prepared to not have questions answered in a timely manner or at all
title: July-August 2012 - Olympics
comment: room staff was great. Guest Service Mgrs were not. the hotel's television system is way below average. multiple channels in shown as overblown SD instead of HD including NBC channels which is significant because (A) hundreds of people working the Games in NY for NBC were staying at the hotel and (B) when I called Guest Services early into my stay I was told by both Marisal (7/28) and Joe (8/1) that someone from Engineering would be getting back to me but no one did until I called again on 8/4. and I called Joe because Marisal never called back thoguh she said she would. The channel guides are also off with some channels mislabelled.

title: You should stay here
comment: The facilities are well kept and attractive and the staff has always been courteous and helpful. We have stayed at this Belvoir many times, and each experience has been very good, which is why we return there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms will not cool adequately for guest suffering allergies. You'll find yourself "Sleepless in Birmngham."
title: No cool rooms!
comment: Room was hot and would not cool off.

title: New Orleans stay
comment: the hotel was unde construction and was a bit congested.

title: Convenience and comfort
comment: This is a super convenient and comfortable hotel. Great location for access to airport, downtown, sea world, beaches and the water. Hotel has all the intrinsics....pools, gyms, club lounge, marina and water sports, shuttles. Two areas of opportunity--the food is overpriced and of an underwhelming quality and taste; and the hotel seems short staffed all around, particularly restaurants and club lounge.

title: Room 201
comment: We were in room 201 for our recent stay in your hotel, it was quite the disappointment. My children and I saved for this trip for quite some time, and I purposely picked a hotel that was touted as nicer. Our room was constantly damp- so much so that the sheets were damp enough to make my daughters nightclothes damp as well. The cleaning staff came to our room while we were at Hershey, turned off our air, left the damp sheets on the bed and left a dirty cleaning rag on the bed which I later brought to the front desk. We were given breakfast buffet the next morning on the hotel, which was nice, but a dirty room is a dirty room. I don't think we will come back.

title: Well above Expectations
comment: All I can say is that my wife and I will be back. the staff went out of there way to insure that we had everything we needed. everyone of the staff was friendly and helpful. I will recommend this resort to everyone that will listen.

title: Easy Access - Good Location
comment: Excellent location, great staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: inform the guests which end the pool is at for better room choice.
title: Good location to parks and Boardwalk
comment: We had a nice time this past weekend at the Dolphin. Our room was clean and ready when we arrived. Hotel staff was courteous and friendly. Our room was located in the East side and close to Boardwalk and the shuttle boat. However, a long walk to the pool area with grandparents and children, would like to have known that the West side is much closer to the pool area, prior to having room assigned. The jacuzzi steps behind the pool slide are slippery i suggest having that looked at. Nice stay and we would recommend to friends and family.

title: Best Beds!
comment: This hotel was great. We were here for a wedding. The shuttle service to the reception was great. The beds and pillows were the most comfortable we have ever slept on. We would return just for the good nights sleep.

title: I love this hotel.
comment: This was by far the best hotel I have stayed in.

title: Everything was great, except....
comment: I called last minute and got a great room that met our needs - sleeping space for 5, hors d'oeuvres, beautiful pool, continental breakfast, but we saw a GIGANTIC roach in our room. Luckily, one of the girls I was staying with lives in Central America and is used to squishing all sorts of nasty bugs, because the rest of us couldn't handle it. I would recommend that staff do some extermination before I'd come back.

title: Recognition
comment: not comfort hotel and stuff not helping.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is as friendly and helpful as it is beautiful
title: this hotel was friendly and clean
comment: the accomodations were generous, clean, and very comfortable. The staff was very

everyoneShouldKnow: Short walk to the baseball stadium
title: Extra Mile
comment: Whenever we made a special request, the staff was eager to help and fulfill that request.

title: NYC Ironman Stay
comment: Everything great except when it came time to check out - very unorganized

title: Decent hotel, great service
comment: This was my first stay at the Hershey Belvoir. I have been a BPG Platinum member for many years and have stayed at many Belvoir properties. While the property is not comparable to some of the newer hotels (esp. with one of the elevators not working), they made it up in service. The front desk staff was courteous and welcoming. The restaurant staff did a phenomenal job despite a very busy breakfast crowd.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Room decor and comfort and how beautful the Hotel is structure
title: Presentation
comment: I highly recommend this Hotel. From it's decor in the lobby and in the rooms. The service you get is treated well.

title: honesty of staff
comment: I was a guest at your hotel on 8/6 with Delta Airlines. We are new to your hotel and as a flight attendant who has stayed in San Antonio for years, I am very glad to be staying at your beautiful establishment. After 26 years of flying I have never left anything behind in my room. This was not the case for my stay with you as I left my I-pad on the desk. I didn't realize it until I got home later that evening. You can imagine my anxiousness. I immediately called the hotel and was transferred to loss prevention. I spoke to Joseph and to my surprise he told me it had been turned in by housekeeper Rachel. I couldn't believe it! He told me to call his boss, Jimmy, the next morning to make arrangements for its return. When I spoke to Jimmy the next morning he was so gracious and told me how things like this were normally handled. He shipped it overnight to my home and I received it the next morning. I can not thank everyone involved enough, especially Rachel. Her honesty and integrity is something I don't see very often in my line of work! I have told this story to many of my friends and co-workers and everyone has the same shocked look on their face as I did when Joseph told me he had my I-pad. Please except my sincere thanks to everyone involved. I hope to come back soon and thank them all in person.

title: this hotel is close to route access
comment: nice place to stay.........

everyoneShouldKnow: A feeling of being served by everyone
title: Everything in one place and close to shops
comment: Initially, we were not happy with an issue with number of beds in the room. Wanted 2 double and received king and roll in bed. It was not clear on reservation that 2 guests in a room meant king. In fact, I am pretty sure that I specified 2 doubles as I have with 10 other hotels this summer. However, this is not clear on the reservation either. Some of the issue might be in translation as this was a block of rooms for the Stanford Baseball Camp. Regardless, your staff was very patient with a fairly aggressive tone by me initially (apologies for that) and the roll in bed was surprisingly comfortable. My son and I had a great stay and we would recommend your hotel to anyone.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is great! Location is quite convenient.
title: Staff was exceptional!
comment: This hotel was conveniently located to everything in downtown Indy and within walking distance of everything we wanted to do. The staff in the Club Lounge (especially Katie) was fantastic and made us feel right at home and catered to our every need.

title: Great Hotel, BUT...beware extras cost (WiFi, parking, fridge)
comment: Enjoyed our stay and convenience of the ferry access. It is all the extras that catch you on the overall cost of your stay; WIFI, Parking ($25.00 p/day) and Fridge ($25.00).

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic beach. Bring snorkeling gear as rental can quickly add up.
title: Fabulous beach hotel
comment: This is a well-kept hotel with a fantastic location. We had a room with pool and partial water view close to dining areas, etc.

title: Awesome beds
comment: Loved the bed! Soft and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Everything and everyone will do all they can to make your stay enjoyable.
title: Great Location
comment: If you are looking for a hotel near Hershey Park, this is the one.

title: Not a family environment
comment: Noise level was unacceptable. I finally had to call security around 4:30am to report the running up and down the hall, banging on doors, slamming doors and all the yelling. Apparently the hotel allows underage or very young adults without supervision. Why would you put these customers on the same floor with a family?

title: Great Stay ... great rate
comment: We tood the opportunity to stop at the Belvoir Stamford on the way up into New Hampshire and found it a great place to stop along the way (and possibly return to in the future). We also took advantage of a excellent weekend rate.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to outlets and short walk to boardwalk and casinos.
title: Excellent and convenient hotel..
comment: VERY clean and convenient

everyoneShouldKnow: location great, very clean, and nice bedding
title: Tool care of all our needs
comment: Very friendly staff and excellent facility

title: recent visit
comment: service staff in club room was friendly and helpful.

title: Vacation oasis
comment: The Belvoir on Waikiki is an oasis for me and my wife . We have found the hospitality, is second to none. This year we have a family group of eight, and they all think the same way.

title: great location to enjoy chicago
comment: overall this is a great place to use as a home base to enjoy Chicago

title: Moore/Yuille Reunion 2012
comment: We would like to sincerely thank you all for your Hospitality for our reunion. You all helped to make our reunion stay a very pleasent one,

everyoneShouldKnow: provides everything you would want in a hotel
title: Belvoir Universal
comment: Our family vacation to Universal Studios was greatly enhanced by our stay at the Belvoir. Staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was beautiful. Enjoyed our time in the hotel pool, spa and fitness center. Excellent stay!

title: Terrific Hotel. Great Staff and Ammentities. Great location.
comment: Great location. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and we loved the fitness center. Thanks.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pay for wi-fi if you want to use it in your room.
title: Fabulous!
comment: Beautiful hotel! I was very pleased with the staff's courtesy. We arrived very early and the hotel was able to accommodate for us earlier than expected. The room was very spacious and clean. It was very nice to have 2 seperate rooms, one for sleeping and the other for eating and relaxing. It was nice to have 2 TVs also. The pool was beautiful and clean. I love the interior of the hotel with the waterfall and the fish and turtles. The housekeeping was great and kept our room clean and freash towels daily during our 5 day stay. I was very impressed with the discount offered if you pre-pay also, it made my whole vacation extremely affordable. I was a little unhappy that you have to pay for wi-fi however the hotel offered computers and a printer at no charge which was very handy when I wanted to print out coupons for attractions I was going to. I was very impressed with the hotel as a whole and I will plan on returning in the future as well as recommending it to others.

title: Great Staff!
comment: Hotel was great overall and, in particular, the manager and staff of Chops Steakhouse was absolutely first rate! I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Incredible view
comment: This hotel has an incedible view that stretches all over San Diego city and beyond. The rooms are very large and service was fabulous. Location wonderful for walking downtown.

title: This hotel is great!
comment: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The room overlooking the pool was GREAT! The breakfast buffet was AWESOME! The hotel was in a great location for our sight seeing tours. The staff was always polite and greeted us with a smile. The night of our banquet the staff was great and the food was delicious. The Atlanta Belvoir was a great choice for our family reunion!

title: Good, but not a fan of BPG
comment: Have been very satisfied staying with Grandbourne hotels, but can't stand the points program. They choose to penalize me for booking through Expedia. Guess I would rather book through Expedia than get BPG recognition, but it doesn't make me any less bitter...

everyoneShouldKnow: its a nice get away for some one living new york city just for the night or weekend its near and its feels like your far away
title: the view from the window is the best
comment: the hotel is very nice the service is great and fast when you arive the rooms with view to the front makes the stay feel your on a airplane looking at niagre falls

title: My stay at Tampa Belvoir
comment: The hotel is been renovated, so i had an opportunity to stay in a newly renovated room which is very nice. The room had beautiful furnitures with nice soft beds and pillows.

title: Great Conference site
comment: I was totally impressed by the hospitality and organization of the hotel in accommodating the conference that I attended. An outstanding weekend.

title: This hotel is convenient
comment: close to SeaWorld and downtown

title: Renovations iffy.....
comment: I stayed about 4 years ago and now just again. The rooms look very nice compared to before. I dropped something in the bathroom and saw under the counter.... the work was very shotty, rushed and not nice. This highlighted all the other details, paint splatters, wallpaper crooked,etc. Dont get me wrong, it looks great, just need a little attention while being done. Must have been rushed.

title: Great hotel, great staff
comment: Hotel is very nice and clean. Staff are very helpful to every need. I travel a lot for business and I must say the beds and pillows at this hotel are the most comfortable around.

title: Friendly staff! Nice room.
comment: Only issue was the very loud a/c that kept turning on and off throughout the night and woke me several times.

title: Love this place
comment: My family stayed in early Aug and had a wonderful time. the staff was helpful and the location was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: It smellsssss sooooooo good in the lobby!!! They have a fragrance machine in the lobby and it smells great!! I want one!
title: great staff buttttt
comment: the hallways were extremely HOT & HUMID...the elevators are old and scary - some of them not working properly....that definitely needs to be fixed!!! Other then that - LOVED IT!!!

title: expensive
comment: everything about this hotel was entirely too expensive. the food was way too high, the gift shop should carry the shine products.

title: Nice Location
comment: Very nice hotel in a good area with nice falls view highly recomended.

title: Nice hotel, but.....
comment: Very nice hotel and staff but the double room given to us was very small. A bit claustrophobic. Nothing like the pictures on the Internet. One of the staff, Drew, gave us really good service.

title: Hotel has awesome views and Great Staff!
comment: We loved our stay here. Everything was awesome from the staff to the views and the room itself. Although we never made it to the pool area because of the crowd, we enjoyed cocktails by the pool and went out to enjoy the beach instead which was GREAT! We definitely will be back and recommend this hotel to everyone!!

title: Belvoir West Des Moines
comment: Our stay at your hotel was excellent. The room exceeded our expectations; good value. The bed was most comfortable, the down oversized pillows very well received and the cleanliness superb. The staff was most helpful and directed us to a fine offsite restaurant and much more. We will return.

title: Great time and a beautiful place
comment: Would come back again in a heartbeat only exception was couldn't print our boarding passes because printer was down.

title: This hotel has some issues
comment: No hot water at 5:45am on a Sunday. Hotel staff unwilling to do anything other than a simple "sorry" from the night clerk watching over the desk. Very disappointed. There are less expensive accomodations in the area that have hot water service in the rooms.

title: Marina is Magic
comment: We've stayed for 8 straight years, there is a reason... the sights and sounds of the Marina. Dog friendly, babies welcome, WiFi, nice health club. Only negative is dirty, crumbling parking lot that needs resurfacing for last forever. Matters? Sure, gotta track thru the dirt into hotel. On balance very positive property, still hope they'll spend the $$ and clean up the mess.

title: Really enjoyed staying in this hotel
comment: sound insulation could be better in Bay Tower.

title: Had a great stay
comment: We really enjoyed our trip to Chicago. We were there for our anniversary and our room was upgraded and we received a complimentary breakfast, which was really good. We would definately stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: classy you didnt have a bunch of kids running around in the halls and lobby area .you could hardly tell that kids were there.
title: great nite sleep
comment: my stay was great the bed was so nice until we bought everything that we slept on from the Belvoir store..

title: Valet Service
comment: I was in town for a meeting and had valeted my car. I called down 15mins before I needed my car, expecting it to be there waiting for me. 1hr later my car finally arrived. I was late for my meeting. There was no sense of urgency from the staff to get my car. Also, the hotel promised to email me a copy of my receipt instead of placing it under the door (this was in an effort to be more "green"). I still have not received an email with my receipt.

title: good time
comment: We had a nice time, great location, rooms were very nice, beds comfortable and kids loved the pool.. just wish there was a refridgerator in the room..we have children so it would have been nice to have that, also wish there was free wifi

title: Belvoir Review
comment: Love the location, loved the hotel the staff was more tahn friendly. The only problem we had was the bartenders and waiters at pool were less then friendly.

title: Good off the strip stay
comment: My only gripe the shower tiles had mildew.

title: Nice oasis of the Highway
comment: This is a really nice place. Kinda of Pricey.. but really nice.

title: Pleasant visit in sunny Albuquerque
comment: A comfortable, pleasant hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Out of the way, difficult to get to, uninformed staff.
title: Totally uninformed front dest staff
comment: I called the hotel (twice) before my stay, to inquire about transportation from Union Station to the hotel. Both times, I was given wrong information, which resulted in my arriving later than expected. For my return, I was told that I should use the Supershuttle, which would cost "about $35." Not only would the desk not assist in making the reservation, but the actual cost would have been $85 -$90, and I was left scrambling again.

title: Enjoyed the Stay
comment: Hotel was great overall. The only bad thing I could say is about the squeaky front door of the hotel room. Other than that it was a great hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor Service. Room in poor condition.
title: Disappointed
comment: Poor Service... Room shaby. Bathroom not clean...

everyoneShouldKnow: Valet parking service is separate from the hotel which makes payment confusing.
title: AC in Room
comment: The ac unit in the room makes a very abrupt sound, that startles you while your sleeping. The thermostat is located just under the discharge, which means you have to adjust the ac down to compensate for the false cool reading.

title: great location
comment: For my families first vacation in years, we couldn't have chosen a better location. With a great view of downtown indianapolis we came home with great pictures for our album, not to mention the great food and drinks served in the bar and grill located in the lobby.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best Staff at a reasonably priced hotel. You could pay double and people would still not be this gracious.
title: Comfortable beds - great staff
comment: This is the second time we have stayed here since the first time was such a great experience. This time again the staff was exceptional. Only glitch was we reserved 2 double beds and when we got to the room it was 1 king. We switch rooms and got the LAST 2 double bed room. In the morning we could smell cigarette smoke in the bathroom (coming in from the ventilation system) - very strange. But slept great - the beds are awesome and the indoor/outdoor pool is great for the kids.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, centrally located in downtown Chicago and outstanding customer service!
title: Great Hotel and Outstanding Service!
comment: My stay in this hotel far exceeded my expectations. The hotel staff was exceptionally professional, friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The fitness center was also very well equipped. I would highly recommend the Chicago Belvoir Hotel and Towers. I am defintiely coming back to stay at this hotel the next time I'm in Chicago.

title: Great Hotel
comment: This hotel was beautiful. We stayed in a King Suite and it was lovely. However, we were not told that the pool was under construction when we checked in, and only found out after we changed into our suits and went to use it. If we had known ahead of time, it may have effected what hotel we stayed at. Also, The concierge was not aware that they recommended a restaurant that was closed for repairs, and we were not told that the local restaurants closed for lunch at 2:30 and did not re-open until 5.

title: Poor Representation
comment: My daughter is starting college in Tucson and I was hoping this could be my regular stay location since it is in town, and La Paloma is a little far away. Unfortunately, it was a miss and not a hit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice with a great location.
title: Showing her age.
comment: We adore the ASH. The rooms and lobby appeared a little worn. Both rooms we stayed in over the past two stays had carpet stains and shower drainage issues. I would stay at ASH again i'm just not sure how likely I would be to recommend ASH to someone else. Especially at high dollar peek season rates.

title: Amazing Hotel, Great Location!
comment: This hotel is so amazing and each and everytime we stay there, the experience gets better. We love the beds the most and we always sleep better than we do at home. We had our grown daughter with us this time and she loved it too! We will always stay here whenever we are in Arlington, no doubt about it!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great. Good for families & business travelers too.
title: Great Location
comment: Close to the navy pier yet walking distance of the mag mile too. Concierge desk was wondeful--Paula was a great help. THey also have a shuttle to the Horseshoe casino in Hammond, IN. From our window we could see the various tour boats ride by. Yet this hotel is quiet and not noisy at all. Everyone was so friendly and professional.

title: Great place to relax.
comment: Room was very comfortable with enough room to have a few guests - little footstools/automans were a good touch. Having 24-hour access to spa/pool was great! Extremely quiet given that location is at airport.

title: outstanding emplyees
comment: We have stayed there many times and rack visit gets better and better. The employees are outstanding. One in particular. The front desk clerk by the name of Taneka , I do believe thats her name. She mad our last vist just beautiful..

title: We'll be back
comment: What a great location - walking distance to so many attractions. The rooms were exceptionally clean. It looked like it had been recently renovated, everything was like new. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I didn't get a chance to take advantage of the pool but it looked very inviting as well. We enjoyed a drink at the Taste and although the bartender/waiter was very busy with a large wedding party we weren't ignored. I checked into hotels to stay while attending a concert at the Susquehanna Bank and this was the perfect place. We booked the Philly Overnight Pkg which included parking and the rate was still cheaper than a lot of other hotels. We will definitely be going back for a night of partying in Philly.

title: This hotel has a good location
comment: Enjoyable experience. Staff extremely friendly

title: This hotel has great rooms and space for family gatherings
comment: Great accommodations, safe environment, clean and spacious. Staff friendly and went out of their way to meet our needs. Location allowed us easy access to St. Louis attractions and it was easy for out-of-state commuters to move around the city, even without a GPS.

title: Hotel Service needs improvement
comment: I checked into the first room that had the shower broken...after a while they moved me into a different room which was next to the elevators and it was very noisy. During the checkout, they charged me more because of my new room.

everyoneShouldKnow: One thing is the pool(s), so many to choose from.
title: 15 years later, it was better
comment: About 15 years ago, I stayed at the Dolphin for free while my friend went to a convention there. I never forgot the trip and decided to pay for a stay there this year. Just a few of the perks: the great location to the parks, no driving anywhere, Starbucks in the room, the pools are amazing, cleanest and best room I've stayed in, firework show every night nearby. There's more, but find out for yourself. I hope to make this an annual trip.

title: Hotel has great features
comment: The Dolphin is a wonderful experience with its location, the amentities the hotel has are excellent. The restaurants are superior to other like propertities and other locations in Florida.

title: Fabulous Suite!
comment: Our room was beautiful and well maintained. Very comfortable as well!

title: Great Stay
comment: Fabulous location and cozy room

title: comfortable
comment: room was clean, large and the bed very comfortable

title: Great service, ammenities and location
comment: Perfect location for getting to local meetings and sites as well as getting on the highway. Walking distance to city hot spots - music, restaurants, sports. The service was helpful, friendly and accessible. Travelling on a mix of business and pleasure, the features of the hotel were perfect for professional purposes as well as for the family.

title: Staff needs help in hospitality
comment: Your staff was not the friendliest group of people. Chris at the front desk should think about a job as a mortitian. His people skills are not up to par. Everytime we asked for something we were told that their were three major events and no staff available. It seemed as if the entire facility was understaffed. It seemed as though the entire staff was overwhelmed. My family vacation should not suffer becuase your hotel is completely booked.

everyoneShouldKnow: The front desk is poorly trained.
title: Staff is not good
comment: I stayed in this hotel for two nights with my daughter. When we arrived, all seemed good. Hotel is pretty and clean. At 7:20 I realized that I had one pod, one creamer and one packet for coffee. I called the front desk and he told me "I'll see what I can do". I called back 30 minutes later and was told "I'll do my best". That is really not ok. I seank the one cup i could At 8:30 I cancelled my request and went out for coffee. When we came back the room was not cleaned, the bed was made, but the empty used coffee cup was on the nightstand. The bathroom was not clean either. That night I called the front desk at 10:30 and asked for extra towels and coffee again. The response was "I'll see what I can do". I asked if he could tell me what that meant and if the towels and coffee were coming and he said "ya know, I'm really busy". 45 minutes later they arrived. I am so disappointed. The hotel was packed with a family reunion. We were definitely treated like second class guests. I used 6000 points. In not happy at all.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location off of 101 Freeway. Located on water and close to wine tasting.
title: Exceptional stay in every facet!
comment: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay and would return anytime we are in the area. Exception service in the BPG Lounge on the 4th floor. Room was clean and comfortable. Manager was prompt and helpful when I called about a future group trip. A+

title: nice staffs
comment: the staff well accommodated our needs, and automatically upgraded our room from king deluxe to king suite without even asking them.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location - walking to sites and restaurants
title: Nice hotel
comment: Staff was good. The hotel was clean and in good shape in the rooms and public space. Bed was comfortable and AC worked great. There was some confusion on where the ice machines were located.

everyoneShouldKnow: PARKING. PARK ACROSS THE STREET MUCH CHEAPER
title: ELEVATOR PROBLEMS
comment: GREAT LOCATION BUT ELEVATORS WERE TERRIBLE. GUEST SERVICES WERE NOT VERY HELPFUL. NO CLUB LEVEL LOUNGE

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel staff seem very quick to make amends by providing little "rewards" for hotel shortcomings (e.g. free breakfast when the TV remote stopped working)
title: Hot and cold
comment: The cold water in the sink never really got very cold, and the tap in the tub was labelled backwards. Took cold showers until I figured it out! Bonus for guests was leftover garbage in one of the drawers.

title: Know All The Hidden Costs
comment: Whenever anyone may be looking to comparing the total costs of staying at a hotel, be sure to know about this Belvoir: No refrigerator, but there is a stocked 'charge per item' refrigerator in the room ($9.00 for a liter of water); Internet charges $12 or $18 per night depending on speed; $15 continental breakfast (very poor quality); and expensive "self-park" charges. The room had a spectaular view, but the carpet has significant stains. The bed was very comfortable with a good variety of pillows. Nothing special about the complementary soaps, shampoos, etc. My recommendation: carefully evaluate all the micro-charges that can significantly increase the 'per-night' charge for this hotel.

title: Quiet and Comfortable.
comment: Very comfortable...loved the king bed and bedding. We were lucky enough to get a room at the end of the hall....very quiet..nice view off the balcony. We will come again.

title: Good f eatures
comment: Great hotel. Only issue is highway noise.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a nice hotel with nice facilities. Poor lighting; long wait in line; need constant reminding
title: staffing
comment: This hotel definitely needs more front desk staffing and a better door key system. Our keys needed to be redone everyday. Waiting in the long lines was a waste of time and frustrating. Also with 4 in the room one would think the housekeeping would put in extra towels and cups. No. had to constantly ask. We did leave daily tips and still poor service.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a bussiness hotel so there is always much movement and activities in the lobby
title: Overall Excellence
comment: This hotel is well located so that Broadway and many more dynamic areas of NYC can be accessed readily. We walked to most places of interest.

title: Staff very friendly and professional
comment: Front desk staff were very helpful. Not realizing it was Key West's mini-lobster fest weekend, it was so refreshing when staff assisted in finding the best rate for me and a lovely suite for a tired/exhausted walk-in at 9pm after flying that morning from New York and driving to the Keys from Ft. Lauderdale. The suite, with a huge walk-in shower, plush towels, pristine bed linens and 2 TV's was absolutely heavenly. Breakfast menu selections and attentiveness of the wait staff resulted in an elegant start to a great day!

everyoneShouldKnow: $9.95 per day for wi-fi service. Rediculous
title: No bang for the buck
comment: Reasons I will never stay at a Sheaton again: $9.95 wi-fi fee, $4.00 water for my enjoyment, no refrigerator in room, no microwave in room, no free breakfast, $1.00 phone calls. TV was nice, Bed and linens were very nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location to French Quarter & Bourbon Street
title: Great location
comment: I stayed at this hotel to attend the Arena Bowl football game. Hotel is under renovation so ask for a renovated room. My only issues were that the bathroom had only been tidied up, not cleaned, you could see water marks, etc on the vanity. Don't think that the carpet in the room had been vacuumed either because there were some white paint chip looking items on the carpet. Overall though the staff was great, room was very nice, bed was super comfortable, room stayed cool and was quiet. The hotel is only 3 blocks from Bourbon Street 1 direction and about 3 blocks to Harrah's the other direction and it across the street from the French Quarter. I would stay at this hotel again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure you get the rooms you reserved when you check in!
title: Horrible Experience!
comment: I reserved two Traditional Bay Tower rooms for a weekend so I could take my family to SeaWorld. We were coming in from Las Vegas and I knew we were going to be late so I called ahead to make sure they knew we would be arriving late. We arrived around 2am and checked in at the Bay Tower. Juan at the front desk was very rude and told us that we would have to stay in the other tower (Marina Tower). We drove back over to the other tower and found our rooms after walking to the opposite side of the tower, outside and down some stairs. The rooms were filthy and extremely small. I would not have paid $50 to stay in these rooms called the 'Lanai Tower'. The doors were facing an open outdoor style hallway facing a dirty rundown parking lot with no type of security. Juan at the front desk did not even bother to give us any details about this room. We had 3 adults and 4 children and the rooms were too small to accommodate everyone as I specifically requested some roll away beds which were not available in this location. I tried to explain to the desk clerk that these were definitely not the rooms I reserved and they were unable to accommodate our needs. She did not seem to understand me and kept saying they had no availability and the rooms in the Bay Tower were EXACTLY the same. I do not understand how I could have a reservation and not be able to check in to the rooms I reserved. We ended up staying the night in these rooms and being moved the next day to the rooms I originally reserved. The rooms in the Bay Tower were much nicer, cleaner and larger so the fact that we kept being told they were the same is not true. I was upset over this entire experience and will not be staying here again. Also, if you are military or veteran, stay away! We paid for the rooms using military vouchers and I suspect that is why our rooms were downgraded! NOTE: We were comped breakfast and parking (both very overpriced!) after a long argument with the desk clerk at 2AM!

title: Best Staff EVER
comment: Jayson checked us in and set the tone from the start. He was awesome. My wife and I felt very special and welcome at the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pretty old and needs to be renovated.
title: Room unsatisfactory
comment: We requested a non- smoking room since my daughter and husband has asthma but we got a room that smells like cigarette smoke. We are not happy about it.

title: This hotel has great features
comment: family enjoyed pool and the downtown area

title: Hottest San Diego Week -- A/C Went Out
comment: We stayed on the 14th floor for 3 days in a suite that was clean. Aside from the popcorn ceilings, the suite was large and airy. There are no free power plugs near the desk area so working was challenging. While staying there, the A/C went out from noon on a Saturday until we left on Sunday afternoon. This is not necessarily a fault of the Belvoir, but it was miserable. We were comped breakfast but it was a rough night. San Diego is normally in the 70's but it was a humid 85-90 this weekend. I thought we were in Florida.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are some of the best in the business!!
title: Awesome!
comment: Everything about this hotel from the staff, to the room, location, and service is awesome. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to MB!

title: relaxing
comment: Our three days at Belvoir was satisfactory.

title: My stay
comment: Keep up the good work. I stayed on the club floor and the staff was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: All your needs will be addressed and accommodated and the beds are ridiculously comfortable. Ok, I said two things, I couldn't help it.
title: AWESOME!
comment: The Belvoir met ALL our needs. Including but not limited to the shuttle to Universal City Walk, and amenities. The entire staff was pleasant and professional. Great food and room service as well. I definitely would recommend staying at the Belvoir to family and friends. I'll be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Five Star quality hotel and very conveniently located
title: Five Star Hotel with Convenient location
comment: I travel extensively and appreciate a quality hotel when I uncover one. I own condos and am very particular about cleanliness and presentation and this hotel met all my requirements.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool and very comfortable beds. Easy location and access to internet and other technical services.
title: This hotel is great for the whole family
comment: The pool is clean and having lunch served there allows you to fully relax all day while the kids play. The rooms are immaculate and the staff is ready anytime to fill any need or fix any problem. Everyone, from room service, to bell man, to the manager on staff was absolutely helpful and very nice. Room service food was not the best....but the charge was taken off as it was not up to standards. Great location....highly recommended!

title: Another delightful stay, but...
comment: Housekeeping wasn't up to the usual standards. The balcony furniture were completely covered with black soot. I cleaned it myself. A couple of mornings tea bags weren't replaced. Also it would be nice if a regular black or English Breakfast was in the tea assortment. We did tip housekeeping everyday. Still, some of the nice touches we've seen in the past weren't happening. The pen wasn't replaced. Overall the room itself was cleaned properly. The refrigerator never got cool enough. The thermostat was tricky. Didn't shut itself on and off. We had to use the on/off switch. BPG check in was excellent. Joel is terrific. We love Swan and Dolpin and have stayed many times. We will be back, of course.

title: Nice Hotel
comment: The room was rather large and clean with a great view of the Charles River and Cambridge. The bathroom was somewhat small, but my stay was short. The staff were all very friendly. I would stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is great and very accomodating
title: The hotel and staff are great
comment: we had a great experience staying at this hotel. The staff was great and rooms were very clean and well appointed.

title: Hotel Stay
comment: We ate at the Fountain several times and loved the service, speed, and menu. Accessibility to Epcot and Hollywood Studios by boat was also a plus. We did have a chance to enjoy the pool but the area was very nicely done.

title: Bumpy at first
comment: At first, I was booked into a dirty room. When I advised the front desk, no apologies provided, she just put me into another less desirable room. I had to complain to her manager and they made good on the situation with a nice upgraded room for the probelms I was faced with. As a long standing BPG member, I still had to move rooms 3 times which should never happen.

title: Very nice hotel
comment: The staff were very friendly and helpful and the restaurant had great food. There was a shuttle that ran to the metro to make sightseeing much easier.

everyoneShouldKnow: Short walk to the convention center and lots of places to eat within walking distance.
title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: Great and memorable stay! Staff were all polite and helpful, even while trying to accommodate hundreds of people from the convention. The temperatures were 3 digits this week, extremely hot, but it was a pleasure returning to our room at the end of the day and crawling into that comfortable bed. My husband and I loved every minute of our stay! On our next visit to Phoenix, we will stay at the Belvoir!

title: Disappointed
comment: No parking unless you want to wait for valet. Parking lot is behind hotel and is packed. Took 20 minutes to check in. Long line at front desk. Fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, twice. Toilet paper roll was wet. Yuck! Staff was nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: The food is delicious and Catering Staff is excellent.
title: Enjoyed the Ft Worth aviance
comment: We chose the Belvoir Catering for our 40th Anniversary Celebration. We chose to stay at the hotel two nights but ran into snafus along the way that give us pause to want to return! The dinner was absolutely delightful and delicious! The hotel stay not so much! Our reservation was not combined as we were told it was (we made a special stop to combine our reservation with the one set up by our Catering Director). At check in we found that not to be the case and finding a King Suite was a challenge. The check-in staff was supposed to inform us of a Spa gift cert. that our children had provided for us. It was not. The fruit tray sent to our room with sparkling water bottles had no opener to open the bottles. No kleenex in the room. Housekeeping did not restock water bottles and lotion the 2nd morning. Our room AC was so loud we could not hear conversation, tv, or even the trains outside! And finally - to the decorator - the bed post of the lovely King bed is right in the middle of the tv screen when watching tv from the bed. To end on a positive note - Valet was outstanding! Our dinner was delightful. Catering & Events the star of this property.

everyoneShouldKnow: A great place and usually a great bargain
title: Great place; but if BPG Platinum, avoid the local amenity
comment: This is one of our first choices when staying in New Orleans--the location is perfect, and the facilities are nice (though the pool is ridiculously small). We decided to go with the local amenity as our BPG Platinum check in bonus instead of 500 points--it was supposed to be a gift packet of Abita beer and several other local delicacies. Sorry to sound haughty, but we really wanted this! After 2 days and 2 requests, we finally received a basket with a couple Hershey and granola bars, an overripe banana, and a couple of bags of Zapp's potato chips (the only local touch). Definitely go with the points!

title: Nice Staff
comment: Good location. Attentive staff. Housekeeping slightly lacking, Scum around edge of pool, not inviting.

everyoneShouldKnow: LB Bistro and Patisserie offers great quality food selection at breakfast plus great service.
title: Great Service at LB Bistro and Patisserie
comment: I recently stayed at the Belvoir Hotel and Towers in Chicago and would like to say that the service at LB Bistro and Patisserie was great. I would like to especially thank Tamding, Alex, and Sharaya at the LB Bistro and Pastisserie. In addition, the quality and food selection at the buffet was great. I stress the quality and the food selection as it was not just an ordinary breakfast buffet. Housekeeping also did a great job with cleaning my room. The only negative experience I had at the hotel was the fact that it took forever for guest services to answer their phone when I called at around 5 a.m. in the morning since I had an issue with the internet connection. No matter what time of day, guest services should still answer their phone when a guest is calling especially given the various time zones that a guest could potentially be from or working under.

title: August Trip
comment: Recommend adding Gold members to Club Level Access

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location. Rooms are nice, but small.
title: Wrong rooms- waited a long time for correction
comment: I was given a room with a King bed. I called the front desk. The woman said she would be "right up" with a key to a room with two queen beds. I waited twenty minutes and had to call again. She said she had a line of people and would call the maintenance man to bring me the key. There was a family with a handicapped child sitting on the floor in the non-airconditioned hallway that were promised their rooms were connected. The rooms were not connected. It took 20 minutes to get this corrected. The husband had to go back down to the desk to get the keys.

title: needs improvement
comment: The room did not have that clean feeling we all want. A light was burned out in the bathroom. The tissue box was re-stuffed with tissues from the previous box. The halls had dirty dishes outside the room doors when I checked in at 7pm and the same dishes were there the next morning when I checked out. Restrooms in the lobby area were not clean, and the cleaning cart was parked outside one for about 6 hours (we were there all day for a meeting). Overall, did not meet my expectations for a Belvoir.

title: Great Renovation
comment: The Staff at C/I was fast, courteus and very friendly. Rioom was awesome, clean, great view. Bedding was very comfy, slept wonderfully.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff really strives to make your stay enjoyable.
title: Great Stay
comment: I having nothing negative to say. We had a wonderful stay in a clean, comfortable room. The staff was exceptionally friendly, check in & check out were quick & the food in the restaurant was very good.

title: Wonderful
comment: We stayed here to attend a function at the Fairplex next door. Perfect location as there is a gate to walk through and you are there. Our room was spotless with a comfortable bed. The staff was remarkable. We are trying to think up a reason to go back.

title: Akron-Falls Belvoir is a great place to be or stay!
comment: In addition to a marvelous indoor pool, this Belvoir has Piatto Nuevo, an excellent restaurant with breathtaking views, an inviting Club Lounge on the Club Floor, and friendly, accommodating, hotel staff. We always look forward to returning here. We also had five family events here including significant reception birthday parties and wedding anniversary receptions for my parents - - 60th, 65th, and 70th anniversaries!

title: Needs Improvement
comment: Carpets were stained and room had a foul odor. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was clean. Stayed here for 1 night while waiting for a flight to New York. Staff was professional and accommodating.

title: Good rooms
comment: The room was very nice. We did not receive any benefit for being a gold member, as most other BPG hotels provide (Free wifi, drinks, etc.)

title: Great hotel
comment: We had an excellent experience at the hotel. Beds were very comfy, the service was very good, and it was in a great location.

everyoneShouldKnow: THE VIEW IS AMAZING! AND THE PEOPLE ARE GREAT!
title: ZENFUL!!
comment: THIS PLACE WAS AMAZING AND VERY COMFORTABLE. THE STAFF WAS VERY FRIENDLY AND THEY MET ALL OUR EXPECTATIONS. THERE STAFF WAS SO EASY TO TALK TO AND THEY WERE VERY ACCOMIDATING. THERE FOOD WAS EXVELLENT WE ATE THE RESTRAUNT ABOUT FOUR TIMES AND ALL FOUR TIMES IT WAS EVEN MORE IMPRESSIVE. THE VEIW IS UNBELIEVABLE AND THE POOL IS EVEN BETTER! VERY RELAXING WE CANNOT WAIT TO GET BACK ASAP!!

title: Wont be back
comment: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Belvoir San Diego 8/11-8/13/2012 and I must say I was very unsatisfied due to the following encounters:

everyoneShouldKnow: Always get a River View room which have balconies. City View rooms do not have balconies and the view is blocked by a huge tall glass/cement office building
title: Very good location on the River
comment: Very very disappointed in that I did not receive a River-View room since that is what I had made the reservation for at that rate (no adjustment was made on the rate). The check-in clerk (3am in the morning) was not very friendly and mumbled - - so we really didn't understand what he was saying. Looking out a window at a very tall glass and cement building wasn't very enjoyable. Although we did find that the Dining Room & Bar staff and day-time desk clerks were excellent.

title: Great Beach
comment: The beach is fantastic and the location of the hotel is very nice. Disappointing is that you have to pay extra for internet in the room, umbrellas at the beach and parking.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is recently remodeled and really nice. The staff is vary helpful and professional.
title: Amazing experience
comment: I love the hotel and the staff. The staff are extreemly well trained and attentive to your needs. The rooms are clean and a joy to be in. I love the hotel and the treatment .

title: parking issue
comment: Only problem I had with this hotel was the parking situation. Friends could not come in and out with out a key, other Grandbourne hotels do not charge them to come visit. Hotel is looking good with revamp, still alot to do, especially the elevators,

title: Grandbourne Quality
comment: I can't figure out why there were negative reviews of this hotel. The front desk staff were very cordial and accommodating when checking in as well as whenever I had any questions. My one complaint was with housekeeping. The rooms were very clean, however, instead of replacing the plastic cups in the bathroom, they rinsed one of them out and placed it back on the counter - that was bizzare. We also had an issue with Wi-Fi service, but once we reported the problem it was taken care of ASAP. Great customer service!! One last thing, I like the idea of if you choose not to use house-cleaning for a day, you can earn 500 BPG award points. That's great for folks that spend minimal time in their room. We enjoyed our stay and will continue to stay at Grandbourne properties whenever possible.

title: Very warm and helpful staff
comment: I was on a very demanding work schedule during my recent stay - 14-15 hour workdays. Throughout my stay all staff that I had contact with were very warm, helpful and competent. I got very sick due to bad food consumed elsewhere, and when I spoke with a concierge to find a place where I could get a very mild dinner she not only gave me good advice she decided to give me a credit against my bill for room service. This was unasked and unlooked for, but very much appreciated and indicative of their approach to service.

title: Location is its best feature
comment: The location is ideal for all of the parks, downtown, coronado...however, the hotel was a bit old and in need of remodeling. The bathrooms, in particular, were old and the wear and tear could not be hidden. They were not as clean as I would expect and the water had a bad smell like rotten eggs. Would recommend only because of the location.

everyoneShouldKnow: They will make sure you have a nice stay.
title: Great time
comment: Although the hotel was very busy with a golf tournament in town, we were treated like we were important guests. My daughter really enjoyed our trip to Charleston and the comfortable room we had to relax in. I did, too. "Thank you!" to the staff!

title: WIFI Unacceptable
comment: Most hotels and motels (even cheap ones) have free Internet connections, either ethernet or wifi. I was able sometimes to connect to the Belvoir Club free wifi, but not always. To pay $14.95 for one day of Internet is rediculous unless you are a business person with an unlimited expense account.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful lobby and grounds, nice rooms, good value.
title: Hotel is understaffed in summer
comment: Three things cause me to suspect that the Belvoir Crescent cuts way back on staff in summer when few visitors come to Phoenix:

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place to stay in Frisco, TX. Exceptional staff!
title: Very nice hotel with GREAT staff!
comment: My recent 4-night stay was very nice! Rooms were clean and comfortable. What made the stay excellent, though, was the front desk manager and his staff. They were outstanding!!!

title: Good location
comment: The hotel is in a good location; however, the pool is inadequate for the size of the hotel. The number of kids in the pool far surpassed the capacity and I was unable to swim during my visit. The room was OK but lacked a makeup mirror, and an extra chair.

title: 30 years later
comment: The thing that stands out here is stay at the tower , pool and beach are great and right out the door ! Spent our honeymoon here 30 years ago and went back First time in 30 years great time We will def. be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds are very comfortable and when I needed washcloths they were there in less than 5 minutes
title: wonderful hotel
