comment: My only complaints - small as they are - is that (1) starbucks closes at noon in the hotel and (2) the valet parking was 36.96 a day!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Everyone needs to have the breakfast at LB's restaurant on the lower level featuring an amazing variety of choices.
title: Awesome Hotel Stay
comment: We stayed here for a family leisure trip. The location is great as we were able to either take the bus, train or walk to the Navy Pier, Wrigley, Museum destinations. We had a great view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. The valets and bell hops were very welcoming. Cynthia at the Front Desk was very knowledgable and friendly. The housekeeping staff did a great job providing a clean room. The Club Level rooms are a must. The breakfast and service at the LB restaurant was outstanding.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms were not well cleaned...especially the bathrooms.
title: We were disappointed
comment: We recently stayed overnight at this hotel. The entry way was very nice and the staff was friendly upon arrival. However, the room was not good. The wall paper was starting to come off. I then went into the bathroom. It was gross. It had ground in dirt that had clearly built up for years. There were small hairs on the bathroom floor and the towel we requested never came. We were given 3 towels for 4 of us. Since I would never give my kids a bath in that tub I didn't worry about it. I am not a person with germ issues so it had to be really bad for me to feel this way. The beds on the other hand were very comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff goes out of their way to be helpful
title: This hotel is in a great location
comment: The hotel is in a great location. They have a shuttle service to and from the airport and if you need to go other places, they will accommodate you. The hotel staff was excellent and so was the service. My only complaint was that one elevator was not working and it was a real inconvenience. However, we were compensated for our discomfort. I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in the Syracuse area!

title: Very courteous
comment: You outdid yourselves! Very nice acomodatins, and clean!!! Loved the free water in the room! Lobby area with bar right there was very friendly and beautifully designed with the orchids, etc.

title: Comfort
comment: I stayed a night here because of my friend wedding reception.

title: Caring staff
comment: staff was very attentive to meeting my needs

everyoneShouldKnow: No handicap rooms close to the elevators. No handicap rooms with 2 full beds.
title: Lack of Disability Attention
comment: There are no handicap rooms on the first or second floor. They start on the third floor and far away from the elevator. They put us on the 7th floor furthest away from the elevators. All handicap rooms should be the close access point. Also there is a lack of signs showing where the pool is.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easiest way to get to the parking garage is turning right from Kuhio Ave. I always got a parking slot, but noticed on Saturday nights, the parking lot does get full after 8:00 pm.
title: Comfort & Central Location
comment: We were generously moved into a city view room w/a balcony (partial ocean view) and loved the room. The housekeeping staff were always on time and kept the room neat, clean & tidy! Lobby and pool area showed signs of age, but I still found it comfortable. Staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. There was an adjoining room with a door separating. The only thing I noticed that when the neighbors got loud, you could hear them. I'm sure they could here us as well! Happy to do a return stay. Also, I usually join 24 Hr Fitness for a week, but found that I could do my daily exercise regimen in the Fitness Center on the 2nd Floor. Would love to have more fitness gear (foam roller, yoga mats).

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very convenient to the Cobb Galleria and a number of restaurants at the Cumberland Mall.
title: Only in one night
comment: Slept well, did not want for anything, would stay there again

title: This hotel has several issues
comment: I stayed a weekend in August. There is limited air conditioning in the bar/restaurant area and no air conditioning in the elevators. This is not comfortable in Texas in the summer. Additionally, the wifi signal in my room was too weak to sustain a connection.

everyoneShouldKnow: They really try to make things right!!
title: The hotel made good on my concerns.
comment: In my previous review I mentioned the problem with ants and the condition of the sheets. I have talked to Erica and she was very helpful and accomodating. I would consider staying at the Belvoir Suites Akron/Cuyahoga Falls again

title: This hotel has great staff TEAM
comment: Checking in, dining in the restaurant and relaxing in the 27th floor lounge is always a great experience.

title: The a/c
comment: When we checked in there was flies everywhere. We came back to our room after the casino and the A/C was making laud noises that we could not get any sleep and since we got to our room at 3:00 am we did not want to call and complain

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, great view, with the Belvoir comforts!
title: Great location, great view, Belvoir comfort
comment: Very nice Belvoir; very convenient, clean and safe. Overall, a great weekend, in part because of the accommodations. This Belvoir was very nice, with 1 exception: Service in the bar. ~10pm 3 of us came in, asked if they served food; they did, they gave us some water, and they ignored us without providing any other menus or taking our order for ~30 min. (but they waited on people all around us)so we left and ordered room service.

title: Great Hotel
comment: My husband and I stayed last weekend at the Belvoir Society Hill and it was great!

title: review
comment: Old and tired hotel needs some big upgrades. It was an overall nice stay. The staff very friendly and helpful. The carpet was not vacuumed very well. Loved the view of the monument. VERY unclear how and where to get to the parking garage, especially with Ohio street closed during the weekend.

everyoneShouldKnow: The ease of getting around from this location.
title: Excellent Service
comment: I stay at the Belvoir Lincoln Harbor for 4 nights. Day one I was met by a doorman named Hector. He was very nice and very helpful in many ways, from food to transportation. All of the staff was always friendly and courteous. The price of the room was good and the location was excellent. I wouldnt hesitate to stay there again or recommend the hotel to anyone.

title: Great Staff!! Lovely Rooms.
comment: Your staff is very friendly and take great care of their guests.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff and management were very accommodating and friendly.
title: This hotel has a warm and cozy decor; and staff that is friendly and focused on great customer service
comment: The decor was modern and cozy; the staff was warm, welcoming and service-oriented, and the location to local dining and theme-attractions was great!

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy in and out fromt he highway and clean
title: Visiting Boston
comment: This Belvoir was clean with a very cheery professional staff. It is very well priced and easy to find. Getting in to Downtown is also easy using I-90.

everyoneShouldKnow: The self parking is really winding driving up. Try to find street parking if you can. Cheaper.
title: Concierge
comment: Mitch, who was the concierge on duty at that time, was very nice and helpful. Made our checking in very smooth and easy.

title: in its day!
comment: in its day i am sure this was a nice Hotel but the carpets were dirty the rooms are dated and i felt the charging for the use of a microwave (15$) was in poor taste my stay just did not meet the quality of the price being charged!

title: Enjoyed our stay
comment: We have stayed at this hotel several times. Enjoyed our stay; the staff was welcoming and professional. Best hotel in the area.

title: Parking problem
comment: While the room, service and facilities were outstanding you have a serious parking problem. You should have adequate parking spots for guests especially when you charge $15.00 per night. This is the third time we stayed at the Dolphin this year and we had problems finding a parking space every time.

title: service was outstanding
comment: Service was outstanding and staff's attitude was great.

title: Great hotel - loved all the amenities
comment: Great experience. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Would stay there again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Bring your own soap, and don't expect wifi to work. Bathrooms could use some work (electrical outlet in bathroom wasn't secured to the wall, and rate card on back of bathroom door had slide down the door).
title: Great people
comment: Everyone is very nice, especially Courtney and Travis at the front desk, and Janice, Trish, and Andrew at 21111. Now the bad - WiFi didn't work for 3 days. Housekeeping expects those little bars of soap to last you 2 days, how cheap is that?

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel has a nice family feel.
title: Nice hotel with a good location
comment: This was our second stay at the Dolphin. The hotel is large, informal and close to the Boardwalk so that you can walk over to the stores in the area and/or to watch the Epcot fireworks at night. The staff is pleasant and helpful.

title: Great Location
comment: The Belvoir Society Hill in Philadelphia is just a few short blocks away from Old Town, Liberty Park and many of the tourist sights.

title: Good Location/ near Seaworld & Zoo
comment: This Hotel has age to it. Small bathrooms,water damage to shower ceiling causing paint to peel off. Ice machines work on some floors. Staff cordial and helpful. Bartender unfriendly and has no pesonality. Wish I got his name.

title: Please work on
comment: The refrigerator froze everything in it. Not good. Please train your restaurant staff to be more polite. Have your restaurant open more.

title: Hotel has great front door staff and main desk staff
comment: The Hotel had a positive fibe to it that went well with the wedding group I was with.

title: THE HOTEL HAS GREAT FEATUES
comment: These was my second stay at the hotel. First the room was bigger then my first stay and I was so delighted. Second I had a great view to my left I had the lake and to my right was the river ,how cool is that. In my stay I was issued coupons for the bistro brunch and food and service was good. I enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The infinity pool and great lobby
title: Great areas
comment: Love it!! Excellent pool area and Great nightlife at lobby.

title: Relaxation at the beach!
comment: Great hotel on the beach, minutes from fun activities. Great staff!

title: Excellent Staff
comment: The hotel staff was very courteous and friendly. After we checked out we went to Sesame for the day. Unfortunately the weather got bad and we returned to the hotel to change. The staff was great and gave us our room to shower and change

title: This hotel has great features
comment: It is conveniently located, near the beach and restaurants. Club benefits are outstanding.

title: Great Location
comment: The #1 best things was the location. Easy to walk to everything.

title: Poorly Maintained
comment: There is a laundry list of issues with this hotel - The ice machine on our floor was broken. We called it in to the Front Desk, but it was never fixed by the time we left. The TV operated erratically, with at least one channel missing audio. The pool was over-chlorinated. The general cleanliness of the hotel was lacking. The bed was WAY too soft and the pillows were a joke. Hot tub was unavailable. All of the above reflects poor management.

title: Great hotel
comment: The fitness center should have some sort of water to drink after a workout

everyoneShouldKnow: It is an overall great value.
title: Pleasantly Surprised
comment: Great value for the price. Very comfortable beds and friendly staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice facility and very friendly, helpful staff.
title: Conference stay
comment: Everything and everyone was great at the hotel except for the staff in the "M" bar. After an evening function on Saturday night that ended at 10pm, several of the patrons went to the bar. The service was not friendly or efficient. The employees seemed to be more concerned with cleaning up rather than waiting on the 20 patrons that were there, including the president of the large organization that was there.

everyoneShouldKnow: I stay here all the time!
title: Great place to stay
comment: The staff is professional and service oriented.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location next to the airport
title: Great Location and Comfort
comment: The hotel is just accross the airport, and next to the metrorail station, if you don' have a car there. The golf course surrounding the hotel gives it a nice landscape and view. A reasonable fitness center for a hotel and very comfortable rooms. It should add more cable TV channels.

title: After the lobby everything is down hill !!!
comment: Elevator broken, whirpool broken, dirty, needs a total rehab.

title: We enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir.
comment: We are a family of four and traveled with our family dog and the stay at the Belvoir was enjoyable. We were in a Deluxe Queen Oceanfront and the room was clean, a little tight and very expensive. We received the AAA discount and the room rate was still high.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Management & Staff. Location Location Location
title: Outstanding stay at this Belvoir
comment: Management and staff at this Belvoir are outstanding. So much so that we stayed over a second night rather than moving to another reservation we had at a neighboring property. We also had the opportunity to dine on property and that was a great experience as well. Concierge was attentive and made several very helpful suggestions beyond my original request. This property is now at the top of my list when in LA.

title: COLD WATER
comment: Was given a handicapped room when reservation was guaranteed for a king. Room was clean but queen bed. Cold water in the shower and sink. Place looks very nice but isn't. Will choose other Grandbourne properties on my upcoming visits to NYC.

everyoneShouldKnow: very convenient for visits to University of Iowa.
title: This hotel is great and very convenient.
comment: Hotel is on campus of university of Iowa and met all of our needs when moving our son in to the school. Everything was in walking distance for us and the surrounding area is beauiful.

title: excellent
comment: room is comfortable and people on the desk are very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not easy to get to from Illinois
title: room reservations
comment: There was confusion about the rooms reservations. My niece kept being told that she had no rooms. I was paying for four rooms . Three of these rooms were under her name and three months before the wedding she was told there were no rooms for the wedding party. The original reservations were made in April. Improve the reservations procedure and have all reservations in the computer.

title: great people
comment: I called late in the day for a reservation & got one immediately. The room was great, people were great. Dinner was average but the waitress was great. Would definitely return.

everyoneShouldKnow: Shower/bathtub controller pulls away from the wall for pressure.
title: An enjoyable stay
comment: Stayed at this hotel while attending a conference at another hotel. I was able to have a ride (for fee) available every morning. The facilities are very good. Best work out gym I have ever seen at a hotel. Pool area is great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very helpful! Hotel is very clean, and consistant.
title: This Hotel is Wonderful!!!
comment: We stay at this hotel every time we are in Town. We are from this area, and prefer staying here than with family. The staff is so attentive and friendly.

title: Flushing"s Chinatown
comment: Nice hotel with Asian decor. Comfortable bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The overall ambiance and view is amazing
title: The hotel was better than I expected!
comment: I never stayed at this property before and I wasn't sure what to expect and everything from the check-in, to the restaurant, to the valet and all around was excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: no microwave nor refrig. in room
title: This hotel was not what we were expecting
comment: This hotel room was very small to sd that i was up graded , no microwave nor refrig. in the room. My bath tub was filled with water in it. was not very impress with the over nite stayed.Did a bad choice when i switched from another hotel .

title: Great Hotel
comment: My family and I stayed in one of the one room suites just as a family weekend get away, and the room was great, I loved the kitchen, we were able to bring in our own food and keep our costs down. Great family weekend!

everyoneShouldKnow: Service provided by ALL of the friendly, professional staff was exceptional.
title: Service
comment: Excellent service - beyond my expectations.

title: you will love this place
comment: We booked for 4 nights and decided to stay 8 nights.

everyoneShouldKnow: Right across from airport, can be loud
title: Our stay
comment: Reserved a deluxe room, arrived went to room on 12th floor, it wasn't cleaned. Returned to lobby, all deluxe rooms were gone. We were then given a room on lower floor. We were given a lower rate and free breakfast for our stay. We were satisfied. Rooms felt moist the whole stay. Didn't care for the self-parking. Very far and dirt lot. Overall staff was kind and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff will make your stay special.
title: I cannot wait to go back!
comment: I have not experienced a state of relaxation like what I experienced during my stay at this resort in quite some time. The staff was courteous and professional, and the facility is very well maintained. I do hope the menu is expanded to allow for more food choices. Thank you to all staff members for making our anniversary special and memorable! SEE YOU SOON!

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not park your car at the hotel
title: Excellent stay except for parking rates
comment: Our room had a gorgeous view of the city. Everything was excellent except for the outrageous parking rates of $39 overnight. The hotel should offer a discount for those who are staying in the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is close to the water/
title: We Will Return!
comment: We loved the price, view, location and the room. We enjoyed some time by the pool as well as just sitting in the room and watching the bay. The location was easy to get to local attractions and shopping.

title: Great resort with a perfect location
comment: If you're looking for the perfect Clearwater location this is it. Unfortunately it's a very popular hotel and is typically very crowded. Also the management seems to have little interest in taking care of Gold/Platinum level guests. Club level and suite upgrades are extremely rare. Even when available I was told I would have to pay more which is rather disappointing.

title: Excellent hotel with a very nice staff.
comment: I just finished a one night stay at this hotel and was very impressed.

title: dolphin
comment: Great elevator, but rooms were dated and not in the best repair. Although we were leaving our room early in the AM, upon returning @ 3:30, the room had still not been cleaned!!

title: Excellent Location
comment: Excellent location. Close to most tourist attractions. Staff is caring and friendly.

title: This hotel is in a great location
comment: My family and I stayed here to attend a Red Sox game. The rooms are large and very comfortable, and the hotel's location is excellent. Walked to Fenway Park and local eateries, and loved the skywalk access to other hotels and shopping.

title: Good hotel - recommended
comment: When I was booking this hotel stay, I had 3 MUSTs which I was looking for: 1 - Near MIA; 2 - Good price; 3 - Nice hotel.

title: Love the location
comment: We love staying here but the room was disappointing as the staff did not recognize us as gold card members.

title: Excellent room/excellent stay!
comment: excellent room, penthouse was really nice!!! Pet friendly a plus!!!

title: Excellent front desk member at check-in
comment: Stayed at many hotels and found the girl at the front desk who checked in myself and my family to be the best. We will be back to your hotel. Pool and fitness center were perfect.

everyoneShouldKnow: No amenities in room, you must pay an extra $20 for any standard amenities.
title: The Worst!!!
comment: I did not enjoy my stay here. The front desk staff did not treat me like a welcome guest, matter of fact I was treated like my service was not wanted or welcome even though I am a BPG member.

title: Belvoir long island
comment: when you check in,get Anuj or samatha or dean

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have a hunch it could be sold out the night you're considering staying there, then don't stay there.
title: Gold benefits? What Gold benefits?
comment: I arrived at 3:40 pm for any check-in time allowed from 3 pm on, only to find they didn't have a room ready for me. When they did get a room ready, it did not even have a complimentary bottled water, much less other amenities for BPG Gold, typically Club access (even if the room isn't in the Club level) and/or the guest's choice of at least 1 among 250 bonus Starpoints, complimentary Internet, or a complimentary drink from the bar. Further, the lever for switching between the tub faucet and shower head was missing / broken off. Compensation to me after multiple contacts was 500 Starpoints. I have previously received an order of magnitude more compensation for much less significant issues.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent accomodations and wait staff that goes beyond your expectations.
title: Staff
comment: I have never encountered such a professional and courteous staff that this hotel provided. They were simply awesome. They simply could not do enough for you. Your drink was always full, your questions were answered promptly and with a smile all the time.

title: Very clean with a great location.
comment: Having stayed the first time for a week in

title: Average
comment: I booked online with a specific rate and was charged a rate $40 higher at checkout. It was adjusted, but no apologies. I made the "green choice" and did not get housekeeping for 500 BPG points. I asked two people to make sure they were posted, but did not get them. I was not recognized as a "Gold" BPG member. Rooms are average and a bit small. Shula's is expensive and the other restaurants are not open for dinner. View from room window and lobby were the best parts of my stay, but no one went out of their way to make this stay memorable.

title: Husbands 50th B day
comment: I made a reservation for a suite for my Husbands 50th birthday. I marked our arrival time as 2 pm. We arrived at 3:50 and were told our room was not ready. it would be 30 minutes and we could have a complimentary drink in the bar while we waited. Our room was not ready until 5pm. When we got in our room, the AC did not work, did not even turn on. it was a 100 degree day. Overall we wasted over an hour and a half waiting for our room to be ready and a maint. man. not a great start for his 50th B-day. Upon checking out, we called for a bellman and was told one was not available as he was on a shuttle run. We took our own bags, only to find out one elevator was not working! It took 45 minutes to make 2 trips in a very hot and crowded elevator, stopping on every floor. This was our 2nd poor visit and do not think my husband will want to return.

title: Fotis fantastic manager
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir and got married across the street on the beach at sunset, from the time we arrived at the hotel Fotis took care on us and made sure our stay was perfect, right down to the pretty towel swans and flowers.Just cant say enough about Fotis and the whole staff at the Belvoir,our wedding was on Aug.9, so if you're looking to stay at a great hotel in Key West for your wedding, honeymoon or just a vacation this is the place to stay, thanks again to everyone there for taking great care on us, Mr &Mrs Schultz Chicago, Illinois

title: Solid hotel - Club room not worth upgrade price
comment: Likes - Compared to other hotels near downtown SD, this has the best price. Large pool and jacuzzi. Staff friendly and happy. Initial check-in pleasant.

title: Home Away from Home
comment: The hotel staff is excellent. The rooms are very comfortable. The cafeteria serves hot, good tasting food. But a little pricey. Location is great. A home away from home.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and staff. Clean and nuetral decor.
title: Very nice Hotel
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir while visiting the Boston, Newport areas. We were very happy with the hotel and the staff. We were given a room on the club level which is a very nice upgrade at no additional charge. We were traveling with two eleven year olds and they are always hungry or thirsty. The club room was always stocked with drinks and snacks. Breakfasts were always good, and evening snacks were yummy. Wednesday they offered adult beverages at No Charge, what a nice feature.The hotel is in a great location, 45 min. from Newport and I think about an hour or so from Boston. We would definatly stay there again.

title: Very humid rooms
comment: With AC on and patio door shut, the room was very humid, which caused towels to remain damp overnight. Even bed covers and bed sheets were damp.

title: A surprise in St. Louis
comment: This property was a pleasant surprise from location, to room comfort, to food, service and overall ambiance.

title: Location and service was great!
comment: Location was perfect. The shuttle can bring you to the metro at 30min intervals. So going to DC was not a problem. However during our stay, the shuttle was late a few times.

title: Bathroom a disapointment
comment: Room was comfortable but the bathroom was way too small and the plumbing stopped working; sink, tub & toilet two hours before a scheduled wedding at the hotel we were attending. We had to use a friend's room to get ready for the wedding. It took the maintenance person several hours to restore functionality to the plumbing as the blockage was in the hotel plumbing system and not originating in our room. Paid a nightly rate way too high for the inconvienence and way too small bathroom.

title: worst Belvoir i've ever stayed at
comment: the hotel should warn guests before accepting reservations about the railroad, the room i was in was right next to the railroad ... the train came through at least three or four times during the night, 11p, 1a, 3, 5 ... each time the horn was blowing - absolutely the worst hotel experience i have ever had

title: good hotel - average restaurant
comment: We stayed one night on the way through town. The hotel was just as expected. Nice walk down to King Street. Front desk was very helpful in giving directions, etc. Room was very clean and quiet. I love the Belvoir Suite floor plan when travelling with kids. Restaurant staff was aloof - almost rude. We showed up at 2 minutes until 7, and they almost wouldn't seat us, as they weren't open for 2 more minutes. Then they almost acted annoyed that we were not going to do the buffet. The food was good, but the service was less than "Grandbourne" - and good luck if you want to eat early and hit the road I would totally stay here again - but I would grab a pastry on King Street the night before and eat it in my room.

everyoneShouldKnow: AN EXCELLNT LOCATION TO KENNEBUNK PORT
title: :LOCATION & STAFF ARE EXCELLENT
comment: WE ENJOYED THE CONVENIENCE TO

everyoneShouldKnow: Never stay there unless new management is installed.
title: Worst experiance in my life
comment: I have been an owner for over 10 years. I never in my life been treated like I have been in this resort. Dirt and dust on unit, wild animals destroying garbage and it is left there all night to the morning. Bad counter person that checked me in. Problems with the shuttle service. Just to name a few. Some people did try to help. Unfortunately I am not going to give up the remaining days I was there to talk to them instead of enjoying my time with my kids. I lost 1 day already because of them.

title: Good downtown
comment: Hotel is in the middle of the downtown. Very convenient walk to hopping and attractions.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service and amenities are outstanding.
title: Excellent accomodations for mobility impaired guests
comment: I had the pleasure of an 8 day stay at the Dolphin in July, 2012 and was accompanied by my service dog. Facilities were comfortable and accessible and the area for my dog to relieve himself was easily accessed. Hotel, restaurant and shop staff were very kind and experienced with guests traveling with service dogs. When I requested a shower chair and handheld shower head, my needs were met within minutes by courteous and professional staff. I look forward to returning next year to attend the annual conference and enjoy the beautiful and comfortable amenities of this outstanding property.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location for major venues in arlington
title: poor condition and service lacks TLC
comment: Overall the hotel is in need of some general upkeep. At my conference this was voiced by several.

title: Beautiful views
comment: Excellent location, close to airport, Harbor Drive, downtown and Gaslamp Quarter. We had a bay view in the second tower, which had amazing views of the SD skyline and Coronado Bridge.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't take your reservation for granted. Follow up on everything involving you credit card use here.
title: Excellent Stay BUT
comment: The rooms were comfortable and service from staff was great but I didn't wish to have twice my actual bill charged to my credit cards. As of today (8/18/12)I am still waiting for the return of the excess charges. Too bad that you can't refund overcharges as quick as you charge for services.

title: Staff was wonderful!
comment: Thank you to the staff of Read House Hotel in Chattanooga for making things easy for me, a grandmother traveling with 5 grandchildren. From my first phone call you were attentive and provided excellent personal attention. Unlike your competitors, who could not guarantee ajoining rooms, your staff understood the importance of my needs and delivered!

title: Needs some work
comment: I stay here often. Staff is great and facilty not bad. Needs: new shower fixtures, carpet and overall facelift. Also one elevator was not finctioning for a week.

title: Hotel was a relaxing getaway!
comment: We originally checked in late at night and got the last room available which we were notified that the room has had condensation leaking from the AC unit. To our dismay when we woke up it smelled of mold/mildew so we went to the front desk and they ended up upgrading us to the Carlsbad suite. It was great and since we were there celebrating our anniversary and I am 8 months pregnant so we spent a lot of time in the pool and room. On the weekends they have pretty good BBQ too poolside.

title: Lack of Hospitality
comment: The hotel was amenable in terms of what it offered. The staff were very rude and off-putting when I asked questions (staff supervisor). In fact, they even gave us the wrong room card for another guests room with no apology. There were several other guests we met that echoed our concerns about the staff and hospitality.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is wonderful. Each one always makes sure the stay is comfortable and memorable. In addition, the hotel is fantastic; all of the accommodations are ideal.
title: This hotel is unforgettable.
comment: As we arrived, the hotel looked beautiful. We enjoyed the relaxing, spacious lobby and the service in all of the areas. The employees there engaged us in friendly conversation without any useless small talk; they were authentic. The view from the 19th floor was AMAZING! We enjoyed the large contemporary room with the extremely comfortable bed and pillows - so many little extras.The food and service in Phillips Seafood Resturant was outstanding. From the delicious courses to the fabulous servers, the experience at the wedding rehearsal dinner was perfect. The atmosphere at this hotel contributed to the pleasure of spending tme with our family and meeting new friends.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is close to all the places one would want to visit in Chicago.
title: This was an excellent hotel experience
comment: I would heartily recommend this hotel,and the next time I visit Chicago, I will make reservations there. It was clean and quiet, and the staff, every person, was friendly and helpful. I will pass this information on to my friends and colleagues.

title: Disappointed
comment: You would think a hotel in such a prime location would be unforgettable ... unfortunately our stay here was disappointing. First, we arrived promptly at our indicated check-in time but had to wait an hour and a half because our suite wasn't ready. We were given a $30 food credit that just didn't seem to satisfy. And this was offered only after my wife and I pressured the staff for some kind of compensation. Second, I booked a suite expecting to be amazed but only came to discover the room was very average at best. The room was small with no barrier between the living room area and master bed. It was as though the hotel took an oversized room and crammed as much furniture into it as possible. Third, the balcony view was very nice but, again, for a suite, of which there are only eight of in the entire hotel, you would think the balcony would stand out from an average room, nope. It was small and only big enough to fit two pieces of stock lawn furniture and a table the size of a small pizza. Unfortunately, we won't be staying here again.

title: GREAT STAFF AND FOOD
comment: THE ROOMS ARE NOT ABOVE AVERAGE, BUT TE SERVICE AT THE RESTAURANT, ROOM SERVICE, BAR WAS EXELLENT AS WELL AS THE FOOD ITSELF. ALL EMPLOYEES STARTING AT THE FRONT DESK, WAITERS, HOSTESS, COOKS DID A GREAT JOB.

title: Better skip Birmingham next time
comment: The check in process was very long. While there were 8 stations available to check into this downtown hotel, only two were manned. The line was not that long, but it took us over half an hour to check in. There was no special consideration for BPG members. There was no local free parking. There was only self park ($12) or valet ($20). The valet service was the only bright spot of this whole stay. There was no concierge/club level lounge available, which I found hard to believe from a large, downtown hotel. Breakfast buffet for two was $35 and the quality and service were in line with a $3.50 buffet for two. I had received a $25 BPG gift reward that was not honored. The next night we stayed at a Belvoir in Charlotte where all these negatives were reversed which helped restore my faith in the chain. Keep a low level of expectation if you want to stay at the Belvoir Birmingham, and you'll be OK.

title: 2 night minimum stay now required..even if you're a Grandbourne Member.
comment: We are Grandbourne members and have been staying here for years. I tried to book a room for one night and was informed it had to be at least 2 nights. I have been staying here for years and this is the first time this has happened. I am cancelling my AMEX Grandbourne credit card!! This is ridiculous!!!! They change their policies/point values constantly!! Being a Grandbourne Member means nothing....don't waste your time staying here!! Overpriced dirty hotel!!!

title: Great Place
comment: Great location in downtown and staff met needs.

title: Nice location
comment: When we arrived the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room smelled very bad when we walked in, the staff changed our room right away. The new room was clean and fresh. The hotel is very close to all the shops and eateries. The Isle of shoals cruise ship is just behind the hotel, a must do.

title: Ideal hotel for 4th of July Fireworks spectacular!!
comment: For two years in a row we have stayed at the Belvoir with our family for "front row seats" to the San Diego Boom Bay Fireworks. One of the fireworks barges parks just offshore from the Belvoir - what a knock-out thrilling spectacle! From one's room one can see all five barges in the bay at once! But apart from the July 4th experience, my husband and I also appreciate the relaxed elegance and serenity of this hotel when we wish to get away by ourselves for a little R 'n R time. The location is ideal, the rooms lovely, and the service has always been top notch. A luxury we personally enjoy is breakfast served on our private deck overlooking the marina.

everyoneShouldKnow: You get what u paid for. Price meet expectation.
title: This is in a wonderful hotel to stay
comment: One of the customer service the day of my arrival was rude, unconsidered.

title: Nice facility
comment: Liked the layout and the multiple entrances to the hotel. Very close to interstate. Very close to shopping at University Mall.

title: Internet services and breakfast
comment: While you charge rates which are on the high end, you deny customers the very basic services - breakfast and internet. I found this ridiculous

everyoneShouldKnow: Not great service and very stingy.
title: Club level not accessible.
comment: Tried upgrading to Club Level but was informed there was no accessible rooms there. So I paid for upgrade but got none of the extra amenities except the breakfast. The manager even tried to charge us for water that was supposed to be free. The WiFi never worked either. You get a room for four people but only get 3 towels. Isn't this America? Stop being cheap. I don't like begging for towels.

title: Wonderful Vacation
comment: We stayed in one of the rooms for people with disabilities and it was a wonderful room. If you are looking for an updated room in the middle of the action, you might consider a different location, but for families and for a slower pace this is perfect. I didnt like having to pay for a refrigerator, but that was a small price to pay for the service received. We rented a beach wheelchair and on our last day discovered that the hotel would be glad to drive us in one of their vehicles to the beach (which is quite a walk). The sand is powder soft and the beach is nice and sloping. The service is outstanding and since we told them it was our anniversary we even had a surprise in our room when we arrived. I would recommend this hotel and would go there again in a minute.

title: Great Airport Location
comment: We spent one night before catching our plane out of Tampa. This was a beautiful location to do that in. Rooms are located around an atrium so all rooms look out. The atrium is rather loud, but is absolutely beautiful. Our room was quiet and had a refrigerator and microwave. It was a perfect place for a quick ride to the airport and if you are lacking a car there is a shuttle service. It was a nice way to end our vacation.

everyoneShouldKnow: The amenities are abundant. The walk between the bay tower and the marina could be slightly cumbersome.
title: Very relaxing...
comment: The room in the Bay towers are very relaxing and spacious. The bathroom is small and the tub is not that great. I did enjoy that the hotel is more green than...I.e save towels and 5$ is given back to the guests to spend in the hotel. Also there is a recycling bin in the room.

title: I love the location and the suites feature
comment: This hotel has been great for us. We love the location, and the fact that it's so close to the main downtown, but up on a hill and with wonderful city and bay views.

title: thi hotel is close to fort meyer
comment: the Host in the dining room was rude to us and gave poor service. the room, while comfortable , had a soiled carpeting.

title: Nice public areas; rooms are neglected
comment: This hotel has the advantage of a very convenient location near the airport as well as a nice lobby and restaurant. Beds were clean and very comfortable. Unfortunately, both of our rooms smelled strongly of mildew and the carpets were badly stained and grimy. For that reason alone I would avoid staying there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful hotel in a nice, quiet neighborhood
title: Great location, facility and value
comment: This was my second time staying here...I enjoyed it so much the first time, I came back for a four-night stay. Downtown Clayton is a bit sleepy, particularly on the weekend, but it's very quiet, green and suburban, so it's a good place to stay if you want a good night's sleep, and some peace and quiet. This is one of the nicer Belvoirs, and everything is beautiful inside. The staff are very helpful, and it's an incredibly good value for the money. It's particularly good if you have business in the Clayton or Maplewood area...very convenient, and some good restaurants nearby, or a short drive away. I'd highly recommend this hotel for business travelers in the St. Louis area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer service is their number one goal.
title: Nice hotel.
comment: The hotel, staff, accommodations, and facilities were above expectations. The only disappointment was the breakfast served in the Club Lounge. Compared to other Belvoir Hotels, it was below average. The cost of parking seemed to be a little high at $17/night.

title: Surprise
comment: In easy reach of all Brooklyn and Manhattan lies this very adequately fitted hotel. Rooms surprisingly nicely decorated, clean and good beds. Place to stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Larger room than other hotels in Key West
title: Exellent Hotel
comment: Belvoir Suite Key West is far from the center of Key West but you don`t have to worry. Shuttle Service is available to access Duval St. or Mallory Square. Room is large enough and clean. Staffs are friendly. Pool is cool. I really enjoyed the four nights stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: The best pool facilities of all hotels in Waikiki Beach!
title: Book the Club Rooms for Club Lounge Access
comment: This hotel's facilities more than meets our expectations. I love the inifinity pool, the restaurants, shops and lobby. Try the Dole Whip from Peets while lounging by the pool - it's awesome!

everyoneShouldKnow: Take a room with ocean view, really nice in the morning!
title: Great beach resort!
comment: All in all had a great stay at this hotel.

title: Excellent stay, except
comment: Great hotel, clean and convenient. The overall review would have easily been a 5 star if the housekeeping hadn't taken personal items when cleaning.

title: Average at best..
comment: Gievn the hotel's proximity to the Jersey shore, we decided to stay.....The building and rooms are nice. But the service seems to be the the missing piece. I hope for improvements.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice...clean, spacious rooms with a great view of NYC and quick access right out the door to Ferry to the City!
title: Nice hotel with some exceptions
comment: Called hotel early in morning. My flight landed at 7 a.m. I asked them to call me when room was ready and available. Left my cell number. Never received call. Check in desk was a little chaotic when I arrived at the hotel after a long day staying with a friend because of not being called. 12:00 checkout was nice the next day, so that made up for it. I just wish I would have received the phone call that was promised.

title: Wonderful Staff
comment: My husband and I stayed at this resort for our Wedding Anniversary. The resort, room, pool, beach, and staff were excellent and we will definitely stay here next time we visit clearwater.

everyoneShouldKnow: Being a preferred guest provided an upgraded room.
title: Would definitely stay again
comment: We had a lovely stay. Our room was on the club level and very comfortable; the continental breakfast was excellent. The beds are so comfortable, and having two tv's was very convenient.

everyoneShouldKnow: For the most part, they seemed genuinely interested in making your stay pleasurable.
title: Service May Have Slipped
comment: Very good overall, but service for example by pool as compared to the past was lacking. Last stay 2 years prior there were a lot more people taking food/drink orders. Where'd they go. Plus, towel service rep was gone most of time--as often were the towels? Also, some things in room need to be replaced--mini refrigerators have been and still are a problem.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's just beautifully laid out with a great beach
title: Beautiful Resort Property
comment: A beautiful resort on a beautiful property. A guest could spend their entire stay enjoying the pool and beach, although the food outlets are limited on the premises.

title: Brief Stay
comment: The room was overall kinda clean. The breakfast bar was great. The only issue was hair in the bathroom.

everyoneShouldKnow: Only stay here if money is no object.
title: Charges extra for everything
comment: Nice hotel, great views, nice room but not particularly accommodating staff or policies. I travel for business every week. Maybe this hotel is not meant for travelers. Nickled and dimed for everything!! Food was fabulous but too expensive.

title: small johns
comment: Great hotel only exception was the bathroom in the room. it was cramped

title: great hotel
comment: We stayed at this hotel to attend a wedding in Syracuse. It was centrally located, quiet, very quiet, which was just what we needed. The hotel bar was comfortable and the bartenders were attentive, The food in the restaurant was excellent for breakfast. We felt very well taken care of safe in the hotel and parking lot. All Good.

everyoneShouldKnow: It was very kid friendly, even on a week day.
title: Swimming pool was the highlight
comment: I brought my 2 grandchildren (ages 8 and 4) so they could use the swimming pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, great water coolers, great staff. No free transportation to or from airport.
title: One of the nicest hotels.
comment: I found this hotel to be great in all areas.

title: Great Hotel
comment: The check-in procedure was superb. The one who checked us in was extremely friendly and helpful. As a Gold member, she right away offered us an upgrade and a late checkout. The room was comfortable and the facilities were very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is great. .

title: very nice
comment: Hotel was great, staff very friendly and responsive. didn't get to try out exercise equipment or pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: Food was exceptional. Both dinner and Breakfast.
title: Perfect getaway
comment: Perfect getaway, short drive to Boston or New Port. Comfortable room, great staff met all our needs. Will definitely be back to stay at this Hotel.

title: Courtious staff
comment: The staff was extremely courteous. Namely, the registration and the restaurant staff. Their smiles and service level were inviting, that goes a long way.

everyoneShouldKnow: The ocean view rooms are worth the extra expense!
title: First time and I will go back!
comment: I came to VA Beach for the first time with my family. Being a loyal BPG member and knowing I could trust reviews and hotel qualifications, I figured this might be a nice place for a family, beach vacation. We were not disappointed. The hotel and staff exceeded expectations. The location was wonderful! We will return!

title: This hotel is accommodating
comment: When we arrived at 8am they found us a room right away but unfortunately it had not been cleaned but when we went back to the FD they immediately found us a clean room in a much closer location.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want a real breakfast, you have to go out. Staff is lovely but they seem to have less authority than in the past.
title: Fine hotel hurt by new ownership?
comment: This is a conveniently located hotel with many long-time staff members who do their best to help. Recently purchased in September of 2010, the facility has undergone an extensive renovation. However, the offerings in the concierege lounge have been cut drastically & maint. seems to have suffered--dust on the AC filter in my room was a quarter inch.

title: Disappointing stay
comment: I was disappointed in this hotel. The door locks were difficult to use and when asking for help, on received a reply that "They are tricky." Bugs in the room. Food in the restaurant was ok but the service was slow.

title: Nice place to stay.
comment: We were pleased with the very spacious

everyoneShouldKnow: Food location, great staff, very comfortable.
title: Above and Beyond
comment: I can't say enough about the Belvoir Riverside. We were in town for a sad occasion (the death of a family member) , and the staff was wonderful. They even left some flowers in our room to express their sympathy for our loss. When we arrived, they were very helpful in making the room feather-free for us. The room itself was fresh and spotlessly clean. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in. We had a lovely meal at the Bristol, located in the Hotel. They even had something for us vegans to eat! Lovely hotel located right on the Ohio River directly across from Louisville.

title: Great place for quick weekend to NYC
comment: Place is great. Has a starbucks right inside.

title: perfect location for my needs
comment: hotel located in the heart of town walking distance to beach and boardwalk

everyoneShouldKnow: The Lobby looks better than the rooms on the floors.
title: The Hotel needs upgrading
comment: The hotels I have visited was a lot more

everyoneShouldKnow: See Sam, she is the best hotelier ever!
title: Excellent Staff
comment: The staff took the time to understand all of our needs and do everything they could to make our stay as pleasant as possible.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is excellent!! We loved being on the club floor!
title: Belvoir was great on everything!!
comment: Rooms were very comfortable and the staff was excellent! We loved being on the Club Floor. Only problem we had at all was issues with the WiFi and their support through AT&T was excellent.

title: Staff attention
comment: I was in town for my father's funeral. The hotel was sold out for the night of 8 14 but Denise at the front desk was able to extend my stay to accommodate my need at a very difficult time for my family. I was treated with kindness and sessitivity for my stay

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are comfortable and the front desk service is always very helpful.
title: The Belvoir Key West is our hotel of choice while in Key West!
comment: This is our third time using this hotel and we will be staying there twice more later on this year. As an BPG member, I appreciate the BPG rewards for free nights and the Starhot rates we receive. The room is always comfortable and exceptionally clean. When we arrive, all transportation to and from the city by their shuttle is such a nice feature to have. The staff is always very nice and helpful. The concierge is extremely helpful in getting us scooters and other items such as tours and discounts to some of our favorite places. Overall, we love this Belvoir and will always make this our hotel of choice when staying in Key West. Many nice memories with family were made here, and we have had nothing but enjoyment. Thank you guys for always caring.

title: Below expectations
comment: I stayed one month in the hotel and for the price paid and no breakfast included and the amenities available in the room I found it very much below my expectations.

title: Rating for Belvoir Kauai
comment: Wonderful facility and great service!

title: Price being equal, I'd stay somewhere else
comment: I just completed a three-night stay during which the hotel appeared to be full. While there were no significant negatives about my stay, my overall impression is that the property is showing a lot of wear.

title: Great place to stay!
comment: A pleasant experience as always at Belvoir Palo Alto. Employees are very friendly and professional. Always a smile and recognition to guests. Go Green program very confusing to us and we would not participate again. We do not feel pool toys should be allowed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Unlike the other Belvoir hotels (but not in a good way)
title: Surprising disappointment
comment: I was beyond disappointed with this hotel. It did not matter whether I was an BPG Gold member. I was told that this hotel did not participate in BPG member benefits as with other Belvoir hotels i.e complimentary wifi, club room access/purchase option etc. In fact there were no perks and even worse they placed us into a room where the AC did not work and there was a rancid odor in the room. My family became nauseous and so we requested a different room. We had to settle for one without the microwave, fridge and working hair dryer. It was the first time I've stayed at a Grandbourne property and could not wait to check out.

title: Fabulous Experience
comment: This was our second stay at the Belvoir Suites. We love the facility and staff. With the exception of the spa nothing working well, everything exceeded expectations. This is an outstanding location for a family vacation!

everyoneShouldKnow: Wait until they turn it around. Check back for better feedback before making a reservation. Sorry.
title: First Disappoint of a Belvoir Property
comment: Housekeeping issues seem to be the theme of others who have stayed at the hotel. In addition, the room keys have issues, in-room movies have sound problems, lack of towels, housekeeping taking unopened bottles of water, hearing about a guest who found cockroaches didn't surprise me. As a frequent traveler, I find this Belvoir to be one of the most INFERIOR I have ever stayed at. The front desk did bend over backward to make sure I was satisfied. Maybe a training session with Housekeeping would be a good place to start. Fitness center was okay.

title: Worst Valet Service I've Seen
comment: There never seemed to be enough valet staff to park cars or bring the car in a timely manner. There was always a crowd in the waiting area for the cars and at times it was as if the staff had never done this before. There was times I parked on the street and paid twice for the parking just to avoid dealing with the hotel valet.For $51/night and at a Grandbourne property I expect a lot more.

title: Didn't expect $22 /day parking Fee & airport noise
comment: We had to pay $22 /day parking fee. We told the front desk manager when we checked in that we were not informed about the parking charge when we booked our reservation. The manager said, "Did you tell the reservation that you have a car?" and she added, "The parking fee is stated on their website." We told her we didn't book it online. We would think that the person at the central room reservation would inform as about parking charges when we made the reservation.

title: Staff was very helpful
comment: Staff assisted us in getting ealier access to complimentary suite so we could shower ahead of our flight after we had cehcked out.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is convenient to the Charlotte Airport
title: It was an OK stay
comment: This was a last minute booking and I was able to use my Grandbourne Points. However, when I checked in the room smelled of smoke and it was supposed to be a smoke free hotel. I recognize that some people do smoke, but it did not appear that housekeeping was successful in removing the smell.

title: Visit to Roanoke
comment: Very good hotel and resturants, the pool looked cloudy

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean very comfortable and great staff
title: Fantastic
comment: This hotel is great for business meetings

title: coffee
comment: The coffee in the rooms as well as what is served in the conference rooms is terrible. Maybe a medium grade would be more suitable.

title: Business Center needs much improvement
comment: 6 months since last visit and quality of hotel has gone down greatly. Food at banquet was terrible and business center equipment needs updated badly

title: Excellent extra effort by staff member
comment: I needed 2 rooms, preferably next to each other and Danus (I think that was the name) at the front desk made an extra effort to arrange this and saw it through until we were able to get in the room. A very nice extra effort.

title: Awesome location!
comment: Hotel is beautiful and staff were wonderful. Only issue I had was female travelling alone, I was put into a building a distance from the main building on the 1st floor next to the parking lot. I checked in at 9:30PM so that was the problem. I was moved the next day. In addition, the airconditioner took a few days to get the room cooled off. Other than that, it was awesome!

title: Good hotel for a family
comment: The suite with mini-kitchen was perfect for our young family. We selected it because of the pool and used it with our 3 & 5 year olds each evening. A microwave in the room allowed us to heat dinner and have room picnics. The staff were mainly very helpful, although there was limited local knowledge about Chesapeake beaches and i was told to go and "look on the internet". I was hoping for a more proactive and helpful approach from someone who clearly lives within an hour of the sea. We didn't eat here and chose to shop locally for our breakfasts. Limited wine selection in the bar was disappointing.There is a great free shuttle service to King Street and the airport, and the Metro into DC is walkable and very handy. Parking is expensive. If you just go for a room, it's worth it. If you add on all the extras it can be pricey.

title: Maintenance
comment: Over the last 3 months I have stayed at this hotel 4 times). There has not been one stay where something was not right with the room (i.e. curtains wouldn't close, air conditioner not working, remote control broken). Although these items were brought to the attention of the management team, on only one occasion was the manager interested enough to getting it corrected and move me to another room. You need to get managers that actually fix problems and just not good at apoligizing

title: Our Stay
comment: We had a pleasant stay. My kids really enjoyed the pool. The quiet atmosphere made for much needed rest.

title: Denver
comment: Very well designed hotel in a great location. Furniture placement in the room was awkward.

everyoneShouldKnow: The customer service is outstanding and the rooms are beautiful!
title: This hotel is OUTSTANDING!
comment: Our entire stay at the Belvoir Virginia Beach was exceptional from start to finish. The customer service provided by everyone who works at the hotel is outstanding. The rooms are beautiful and clean. The beds and linens are excellent. The staff treat each person like they are the most important person in the hotel. Exceptional!

title: Meeting
comment: Staff is very friendly and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is old and there is nothing decent within walking distance.
title: Very OLD Hotel
comment: There were four elevators working for a twenty-six floor tower. It took me fifteen minutes to get an elevator one day. Not acceptable!!

title: Very nice stay
comment: We had our doubts about the location but that was soon relieved when we arrived and guest services took over and explained everything we needed to know from venue location to eating at the Hill mad our stay wonderful from easy parking to area sites. The only negative we found was that the rooms could use a "DEEP Cleaning"

title: Wi Fi or Internet Access
comment: Overall I had an excellent stay. I was a little dissapointed to find that this hotel only offered wifi access on the 1st and 2nd floors and you had to pay for the internet.

everyoneShouldKnow: very comfortable rooms, beware the bathroom hardware, very pricey
title: comfortable but keep up with maintenance
comment: Very nice room with the exception that the handle to turn on water in tub/shower was not tightly connected and repeatedly fell off. Rather heavy so lucky it didn't hit my foot. Other than this great room and hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close location to convention center and train station
title: Front Desk personnel was great
comment: Diane at the front desk was great. She immediately responded to my requests. She also made sure I received a BPG numer.

title: Very nice. great location.
comment: Nice place to stay with good service and convenient location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Valet cost is $28 per day. I didn't notice that and found out the hard way.
title: Hotel gets two thumbs up!
comment: Stayed at the Belvoir for a business trip and the hotel was great. The staff was very courteous and glad to help with anything I had. Room was very comfortable with a great view of San Antonio. Only knock on room was a real lack of electrical outlets and the doors allow too much noise in. I kept hearing the maintenance people on their push to talk radios while laying in bed. The meeting room we met in for business was nice and the meal they provided was healthy. Would recommend to all travelers since the Riverwalk is real close too!!

title: Great location & amenities
comment: was impressed with the shuttle service to pentagon city staff was very courteous

title: No service and a dirty room
comment: Shuttle from airport took over 45 minutes, there was a large hairball in the shower, no shampoo, bed sheets were not pulled over mattress, no receipt under door. Will never go back.

title: Friendly service
comment: This hotel has very friendly staff.

title: ace conference
comment: The hotel is decorated beautifully. The concierge should me exactly where to go when looking for restaurants. I would stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Marvelous open atrium up to top floor.
title: A bargain at O'Hare
comment: Hotel was very modern and up-to-date. Last minute reservation was the lowest price around. Room was nicely furnished 2 room suite.

title: STAFF UNSATISFACTORY
comment: I am a PLATINUM member with BPG who had just stayed at the Dolphin for 2 nights on July 23-24. On the morning of checking out a family member was not feeling well so I called down and requested a late checkout. I explained the situation to the front desk and they would not give me a late check out. After explaining some more they only extended my checkout time by 1 hour. Because of how bad this service was and how sick the member of my family was we checkout of the hotel and went over to another Disney resort hotel and checked in for one night there. If I was granted a late check out that is normally offered to PLATINUM members I would have inquired with the front desk about extending my stay one more night if they had the availability. I find this to be a very poor way to treat paying costomers no matter what statues of membership they might have!!! Also it is now August 20 and I have still not received credit for my stay at this hotel!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Management welcomed us to the hotel at the start of our convention
title: Putting a face to the Hotel
comment: I just attended the 2012 Sweepstakes Convention and one of the planners for a past and future convention (working with Tom in Boston for a location in FL) and I mentioned to a friend of mine that this was the first hotel where we actually got to see someone from management at the start of the convention and made a public announcement as well as to how impressed he was. It was the fact that the hotel manager actually got up on stage and welcomed us to the hotel. As the planner and convention worker each year, I was listening to what our people had to stay about their stay and they were all impressed by the service in driveway, lobby and even when coming out of a session waiting for the elevator and being lead to a service elevator, rather than having to wait 10 minutes to squeeze into the elevator.

everyoneShouldKnow: Know how to find the Director of Front Office...in the event of any issues
title: Front Office Manager saves the "Stay"!
comment: My initial experience beginning with check-in, was a true nightmare. I had reserved a total of four rooms and had my team members checking in and out at different times...all of which were clearly documented on the four individual reservations. As a Lifetime Platinum guest, I have become used to spending no more than five minutes at the reception desk and then I am off to continue my very busy schedule. In this case, I stood at the counter for over one and one half hours, trying to get these four rooms set for my staff's arrival later in the day...to say that I was beginning to get a bit cranky, would be an understatement. Enter the ProActive Front Office Director. In my 700 plus stays with Grandbourne, I would be correct to say that I have had similar occurrences...with one significant difference...This astute gentleman was not there...fortunately, he was in attendance here. There is something about this outstanding individuals demeanor that emphasizes his sincere apology...individuals can say "I'm sorry" all day long and you have a sense that they don't really mean it. This Front Office Manager is a very self-assured gentleman. He also demonstrates a sincere concern...empathy...for what his guests are dealing with. He was able to resolve the situation within a matter of a couple of minutes and I was on my way. I ran into him in other locations on the property throughout the stay and he was most gracious, asking how my stay was going and offering to do whatever was necessary to provide a positive experience on the property. This young man clearly understands interpersonal relationshipshe gets it! He understands hospitality and the associated responsibility of providing within Grandbourne guidelines, all that Grandbourne promises and then some to each of his guests. In my global travels of the past 40 years, I can say without reservation that this individual represents the very best qualities for success in your business, both professionally and personally...you are incredibly fortunate to have him in your employ.

title: Alarm Set for Mid-Night
comment: On the second day of my stay, I had to have maintenance check my toliet because it wasn't flushing. Housecleaning would have also been in my room that day. That night at mid-night the clock radio alarm came on. I did not use the alarm and the alarm did not go off the first night I was in the room, so someone deliberately set the alarm for mid-night that day. I wasn't too happy to be woken up at mid-night!

title: Awesome!
comment: Great location, great hotel. Will stay again and will recommend! Fitness centre could use some disposable wipes or cleaner to wipe down machines after use.

title: Great family hotel.
comment: We stay at Wild Horse Pass every chance we get. The pool's are great, and my kids love the slide. The staff are very nice and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Everyone is so friendly, helpful, above and beyond and yet they don't give an impression that it is driven off of tips! Just truly gracious hosts and hostesses!
title: AWESOME!
comment: I was with 2 employees for the Allscripts ACE conference. Much like Denver the hotel was OVER THE TOP and I truly felt like the entire staff were happy we were guests. I saw an employee empty a super-full trash can in the Starbuck's and it was obvious that they are an independent vendor. And she was training a new hire as well! The only "issue" I have is with the gift shops which are independently owned and they are less than stellar, certainly not the experience I had with other staff. The lamp shade was on the dresser because it was broken and the shower faucet was VERY hard to pull on, and loose from the wall. Otherwise perfect experience!

title: overpriced
comment: There was AAA rate rooms available, they were not suggested by the reservation staff. Prices for the room given were higher than expected. Parking, esp. not secured, was an additional $10. Breakfast prices were outrageously overpriced - $5 for a glass of orange juice, and $15.50 for pancakes or waffles. We went out of the building for breakfast. Rooms were not soundproof - heard children in the hallway until late at night.

title: Wi-Fi
comment: Hotel room was great, however I was disappointed to learn that Wi-Fi was not included in the price of the room. Many people who business travel depend on this feature so they can respond to email back at the office.

title: The Draft at lunchtime
comment: We waited an hour for food at the Draft and it never arrived and the staff was indignant and rude. The temperature in my room read 65 but it was so stifling hot I couldn't breathe and they never fixed it.

title: Location
comment: Good location, friendly service and clean rooms. Should look into free internet and better parking options,

title: Hotel needs to be updated
comment: Carpet is showing wear and tear - time for the rooms to be renovated. Great pancakes for breakfast.

title: Hotel service depends on "busy"-ness
comment: Ordered breakfast room service that failed to show up in the AM. Ordered dinner room service that was delivered with incorrect order. I stay here every week and it is still unclear to me whether I am receiving points for "Go Green" unless I check with the front desk before leaving. Sometimes service is excellent but when the foot traffic is high you see a marked decline.

title: Return after six years
comment: A nice 5 nite stay in the room we had requested. First visit since the renovations. Love the beach facilities but miss the pool over in the Marina Tower. Also miss the old beach bar. Hope to return next year.
hotell was ok, but the extterier where the mall was closed needs to be cleaned up

everyoneShouldKnow: The consumer is first and your stay experience is their number one priority.
title: This motel pampered ME!
comment: I work in the field of child abuse prevention. The Sheaton makes anytime I have at their motels a time when i feel put first and pamperd with excellent service and lavish amenitys Belvoir Hotel staff go above and beyond what a hotel staff need to do to make your stay perfect!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's very large and can be difficult to find waht you're looking for.
title: Lacking in Customer Service.
comment: The staff weren't very friendly. I had to wait up to an hour to get a response from requests to guest services. This happened twice.

title: The noisiest hotel ever
comment: Located right next to waterfall stream, major highway and railway, the room needed better sound-proof. Throughout night, my and wife couldn't get a good sleep even for an hour as trains pass by, loud motor vehicle pass by and emergency car pass by.

title: Great hotel
comment: Convenient place to get in and out of Disney Resorts using their shuttle at a reasonable price.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hard to get a cab from this location. Staff works very hard to adjust to this.
title: Great staff
comment: I always stay at the Belvoir Tribeca. This last trip I showed up w/o a reservation! Something I have never done before. They were very helpfull considering...The shower in my room could have been cleaner.

everyoneShouldKnow: Center of Sioux Fall - quick and easy access to the entire City
title: Lucifer Angel
comment: Excellent location

everyoneShouldKnow: The lemon water in the lobby was a big plus when my family got back from walking around the Inner Harbor. So refreshing!
title: This hotel has good location and helpful staff
comment: The room was clean. The hotel was hooked to the convention center and only a block away from the Inner Harbor which was so convenient. We needed some extra towels and suggestions for where to eat or how to get there and the staff was friendly and helpful. They always met our requests.

title: Personnel is nice
comment: The employees were super friendly and helpful. Your business center printer was down for several days, the closet doors in the room wouldn't move...too close to carpet, and the caulking in the bathroom needed to be redone. no way to valet park and check in, had to go to parking garage across street, not so safe for women. otherwise a decent stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: parking costs 12.50 and the decor is outdated
title: Will not be going back
comment: I recently brought my family to this hotel . I was disappointed with the appearance as I have been to many Belvoirs. The bathtub didnt look very clean with grout coming apart and black. Charging three dollars for a bottle of water is insane. And the bed did not smell clean and had other peoples hair on it. It smelled of men's cologne. It was a bit offensive, but my small kids were sleeping and it wasnt worth waking them. I certainly would not come back. I recently stayed at a less reputable hotel and it was more updated and cleaner than this hotel.

title: Hotel stay
comment: Hotel room was clean but very cold. Had a hard time adjusting air, finally turned it completely off. Tub would not drain properly. Other than that, room was clean, nice and roomy. Food in restaurant was very good.

title: Dirty Towels/ Poor Customer Service Response
comment: The front desk reservation desk was the longest line only two employees working. All the towels we received and requested all had a horrible smell. Person delivering was not friendly when we requested another set of towels but they also had a horrible smell. The guest services that we called also sighed and was unfriendly when we asked for towels.

title: Excellent Staff
comment: I was very pleased with the staff during my visit. Our bill had to be split unevenly, and they were very helpful in completing this task!

title: So-so but needs upkeep
comment: Most of the staff was very nice and the location is great if you are in downtown Austin. The hotel is within walking distance of all the good restaurants and bars and even to the South Congress Bridge.

everyoneShouldKnow: Outstanding service at the Club Lounge
title: A great bite of the Big Apple
comment: I spent here four nights with my family and I really could not ask for anything more. I got an upgrade for my room and the service at the Club Lounge was really outstanding, not to mention the fantastic view from the lounge terrace.

title: Hotel room was disappointing
comment: I found the Belvoir Downtown Denver to not meet the usual experience I've had with Belvoir properties. The hotel room was worn, smelled of mildew and the air conditioning would not turn off - no matter what I did. A couple of times we asked the door men for assistance and were met with a less than enthusiastic reply. The front desk staff, however, seemed to have the usual Belvoir friendliness.

title: Good experience, but with an unexpected incident
comment: The overall experience is good. However, one unexpected experience happened to me. When I stayed in the room 30 mins after check-in, another group of guests entered the room with key. They were arranged by the front desk too! Then my key didn't work for this room. The staff assisted me did apologize for this and helped me to figure it out. His honest and performance made me feel better. However, I feared when I was on the bed. What if I was not in the room when they entered? what if they were not a polite lady and a child?

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location - near places to eat and the DART stops.
title: Going Green
comment: I think it is great that the hotel is trying to go green. The incentive of receiving a reward for not having your room clean is an excellent idea.

title: Always Great
comment: This hotel is consistently good. The staff is very friendly, it is close to anything you could want while you visit the Milwaukee area and the rooms are comfortable.

title: wonderful stay
comment: beautiful hotel, good food and friendly helpful staff--especially JESSE

title: Belvoir never dissapoints
comment: Honestly, awesome rate, great staff, ammenities were amazing; cant say enough great things :)! They were so accomodating :)! Had a BLAST!

title: The staff went out of their way for us
comment: The staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs. It's our favorite Belvoir to stay at and we'll be back before long. The location is excellent and it's a very pretty set up.

title: Great trip
comment: Very pleasant experience and wonderful view from our room. We really enjoyed it and plan to stay here again.

title: Over and above
comment: Staff very friendly and helpful, accommodating whenever possible.

title: Valet parking
comment: I used the valet parking. I had an early flight out of Logan. i called the Valet desk and left a message on phone well ahead of time. The care wasnt ready when I checked out. I had the woman at the front desk call. She said she would take care of it but nothing was done. The bell captain found the vfalet person only after I tracked the Bell Captain down. An unnecessary hassle, especially for a 46.00 valet parking charge.

title: Myrtle Vacay
comment: The convention center was a great hotel, my family totally enjoyed it!

title: Service
comment: While the site had some issues for the most part the service was great.

title: Great Location with Bad Services
comment: Stayed here 6 nights in conjunction with the IronMan NYC event. Complained about the smelly towels from day 1, did not get better throughout the stay, even the bedsheets smelled.

title: SLL
comment: Great Location to downtown shopping and the Navy Pier!

title: Average
comment: As a Platinum member I have come to expect above average for all of the Belvoir Hotels. This hotel and staff did nothing to impress, nor can I speak ill of the hotel.

title: Great leisure hotel
comment: We stayed here for the Balloon Fiesta, and many other times. This hotel has a very happening environment, the bar and restaurant had enough people to make new friends, but not so crowded you cant get in. The hotel is in the heart of ABQ and there are many eating establishments, shopping venues and activities close to this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Boston Sporting Club in front of the hotel is by far the best hotel gym/pool I enjoyed in my life.
title: Better next time
comment: I spent five nights at this hotel with my family, booking two rooms and making them our "base camp" to visit Boston and the area around Salem. The fact I got no room upgrade did not annoy me at all.

title: Alot to work on
comment: No one asked if I was driving when I checked in but I was charged for parking even though I didnt have a car. The phone operator told me 1800 calls were free, i found out at check out, that was a lie. Local calls is charged more after a certain amount of time, nobody said so. They said it was written somewhere by the phone. I couldnt find any info so I had to call and was misinformed.

everyoneShouldKnow: restaurant staff is not polite at all
title: staff and mgmt
comment: The customer service is lacking at the resturant and front desk as a hotel guest I should not be told to call a 800 about low wifi signal. front desk has no manager card to give a guest I'm sure I wont be back

everyoneShouldKnow: How helpful the staff are at this hotel.
title: Great service and assistance
comment: I had to attend a conference that was going to end approximately one hour later than my checkout. The staff at the help desk was extremely helpful in that they delayed my checkout time to meet my schedule and also gave me an umbrella that morning to walk to my conference location.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Staff. They cannot do enough for you.
title: Lovely time spent at the Universal Belvoir
comment: Spent 9 nights at the Universal Belvoir. It was great! the staff were fantastic. Would definately go back and recomend to anybody looking to stay in LA.

title: Best place to stay in Plantation Fl
