comment: we stay in N.Y. city at least 4 times a year we have been in a variety of hotels all over the city, the Belvoir 7th ave and 53rd was the 1st time we were disapointed! we were in overnight with AMERICAS 911 FOUNDATION on a motorcycle run. The room was very clean but it was the bathroom sink and shower that absolutely did not drain properely something the housekeeping had to notice when the room was cleaned and prepared for us. the towels had a strong mildew oder which we realized upon getting out of shower. when we made them aware they did not seem overly surprised or concerned we got a sorry and please pay your $346.61 bill.So no we will not stay there again and with all the beautiful hotels in the city you should stay elsewhere as well!

everyoneShouldKnow: Besides location/view of NY City/staff/room comfort... I want all to know, that if you see a problem or have a request, tell/ask someone while you are currently staying, don't let it go unknown, until you are home & then voice issues. Mgr's & Staff will fix/accomodate every issue in a timely fashion. Grandbourne Brand is the BEST & fixing/knowing/accomodating issues, etc, will keep it that way!
title: I am Platinum & was treated like Platinum!
comment: Perfect stay in every way! As a BPG Platinum status member, I have been to ALOT of Grandbourne Brand hotels thru out the world.... I know what I can get, should get, have come to expect to get, and I admit, I am very very spoiled! The ENTIRE staff here @ Belvoir Meadowland's gets 5 stars from me for going above & beyond in every way during my stay. The food is very good, the drinks in the Lobby Bar are even better! lol Thank you each & every person working here, who I had the pleasure to meet and come to love! You each made a stay, forced by the illness/hospital stay of my Mom, enjoyable & perfect, under the worst of personal situations! Appreciate all of you very much! Words can not express my gratitude & I shall always pick Belvoir Meadowland's for my future NJ/NY needs! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you all!

title: Nice facility in good neigborhood
comment: Due to flight availability I reached the hotel before 10AM. The staff was very courteous and accommodated me right away.

everyoneShouldKnow: Faboulos view and location. Staff is very professional and courteous.
title: Great View and Expectations
comment: This hotel is very nice and consistent with the Grandbourne product line. I was more than pleased with the room and the friendly staff. Special thanks to the GM and Alexandria at the front desk.

title: Airport Get-a-way
comment: This hotel for perfect for my quick business trip. I took the shuttle from Dulles Airport to the hotel and the driver was very friendly (Very quick drive). Once I got there the hotel looked great and everyone was very friendly.

title: Clean rooms
comment: i was pleased with the room cleanliness. I was concerned about bedbugs, but I didn't see any nor did I get bit.

title: Our stay was good, but not spectacular
comment: Overall, our stay was good, but it certainly wasn't spectacular. I didn't like the fact that the room had only one garbage can. Another can or even a can for recycling would have been appreciated. Also, I have a young child who needed to nap in the afternoons of our stay. The housekeeping schedule made these naps less convenient to coordinate. The hotel's location and facilities met our expectations.

title: vfw
comment: I feel that the hotel is very chinsey and cheap when charging for wi-fi in the room when they are charging a rate of $100+ depending on the room per night. You can get a room at many other hotels for $50-$60 a night that include in room wi-fi for free.

everyoneShouldKnow: They had a candy bar in the afternoon!
title: location
comment: This hotel is located right across the street from the Arizona Center! You can walk to the Convention Center as well.

title: Tropical retreat
comment: This resort has something for everyone. When I tired of the gorgeous ocean, I retreated to the private garden pool. Or I could relax on my balcony and enjoy the sounds of the waterfall, breeze, and birds. Awesome!!!!

title: Great Place to Stay
comment: The common area is very luxurious with lots of marble and classy furnishings. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We had access to the Club lounge which serves snacks/soft drinks all day long and an excellent breakfast notable by its fabulous fresh fruit offerings. Would stay here again.

title: Dissapointed!!
comment: I was so exited about these hotel in fortworth down town.. valet parking was exelent the lobby is nice and clean it has a nice litle starbucks and the swiming pool is nice and big it needs a litle more plants or some decorations it looks too plain and lonely .. My room was located in the 10th floor the first thing i notice was the carpet was owful. Dirty it had huge stains it grossed me out the furniture its a litle too old lookig and my toilet paper keep on falling because the thing were it goes was loose off the wall :( also the hall ways are a litle boring and empty it definetly made me feel like if i was in a low cuality hotel .. I did love the area close to all the night life and also the staff was really nice the valet parking was really nice even the house keeping ladys i think these hotel definetly needs improvement in the rooms and hallways.. : (. Please fix it ..

title: Loved this hotel!
comment: My son and I stayed here for a long weekend trip and could not have been happier. They gave us an upgrade at check-in to a room with a view of the Galleria. The room was nice, well-stocked, and quite spacious. We received great service from the front-desk and the restaurant throughout our stay. We will definitely be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Best location on Waikiki Beach and also the infinity pool for adults only.
title: Best hotel on Waikiki Beach
comment: We have tried all the other ocean front hotels on Waikiki Beach, and this one is by far the best hotel to stay. Loved the infinity pool even though there was limited amount of chairs for the number of hotel guests. The lounge chairs were always taken no matter how early we came down - people came the night before to reserve more than one chair facing the ocean, and end up never using those chairs, while other people were struggling to find chairs.

title: Great Place to Spend an Evening with Friends
comment: We asked for two hotel rooms on the same floor as we were traveling with friends. Upon arrival we were delighted to find we were provided with adjoining rooms with a suite between us. After walking to dinner nearby, we spent a comfortable evening visiting and enjoying the rooms amenities. As usual, the staff was friendly and eager to assist us.

title: could have been nicer
comment: We have stayed in Belvoir Hotels where our rooms were very nice. I was a bit disappointed with our room in this particular hotel. The lights were very dim, the air conditioner ran all night, our toilet seat was broken and moved everytime we used it. We were told we'd have "mountain view, we had roof view. The staff was nice but the room was a little "iffy".

everyoneShouldKnow: Get rates from the hotel directly or thru Star wood.
title: Vacation
comment: Had a 2 bedroom suite for 8, used 80000 points for a 1 bedroom suite for 5 nights and paid cash for 1 room. Plenty of room and since I was a Gold member I had the resort fee of $14 as a gift. The way I paid for the room it was set up as 2 reservations and it was waived twice.

title: customer friendly !!!
comment: Clean rooms, very comfortable beds and "very" pet friendly !!!! Wonderful staff ... definitely upgrade to club floor, it is worth the extra dollars !!!

title: This hotel is ideally located
comment: My business appointments are located throughout the city and I find that this hotel is ideally located which enables me to drive within the city without difficulty; I am able to utilize the main thoroughfares leading to and from the hotel with ease. The rooms are spacious and the the club offers just the right combination of light meals for my dietary needs.

title: bugs
comment: We had bugs, I believe termites in our room, crawling all over us on the next to last day. I called and they did accomadate us and move us to another room, but i'm not sure it was thoroughly cleaned before we got there, open soaps, wet towels. however the manager did take care of us at the end of our stay. Also i complained about the AC on the 4th day and they didn't come to fix it until after they moved us out. Overall I had a good time, but the bugs, which i hope didn't come with us sort of ruined everything good

title: This hotel is beautiful
comment: Enjoyed my stay, hotel was very clean, most of the staff was friendly. Enjoyed waking up in the moring to the music in the court yard.

title: Great location and great service
comment: Great location and great service, excellent pool

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff was extra friendly and helpful!!
title: Great
comment: Had a great time. Staff was great!! Room was great!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: View your room prior to acceptance!
title: Look before you leap!
comment: Granted I was only booked for two nights but I was given a fifth floor room with no balcony and one small window that was permanently locked, and camouflaged by a wall of drapery. The window was roof level with either a parking garage or warehouse building. I felt like I was sleeping in a basement of a sleazy hotel! When I made inquiries at the desk, several of the Japanese clerks could not understand my English. I was told it was August and very busy. Needless to say, for the price of a little bit more I could have had a room at other near by hotels. If youre going to book those particular rooms to guests, at least give your clientele an explanation with a noticeable discount! I won't bore you with the children running up and down the halls at all hours, with the hotel staff parking several carts outside my door having their loud and boisterous break, and the sounds of human copulation taking place in the next room!

everyoneShouldKnow: Pool is cold by Florida standards...less than 82 degrees f
title: PHC THE VIllages
comment: We had a great time, the hotel was very nice...no problem

title: Beautiful and clean!
comment: This place was airy and bright! The bed was to die for, so very comfortable! I also felt the facility was clean and quiet!

everyoneShouldKnow: The pools and pool bar/service are resort quality - exceptional.
title: WONDERFUL FAMILY VACATION!
comment: This hotel FAR exceeded my expectations. The pools and slide entertained our kids for hours. The staff was wonderful. We were upgraded to a family suite with easy access to the pools due to our Gold status!!!! The food was wonderful. It was such a great value, and the renovations are outstanding. Our kids really say it is a nicer hotel than the next hotel we stayed at - the Grand Floridian. We will be back!

title: Our New Favorite Hotel!
comment: Annual visit w/ family from back East. Usually do Disney, but decided to try Univ. Studios this summer and happened upon the Belvoir. Maybe business has been slow (but the hotel was completely booked) or maybe they're making an effort to improve their image. Regardless, hands down the BEST customer service we've experienced in years! From Max at the front desk to Juliet in the restaurant to Mr. Wall (Asst. Gen'l Mgr?), everyone gave 110% to make sure our stay here was memorable. We'll be back, and we'll spread the word about the Belvoir at Universal Studios. FABULOUS!

title: WOW! Excellent Digs!!
comment: The Belvoir Phoenix Downtown Hotel is a very elegant place to stay. Everyone is so friendly, the food is delicious and the rooms are wonderful. If you want to be pampered, this is the place to stay. I plan on returning soon.

title: Facilities cleanliness
comment: Overall the facility observed proper cleanliness except in the pool/fitness center area, particularly the bathroom. The bathroom area was far less than sanitary.

everyoneShouldKnow: You are centrally located between Queens and Long Island. Also, JFK Airport is across the street.
title: Pleassure Trip to NY
comment: The location of the hotel was ideal for the event I came there for.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
comment: I wasn't relishing the thought of staying in Ontario during an August heat wave, but this hotel made it a more pleasant experience. I was struck by the friendliness of all the staff including Frankie at the front desk, who recognized my BPG status by assigning me a room on the Club floor and giving me amenity points as well as lounge vouchers for evening hors d'oeuvres and breakfast. The room was compact, but had a comfy arm chair and an ultra-comfy bed. There was a flat-screen TV and speedy, complimentary WiFi. I used the gym, which had a good array of equipment, but didn't see the pool. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, along with fruit (including fresh berries), yogurt, cereal etc. All in all, a great stay.

title: Nice Short Stay
comment: I travel a lot for business and this stay was no different. It was a pleasure being greeted at the front desk and being provided with excellent dinner recommendations.

title: The Hotel was as usual a great place to be at.
comment: From the location to the staff and room and other amenities this hotel is one of the best.

title: from another Grandbourne associate
comment: I travel alot for work and stay in all Grandbourne brands. Some Belvoirs are not up to par but this one is. The staff at desk and bellstand are very nice and accommodating. the only thing I wish was better was the parking or they had valet. It rained while I was there and had to walk across in the rain with no umbrella.

title: Worst Belvoir Ever
comment: Seldom am I compelled to write a review, but this hotel, including service, amenities, room and etc. is not only the worst Belvoir I've ever stayed in (and I've been Belvoir Gold since 1994 - before there was a Grandbourne), it's possibly the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. There are no-star hotels I've enjoyed far more. I was there for a three night stay in August 2012.

everyoneShouldKnow: location - its more private and removed from the Condado area.
title: great hotel
comment: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The meeting rooms, staff, food....was excellent. The infinity pool was amazing. If i would have one complaint it would be the hotel self park. Sometimes it was an inconvenience to have to go check in at the counter everytime i was leaving the garage. I guess this is for our own security.

everyoneShouldKnow: ON THE BEACH ROOMS ARE PERFECT
title: GREAT HOTEL
comment: THE STAFF WAS FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL. THE ROOMS ARE PERFECT AND CLEAN. WE STAYED IN THE ROOMS RIGHT ON THE BEACH AND ITS A GREAT LOCATION. I WAS NOT PLEASED WITH THE ROOM SERVICE CHARGES SO I JUST WONT ORDER ROOM SERVICE AGAIN. ALL IN ALL THE STAY WAS GREAT.

everyoneShouldKnow: We were a little apprehensive about leaving our kids at the service as we've never done this before. Having two days of formal dinner obligations, however, meant we had to. Not only were the kids comfotrtable with it on day one, they kept asking us when they could go back on day two.
title: Loves Dophins
comment: Our recent visit to the Walt Disneyworld Dolphin and Swan was a wonderful experience. We enjoyed the hotel amenities, including the art shop in the lobby. The kids really liked the people at Camp Dolphin, and the pool was heavenly. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

title: Hotel Room
comment: Absoulely loved the bed and pillows. A most comfortable night's sleep. ALs loved the view from our room.

everyoneShouldKnow: the food at the beach restaurant and bar was excellent
title: hotel has great location
comment: location and renovation excellent, however no outdoor hot tub only indoor. would have liked to be in hot tub looking at ocean after day at the beach

title: Executive committee
comment: Lovely room great location, would recommend highly.

title: Nice place
comment: Great place to stay, location is a good spot for everything.

title: NAR
comment: Service staff that did banquet service was great. So attentive. Front desk took care of every need and asked to do more. Great place to stay.

title: The big apple
comment: Overall we were very pleased with our experience . There was only one thing that I think should absolutely be mentioned that was very disappointing. We stayed on the club floor. My husband and I bought a bottle of wine so we could enjoy it in our room. We requested the male bartender to open the bottle for us and were told there would be a 25 dollar corkage fee. The bartender had a very nasty attitude. !!! Funny enough my husband then asked the concierge to give him a bottle opener and the gentleman said just ask the bartender and he will be more than happy to open it for you.

everyoneShouldKnow: How professional and pleasant their staff is.
title: Tampa Visit
comment: Excellent service and accomdations. Staff always goes well beyond my expectations.

title: Great
comment: My hotel stay was great, the hotel is clean, very near to many local shops and attractions, I stay there whenever I can if its available on my travel dates

everyoneShouldKnow: the parking is quite tricky but I loved the location close to everything downtown
title: Beautiful room
comment: the rooms were well kept and meet my expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Gracious, considerate accomodating staff- true southern hospitality.
title: Staff is professional and friendly.
comment: Theroughly enjoyed my stay while attending the 23rd Sweepstakes Convention in Atlanta. Your facility is impressive and your staff is polite, attentive and efficient.

title: Would visit again!
comment: The staff, location, and accomodations were lovely!

title: $11 for 12 hours of Internet access?
comment: Nice hotel, very comfortable and great location in downtown Seattle; but seriously, charging $10.95 for an Internet connection (for up to 12 hours) at a $200+ per night hotel is ridiculous

title: Great stay and great pillows and bed
comment: come in road weary and leave refreshed, isn't that the plan?

title: Needs work in the Bathroom
comment: Nice hotel, other than the fact that the bathroom had hair stuck to the walls and the ceiling. paint on the ceiling an the walls was peeling off in the bathroom.

title: General facilities excellent
comment: The hotel has excellent overall facilities however the rooms need a re-design. The bathroom has absolutley nowhere to put anything other than a small rolling cart. The lighting is very poor.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's very close to airport but very quiet and they are very friendly.
title: Nice surprise
comment: Checked-in around 6pm and extremely tired from driving up from NJ. Was upgraded to club level but we had to meet family for dinner at 6:30. Room was as expected, clean and quiet. Only thing I didn't like was the toilet; it had like a gray unsightly stain in the bowl. The manager at check-in is very sweet (don't remember her name but she's from California) and they had lemon water and fruit at check-in; very refreshing. The next a.m. we had breakfast and it was pretty good. Thanks for the upgrade.

title: experince
comment: Evaluation on my stay at the Belvoir hotel and Marina in San Diego CA.

title: Beautiful hotel, but worn out mattress
comment: I liked everything about this hotel except for the fact that the king mattress was mush.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice club level, restaurant leaves a lot to be desired.
title: Overall Better than Average
comment: Had a good one night stay on club level.

title: Understaffed and slow
comment: Front desk, valet, bell service all were understaffed and slow

title: Not a comfortable stay
comment: Original reservation was lost, I was quoted three different rates during last minute reservations. Room was not clean.

title: doesnt feel like airport hotel
comment: very nice room with views to the golf course.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff, from maintenance to desk clerks are very friendly and helpful
title: This hotel has comfortable beds
comment: The rooms were quiet and beds were comfortable. We were upgraded to a suite when we extended our stay. Hotel is convenient to Hospice and Tucson Medical Center

title: wonderful hotel
comment: The staff was great...room was clean...and price was reasonable. Thank you

title: The rooms were beautiful
comment: The rooms were greats and very neat upon arrival. Room/maid service was very good. All staff were friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast was delicious and the views from both sides of the hotel were beautiful. The only downfall was our bathroom was a bit of mess. The lights sometimes didn't turn on, we couldn't stop the shower from dripping and our toilet wouldn't stop running. Also, you have to pay for pretty much everything. We were going to rent a car before we found out about the parking fee, wifi was not free (most places are), no fridge for personal use and room service went from an initial 8.00 dollar item to 16.00 by the time it gets to your room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Shuttle Service is a great convenience, great value!
title: Great Value
comment: Always a great value, especially for a family with kids. My family and I are local, and love to spend a weekend here every quarter or so. With the frequent visits, staying at the park hotels would get a little pricey.

title: BPG Platinum * * * +
comment: Whatever you stay one night or more nights using cash&points or internet rate, the room upgrade for Platinum benefits to standard suites is always for you.

title: sweep stay
comment: I love the hotel, the staff was great. The hotel always was clean. Whom every the manager is in the Atlanta location he/she is doing a excellent job. Keep up the good work.

everyoneShouldKnow: perfect location near resturants and attractoins. Club lounge is well above expectations
title: great hotel
comment: this one of the best Belvoir hotels I have stayed at recently. The lobby is emacluate and the rooms are well maintained. The location is perfect for several attractions and resturants within walking distance. it has one of the best club lounges Belvoir has to offer.

everyoneShouldKnow: Outstanding cuisine and Service knowledgeable and friendly staff
title: Transportation
comment: Sandi at Front desk was excellent at helping me arrange for a shuttle to pick me up after my late arrival - she booked car - followed up with me to confirm I had all the details and checked in to ensure all had gone well and if I needed assistance for return service. -- Outstanding!!!!

title: Great Value & Great Location
comment: The Dolphin was a beautiful hotel and the location can not be beat. The proximity to the Boardwalk, Epcot & Hollywood Studios was key for us and the value was exceptional compared to other hotels in the area.

title: Excellent Hotel Choice
comment: Great location, close to the studios!

everyoneShouldKnow: U WILL WANT FOR NOTHING IF U STAY HERE!!!!!! Except to extend your stay....
title: awesome!!!!!!!
comment: The hotel has it all....great food...shopping...swimming...a beach...and great staff who r here to help u and make ur stay amazing!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The restaurant is aweful. The food is never good and the service is marginal at best.
title: no club access
comment: Since this property no longer allows BPG Gold level members access to the club lounge, I specifically purchased a room with king size bed and club level access. When I got up in the morning and tried to access the club my key did not work. There was not enough time time to go downstairs and reprogram the and go back upstairs to get breakfast in the club without missing the van and waiting another 20 mins.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is centrally located and close to mall and transportation.
title: Everything at this hotel was the greatest
comment: I have never been at such a near perfect hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I really liked the lovely shower curtains--so white and pretty. The bathroom looked brand new. The staff was very helpful and courteous.

title: This hotel knows the meaning of service
comment: I work for a company which provides a service to clients so when I am the customer I pay attention. I was welcomed immediately and by the time I arrived in my room the phone was flashing with a message asking me if there were any problems with the room. I also ordered room service one morning and I had barely sipped my coffee and taken a bite when my phone rang asking if everything was ok and if I needed anything else. The restaurant was delicious and there was the same attention to detail. Water glasses were kept filled and the staff was very attentive. An added plus was the fact that much of the food served was grown in the garden of the farm on the same property of the complex. I stayed 2 nights and enjoyed the entire stay. I also attended a conference at the conference center. Assuming this is part of the hotel I will include my praise. The latest high tech equipment is in each board room. The bathroom was huge, beautiful, and spotless! The live plants were a nice touch. There was always ice cold water(with lemon), coffee, tea, or soda available. I can't say enough as I was truely impressed!

everyoneShouldKnow: Room Service closes early - nowhere to eat at this hotel if you get in late.
title: Average at best
comment: No dining and food and beverage options past 11pm - not even room service?

everyoneShouldKnow: Older Hotel. Looks dark and dirty sometimes
title: Hotel Stay
comment: I stayed at this location on several occasions, approximately 20 nights. The Hotel tends to host large groups of people, and if you have the bad luck to be put on a floor with a large group, chances are that it will be noizy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Look at the hotel map when booking a room to make sure that the specific location meets your needs.
title: Excellent experience
comment: We stayed in an ocean view room and were very happy with the view, decor, and cleanliness.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's very clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful.
title: Satisfied customer
comment: My stay at the Belvoir was 8/19/12 through 8/24/12. The hotel entrance is on a very narrow one way street. Upon my arrival, there was a limo blocking part of the street where guests could park their car to check-in. Since I didnt think there was a place to park, I drove around the block and found a parking lot to park my car while I walked to the hotel to check-in and inquire about the parking. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The Belvoir doesnt have any parking, but they recommended a lot one street over. You can have valet service parking which is $39 a day w/ in and out privileges or you can walk over and pick up car on your own for $25 a day which I chose to do. Now on your first day at the hotel, they will have someone drive your car to the lot without being charged the valet cost. However, you will have to pick your car up on day of departure if you dont want to pay $39 a day. Not a big deal since lot is a short walking distance, but it is in a sketchy area. The best thing to do is not have a car to park. There is plenty of public transportation. Buy an MTA card with unlimited usage, depending on your stay, and you can take the bus or subway all day long. I bought a 7-day card for $29 and never had to use my car. Anyway, back to the hotel. Its very nice. The room was very clean with white linens. Bed and pillows were very comfy. I had a room with two double beds. There was an armoire sized closet to hang clothes, but no drawers. There is a safe for money or jewelry. Easy to use with a swipe of a credit card instead of having to remember a code. There is a large desk and chair if you need to work. I didnt because I was on vacation, yay! There is a coffee maker with Starbucks coffee available. Water was provided for a charge. Not sure if coffee was free or not since Im not a coffee drinker. The 42 TV was nice, although the cable connection needs fixing. Short breaks in programs every now and then causing missed dialogue. Maybe wifi has something to do with it, which is free in the lobby. The view from my room was horrible. Looked at a construction site with large crane lovely. Didnt really bother me though because the location of the crane was actually helpful when trying to get my sense of direction outside the hotel. I could just look up and find the crane and know where hotel was. The hotel has a small pool, hot tub, and sunning area on the second floor. The second floor also has a work out area that can be accessed with your room key, which is really a card. (who uses keys anymore, right?) Also, youll need keycard to use elevator to go to your room. Pain in the pants, but good security measure. Another feature to your room, you can earn $5 coupon if you dont have maid service every day. Keepin it green gets you $5 off at their restaurant. Grubsteak is the hotel restaurant. Had breakfast there one morning with coupon in hand. No other customers were in the restaurant probably because it was like a freezer in there. The thermostat had to be set at 600, so much for going green. Brrrrr. I like it cold, but that was too cold. I think it probably drove a few customers away while I was there too. Now, about the surrounding area. During the day, theres plenty of hustle and bustle. No need to feel afraid to roam the streets. Juniors restaurant is very close. Juniors is a diner thats famous for their cheesecake. There are also plenty of pizza shops to buy a slice of pie. To go downtown Manhattan, the Jay St. subway station is just a couple streets over from the hotel. Brooklyn Heights is a very nice area that you can get to on foot. To get into eastern part of Brooklyn, walk to Myrtle Ave. and take the B54 into Ridgewood. This is during the day. At night, you have to be more cautious. The area is dark and deserted. Keep in mind when returning to your hotel. The area is in transition with lots of construction going on. The price of this hotel is much cheaper than in Manhattan and quality of hotel is probably better, as well. I enjoyed my stay and would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Great location
comment: This is the first time we stayed at the Dolphin. It was a weekend anniversary trip.

title: Comfortable, convenient hotel
comment: Nice, comfortable room, although did have to move rooms as first room allocated was not up to expectations as it didn't have a balcony and was directly next to the pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has a great lobby area and a short walk to the beach.
title: Last Minute Trip
comment: I thought the room was comfortable and clean. The lobby area was very attractive and comfortable. The hotel is a short walk to the beach, so you don't have to pay another parking fee.

title: Great place to relax!
comment: My apartment had been flooded out so I used some of my BPG points to stay here. The room was outstanding, TV was great and customer service was good. Only problem was Internet access, I tried rebooting my laptop three times and played with settings but was unable to connect. I called the front desk and after a long hold was advised to use the Lobby Internet access.

title: This hotel is excellent for family
comment: We stay at Belvoir Waikiki for 6 nights. Our 4 yrs old son has a good time at Keiki pool and waikiki beach. We love Kai market restaurant, they have variety food for all of us. We leave your place with smile and best memory Thank you. We'll be back again.

title: Beautiful facility
comment: This is a lovely hotel with comfortable beds. I enjoyed being able to walk across the street to an enormous shopping mall with a large food court. Booking the club level saves lots on food costs plus its a great place to relax. Everything was very clean and well-cared for.

title: This hotel is becoming shabby.
comment: I have stayed at this hotel several times. This time I was on the club floor and the room had a large hole in the carpet at the entry. The sliding mirrored doors were off the track and the light in the entry hall was burned out. The tub was worn.

title: Great Location! Rooms! Facilities!
comment: Loved the location of this hotel! Quick walk to Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, Rush Street, right on the river. And to add to the lovely location the rooms, staff and everything else was great too!

everyoneShouldKnow: Double room is very comfortable; staff is friendly and helpful
title: A little improvement, but overall very good.
comment: The location and room comfort was excellent. The room itself needed a little more attention. The bathroom tub was wet and had hair in it. The dairy creamer for the coffee was spoiled and solid. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Though they did not offer any BPG incentives.

title: Disappointed - not Belvoir Standard
comment: We were staying for the AIr Show 2012. The front desk staff were excellent and recognized my status, however going to the elevators and then my room was disapponting. I have stayed with Belvoir for my time share and BPG and they did not meet the expectations that all others have. The room smelled like cigarette and cigar smoke. The bathroom had long strands of black hair in the tub and all over the bathroom floor. Toilet under rim was not cleaned properly, We also had a socket in our room below the fire alarm that the plate was broken and had exposed wires. There was also black mold on the vents above the 2nd floor elevators and we informed the desk of it and none of this was addressed or taken care of. Very Disappointed as a frequent Belvoir Guest.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is hard to find - keep looking. Very nice accomadtations once you're there
title: Hide and Seek
comment: The hotel was lovely and we had a great meal at the inhouse restaurant. But our stay was somewhat like playing hide and seek. Signage for the hotel on the approaching highway is non-existent. Signage at the actual street for the property is set back from the road and is at ground level - nearly impossible to detect until you have passed the turn. No indication which of two sets of entry doors lead you to the front desk. Entrance to the restaurant from the interior of the hotel is at the back of the bar with no directions as to where the hostess station is located. One could call this a "hidden gem". Why not make it easy for guests to find, stay and dine rather than a guessing game?

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff ar=t registration could care less if you're unhappy!
title: Terrible Experience
comment: We did not know our parlor room had no dresser. The keys needed to be changed at least 2 times a day, the worst was the embarrassment we were caused because check in process was never conveyed to the proper person. Our room was being paid for by the organization paying for many other rooms and the hotel actually called the CEO of our conference to tell him that we did not have a valid credit card on file. Three other people were also told and we were thouroughly mortified.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff - clean rooms, Great location..
title: Complicated Stay
comment: Spent many night here over the past 3 years. Don't have many bad experiences. Had to check in at 1:00am due to my arrival and went straight to work. Didn't get back until 7:00am so I didn't get the no maid points. Had to change rooms because the AC was making noise so missed out on the points again. Normally I'm asked at check in because of my status but no mention was ever made.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Restaurant is 5 star.... excellent excellent staff and Chef
title: Wow look @ the view!!
comment: I have to say, this was our first strip to Cuyahoga falls, Ohio.... in fact it was our first trip to Ohio. The Hotel was spectacular. The front desk staff was awesome(Simon), they made everything perfect and bent over backwards to make our stay wonderful. The Restaurant Sunday brunch was amazing, and the staff in the Novo Lounge were engaging and interactive (Juan). We left feeling like we were leaving home and will miss the staff the amenities and the view of the falls most. With warm memories and looking forward to coming back.

title: Great location
comment: Staff was very accommodating. Our room was upgraded from partial to deluxe ocean view upon arrival. Enjoyed the Infinity pool and nightly entertainment.

everyoneShouldKnow: if you don't want your room cleaned, you receive a $5 credit.
title: Great Location
comment: Front desk staff and pool staff were very courteous and polite. Allan is to be commended for his client service. The fitness center was very clean, spacious and a wide variety of different equipment.

title: very friendly, helpful staff
comment: all the staff was very friendly and helpful, always willing to go out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. the hotel was very clean and well maintained. hotel location was great for nearby sightseeing. beds were very comfortable.

title: The hotel was great
comment: This was the first time that we use the club lounge the morning was excellent the evening was a little disappointing, excepted more.

everyoneShouldKnow: BPG club lounge is a nice touch!
title: very happy!
comment: I was nervous about staying at this Belvoir after reading the negative reviews, but I must say my husband and I were very pleased with the accommodations. Granted, it's not the most modern, updated hotel but it was clean and the room was nicely appointed and spacious. As BPG members we had access to the club lounge, which offers free wi-fi, computers and complimentary beverages and snacks until 10pm. That was a nice touch, and it was nice having access to Starbucks coffee! The continental breakfast was adequate... come on people, it's a continental breakfast...you can't expect a ten course hot meal!!! The staff was very friendly, and checking in and out was a breeze. I highly recommend!

everyoneShouldKnow: Best staff ever very helpful, courteous and accomadating
title: favorite hotel
comment: We love the Dolphin and stay here every year, staff is great, rooms are so comfortable love love this place. Colleen

everyoneShouldKnow: Location. The ABQ area is very close & has good shopping & food options including a TraderJoes.
title: Great stay
comment: We did the upgrade to the club level & it was great. The hot nibbles at night & the breakfast in the morning were very good. Great location & very friendly staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff will assure you of everything but in the end, they don't follow through.
title: Reservation/Billing Errors
comment: Folio was billed to incorrect credit card after being assured it would not be billed. Major hassle and headache at checkout since staff failed to extend original reservation by one day (once again, assured by staff this had been taken care of but . . . no). Staff really didn't care when it came time to check out that all the assurances made never were actually achieved. Very, very disappointed.

title: Excellent staff
comment: One of the best things here is how the staff goes out of their way to meet your needs. Also, the beds were comfortable and the views from the room were amazing. I would definitely stay at this hotel if I have the opportunity to visit San Diego again.

everyoneShouldKnow: there is no wireless access in the guest rooms. If you depend on wireless access to be able to work as I do, you may wantto reconsider.
title: Average Belvoir but below expecations
comment: This hotel is older but undergoing renovations. My room was renovated was clean and a very typical Belvoir hotel room. However there is no Wifi in the rooms. There is hard wired internet access which worked well for my laptop but I could not use my tablet unless I went down to the lobby. Also there is no club lounge. My understanding is that there will be once the renos are complete. I am not sure about the wireless access. I would not stay here agin unless I knew that wirelesswas available

title: Great
comment: Great service while undergoing renovation and the crowd

everyoneShouldKnow: One of the best Hotel in Orlando.
title: One of the best
comment: We love this hotel. We stayed here for the second time and we will come back again before Thanksgiving. Nice ambiance, clean, good location -safe area. Very courteous staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: close proximity to hershey park and shopping.
title: great stay
comment: great hotel. have stayed here the past 3 years while traveling to hershey park with my family. rooms are clean, staff is accommodating, and in a great area. my only complaint is the pull out sofa bed and refrigerator. pull out sofa extremely uncomfortable, the coils dig into your back. the mini fridge in the room was leaking water. there was a puddle in the cabinet its in. other than that, plan on staying here again when we visit hershey park.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location to the airport and many local businesses.
title: Needs Fixing
comment: I am an BPG. platinum member and average about 78 stays per year. This hotel is showing its age and is in need of an upgrade. The restaurant and lobby are great but the rooms are certainly worn - even on the club floor. Customer service at the desk ranges from excellent to severely lacking depending on who is working. My room had wall paper peeling at the seems and ceiling cracks and water stains.

everyoneShouldKnow: all the staff are extrm=emely attentive, courteous and maintain all of the property in an excellent state.
title: great service
comment: The locaton was perfect for my needs - the staff and service were excelent in all respects. The room and faciities were clean, I will return and would recommend for anyone that needs accomodations in Atlanta.

title: Food
comment: The resturants were not up to my expectations. I was not happy with the food and the cost for what you got was not in proportion to the price.

title: Great Stay!
comment: We stayed for 2 nights. Everything was great! Room was spacious and clean. Pool and hot tub were wonderful. Right on the beach- which was also wonderful. We may have had a quick stay but it was a wonderful one!

title: Seattle
comment: Hotel was clean

everyoneShouldKnow: Conveniently located near DC and the Pentagon.
title: Free WiFi & Free Parking
comment: I think you can improve your hotel guests experience by not nickel and dimeing them with parking and WiFi charges on their bill. Also,during renovations like now when you have no pool, health center or restaurants, you need to give out something else.

everyoneShouldKnow: The comfortable atmosphere in a beautiful setting make it wonderfully peaceful.
title: The views and service are impeccable
comment: The service is fantastic and friendly. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The room service and breakfast offerings are varied and delicious.

title: Brooklyn NY Belvoir
comment: Outstanding property. The staff is fantastic and with the leadership of the general manager Marie they excel in every hospitality category. I travel frequently and stay in facilities all over the country. This is one of the best.

everyoneShouldKnow: The breakfast service is slow due to only one person being there. Sometimes there are very long lines there and it takes a while to get served.
title: Lighting
comment: We found it annoying that the bathroom and the wash room were on the same light switch even though they are different rooms. This made it impossible for someone to turn on the light in the middle of the night without waking everyone up.

everyoneShouldKnow: Overall, the staff tries to be very helpful.
title: Good staff compensated for most issues
comment: College cheer camp made our last night at the hotel a nightmare - with hotel staff unable to stop the noise even after calling the desk at 1:30 am. Desk staff in the morning compensated us with Starpoints, which was nice, but there needs to be better management for such events.

title: Towels smell like vomit
comment: Location is great for theatre. Our stay was quite Belvoir average - but the towels smelled of vomit, and even when we requested replacements, they still smelled. Also, they used some sort of air freshener that was toxic - it permeated our lungs and caused us to cough and wheeze. I would not choose this Grandbourne hotel again...

everyoneShouldKnow: It's location - on a lake surrounded by trees. Very peaceful.
title: Great Stay!
comment: I haven't stayed in a hotel where I'm not at top loyalty status in quite awhile, but I have to say that I really enjoyed my stay here. The hotel location is great and the staff was extremely efficient and accommodating. I will definitely stay there again!

title: Needs some updating
comment: Hotel rooms need some updating, especially carpet.

title: We had a great time
comment: This was our second time staying here and it was just as good as our first experience if not better. The hotel is very clean ,the rooms are comfortable and the staff is very polite and helpful.We would definitely stay here again.

title: Exceeded my expectations
comment: a great hotel. wonderful, friendly staff. The gym was amazing - i wish i had more time to workout, as I would have definitely made more use of the gym.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent service by all employees throughout the hotel.
title: Location, Location!
comment: My recent stay at the Chicago Belvoir on the Club floor was great. The amenities provided on the Club Level boardered on the terrific with the appetizers in the evening and the breakfast. Staff in the Club lounge were attentive and friendly. Only five blocks from Navy Pier provided a great walk.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have issues this place goes above to help correct it.
title: Ocean Front Vacation
comment: We had an awesome time on our vacation. First night at this facility was a bit of a surprise,we went to go to sleep and the sheets were dirty. The night time manager after much a due did right the wrong and she made sure we got points back for the problems we had. After that one bump we had a really nice stay. All the staff was courteous and helpful. The Hotel is on the boardwalk and you can walk pretty much any where you may need to go. Waking up to the ocean and seeing the sun rise every day was wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: The view of the marina from my balcony where I sat with a glass of wine couldn't be beat!
title: Has it ALL!
comment: The phenominal views from almost every room in the hotel to the fabulous service from everyone working at this property it's top rate! Small negative is you are very close to the airport which does yield some noise.

everyoneShouldKnow: They do respond to your needs.
title: Thank you for your responsiveness
comment: We have stayed here comfortably several times. This is the first time we have encountered a glitch, in this case with the A/C in our room on arrival, and we were very pleased with your responsiveness in relocating us. We have always appreciated your efforts in de-feathering our room. Too bad to give up the lovely down accessories, but they don't agree with us and you have always responded. Thanks.

title: don't get a suite, or check in on time.
comment: I arrived a few minutes early to check in. My room wasn't ready, but the woman checking me in said it should be within a half an hour, and said they would call me when my room was ready. Fortunately, I had another friend staying there in a different room. I put my things in her room, we went to the pool, where the bartender was AWFUL! He gave us one drink, and never came back to our table. I was there until 5pm, and still, no call. I called the front desk, my room was ready. I had a king suite, with 3 guests. There was NO extra bedding for the fold out bed. You would expect they if it took 2 EXTRA hours to clean it, the room would have been ready, and equipped for the number of guests on the reservation. (Also, I was surprised that a suite has no coffee maker). The next morning, the housekeeper knocked on the door at 9:30am, and wanted to CLEAN, REALLY?? a late check in and an early check out? When I checked out, and told them what had happened, all they offered was a swift " I'm sorry ma'am, really sorry about that" and no other compensation. I was really expecting more out of this highly recommended hotel. Unfortunately, I never plan to stay here again.

title: Pilot
comment: Great staff and adminities.

title: Good but dissappointing
comment: Checkin and lobby staff as well as the staff answering the phone, were friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and met my needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: location and better than what is available
title: Hotel Convenience
comment: I have made it a habit to stay at this hotel when in Duluth on business. While it could be updated with some more conveniences I find it better situated and more accomodating than anything else Duluth has to offer for business travelers.

title: Easy access to Adelphi and College Park, Maryland
comment: A stone's throw from I-95 at the Capital Beltway north of Washington, D.C., this hotel's location is the reason we choose it. The staff are friendly and do a good job of making us feel at home. While I didn't use the in-room refrigerator or microwave oven this visit, it is great to have the option!

title: Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Staff
comment: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in late August. Staff is friendly and attentive, clean and beautiful hotel. Always greeted with a smile and a hello. Mckinley Grill serves a wonderful array of food with very friendly prices. Staff and management very knowledgeable and curtious. Pool area is clean and well managed. And the new Belvoir Fitness center enhanced by Core fitness is outstanding. Would stay again anytime.

title: This hotel has great features
comment: Love the screens in the windows that allows for fresh air at night. great breakfast, and the Friday night wine tasting was terrific.

title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: The housekeeping staff was wonderful; Grounds are beautiful; room very clean and comfortable; location excellent. The only negative of an otherwise wonderful stay was at check in. The tone of the woman checking me in was somewhat harsh. I had a wedding to attend that day and had requested, at the time of booking, an early check in. I realize the hotel cannot guarantee this but I don 't expect to be chastised for such a request.

title: Staff good, hotel OK, room below avg
comment: My TV did not work. I did not have a frig. I had 2 beds instead of a queen or king.

title: Disappointing
comment: Having stayed at this hotel several times I have come to hold it to a very high standard. Unfortunately that expectation was not met on a recent visit. I was not recognized as a Platinum member, was not offered a choice of amenity at cehck-in (was told "you'll get points) and did not have access to the Club Floor when attempted to do so from the elevator (I had been given a room on another floor). When I went back down to the front desk to have my keys re-done I was told it was a rookie mistake by the front desk person who had checked me in. This was even though a cohort actually waited on me the second time. Perhaps there is a new manager at this hotel as my previous experiences have been excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very good bar and food service.
title: Always Great
comment: I have stayed at this hotel many times and always enjoy my stay.

title: Mr & Mrs
comment: Everything was excellent, except the food and it's prices. Prices were too high. Had to leave hotel to get reasonable prices.

everyoneShouldKnow: They may charge you twice for the service provided. Watch out for your bills.
title: Incompetent accounting and lack of service
comment: Watch out for their accounting errors! I stayed there and got some dry cleanings done. They double billed me and haven't dealt with the problem after a week! Besides this annoying experience, I found there is lack of service. People are not bothered to introduce what breakfast service they have or to supply the basic courtesy.

title: Extremely well situated
comment: I was very pleased with this Belvoir property. As a bonus, it is located near some excellent restaraunts and great shopping.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has a great location to downtown, southtown and the freeway. There is a train track close by, but i never had a problem sleepin because of it.
title: winning hotel
comment: I have stayed here for two weeks and can say i have been very pleased with the staff and the room. The most important thing I want in a great hotel stay has been met with flying colors! The bed, the pillows, the sheets and quilt....all are very very comfortable.

title: Great deal for the point value
comment: We stayed here as a one-night stop before returning home. The rooms were comfortable and clean. It's a bit further than walking distance from Disneyland but if you're not looking for that specific feature, it's great.

title: Great Service
comment: The hotel staff are great and very nice. Special attention to David at front desk and Rocha at the restaurant. They are very nice guys and gave me and my mom all the attention we needed to be confortable at the hotel.

title: Great for work and relas
comment: Hotel had a desk for late night work. It was also had a pool and Spa for relaxation.

title: Verynice hotel
comment: Large, comfortable room and a nice hotel lobby with facilities.

everyoneShouldKnow: good non casino location in Atlantic
title: good non-casino location
comment: hotel was within walking distance of boardwalk and outlet stores. Parking was expensive and not attached to hotel. Indoor pool small but fitness center well equiped. We experienced TV problems that were unresolved but did receive compensation for our inconvenience.. Room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was only average but overpriced. I would rate this as average but because of location I would return.

title: Services
comment: Given breakfast coupons, but for continentinal only, not really worth going downstairs for. Rooms need refrigerators and microwaves for guest staying more than three days. Real coffee pots needed in rooms.

title: No bells or whistles
comment: This hotel does need some attention. I had a reservation, using BPG points, and upon arrival at 8:30 pm my room was not ready. I had asked for an upgrade, which is customary as I am a gold member. They did not offer an upgrade, and after I asked, the rooms available were not clean. It's 8:30pm. They should have had my room already set aside for upgrade and checked to make sure all was in order. I also was not impressed with the fact that after I checked in, went to my room and returned to the lobby, approximately 20 minutes later, to find the lobby full. A bus had unloaded and the people were waiting to check in. I wondered if their rooms where ready or if they received higher level rooms over BPG clients.

everyoneShouldKnow: if you can access the club level area its fantastic,they have free internet access plus breakfast is complimentary.
title: convenient
comment: if you have a conference,a very convenient hotel because its across the convention center.the walk which is the outlet is within walking distance.its further from the noise of the boardwalk.

title: Services
comment: I was disappointed to arrive after hours of traveling and after check-in time and still had to wait two-three hours for a room. The services after this was wonderful! I could not have asked for a more of a positive experience.

title: Great location
comment: Awesome view of NYC and easy to get there. Ferry right outsidet the door which will take you accross into midtown and then you can take a bus almost all the way down to lower Manhatan. Also lots of places close by in Hoboken to eat.

everyoneShouldKnow: They take care of their customers!
title: My favorite place to stay in Chicago
comment: I've stayed here several times and love this place and its location! They beautifully handled their recent overbooking error by putting me up at another close by hotel for one night, comping the charge, and giving me cab fare! They also upgraded my room the next day when I returned, and even gave me access to the Club Lounge area. They made lemonade out of a lemon!

title: wonderful features
comment: Location, comfort, cleaniness,& good service

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent loaction for airport, MT Pleasant and downtown Charleston.
title: Nice Place Some Issues
comment: My wife and I reserved 4 nights in mid August. The hotel was busy which I hoped would nit mean lots of noise. It didn't. The hotel needs to keep the pool cleaner, pay attention to the condition of the linens and get the TV's replace with better quality. The Fitness Center was way above expectation and the staff was efficient for every request.

title: Great First Stay in Virginia Beach
comment: First time to Virginia Beach - we decided to stay at the Belvoir based on other reviews and pictures on the internet. The hotel met our expectation in every way. It was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is right on the beach and has an indoor and outdoor pool. Thanks Belvoir!!

title: Excellent downtown location
comment: I loved the walkability of the downtown area from this location. The accommodation were just great and everything you needed was right there.

title: Downtown Denver Belvoir
comment: Arrived around 3pm after driving 7 hours to be told our room was not ready, they said they were at capacity the night before... waited for 1 - 1/2 hours before our room was ready and all we got was they were sorry, so much for BPG recognition :-(

title: Belvoir Arlington Hotel
comment: Excellent facility. Pool area was great for relaxation. Food is a little overpriced. Not a lot of area choices for food. Staff was excellent, very polite. Shuttle service was excellent and free. Nice easy walk to Texas Rangers Stadium, the reason why I was there.

title: One bad customer experience
comment: Checked in on 8-19-12. Sometime during the night the wall started humming which did not stop until 7:30 AM. No sleep that night. Next night same thing and was moved to an even noiser room and then finally a quiet room at 2 AM. No one to help us move. Checked out to a bill $60.00 over quoted rate. UGGGG

everyoneShouldKnow: Conveniently located to Sesame Place, shopping and restaurants.
title: Great Family Hotel
comment: Its a great family hotel. Clean hotel, friendly staff that will go out of their way to make your stay a very comfortable one.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location - friendly and helpful staff.
title: Pillowcases and towels
comment: Pillowcases and towels had a sour smell, similar to what I've experienced in cheaper hotels. It was very off-putting, as I had to go through quite a few to find some that smelled fresh. Maybe your laundry should consider changing its detergent.

title: Good Stay
comment: I generally stay in mid town but decided to give this hotel a try. The experiemnt worked because it caused me to explore an area of NYC that I would not normally travel to. I do like the newness of the hotel and the starbucks in the lobby.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parts of the hotel are a bit aged but the rooms are renovated and we had no issues with the rooms or facilities
comment: We had a very enjoyable stay for 7 days. Staff were excellent, pool was great. Convenient location.

title: Beautiful hotel
comment: The lobby and room were very nice. A nice safety feature was that you had to have a key to get to the floors that had guest rooms on them.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient access to most anything, it's central downtown location
title: This hotel is centrally located and convenient
comment: This hotel is centrally located and convenient to many points of interest in Seattle and to moderately priced restaurants which is great for conference attendees.

title: Unaccomodating & Unsympathetic
comment: With a hurricane brewing in the Caribbean expected to make land fall at or near Key West during my stay, i called the hotel on the wednesday before my friday afternoon arrival. After being shuffled around and continuously on hold with the hotel and Reservations, i finally was informed that i could not cancel nor reschedule my visit unless there was a mandatory visitor evacuation of Key West. After reviewing information from the National Hurricane Center (coupled with my 30 years of living in South Florida), i realized that it was highly likely that a visitor evacation would occur sometime during my stay. Numerous times i was told by the Belvoir's resident meteriologists that this would never happen. I told them what a predicament this left me in being unable to cancel or reschedule. I would have to begin my travels on friday morning, a 4 hour+ drive from Fort Lauderdale (our friends from Baltimore were traveling a much greater distance to reach us first of course). If an evacuation was ordered while driving down i would have to turn around. If it occurred after i got there, it could be an 8 hour drive for nothing. But instead of offering me to reschedule or cancel so that i could go to another Belvoir in say Orlando, Holly at the front desk told me that's why people get Travel Insurance. So given my predicament and the condescending attitudes, it was either travel 4+ hours on friday with the hopes of being able to stay more than 24 hours or sacrifice 24,000 points and several hundred dollars on the 2nd suite i also reserved (trying my best to not be specific).

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Have stayed twice in several months, both times for business and extended stay over the weekend for pleasure. It's now my go to location in SD!

title: If only their food was better
comment: I spent there more than 40 days in total in the last 6 months and the staff is fantastic, rooms are very comfortable, clean, and well designed (you will love or hate decor depending on your taste). Views are beautiful (if you get the right room) and while the pool is rather small (3 strokes free style to travel the length of it) it is well kept.

everyoneShouldKnow: GREAT VIEWS from high floors and close to AIRPORT and RAIL STATION!
title: Excellent to me as BPG GOLD!!
comment: Very appreciative and pleased in every way with special treatment to us as BPG GOLD with upgrade!! Loved club and bottled water!!

title: Watch out for hidden charges
comment: The last few times that I've stayed, I have found incorrect charges added to my bill. This time, it was a charge for the Internet. Once or twice might be a mistake, but it has happened too many times at this hotel. At least there are other options to stay downtown.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is where you want to stay when in Bostoin!
title: The Place to Stay!
comment: Couldn't ask for better! Friendly staff, clean room and great rate,

title: Regular Florida Visitor
comment: if you are travelling from the UK this is a fabulous resort for your holiday. An ideal location for all of the parks and shopping. Super apartments and facilities with decent priced quality food on site. Particularly like the pool areas and late night jacuzzis after a busy day at the parks. Liked it so much I bought 3 weeks.and have never had a bad experience in 10 trips. This is a vacation owners resort so If your not interested in vacation ownership just say noor ignore they won;t bother you again.

title: Service was fabulous
comment: From check in to check out every staff member that I came in contact with was super friendly and very helpful!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Green Program - Loved the idea!
title: Location
comment: Best location for the city of Seattle. We could walk ever where. Close to public transportation if we needed it!

everyoneShouldKnow: It transports you to a real getaway....
title: Best Hotel
comment: Exceeds all expectations. We were treated like royalty and family by the staff and offered luxury at a ultra reasonable cost. I recommend this hotel for all.

title: Problems
comment: I was very disapointed that there was a charge on the wireless signal in the rooms and because I was staying multiple days it would have been nice to have room in the mini refrigerator to store things. It just felt like there was a charge on any incedentals and no extra niceties.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, usually the staff are very friendly and accommodating, excellent food although a limited menu
title: BPG Recognition
comment: Used my BPG points, didn't get the room we wanted, even though we checked in at 1:30 and although the hotel was quite busy, many guests had still not checked in so not quite sure why thy couldn't accommodate us? Previous stays were very nice, most staff very helpful, Club Lounge staff VERY nice.

title: Change are a disappointment
comment: Starting breakfast at 7:30 is too late for a business person. Reduction in evening hours and selection poor - no cookies even. No water in BPG rooms and no welcome tray. Rates going up and service going down. Getting more and more like their sister property across the street who is always cheaper. Disappointing.

everyoneShouldKnow: just ok, not worth the price..........
title: room ok, staff not.
comment: Except for our friendly breakfast waiter (Mario) and one of the concierges (Lucie)who was pleasant and also gave correct information (others we deal with did not!) the staff was unpleasant and curt.

title: Short Stay
comment: The room was clean and comfortable. The a/c worked very well. Always love the beds at Belvoir. Bathroom could have been alittle larger.

title: wonderful location
comment: The bathroom had hair from previous visitors. I reported it to the desk but it was not cleaned for the 4 nights I was there. The carpet looked as if it had not been vacuumned.

title: Fabulous Hotel
comment: The room was recently renovated and was extremely pretty and very comfortable. We were pleasantly surprised. We are alumni and the hotel has NEVER looked so good. The hotel has a gym and an indoor pool which was a great activity for our younger children.

everyoneShouldKnow: "Harbor view" rooms don't necessarily look toward the harbor.
title: Customer Review
comment: I am giving the hotel one star rating only because my reservation expectations were unfulfilled. My reservation was for 7 rooms with harbor view near each other. When my foreign national guests and I checked-in, we were scattered throughout the hotel. Several of my us were given leftover corner rooms on second floor with no views. When I asked about the situation, a receptionist explained that corner rooms on harbor side are technically harbor view rooms. If that is fact, I recommend changing "harbor view" to "harbor side". There was no explanation as to why we were not in the same area per our reservation. Other aspects of the hotel was fine. Continental breakfast was excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: A very loud street fair occurs every Thursday in August outside the rear of the hotel.
title: Going Green
comment: Don't go green. The $5 coupon for use in the hotel dining faciliies does not warrant a bed not made up, waste baskets not dumped, nor coffee refreshed. We were not told until we were departing that no one would come near our room while we were there if we went green.

title: Downhill.....
comment: I have stayed at this hotel over 100 nights in the last several years and the last 3 trips ALL have been bad. During this last stay I said something to the front desk about my issue... and was told..."sorry to hear that"

title: Great Hotel
comment: The location near the conference center was excellent. Hotel was very clean and staff was wonderful. I greatly enjoyed my stay.

title: An Unexpected Pleasure
comment: It was the nicest stay on our trip from Baltimore to San Antonio. Loved Shulas"s for dinner, and your wonderful chef-prepared omellets for breakfast. Had a wonderful night's sleep, thanks to your super comfortable beds. We might return to Roanoke just to experience another night at your hotel.

title: EVP/General Counsel
comment: We were on a very tight short time schedlue for business trip that required us to be at the airport for a 5:30am flight.

title: Excellent Again
comment: Although I rarely get to experience the joy of visiting Alaska, I have always been treated as a valued guest at the Belvoir. On this trip which was for business only, it was the high point of my short stay.

title: Staff was very responsive
comment: My entire stay was very comfortable. Everytime I asked a staff member a question they went out of their way to answer it and provide additional information. I left an item in my room and called the hotel as soon as I got to the airport. They sent housekeeping, retrieved it and took it to the safe until my colleague could pick it up. I would stay here again if in Seattle.

everyoneShouldKnow: Centrally located in the heart of Atlantic City
title: Great Night!
comment: We had a great night of sleep. Very comfortable room, bed, and decor. I was very impressed with the quality of room we received for the price. Thank you.

title: Great week in New Orleans
comment: The hotel's location was great and the service was very good

title: Excellent Customer Service
comment: It was my first trip back since the remodeling. Very nice! Everyone was friendly and helpful. Over the course of our 3 day class I never heard a single complaint from any of my students and the staff was very attentive to any special request or change great job!

title: love this place
comment: favorite place to stay in NOLA. construction still a bit annoying though.

title: Below my expectations
comment: Overall my stay at the Belvoir was just Okay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Did not have to wait in line. Fast and friendly.
title: Great Staff
comment: Fast, friendly service from the moment we drove up to the hotel, till we when we checked out. Great staff, clean rooms, great food. Thank you for a stress free stay.

title: Very Pleasant
comment: Really a nice, relaxing stay -- and I was on business!

everyoneShouldKnow: Free WIFI and Exceptionally Comfortable Beds
title: Very Comfortable Beds
comment: I never sleep well in a hotel, however, I get some of my best nights sleep when I stay at Belvoir Myrtle Beach

title: Excellent
comment: Good pool and comfortable facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can't go to the lounge and the balcony without being a club member or paying extra.
title: Great location!
comment: The location is fabulous - close to 2 subway lines, Soho, Little Italy, and Chinatown. Th Starbucks in the lobby was great, as was the Starbucks provided in the rooms. The room was large and kept very clean, and the bed linens were extremely comfortable. The concierge was knowledgable, friendly, and very helpful. Would have liked to see the lounge, but didn't want to pay $75 extra! Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone!

title: Always my 1s choice
comment: Love this Hotel, will always be my first pick when visiting NY.

everyoneShouldKnow: How polite and accomodating every was.
title: Accomodating Hotel
comment: The staff were polite and genuinely concern about your stay. The rooms were clean and well stock, and we recieved complimentary bottle water every day. The food in the restuarant was great!! The hotel is in a great location, and the garden was beautiful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Definitely try the salmon on the menu!
title: Week Long Stay
comment: Stayed here for a full week. the room was very clean, and tha staff were all friendly. I would definately stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is very good for shopping and public transportation access.
title: Belvoir Boston okay and good
comment: Arrival: We arrived at the Belvoir Boston Hotel on a Thursday around 1:30pm. We proceeded to the check-in area to check-in. This area is a bit confusing they have a check-in line but no real check-in line for BPG Gold Members. They do have a BPG desk so we walked to that area and we were greeted quickly. Tom who checked us in was friendly and gave me the room requests I had asked for without any issues. Check-in was quick and friendly.

title: Most recent Portland stay
comment: While I have stayed at the Portland Airport Belvoir on many earlier occasions, I rate this stay very highly, in large part due to the exceptional courtesy and efficiency of the desk staff; they made this a sincularly pleasant experience.

title: There were issues with my room, 1217
comment: Air conditioning - engineer needed to come in change filter and bleed lines - too hot.

title: All Around Exceptional Stay!
comment: Check in staff was most helpful.

title: Impressed w/ Staff
comment: Front Desk Staff was very friendly and thorough. Handled my late check out well, called to confirm the late check out to make sure I was not disturbed.

title: This hotel is located in the perfect location near the wharf!
comment: Great staff and location! Very clean.

title: CHECKING INN
comment: JESSICA AT THE RESVATION WAS WONDERFUL. HAD ASICK CHILD AND HER HELP WILL Be REMBEMBERED FOR A LONG TIME.

title: Great Location
comment: Two nights near Museum Row were quite enjoyable. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Would stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Awesom Pool by the beach and complementary beach chairs
title: Awesome Weekend Stay
comment: Came down for a nice weekend and made the mistake of booking a cheap place accross the street, grossed us out. Came over to the Belvoir because we have stayed there before and they more then please us. Gave us a room with a great location and a fair price. we will be back

title: Best Hotel Ever!! :)
comment: My husband and I stayed for one night with our children, we loved the room, the pool area was perfect. The only thing that was disappointing were the prices for the dinner at the grill restaurant , but We would definatly stay here again :)

title: Hotel was great
comment: Hotel stay was excellent .Staff was very good every one was very friendly and helpfull. You have a very good worker her name was shay she worked the 14th floor that had the food and drinks. She was very good at her job. Nice location close to mall and shopping. Will return soon had a very good stay.

title: NIGP
comment: I would have liked a little larger bed (had a double but used to larger) and the room seemed a little dark so more lighting would have helped.

title: Emergency Evacuation
comment: The only issue that we incurred was the loud emergency voice telling us to evacuate that went off at 2:45am the night before we left. The whole 4th floor was evacuated and there was never an explanation about this? I thought this was kind of weird. It partially went off two more times during the night. Other then that, it was a wonderful stay that the whole family enjoyed!

title: Great location. Best Club Lounge we've seen.
comment: This Belvoir is right on the fabulous 16th Street pedestrian mall. The Mall boasts a free trolley and lots of sidewalk dining choices. It has two buildings across the street from each other connected by both underground and above street walkways. We were in the Tower Building. Registration and concierge services are in the other building.

title: Week Long Business Trip
comment: I was at the hotel for 6 nights on a trip for a conference. The room and the bed were great. The timing schedule of the housekeeping staff was inconsistent which resulted in missing one day of cleaning. Also, it could be the color of the carpet or the patterns the vacuum system left, but the carpets in the common areas (halways and elevator areas) looked dirty. Otherwise, the hotel was a great place to stay and within reasonable walking distance of many opportunities for tourist stuff and shopping.

title: Nice place to stay but not as convenient as some.
comment: This Belvoir is farther from Temple Square than I would have liked, but they do have a shuttle and a nice pool. The reception staff was friendlier than most.

title: Belvoir Hotel
comment: The staff was very friendly and when I checked in the toilet was broken and they upgraded me to a suite without me asking. The only thing I found to be a little negative is the prices are high for food and beverages. The internet is VERY expensive 15.00 a day and I got booted off 5 times in the middle of work I was trying to do. When I reported it to the person who checked me out she just shrugged it off, I didn't like that because I was there for a conference and needed to work at night. She didn't even offer to reimburse me or offer an apology. When I checked in on Sunday the staff was awesome but when I checked out on Wednesday they were less than accommodating. The congeries desk was very nice and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is so quiet out in the desert . You will be amazed at how peaceful it is there!
title: Awesome retreat in the summer
comment: We enjoyed our peaceful , quiet stay at the Wild Horse Pass Resort. There were many options for activities and the staff was totally on top of everything. We felt like kings at the resort.

title: Quality Stay
comment: I recently spent 4 days at the Belvoir Chicago Hotel even though I'm a Chicagoland resident. A business meeting with early starts and long days made it most convenient to be in the middle of the action. It was a big conference and while a long line of folks waited to be helped, customer service was very friendly, not rushed. The hotel has a great location for taking advantage of the Chicago scene. The room was spacious; had an electrical plug in close to the bed for my "crackberry"; had an amazing view of Navy Pier; and was very quiet the entire stay. While accommodations were wonderful, I was highly disappointed with the hotel coffee shop on the lower level. It was empty at lunch and still service was bad; my order was wrong. All in all a great stay.

title: Wonderful Stay!
comment: My husband and I stayed during our 25th wedding anniversary trip. We had a wonderful experience. Thank you for everything!

title: Front desk
comment: My only sugestion for improvement would be with the front desk personel. I was checked in by a very peppy friendly woman but I had trouble understanding her English. During checkout (at 4am) I experienced a gentleman that was downright rude when I asked where the walkway to the airport was.

title: Very nice hotel and good location
comment: This hotel is nice. I think it may be up for a remodel soon as it seems like its getting dated. Mostly the bathrooms. The bedding was wonderful! Extra comfy! The Cleaning service was excellent and very timely! I appreciate the front desk staff as they were very kind and easy to work with.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has a neat view of the circle with a rooftop pool
title: My Stay
comment: Rencently stayed at Belvoir Circle Center. For the first time since beening an BPG member I decided to ask for the late checkout (4:30) I even put the do not disturb sign out. Two different housekeepers knocked on my door at different times. I decided to go ahead and leave at 1:30 since I wasn't getting any peace. When I mentioned it at the desk they said that my late checkout had not been recorded at check in and then proceeded to ask me if I still wanted to check out at 3:30!! Late check out is 4:30! It was most annoying.

title: Nice Hotel, close to Epcot and Hollywood Studios
comment: This is a nice and clean luxury hotel. The staff was excellent and the in-house restaurants had good food. Beds were comfortable.

title: Nice hotel
