comment: Overall good stay and would stay again. Just a couple improvements - bathroom mirror wasn't clean and counter had some liquid on it. Was disappointed about having to pay for parking, but understand, especially in a downtown area. Bed was very comfortable and staff was very friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is located in the perfect spot for conferences as well as sight seeing.
title: A shining star in Seattle
comment: I have been a guest at this hotel on four separate occasions now. Each time the service from each department was no less than stellar.

title: NIce Hotel
comment: We had a great stay. Good location. Great service. Beautiful weather.

title: FIRST CLASS HOTEL
comment: Our stay was a 3 day getaway which we always return to this Belvoir. Speedy check-in, very courteous desk agents. The room was found spotless as expected. THE BED... o what a fantastic mattress. Housekeeping staff always greeted us with a smile as we passed in the hall. The Starbucks coffee in the room is a nice touch but we would have enjoyed it more if it was DD. The complimentary computers on the 2nd floor came in handy but operated SLOW. We didn't use any F&B as we were out enjoying the town most of the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel as it always exceeds my expectations!!

title: Great View, That is about it
comment: Our room was invaded by Ants on the 4th floor, and as they did move us, nothing else was offered. The Concierge gave wrong directions 3 times. The AC in our 1st room was stuck on and made the room a meat locker. All they did was say turn it off.

title: Tim's Review
comment: One of my biggest pet peves is to walk into to what you think (by looking at the lobby) a room and the lamp shades are all crooked and night tightened down and for the type of hotel the Sherton is I would have expected much nicer furnishing in the room. It also appears that when I called in previous to my stay and had the room extended for an additonal day that did not happen. Also had to call front desk regarding food, garbage and dirty dishes on the 31 floor lobby area.

everyoneShouldKnow: very bad services, bad food, and allow people to smoke in their room when it is a no smoking hotel
title: Not Just The View
comment: My wife and I decided to take a vacation so we decided San Diego is the place. Now we go there alot and always stay at another well known hotel, but this time we decided to stay and the Belvoir San Diego Hotel and Marina and we stayed at the Bay Tower and it was a beautiful view and that is all it was.

title: Poor service
comment: It took an hour plus to get our suitecases to the room. despite sveral phone calls.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: The staff was very helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

title: Excellent in every way!
comment: My family has stayed here several times, and the service and amenities have always been great. In addition, the hotel is perfectly located with easy access to the Towsontowne Mall and I-695. We will continue to visit Belvoir North.

title: Very Basic for the price you pay. Staff only does blame game
comment: Started with a long Q for check in. Took 30 mins to reach the front desk as it had only one person manned up. The BPG Gold and Platinum had two front desk with only 1 or 2 guests waiting. On talking to front desk, she said its not her decision. Front desk manager said staff on holiday can't do anything.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very accomodating! The staff is amazing and always there to help and answer your questions.
title: Double Mint Twin Experience
comment: Can't thank the staff enough for the amazingly great experience my twin sister & I enjoyed last week. We took our first annual twin vacation on our bdy (8/21) to Key West and stayed at this wonderful hotel. The front desk and staff were beyond helpful and did everything to help us feel welcomed and comfortable. We would definetly recommend to others. 5 star service and a big thank you from the twins from WI.

title: Terrible time at Belvoir university city Philadelphia
comment: Worst stay ever! Stayed last Thursday for my daughter's 3rd Bday. To take her to Philly zoo. We stayed at room 1501 on 15th floor. At 1am in the morning we woke up the the fire alarm. Me and my family was so scared because there was such a large comotion going on. We were all in panic for our safety. I had to carry my child down 15 flights of stairs to find out from the police outside that guests on the 11 th floor burnt popcorn. By the time everything cleared up from waiting in the lobby half dressed with my kids we were able to go back to our rooms at 3am in the morning.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bring your own shampoo and be prepared to make your own bed.
title: Grossed out
comment: Additional charges are too high, $16/day for internet! Housekeeping didn't visit my room my first morning. Trash in hallway outside my room remained there for two straight days. Plate of food remained in lounge area by elevator for two days. Dust/dirt all around corners of carpet was pretty gross and the amount of hair on the bathroom floor lead me to believe a vacuum or mop hasn't hit that floor in some time. Shampoo and soaps were gross, had to go out and buy travel shampoo. The "Swing bar" privacy lock was broken/missing on door. Water pressure in shower was poor. The food service was pretty good.

title: Below Average Again
comment: I have been coming to this hotel annually for over 10 years. Over the past few years there have been numerous problems. This trip was no exception, as the cleaning staff forgot to make up the room one night (I had to go to the front desk where I was handed towels and given an apology) and there was an elevator out (only 2 in a ten story building to begin with) for 2 days. Why go there? It is close to Hershey and it has an indoor/outdoor pool.

title: FEELS LIKE HOME
comment: The Belvoir Portsmouth Hotel feels like home; the staff is AMAZING...we miss them already and I truly wish all Belvoir staff around the world would be as friendly and warm as this place! Every stay and we come every summer, has been memorable!

everyoneShouldKnow: Was far below what we expected based on our experience at other resorts..
title: Great location. Beautiful view of sunsets.
comment: We had heard about the money that had been put into the hotel to update it. We did not see that. Our room had wall damage. The patio ceiling had a roof leak that dripped all of the time. The bathroom had mould in the grout and in the caulk at the floor. We had roaches in the room and the exterminator did not come for three days after we complained.

title: Solid hotel
comment: Great location for business, fantastic sized suites.

title: Some of the best hotel staff.
comment: Mecca checked me in. He was very professional and left me not needing to ask a single question. Jose and Maria in the Club Lounge exceeded my families needs.

title: Friendly Staff
comment: Everyone I came in contact with was super friendly. I would stay here again just for that.

title: worse hotel ever
comment: Horrible experience, smelled like dead person in the room

everyoneShouldKnow: Research your own questions before your stay because the concierge was ignorant.
title: This Hotel needs improvement
comment: The concierge agent was chomping down on gum and was hardly able to speak. When I asked her for restaurant recommendations, she spoke with gum hanging out of her mouth, almost spitting, & only gave me one restaurant name instead of several choices. She never offered to set up reservations either. The front desk never gave us any info on the hotel about where to park or offer help with luggage. The key cards for self park that we received never worked, we had to call valet to open the gate each time we came and went. The housekeeping staff lost my daughters stuffed animal when they cleaned our room. I checked with lost & found but they were mo help either. I am an employee of a AAA/4 Diamond rated resort in Las Vegas, and the service that I received at Belvoir was unacceptable. Your staff really needs customer service training.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent A+ Staff....I can't say enough....Staff really makes a hotel. Although the hotel is really beautiful and clean...very nice and neat too.
title: Happy Hospitality
comment: The hotel was easy to find and convenient for sightseeing. Our experience began in the parking garage by a very helpful, energetic, smiling staff member, giving advice and assistance. We recommend the Club Floor. We enjoyed the convenience of the evening snack and the early morning breakfast. (Tasty too) It made our long trip so enjoyable and relaxing. Our club room was spacious, clean, and quiet and had an array of views. We enjoyed the friendly feeling we received from all staff...the moment you drove into the parking garage until you opened the door to your room. Even upon checkout the next day. Again the A+ Staff, really makes this hotel! (nice modern hotel too) Enjoyed the Sessions Lounge also.

title: Perfectly serviceable
comment: I was allowed a late check in and late check out - both added huge value to my trip as I engaged a trying travel schedule. Everyone I encountered was a professional and made me feel welcome.

title: Boutique style
comment: Loved the great decor and furnishings

title: Above and beyond
comment: We recently spent 1 night at the Belvoir Harrisburg Hershey Hotel. It's one of the lower priced/lower starred Belvoirs we've stayed at. We wanted to be near Hershey, so we booked it with some trepidation.

title: super staff and great location in a beautiful city
comment: really appreciated the kind service...good experience all the way around

title: Great location but the linens had a foul odor
comment: The location of this hotel is perfect for enjoying the city. It is only a few blocks from just about any point of interest in the area. The sheets and towels, however, had a foul odor, even with clean ones each day. I had to buy some fabric and air odor eliminator to spray them. I think there was a laundering problem, but it was a bit offensive at times.

title: Disappointing
comment: Not working... Ice Machine on floor; coffee maker in room, fax machine in business center. Front desk rebuked me for setting my drink on their counter but then took about 5 minutes of interacting with paper rather than other guests including me other than "get your drink off the front desk please".

title: Great Hotel
comment: Although we didn't use all the amenities (pool, spa, fitness center), everything else was great. My wife and I stayed for our anniversary and thoroughly enjoyed our time at the hotel. Service was excellent, room was very comfortable and spacious. We would have stayed longer if we had the time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is wonderful. Room is huge.
title: Excellent location
comment: This hotel was in a fantastic location. We couldn't believe how much was around us- shopping, convenience stores, restaurants...all walking distance. We had a great stay here. Extremely clean, great service, outside bar was very convenient, and staff was wonderful. Very friendly. Just wished we had more activities offered to adults and teens. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Not Excited
comment: This hotel fell beneath my expectations, by far. I was expecting a cleaner environment, but was met with tidy, at BEST. Not excited, and will probably not come back.

everyoneShouldKnow: it don't care about you just your money
title: a bad start to a 5 day stay
comment: service was slow on needs, 1st night leak in closet from ceiling dripping for a while black mold was growing, moved to new room same floor , first use of sink while shaving , the sink was clogged told them, went out for 3 hours, sink still clogged... i did not get an apology or cookie to say they were sorry

everyoneShouldKnow: convient pick up and close to the airport
title: please add
comment: I think this hotel is the nicest in the airport area for the money. I stay here many times a year. I would like a light breakfast room included for BPG members

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs some upgrades & the lobby is on the 3rd floor
title: needs some upgrades
comment: I love Grandbourne, but this hotel needs some upgrades. Elevator was not working when I

title: Bad experience
comment: Hotel Can't find my listing and when they located my room they did not have it ready. Understand mistakes happen, but attitude and ability to make good decisions on the spot are important. I ended up changing cloths in the bathroom?

title: great features
comment: comfortable, freindly professional staff willing to help, clean, and modern.

everyoneShouldKnow: great staff and very nice hotel
title: Great Experience!
comment: We would highly recommend the Belvoir. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We were checked in very early with no complications or questions. The room was very nice and spacious. There was construction in the lobby which we knew of ahead of time. It was a little hard to hear at the check in but would stay again without a doubt. Great experience!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's the only place I can really sleep beds are great and relax totally
title: retraining the hotel desk staff
comment: Checked in after a very long flight from the East Coast.,Upon arriving it was pouring rain

title: Staff were exceptionally nice!
comment: BPG check in was fast & efficient. Room was comfortable and clean with a great view. Free internet to print our boarding passes to leave. Starbucks coffee in the room. Everyone smiled and said hello. A winner!

title: guest
comment: very comfortable stay with central location to center of Boston

everyoneShouldKnow: It is located right off the interstate. Not in all the high traffic areas.
title: The hotel met all of our needs.
comment: Our group really enjoyed the hotel. It was very comfortable and clean. Some of our ladies got to enjoy the pool area which was very nice. We would recommend this hotel to others.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not very clean- old dated property
title: Room condition/ check in
comment: When I arrived on my floor, the first thing I experienced was a hall full of maids chatting with each other & the carts blocking the hall. None of them offered to move their cart so I could pass by. The hall floor was filthy. I entered my room & first found a bug crawling on my pillow, then found many pieces of debris on the carpet & it was obvious that it had not been vacuumed in ages. In the bathroom, I moved the tray on the sink to find dried toothpaste, soap scum & mold. On the coffee service tray, the lids for the cups were placed upside down on top of the cups & had collected dirt & dust. I asked to have the housekeeping supervisor come take a look, she agreed that it was unacceptable & had me moved to another room. I think that the maids should perhaps do more cleaning & less gossiping in the hallway.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay away until the remodeling is done. I would think they would put that on the webiste for the customers.
title: Messy
comment: The lobby was a mess with the remodeling. I would have stayed somewhere else if I knew this in advance.

title: This hotel needs some improvements!
comment: A/C would not turn on had to contact front desk, went to turn on TV and it had a big wad of bubble gum stuck to the bottom of it. The toilet was so loud when flushed, when we get up in the middle of the night and flushed the toilet it would wake the other person up.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is just one block from the harbor and the staff are very friendly.
title: Comfort and Cozy Great Location
comment: This hotel meet all my expectations and the location was just one block from the harbor. The restaurant and pool was the icing on the cake. The room was clean and beds were very comfy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location- 15 minutes from Hershey Park
title: Would stay here again
comment: We stayed for one night before heading to a conference in Hershey. I found the hotel clean, although the hallways were dingy and in need of some renovation.

everyoneShouldKnow: Awesome staff, very clean, very spacious suites, close to all attractions; shuttle service was amazing, always avail to take you at a given time to downtown or ride bikes around the island. Close to the airport, very convenient, 4 miles...can't get much closer.
title: Very Accommodating!
comment: It was my first get away trip with my twin sister. We found the hotel on-line during our trip search...they offered gov rate which was helpful! When we arrived we explained it was our birthday and we received a few extras like drink and breakfast vouchers...the staff was always accommodating to our needs and questions and super friendly, always asking what we did during the day and greated with a smile

title: Wonderful place to stay
comment: Hotel was wonderful and the room was very comfortable.

title: Good Hotel in the Valley.
comment: All of the staff at the Belvoir Roanoke are very friendly. The food at Shula's and at the hotel's Pi restauarants are both just average.

title: Excellent service and friendly staff
comment: Stayed and the Stamford CT hotel. The staff there is always helpful and friendly. Ken in the restaurant always welcomes me and my colleges like returning college students that were away for the summer. Keep up the good work.

everyoneShouldKnow: Short drive to beach. Beds are amazingly comfortable!
title: Comfortable beds and great views!
comment: Upon checking in, staff was very friendly. We were even upgraded to a room on the top floor free of charge. Great location if yo eu want to be near Broadway at the Beach, skywheel etc.

title: Very nice hotel
comment: Very beautiful and classy hotel. Staff was friendly and professional. Rooms were very nice... well decorated, clean, comfortable... and, of course, the Sweet Sleeper beds are sooooo comfortable. We were in the area to attend a family memorial service, so we weren't there long and didn't use a number of the hotel amenities. The location was perfect for our needs and the hotel is very easy to get to from the Garden State Pkwy or the Turnpike. Cute bar with typical hotel bar prices (as in, expensive!).

title: Hotel alright but not 4 star worthy.
comment: First impression of this hotel was good. Upon further inspection this hotel needs employees who clean the guest rooms better! I stepped on an old french fry by the desk area, long foreign hairs were still in the "cleaned" tub, but the worst surprise was the brown filth under the toilet seat my husband discovered after less than 5 minutes in this particular room!! This hotel will not be my first choice when visiting downtown Chicago again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Staff...enthusaistic and smiling and very helpful
title: A great Hotel
comment: After a long journey..It was great to be received by a friendly staff at rception even though it was late...and the bar staff was excellant and food was exceptional even thogh it was a few minutes to closing of kitchen...we were well received..

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean with very comfortable bedding and mattress.
title: This hotel has excellent mattresses
comment: Our experience at your hotel was excellent. I would have liked to have 2 comfortable chairs since there were 2 of us in the room, but I understand this was due to the fact that we had a king room instead of 2 double beds.

everyoneShouldKnow: Try to get a Balcony - most rooms do not have balconies.
title: Very good location on the Beach.
comment: I spent my entire stay in the Hotel including eating in the restaurant. My only complaint was the 'noise' level in the restaurant. The music was much much too loud which resulted in everyone yelling at each other in order to hear - - which resulted in even more noise. Food was very good - but eat outside on the Patio for less noise. I had a nice view of the Ocean (South Tower) - except for that very very large condo on the beach that blocked about 3/4 of my view.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Our stay at the Belvoir Waikiki was fantastic. The customer service was 5-star. Not only were the staff aware of our needs, they continually went above and beyond to insure that our stay was flawless. I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Honolulu.

title: Perfect stay...
comment: This is a gorgeous hotel with great customer service. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our spacious room and pool area. This hotel far exceeded my expectations and the front desk agent Carlos was very welcoming at check-in. Thank you for a wonderful stay. We will be returning again!

title: Awesome
comment: From the staff to the facilities, our stay far surpassed our expectations

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to the convention center if you are attending a convention. A short taxi ride to Old San Juan.
title: Wonderful Hotel and Pool Deck
comment: Really enjoyed the pool deck and the Spa servces I received.

title: Way below my expectation
comment: It might be isolated but I've experienced unpleasant things in my one night stay. First, the front desk staff could use a little deeper training. My room key had to be re-keyed two times- one time because it couldn't open my room and another time because it wouldn't open the parking gate. Second, you charge for parking, which might be understandable though free parking could be appreciated. However, I was surprised to find myself driving around at 11PM looking for a parking spot. A lot of parking space is blocked for valet parking. To me, this is unacceptable because I paid for it.

title: Nice stay
comment: I stay at the hotel two weeks every year. My last stay was the week of August 20th. The hotel seems full and the service was not a good as it normally is when I go there. The front desk seemed to be under staffed and the wait took a while. The food did not seem to be a good as in the past.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to shopping and other nearby activities.
title: Renovation 2012
comment: The room was excellent, but it lacked a couple of things after we checked in. A book of the hotel's amenities and a telephone on the nightstand. I asked for the telephone twice but did not receive it. For anyone calling the room you must get out of bed before the call goes to voicemail. Didn't like staying during renovations to the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is excellent from the front desk to housekeeping to room service.
title: Highly Recommend This Hotel
comment: My family stayed 6 nights (I was only there for 3). The staff was super friendly. I had surgery at one of the local hospitals and stayed in the hotel for a few days after discharge from the hospital since we live over an hour away. The restaurant (Shula's) was excellent and room service was great. Bed and pillows made it easy for me to rest comfortably until I felt good enough to go home. Super clean and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Downtown close to lots of things, easy to get to and rooms have great views of the moutains
title: good place
comment: this hotel had nice views and comfortable rooms. food and service were okay and the breakfast staff was always very welcoming and pleasant> really started your day off right whether for work or vacation.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a fee for parking which kind-of stinks.
title: Great get-away!
comment: Really enjoyed this hotel! Excellent pool, excellent rooms and facilities! The fact that they had games and balls scattered around the pool shows they are willing to go above and beyond to make things fun for the kids.

title: This stay was okay...
comment: Room had ants, one of the pillows had blood stains, there was only a quarter roll of toilet paper and no extras in the room. We had to take bath tissue from the public restroom. The shower was stained and dirty. In addition a hotel employee mistakenly knocked on our door in the middle of the night and didn't even apologize for disturbing us. Lastly the wait at the restaurant for breakfast was too long and by the time we received it it was cold.

title: trip
comment: It was a great hotel after we changed rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Room service was below expectations but solutions were offered and accepted. The hotel staff was extremely professional during the entire conference. Their attitude & service were exceptional.
title: The view was fantastic
comment: My room overlooked the marina. The weather was excellent allowing us to sit on the balcony in the evening and truly enjoy the view.

everyoneShouldKnow: The welcome team are really selling timeshares!
title: Friendly staff
comment: We arrived after a long drive to be met my a friendly reception team. This was our first stay at a Belvoir so when we were passed over to the 'welcome team' we naively thought it would be just that. Instead it was a rather aggressive invitation to a sales pitch for time share. Now I didn't mind being asked the question but I did mind the onslaught that folloed our 'no'and refusal to accept that we didn't want to attend. We even asked him to respect our decision and he still carried on.

title: Needs Improvement
comment: Had 3 occassions when the room key did not work and security claimed it could have been a faulty lock. Worse thing was that each time it happened my ID was locked in the room causing extreme inconvenience when dealing with the front desk staff.

title: Hotel has Quality CustomerServicel
comment: The Hotel has an excellent Customer Orientated Staff

title: Disappointment
comment: Paid extra to have room in the tower. Booking confirmation said upper floor with marina or city view. Was given a bottom floor in the Lanai wing. The room had a terrible musty smell. Opened the balcony sliding door and the room door with the AC on to try to clear the smell, but to no avail. Carpet outside of the room was dirty, and room service dishes along the corridor were not cleared. Passed several staff members in the hallway who looked the other way. When I pointed out that the room was not what we had booked, was told that I would be given a $20 credit, but it hasn't shown up on my statement. This hotel needs help.

title: Nice Additions
comment: New renovation looks great. New restaurant and lobbby take advantage of the amazing views the property has to offer. You can now rent kayaks and ocean gear at hotel. Great staff. A nice break from some of the over sized resorts on the Big island.

title: Free Wi-Fi
comment: I think it is crazy that you would not offer free Wi-Fi. As a business traveler, this is not acceptable

everyoneShouldKnow: The friendly customer service and great location
title: The hotel is one of my family's favorite venues!
comment: The Steamboat Belvoir is one of my families favorite vacation spots and we try to come at least once a year! It is a perfect location with great amenities and the customer service is excellent!

title: Everything was fantastic!!
comment: Beautiful hotel! Very comfortable and clean. They also accept dogs! Great experience.

title: stayed for a conference
comment: The hotel had a great conference center, which is probably why it was selected for the conference I attended. My room was a tad dusty and there was a little bit of a film on the bathroom counter when I first arrived. Aside from those things and that the room had 2 beds when there was only one of me, everything was great.

title: Room did not have proper sleeping for number booked
comment: We booked online through hotwire and was guarenteed a room for 3 adults and one child. Upon checking in we were assigned a room with one double bed. I brought this up to the front desk and was told "this is all we have we might be able to change you tomorrow night, we can throw in an an airmatress". When reaching the room there was an airmatress thrown into the corner, not blown up, no sheets on top of it. The air matress had horrible stains on it. We inflated it (it was 12am at this point) and through the sheets on it we found on the bed. During the course of the night the air matress deflated and my mother-in-law was left to sleep on the floor. At check out the same person was at the counter and said that she had left a message on our room phone to get moved to a two bed room, but we did not receive the message in the room. I was very upset with the customer service when checking in, the clerk did not act like she even cared I had guests sleeping on the floor. I would not stay here again

everyoneShouldKnow: location is good, staff is wonderful at front desk.
title: nothing exciting about the stay
comment: rooms need total remodel, parking gates do not work to the room keys. Staff is wonderful though

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very friendly and the rooms are great. They will make your dinner reservations for a sm. fee & hail you a cab. But most of all you will enjoy the amenities.
title: This hotel has great features
comment: My room was great, the beds were confortable, the room was clean and very organized. I almost wanted to just stay in the room and order movies... but the Space Needle was calling my name! Will stay at the Belvoir again. One bonus... the cost of my car to stay in the parking garage was less than the web information had suggested.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in the same building as the PRU!
title: Convenience....meetings at the Pru!
comment: Hotel is connected to the Pru...fabulous for meetings and convenience and weather. Shipping is great..staff is wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Common rooms lovely. Don't get a room on the 2nd floor. There was an apartment pool right outside our only window/sliding door.
title: Housekeeping
comment: I was disappointed in the housekeeping service. I had to call the desk everyday with a list of things not replaced, ie, coffee, soap, creamer, etc.

title: Good stay
comment: Had a nice time in. San Diego over the weekend. Took wife an kids and did the sight seeing stuff and went to ocean. Room was nice and breakfast buffet was good. Place was busy with people but all was handled well.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great access to Disneyland, but don't plan to spend much time at the actual hotel...
title: Problematic stay
comment: While the room was nice, the toilet wouldn't flush, the shower/tub wouldn't't drain, the Club room had no directional signage and staff were poor at directions to it, and as a platinum member I am not supposed to be charged for access to the Internet, I have never been charged previously b/c I accessed it via my laptop while my daughter did for her ITouch, but this hotel charged me...very frustrating.

title: Consistent!
comment: This is my go to hotel when i come into town. Everyone is so friendly, great location, rooms are clean, and level of service is consistent. Thanks for being a great home away from home!

title: Nice one night stay.
comment: Family of four, two adults and two kids stayed for one night. We came over for a day at Busch Gardens. Suite was nice as the kids could watch TV in one room and the adults could hang in the other. Staff was friendly, parking was easy perfect for one night.

title: It's just OK
comment: Would look elsewhere next time in town.

title: Poor service and rooms need renovation
comment: The front desk was understaffed on both days I was there, I had to wait 10 minutes to check-in and to ask questions.

title: Fenway Fitness
comment: PrePaid -20% (could've had 30%!!) - good

title: CT
comment: Overall the room was very nice and great location

title: Great hotel, great location, great staff
comment: I would highly recommend spending a night in this hotel. You will easily want to stay longer after experiencing the amenities and the staff.

title: great club level
comment: Betty in the club is fantastic on Friday nite.

title: Good, but front staff needs improvement
comment: The hotel itself was nice. There are only 2 problems. 1st. I had to call 3 times to get a copy of my invoice emailed to me! Very frustrating!

everyoneShouldKnow: Check out the shoe bar on the second floor.
title: Belvoir Atlantic City
comment: We were very pleased with this hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful. We loved the Miss America memorabilia in the lobby and on the second floor. My husband cannot walk and the hotel was easy for him to negotiate on his electric scooter. We also loved walking through the outlets on the way to the beach/ boardwalk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for beach and proximity to airport
title: Great locations, rooms could be updated
comment: We enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir. The staff was very friendly, particularly Fatima at the front desk and the beach attendants. The beach was great! Our room was adequate, but needed updating. There was a spot on the wall in room 140 that looked like a bug had been squashed and not cleaned up. The tub didn't drain properly and the shower curtain smelled of mildew. I didn't feel like it was up to Belvoir standards. The bed was really comfortable though! Loved that there was a Starbucks and Dos Caminos.

title: Large room, great service
comment: I spent only one night here and I will go back. My room was huge, staff was great and the location was awesome. Near a park and jogging trail. Room service was very good. I high,y recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a great location and the rooms are very nice........
title: A great hotel all in all......
comment: Am a flight attendant and for me the location for a long layover is very important, and your hotel met that need...Really enjoyed my stay and will definately bid for more Denver nights. thanks again.....

title: Great rooms, comfortable, nice bar/restaurant
comment: The staff is very friendly and love the Starbucks coffee in the rooms

title: Excellent Location, Great Service, Great Staffs
comment: I was not expecting much because I was staying just one night. But, the location was excellent, close to Downtown Diseny, shopping malls, good restaurant, etc. Most of all, all the staffs were very friendly and nice. Great place to stay.

title: GREAT HOTEL-GREAT SERVICE
comment: It is a great Hotel at a great location in Pasdena.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pay for parking or you will get a ticket on the side street.
title: Great but...
comment: I enjoyed my stay there however when I checked my bank account. I was not aware of a $75 hold. Nothing was said when I checked in nor when I checked out. I called to ask what was I paying for and she responded saying it was a hold and would be back on your card in 72 hours. Well here it is Tuesday and I checked out Saturday morning and I still don't have my money back into my account. Other than not being informed of a $75 hold the stay was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great! Its in the center of everything! Love this place and the staff!
title: Absolutely amazing!
comment: My stay here was so awesome. The entire staff was great! First class service all the way. Jason checked me in and my room wasnt ready but he had the staff rush to get it cleaned and then he called when it was ready. Louis was also very helpful throught the lobby all 3 days. The rooms were clean and spacious. I will definately be returning. I have absolutely no complaints. A1 service at this hotel.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Couldnt have been better!!!

title: quarterly work stay -
comment: Staff usually is very polite. My room was dusty, lights didn't work, toilette didn't flush... I stay here (per work) quarterly. When the hotel has room I get a larger room. This time, I was in a closet.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff are very professional and pleasant. They appear to be there to help satisfy your needs.
title: Great place for a local weekend getaway
comment: The staff there are very professional and pleasant. The facilities are very clean and comfortable; you almost forget that you are in West Philadelphia. If I had to change something it would parking. Guest parking should be free or atleast discounted to half of what they charge now.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great for Universal Studio as well as The Glendale Galleria shopping mall
title: Excellent Service and Staff
comment: From the minute we checked in until the time we checked out, we were greeted with superb service from a friendly, efficient staff. The hotel is very "touristy" due to it's location right next door to Universal Studios. It's not a luxury hotel, so don't expect that. We stayed there as guests at a 500 person wedding reception at the Grand Ballroom which was adequately done. The breakfast buffet is highly recommended.

title: This hotel was disappointing.
comment: We made reservations several months in advance and guaranteed with a credit card. When we arrived at 4pm, they had no rooms. They said housekeeping was slow, they gave us a horrible room that only had a sofa with a pullout bed. There was no closet to hang our clothes and it was nasty. The air conditioning didn't work and it was 88 degrees. I would not recommend this hotel. It needs a serious overhaul.

everyoneShouldKnow: dont sleep on the beds and eat out
title: disssapointed
comment: Wanted an xtra cot for room answer NO...The beds are so hard very uncomfortable...Listened to a barking DOG in closeby room...Food for the wedding was GROSS overcooked and flavorless

title: Best Hotel In Orlando, Florida
comment: Have stayed there many times and it is the best hotel in Florida bar none! Location and staff are the absolute best!

title: Nice hotel and nice location. Quality of service needs to improve.
comment: Overall good experience. Nice location, comfortable room, nice pool and very friendly staff.

title: Excellent choice for Boston
comment: Very well situated with direct access to the Prudential shopping center, multiple lunch and dinner options as well as the subway. Great staff, nice views of Boston. Splendid pool.

title: very comfortable
comment: The hotel was very clean and neat. Price was reasonable. The staff was more than eager to please. The only downside, I thought it was ridiculous that they make you pay for internet service

title: Great hotel!!
comment: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff was very courteous and met the needs we had. The bathrooms are slightly smaller than I had expected, but the beds were comfortable. It was also a couple of blocks from bricktown, which made it very nice to be able to walk to. Great hotel!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is right on the beach.
title: The hotel room
comment: To start it appease as if I was placed on a floor set aside for pets. I was placed in a room with a very skinny window near the cileling with absolutely no view to the outside at all. Out of all my travels I was very disappointed with the bed. It was to softand uncomfortable. I really Sid not think this was worthy of 7000 points. I also had to stretch to give this hotel an overall rating of 3stars.

title: Wild horse pass
comment: Everything about the resort was great

title: Check in needs attention
comment: My email confirmation stated that I was confirmed in on the club floor with continental brkfst in club lounge. When I checked in, the front desk guy told me I was not on the club floor - standard room only and "we don't have a club floor". I didn't get my breakfast voucher until that evening when I went back to the front desk and the lady gave it to me. She stated that I should have been on the club floor when I checked in. That happened to several of our guest in our group. I've done a meeting at this hotel, can't say I'll do it again soon.

title: Adequate, older, limited parking
comment: The hotel was fine and the staff was very nice and attentive. My room was old and tired and although I am a Grandbourne Preferred Guest, we recieved the handicap room on the first floor. There were wedding guests in the hallway until the wee hours, so it was a little noisy. I am told that the fitness center is nice, but it is not on-site and requires a shuttle ride, so I didn't go. The only other issue was that there was not enough parking in the main lot, so we had to park a significant distance from the hotel and be shuttled to and from our car. Overall, the stay was average.

title: Great Experience
comment: This was a trip to celebrate my daughters birthday with a couple of friends.The staff was very accomodating and friendly.The club area was also a great plus.

title: Loved the Dolphin
comment: We needed a place to stay for the first two nights of our Disney vacation. Joel at the front desk is so kind and helpful...he set the tone for our entire stay. We were tired and ordered room service and had it delivered on a portable table that we put in front of the window and watched the Epcot fireworks. The boats to Epcot and Hollywood studios made it easy to get into the parks...overall, a great place to stay.

title: great location
comment: This hotel is in a great location with access to times square, theaters, and the subway to get you to every other part of NYC. The room was clean and the staff treated us well.

title: Great Downtown Stay
comment: The room was large enough for the 2 nights we stayed there, and the views were great of the Chicago river and downtown. Very comfortable bed, bedding, and furnishings. Hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. My only complaint is that the bathroom decor could use some refreshing, as it does not compete with the modern look of some newer hotels.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is convenient to the airport and just a short drive into Charleston. I believe the hotel offers a free shuttle service.
title: Great hotel
comment: The Belvoir Charleston Airport is a great hotel option in the Charleston area. The staff are very pleasant and the rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. The club room had an excellent selection for breakfast. I would stay here again if I was visiting the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: We are always guaranteed a nice clean place to stay!
title: Consistency
comment: Always stay here when traveling to the cities. Convenient location, always clean and friendly staff.

title: repeat stay
comment: We have now stayed at your hotel for about seven years ( missing only the year with the earthquake and hurricane!!). Still enjoy the people and view and ambiance!! see you next year !!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Quiet and convenient to subway lines...and SoHo shopping district
title: Great Hotel...Great Location
comment: Everything was great...the staff greeted me and recognized me from before...very nice. My only complaint was that I could not log into my Mac accounts using the free computers in the lobby...they are PCs and the page would time out when trying to log into iCloud...so I couldn't use the free computers...I had to pay for internet in my room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Belvoir Atlantic City is pet friendly
title: Pet Friendly
comment: I understand folks have pets and some consider their pets their children, but the amount of dogs that paraded around the hotel was alarming. People that are afraid of dogs, allergic to dogs were not considered when the Belvoir Atlantic City took on the pet friendly action. How is the rooms really cleaned once the dogs leave? Their hair fibers are left behind as well as their scent. I'm not a fan of enclosed pet friendly facilities.

title: Steamy bathroom
comment: Belvoir Iowa City was excellent facility with one exception - there was no fan in the bathroom in our room and when showering the room and mirror steamed up. Other than that, all aspects of our stay receive high marks. I would recommend this Belvoir to friends.

title: Great Hotel
comment: I loved it!! nice comfy rooms, staff was great.

title: This hotel room was awesome, clean, very quite and most importantly affordable.
comment: This hotel room was awesome, clean, very quite and most importantly affordable.

title: Friendly Staff/Great Location
comment: I liked this hotel. The staff was friendly and it was conveniently located in the market area. The hotel rooms are a litttle dated but clean and comfy. The price is reasonable, too.

title: Best hotel gym!
comment: We recently stayed at the Belvoir Downtown Denver for the USA Pro Cycling Challege. The hotel location was great for the race and also for dinner and entertainment. I was most impressed by the hotel gym. Used to working out in hotel gyms slightly larger than a closet. The gym at the Belvoir Denver was a full size workout facility...very impressive. We would definitely stay again!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is wonderful. They are very helpful.
title: great weekend
comment: This was a special weekend for me and my family. My niece is in pharmacy school and we attended the white coat ceremony. The hotel is accessible to the highways and the staff was very helpful. I cant say enough about the frontdesk staff. The lady (black and don't know her name) has customer service down to a science. The other hotel staff was very kind and nice as well.

title: Clean and Friendly
comment: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff were very friendly. The room was clean and had everything we needed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The front desk people are excellent.
title: Front Desk....Makes it worth the stay!!
comment: We had a great stay all around; HUGE kudos and thanks to Tamara at the front desk!!! She has an amazing energy, personality, and attitude!! She is why we continue to come back. Thanks so much for making us feel at home!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: great location. Very clean, friendly staff, and easy to get to beaches and close to airport.
title: Great time in LAX
comment: It was our first time to LAX and we were extremely happy an impressed with the way the Belvoir Hotels front desk staff was very friendly, efficient and knowledgeable of the hotel and area. We were grateful for the way Martha from housekeeping kept our room very clean and tidy every day we were there. We feel Martha should be commended for her hard work ethic to the Belvoir Hotel.

title: Phenomenal!
comment: Panoramic suite had great views and the room was clean, neat and worthy of what it cost to stay there. Very comfortable and classy! I would definitely go back!

title: Great location and view
comment: Great view from the 25th floor, perfect location to everything in downtown Seattle -very impressed with our stay!

title: Centrally Located, comfortable rooms
comment: All of the staff were exceptionally friendly and professional. The bed was very comfortable, room was spotless and the service was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its right on the beach, great pool area and very kid friendly.
title: l LOVE THIS HOTEL!!
comment: This hotel is right on the beach. Beautifully decorated; Rooms are the right size and the beds are very comfortable. Will definitely be back.

title: Quality lacking
comment: I had heard good things about the Belvoir hotels but my stay was below expectation. The room did not come with a fridge, the bed was not on the foundation, it rocked back and forth, the AC unit did not distribute air across the room, it pointed in the direction of the curtain and was not adjustable to below 60 degrees. The pipes were all visible under the sink, the toilet was missing bolts. The only "good" thing about this hotel is that the hotel is on the the shuttle route. We did not use the pool or fitness center but I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's security and service is excellent.
title: Great Amenities
comment: I recommend this hotel as a great place to stay. It has great amenities and is certainly secured for its customers.

title: This hotel facilities was great for the family but food was not
comment: We enjoyed our stay. We had 3 rooms it was nice and comfortable- we would've ordered a suite but they were all sold out. I was not impressed with the cost of food and the taste of the food. We feel it needs improvement. For the overall cost of the trip for just 2 days we could've flown to Hawaii. I do not think we will be coming back with the entire family.

title: Belvoir New Orleans
comment: We stayed during renovation and construction period. However, this hotel will be remarkable when complete.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a very clean hotel & the staff our very friendly.
title: This hotel was top notch
comment: The hotel was very affordable for all the amenities it offer.

title: Surprise Fees
comment: unhappy about surprise fees

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a great hotel and the location is great!
title: Great hotel!
comment: Excellent facility, location was great, accommodations were excellent. Only disappointment was the pool which was very small and could only hold a few persons, so I was unable to swim.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access to everything. Extra clean and comfortable.
title: Very Comfortable
comment: Simple one night stay in the city with my family. Very clean, comfortable room. Friendly check in. Needed a restaurant recommendation and got a good selection from the concierge. Lots of "stuff" within walking distance. Will stay here again without question.

title: Butterfield
comment: rooms were great, Poeple were very helpful

title: Good hotel with some room for improvement
comment: This past stay might have been my fourth or fifth in the last twelve months and it is rather awkward to have to say that some of the Staff at the Reception,even upon check in,does not make a BPG Gold member feel somewhat welcome and special. I travel frequently and have never received such a cold impersonal treatment. A little polishing up and improvement in their public relations skills would not be a bad idea. Furthermore,the inconvenience of having a non functional ice machine on the Club floor where I was staying and having to run down to the fourth floor every time I needed ice did not contribute at making my stay very comfortable. Another feature which I think should be part of the rooms is a personal safe. The parking situation was totally catastrophic friday and saturday night.We were obliged to have to park in the parking lot of the neighboring hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access and great customer service
title: Great Customer Service
comment: Great Front Desk Service.

everyoneShouldKnow: The people working there are very friendly and really take care of their guests.
title: Belvoir San Juan convention Center
comment: The hotel is nice, very clean, and the people working there are very friendly and helpful. I like that the gift shop opens at 7am and doesn't close until 9pm. For people that are staying there for business, these hours are important. The hotel has a good variety of restaurants and bars, plus the casino. There is live entertainment in the bar and casino several nights of the week. The pool area is large and well kept.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convienient to attractions revolving around Hollywood and Universal Studios
title: Room and Restaurant Service
comment: The room and maid service was very good. The staff was very friendly, prompt and attentive. Although the restaurant facility itself was average, the staff was excellent and the food was prepared well.

title: Just excellent service
comment: Just excellent service, especially the girl who checked me out. Everyone is so friendly and attentive.

title: This hotel was everything I expected!
comment: First time staying at this hotel. Very impressed with the atmosphere, room, lush tropical grounds. Fantastic pool and spa! Close to major roads, shopping, beach. Walking distance to Rock Bottom Restaurant, CVS, Whole Foods. Friendly staff. Overall wonderful experience. Will book here again!

title: Taking my daughter to school
comment: I stayed here because it was convenient to Champlain College. It was a bit pricey for what it was. Nothing special - but it worked.

everyoneShouldKnow: HIgh parking fees and horrible dining experience.
title: Retraining is a must!
comment: For a hotel from the Grandbourne family, I found this establishment extremely lacking. The front guest service was outstanding, they were very helpful; however, all of the workers in the hotel restaurant were rude and almost non-existent. At one point we waited 15 minutes for our server to return to the main room, there was only one other guest. In addition, a hotel of the Belvoir caliber that charges $10 for internet and $14 for parking daily is just tacky. For the money you pay already this should not be the case. Also a heads up would have been nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location for Universal City and very good access for locations in and around the San Fernando Valley.
title: Great location
comment: The Belvoir Universal is not only close to Universal City and City Walk but close to major freeways linking most of Los Angeles. Great resort for families with children--pool, hot tub, etc.

title: This hotel did not meet my expectations for a BPG property
comment: The staff was friendly enough and the outside of the hotel was well kept. The lobby area was also very nice. The hallways and elevators were extremely hot and humid and odorous. The rooms were very tight and dated. My reservation detailed a room with two doubles on a BPG Preferred Guest floor, but when I arrived there was a mix-up and I got placed in a different room. Overall the stay just didn't match-up with my experience with BPG properties.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is in a great location and I would go back in the hope that my most recent experience was a fluke and not representative of the general overall service.
title: Hopefully a fluke . . .
comment: I've stayed at this location in the past and found it comfortable, clean, quiet, etc. Unfortunately, during my most recent past stay, I did not have the same experience. There was a gamer tournament in the hotel and it was quite noisy and trash was strewn about the common areas. I could get past this. What disturbed me, however, was there was no toilet paper in my room when I checked in and it took over an hour and a second call for someone to respond. Likewise, I never got my voucher for "going green" and declining housekeeping. However, someone came in to clean but stopped halfway through -- the soap, shampoo, conditioner, and other amenities were thrown into the trash can that was left on the bathroom counter but not replaced and thebath mat and towels I'd hung to dry were removed and not replaced so I had none of those items available for my shower. Fortunately, the shower gel remained and I was able to dry off with the hand towels before checking out. Based on the length of time I had to wait for a response to the prior evening's request, I didn't bother to call down for replacement items. I had a plane to catch and did not want to be late.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are well trained and very professional.
title: Hotel Stay
comment: Thie hotel is a good hotel. The fan in the bathroom blowed continuously and was loud. The technician checked it and stated that it was louder in some rooms than others. The noise from the fan was quite annoying. I alos noticed that the tub was stained and the carpet was clean. Other than these things, the room was nice and the hotel atmosphere was great!

title: wonderfull
comment: wonderfull place to stay at

title: Great Hotel, great price
comment: What a wonderful hotel to stay in. It was my first time in San Diego and I knew nothing of the area.. The hotel delivered everything it promised.. Comfy king sized bed (LOVE the sleeper beds!) with a balcony that overlooked the marina. It was clean, safe, quiet and just an overall good deal. The grounds are beautiful and we took a dip in the pool, relaxed in a hammock and explored the different excursions offered on the water! The staff was friendly and helpful.. Parking was easy and available and we were a quick 10 minute drive to downtown. if you need a last minute deal or place to crash for the night, this is a great option! I dont have a family, but it seemed very kid friendly with lots of games and activities - rent bikes, ping pong and air hockey tables in a game room.. but I wasn't bothered by the kids.. you can definitely have a romantic stay as well.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Loved it but the elevators were a bit slow. Otherwise was perfect!

everyoneShouldKnow: The best location in Iowa City. Do not need to use a car when staying here.
title: Best hotel in Iowa City
comment: The rooms were fantastic. The staff was helpful and accomodating. The location is perfect. Great breakfast buffet, and a wonderful dinner menu. A "must stay" in Iowa City.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a centrally located suite property with nice amenities.
title: Comfortable room
comment: Belvoir suites elk grove was a nice property staffed by friendly people.

title: Minor Problems
comment: Basically the hotel was nice- very clean.

title: beautiful hotel
comment: nice hotel location good, pool is lke a gym pool not too inviting

title: Charges card even when using point!
comment: I used points for this room,but my credit card was still charged.I asked about it when checking out and they said call when manager is here.Did that and they said they would credit my card,no ! Called back and still not. y credit card was looking into it.

title: Great Location Lots to do
comment: Great Food and atmosphere

title: Location & Amenities
comment: Spent 8 days and 8 nights. Hands down the best place to stay if you're going to Disneyworld! Beds are amazing, plenty of dining options. Can't wait to go back!

everyoneShouldKnow: This not a cheap hotel its needs to reflect its deluxe status which right now is not happening.
title: Very disappointed!
comment: We have stayed at the Dolphin before and looked forward to our 12 night stay. We were very disappointed in the rooms. There was a FOUL smell in the hallways from construction and ear popping drilling first thing in the morning. Staff was only semi helpful. We had 3 different rooms in the first day..Did I mention my luggage was missing for an entire day.The rooms are in desperate need of updating and the drawers made our clothes smell musty. I have recommended this hotel to many friends and family in the past and we were so looking forward to our visit. I have never in my life felt the need to complain about a hotel I have stayed at but this was just so awful. The bright side is the grounds and pool area are beautiful and the location cant be beat . I feel like I need a vacation from this vacation and not in a good way.

everyoneShouldKnow: We asked for certain accomodations at the hotel and all of our requests were met. The staff truly went above and beyond!
title: great hotel! close to universal studios
comment: The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. Everyone went out of their way to make us comfortable. We had a great experience at the hotel thanks to the wonderful staff. Also enjoyed being so closed to Universal Studios and CityWalk. Not having to park our car or worry about that was great!

title: My hotel experience was great!
comment: The hotel is clean and well maintained. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious, clean and inviting. The beds are sooo comfortable! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends, family and colleagues. Very satisfied with my stay and I will be back.

title: Outstanding staff!
comment: This is our fourth stay at Belvoir Miami Airport and we look forward to a return visit! Special kudos to Miguel in the bar restaurant and David at the front desk.

title: Roller Bed
comment: The Cot or Roller Bed was very comfortable.

title: loved hotel except for below
comment: did not get upgraded. Was told by man at check in that the room was best. I was very unhappy with the room that I paid EXTRA points for and was told by Grandbourne that it was the best room. I called to ask if there was a better room, Nora said yes and I told her above and it was my wifes birthday ; after 3hours I got a GREAT room, the one I should have gotten in the first place, was surprised that for inconvience no SORRY or DRINK

title: this hotel was great
comment: we loved staying at this hotel it was really great, our room was clean and very nice. we would be staying here again..

title: great service
comment: I needed some help finding a local busniess. The front desk went above and beyond the call of duty

everyoneShouldKnow: Conveniently located to high end shopping and restaurants.
title: The mini suite was great!
comment: The king bed was as comfortable as home. The bathroom had two separated sinks and the closet was very large.

title: noise
comment: family w/kids next door was too loud

title: This hotel has great features.
comment: I would have preferred to know when I checked in that the house keeping services and bell staff automatically received a gratituty instead of at checkout..

everyoneShouldKnow: will not get a good night sleep and staff is not very friendly
title: High price for bad experience
comment: Beautiful view, horrible location, trains come through every 30 minutes and wake you up, staff is extremely unfriendly and rude. Breakfast bar is almost horrible if not unhealthy. Undercooked food.

title: Last weekend before school
comment: Family went out for last vacation before school starts. Had a good stay. Room was big enough and staff was great. Very busy with lots of people. That's San Diego I guess.

title: stay
comment: i thought the hotel was absolutely gorgeous. extremely professional staff and the rooms were exceptionally nice due to the price i paid. i would recommend this hotel to anyone

everyoneShouldKnow: It is an all suites hotel.
title: This Hotel has a excellent staff and great rooms....
comment: The Hotel itself has fabulous amenities like a resturant, snack shop, bar, pool, gym, washer & dryer. This property is on a huge lot with mature trees . It is well kept and very clean, Housekeeping and maintenance are always prompt &.nice. The general manager is excellent at his job and really seems to go the extra mile to keep his guests satisfied. My stay has been a "10".

title: Old but Excellent
comment: It is an old facility but service and upkeep are excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: They put an additional hold on your card for "extras" that they don't bother to explain to you, and they sure don't help you resolve.
title: Seriously Lacking Personal Service
comment: It's a nice hotel. A little difficult to find, but nice. However, I'm still trying to get an answer as to why there is still an additional $57.50 hold on my debit card. I've called. I've emailed. I've even contacted my bank. I was told the hold would either stay for 15 days OR the Belvoir can fax a release verifying I owe no additional monies. Except I CANNOT get anyone from Belvoir to give me the time of day, let alone assist me with removing this hold. Its too bad because it is a nice hotel, but given the lack of personal service, I'd rather stay somewhere else.

title: Antique show dealer's experience
comment: This was the closest hotel to the show

everyoneShouldKnow: it looks great on the outside but it needs to be modernized on the inside especially the sign in desk that looks quite let down
title: status of this Belvoir site
comment: My family and I were surprised by the state of the main lobby of that hotel and in particular the sign in desk that looks like a plywood framing with stain applied....

everyoneShouldKnow: They want to sell units not make your stay nice
title: Don't stay here too many other BPG options nearby
comment: Check in is an absolute nightmare and your room will not be ready. Oh yea after you check in and come back to pick up your key you have to wait n check in again. No Platnium recognition did not get points promised or stay credit as promised. Room smelled like mild and they would not move us no upgrade. Wanted us to leave so they could bring a machine to clean the air in the room. Clothes dryer did not work n they did not fix. Food is expensive. Pools are ok location is good. They want you to buy if you. Don't of they don't think you will you get crappy surface. Really. Should be dropped from BPG or be cat1

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location and excellent services and courteous staffs
title: Great Location and excellent services and courteous staffs
comment: I am thankful to your check-in desk service specialist help in accommodating my early check in request. I got the room in 2123 with extra $20 per day for Club level privilege. The room was much smaller than I thought and the club was closed on Saturday for a private function. I was busy on the other two days and I could not enjoy the privilege. Overall, the staffs were very courteous and helpful. Kudos

title: Club level
comment: Although I am a gold card member and paid to be upgraded to the club level I felt like I didn't receive much of an upgrade. Our room had some empty boxes under the bed left by a prior guest. So the staff is doing a rush job when cleaning. The first night I stayed the club lounge was so crowded and there wasn't any food left.

title: Sesame Experience
comment: Best Belvoir so far. The accomodations and rooms were great. Large rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel shuttle provides easy access to New York via Secaucus Junction Station
title: Avoide New York Traffic, stay at Belvoir Meadowlands
comment: Great location and view of NY City, without the cost of a NY Hotel. Allows easy access to NY Penn Station via hotel shuttle. Short train ride (one stop) from Secaucus Junction Station to Penn Station.

title: Hershey
comment: The Hershey is a bit dated but still good. However, the bath room shower didn't drain adequately. Also, we stayed on the 3rd floor, which was the lobby floor, and the hallway to our room had a funny ordor, like a taxi cab disinfectant.

title: Hotel room was nice, water piping needs work
comment: The room was very nice. The problem was the water pipes - they rattled (loudly) everytime someone took a shower. Whether or not it was only adjacent rooms we do not know. The rattling pipes woke us up in the night several times. Even after reporting the problem, we were told they were checking it out. We were never informed about a solution or asked if we wanted another room. The problem was not solved the enitre 12 days we stayed at the hotel and we were not offered a different room or compensated in any way.

title: Cleanliness
comment: I was very surprised about a number of cleanliness issues at this location. We arrived at about 4pm. when we reached the 10th floor, there were dishes with half eaten food, partially full glasses etc in front of 1/2 the doorways. Many appeared to have been there since morning. There was food left in our fridge from prior guest. Also, the hallway smelled aweful. I believe it was the rug & smelled of old mold and cigarerettes and rotten food.

everyoneShouldKnow: Surrounded by water and very near the airport. Very accomodating staff.
title: Relaxing and Rejuvenating Stay
comment: Very relaxing and near the water. I spent every minute while I was in my room with the balcony thrown wide open so I could enjoy the fresh sea air. I highly recommend this hotel. It was comfortable and the staff was amazing. We were close to everything and if not, there was a shuttle. I'll be back!

title: Restaurant
comment: My son and I ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant each day and the servers were very friendly and helpful. We really liked it that breakfast was available all morning on the weekend.

title: Best Kept Secret
comment: Staying at the Belvoir Norfolk is always a memorable experience. The Harbor View rooms are one of the best views in Virginia. It is a hotel that will excite and relax you at the same time! It has some of the most friendly staff of any hotel. We stay there and love exploring the historic districts of Norfolk or the short and easy drive to the Beaches.

everyoneShouldKnow: club lounge has good views, fresh healthy foods, friendly people.
title: wonderful suite and sweet staff
comment: Everything was great. The club lounge people were helpful and on top of influx's in a quick and pleasing way. All food was fresh and tasty. Not one bad thing.

title: Excellent Decoration
comment: I especially love the bathroom here. It was absolutely great! However, the air condition unit ventilation is still not ideal. It blows right at me and I had to turn the air off. But that made me hard to sleep through the night.

title: Room description
comment: Traveling with 2 young kids, location was very convenient. The room was clean and met our needs.

title: Great staff
comment: The staff is great and everything was perfect.

title: Belvoir at Harrisburg Airport Is Excellent
comment: This hotel is convenient and excellent for business or leisure travel. The BEST thing about the room was the beds/pillows/linens! Absolutely the best ever...even better than European hotels. Staff members were friendly and helpful and we enjoyed an excellent buffet breakfast.

title: This hotel needs a facelift
comment: Stayed at this hotel several times and it seems basic amenities have declined over the years: customer service, clean rooms and hallways, comfortable beds. This last stay was the worst: assigned a handicap accessible room without our knowledge or request. Front desk staff slow to accommodate our request to move. Another room smelled of cigarette smoke.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a $1 shuttle that will take you to most of the sites in San Diego!
title: I would recommend, with warnings
comment: The hotel charge to credit card I use to hold the room with, instead of charging a credit card they swiped upon check-in....

title: This hotel is excellent overall
comment: I was very impressed by the cleanliness and ssupport by all of the staff. Everyone from the moment that I checked in.with through check out was helpful

title: Great proximity to LMU
comment: This is my third stay at this hotel.

title: Not as expected
comment: The room out dated the furniture from the 80's and the 90's era the bathroom out dated

everyoneShouldKnow: Love that it is attached to the mall -- very convenient for purchasing gifts.
title: Quite nice
comment: I stayed overnight in a river view, queen bed room. It was on the small side, but sufficient. The closet was very large. Everything was clean and crisp!

title: Hotel
comment: I found it interesting that the suite was very nice and large but had an usually small bathroom. The plumbing wasn't in the best condition. Always a foot of standing water while taking a shower and the tub drained very slowly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool bar with friendly staff
title: Great room and pool bar!
comment: The main reason we stayed at this hotel was for the pool/pool bar and it met our expectations....especially with the happy hour and great prices! The price for the room was also reasonable for an Oceanfront room and were upgraded to the Cabana section for our anniversary which was nice :)

title: Good location
comment: This hotel is going through renovations so once it is completed it will be even better. It is in a great location and in walking distance to everything.

title: Suite - with kitchen area
comment: Only issue I had was we had a two room suite (upstairs and downstairs with a kitchen) and no towels or utensils were ever provided in the kitchen area or first floor bathroom.

title: Awesome hotel
comment: I really enjoyed my stay at your hotel. My first time visiting San Antonio and what a wonderful experience. The hotel was so comfortable, clean, beautiful and historic. The staff was so accomodating. Thank you!

guestFrom: Mission Valley, San Diego, CA, USA
title: Not happy with our stay
comment: Originally book in advanced for a 1 room 2 queen beds. I called hotel day that afternoon saying late arrival. After traveling 8+ hours.

title: Easy access off parkway
comment: Good location near amenities, shops and restaurants, not scenic area but convenient to all and very clean rooms with personable staff!

title: great location
comment: Impressive lobby, congenial & attentive staff, breakfast choices excellent & well prepared, pricey but worth it!

title: Comfortable Beds
comment: Chose this Belvoir because:

title: Well Taken Care of
comment: We arrived a day early for our vacation and the Belvoir was able to accomodate with 2 rooms for my family. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. We'll definitely come back.

title: Nice Family Stay
comment: Perfect location to enjoy stay with family and convenient to shopping and casinos.

title: Great Value
comment: absolutely gorgeous rooms, tastefully furnished. Top class duvet, I could have stayed in bed my whole stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: You will be treated like a valued guest at this very comfortable and centrally located hotel.
title: Outstanding Service in Great Location
comment: What sets this conveniently located hotel apart from other brands is personalized service and the friendly professionalism of its staff. Special thanks to operations manager Fred for going "above and beyond" in resolving an Internet connectivity problem and to the attentive breakfast restaurant wait staff, most notably Ed.

title: This hotel did not meet my standards
comment: I went to the Belvoir for my 14th year anniversary. It was an awful experience. I booked a room on the club level for two nights. The room itself was below par. The furniture looked as if it should have been in a motel 6 hotel. The bathtub sqeaked horribly when we got in it. I requested a different room and asked to keep my view. Well I went down to the front desk and asked about the status of the room change, I was told that they did not know anything about. I was given a room, but I did not have a view at all. My view was of a construction site. Also, the elevators were dirty and so was the club level dining room, The service was not good at all. When needed someting. We called the front desk and was always placed on hold for a minium of 15 minutes before someone answered. i would not stay at this hotel in the future nor would I recommend it to my friends and family. I felt like a number and not like family.

title: Friendly Staff
comment: I was staying there for my son's 9th birthday and was very pleased with what the hotel did for me when I had called to see if a continental breakfast was included in my stay. I was told this it was not included in my stay but when I asked if they did anything special for birthdays they said they would comp our breakfast (for 4) and it would be under my door. Within 20 minutes there was a envelope under my door with a birthday card and a voucher for breakfast. I appreciated the recognition and was pleased that they responded. Thank you for your friendly staff and making my son's stay special :)

title: Staff needs some customer service training
comment: I did not have a good stay at this hotel. My room service did not arrive at the scheduled time and then when food did finally arrive, it was not the correct order. I then was not able to get my meal entirely refunded. The staff did not seem apologetic at all. I had other service issues, as well. A big dissapointment as an BPG member.

everyoneShouldKnow: good location but needs a good clean
title: Needs a good cleaning & update
comment: The bed was comfortable but the room was dirty. There were peanut shells and other "dirt" along the edge of the bed frame when my husband went to look to see if any of our things were under there. The bathroom had moldy grouting and the water would run off the sink counter if any got on it which then meant the board under the sink was dirty because nobody cleaned it and the floor would get very slick and wet. We were in a conference room for a wedding and there was still food on the floor - looked like nobody had vacuumed and we had a crawling baby who we had to watch closely because of these food particles. My brother in law was in the rest room and a Belvoir employee was in there on the phone. When he went to wash his hands the Belvoir employee said something to the extend of "can you keep it down, I'm on the phone". My brother in law said "excuse me" and the employee walked out. I thought that was TERRIBLE and he should have reported it to the hotel manager. We got an event discount but I would NEVER pay full price for this hotel. We paid $150/night and that was even pushing it. The only good thing was the location - so close to every thing we had going on that weekend. One plus, the girl bar tending Saturday & Sunday was superb- very friendly and helpful!

title: Weekend Getaway
comment: Upon check-in we noticed there was not enough towels and wash cloths. We were told by housekeeping that they ran out, but they would bring more. At 9:30pm we called to check...from our call it took over 1 hour to get them. The pool was very disapointing for the size of the hotel. The staff rushed us during check-in. The pillows were the best part of the room!

title: Very enjoyable stay
comment: We felt special to be BPG members. The room was specious and lovely. We had 2 people join us for drinks at the bar, dinner at the Cafe, and visit our room. They also had a lovely time and were impressed with the renovations.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is the only place we stay for Ranger games. Wonderful to be able to walk to the stadium. Plus we really like the pool!
title: Terrific pool & short walk to Rangers stadium
comment: The only place we want to stay for Rangers games. Short walk to the stadium. Terrific pool area with beverage service. Family focused pool party atmosphere, complete with a movie to watch while in the pool or relaxing in a lounge chair. We saw Happy Feet Saturday night.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect to get a chair to sit/lay on by the pool unless you get out there to hold a spot by 7:00AM!!
title: Belvoir Waikiki - reputation is not worthy!
comment: Stayed recently from 8/16-8/23/2012 and encountered numerous problems as follows:

title: My Hotel Stay Terrible and a Disappointment
comment: I booked two suites as an BPG member. One room Room 709 had a musty smell and mold on one corner of the shower room. No ventilation because no windows or shutters to let in fresh air. Room 710 which I also booked had a blood stain on the pull out couch bed. The blood stain was on one of the mattress covers. Apparently the house keeping staff can get away with not changing the beddings for the pull out couch until you decide to use it for a "good" night sleep. I'm greatly disappointed with my stay at Belvoir Columbus suites, I had stayed there at 2008 during the labor day weekend and that's why I returned. I am definitely not going back there again the conditions are deplorable and the hotel quality standards have declined over the last four years. I'm also disappointed with the toll free customer service line which could not elaborate on whether we were enrolled to stay using redeemed points or credit transactions. After my disappointment while staying at Belvoir Columbus suites I was further aggravated with a credit card deduction rather than my points being redeemed. The issue was never resolved and I was flipped back and forth between customer service and the hotel staff and "appeased" with courtesy points. Apparently the hotel was not willing to refund my credit card charges and exchange them with the abundant points I have with my BPG membership

title: Great location for me
comment: I need to be in Santa Monica but do not need to be near the beach. I can walk into the downtown area but am still closer to where I need to be for my purposes. Personnel are great -- parking can be an issue.

title: Great Hotel!
comment: Our stay was great, The hotel is very nice! The staff is very friendly, and the complimentary breakfast was great, They even had make your own belgian waffles.
