The only downfall was the housekeeping staff, they were rude and had no clue how to have a good repore with guests. We asked for towels, they didn;t want to give us any because it was our checkout day. We still needed to take showers!!! So they gave us one. When we would walk in the halls they would talk in their foreign language and giggle, obviously talking about us. I would have given this Hotel 5 star if it werent for the rude housekeeping staff.

title: So Disappointed
comment: I travel frequntly with my job and I chose this hotel for this business trip because of past experience with Belvoir and other Grandbourne Hotels. Unfortunately it didn't meet the standards of others in the chain. As soon as I walked in I noticed my room smelled of sour mildew. I called down before ever unpacking to let them know and request a room change. I was told that it was probably my sheets (why would it be my sheets?) and that she would send someone up to change my linens. Reluctantly I went out for dinner only to find upon my return that noone had been to the room. It was rather late and having had a long day I decided to deal with the issue the next morning. The matter was worsened when I found that the bath towels had an even stronger mildew smell, especially when wet. It was so strong that I felt it was leaving the same odor on my skin. My complaints came with a response that someone would come replace my linens. My sheets were replaced the next day while I was out at meetings but the nicely folded, clean looking towels again were horrific smelling when wet. To top all this off, the ice machine on my floor did not work. Although this would have only been a minor complaint, considering my disgust with the room this only added to my overall dissatisfaction with this hotel.

title: Pleasantly Surprised!
comment: We entered our suite and we were pleasantly surprised: King bed with beautiful view of the harbor connected to a large suite with murphy bed, suite adjoined to double bed room for kids. Like having our own condo. Beds were comfortable and staff met all our needs! Thanks for a enjoyable stay in Baltimore Inner harbor!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to Disney. The staff was very helpful also.
title: Enjoyable
comment: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had a lot of bags plus my 6 year old who was very hyper, so I was so relieved when the valet brought my bags upstairs while I parked the car. The only issue was the construction going on in the parking garage. It made the walk to my room very long and I could hear workers outside my room so the stay wasn't too peaceful. But I did get a good night sleep after they left. I loved the pool side restaurant. My daughter and I ate there after our long swim and the food was delicious. The pool was fun and the room was very clean. I enjoyed my stay overall.

title: Beautiful hotel and friendly staff
comment: We stayed here a couple days after we had to work in Godfrey, Illinois. We usually stay at the Belvoir City Center, but we will stay at the Chalet from now on. They had lots of balcony rooms and the property was beautiful. We brought our dog and they accommodated for him nicely. The room service was pretty good, I was disappointed in the shrimp scampi, but the steak sandwich and the burger were very good. They didn't have mini fridges in their rooms, which was a minus, and I hit the bed frame that was sticking out 3 times, resulting in a bad bruise on my ankle. We were also disappointed that the pool was ice cold, we had been planning on spending most of our time there. But overall the room was spacious and well decorated and the bar was nice too. We will stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very friendly and helpful. The shuttle is a wonderful bonus.
title: Enjoyed our stay
comment: My husband and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our Anniversary. The room was very comfortable. We had everything we needed and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The shuttle took us to the Power and Lights District and brought us back. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty and I would highly recommend this hotel. I would like to put in a special thank you to Torrence, the shuttle driver.

title: Hotel facilities
comment: Hotel is in a good and quiet location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Offers a discount to Nurses and Teachers.
title: Always great to stay here.
comment: We love staying at this hotel. Close to everything at Disney. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. Staff is great.

everyoneShouldKnow: The bed and bath linens were fantastic!
title: Luxury Hotel
comment: Finally, a hotel that provides luxurious bedding and towels and enough of both. I did not have to ask for anytime extra, it was already provided. The room was spacious and the bed linen was so nice, I was so warm and toasty in the bed. The towels and toiletries were wonderful. The starbucks coffee was awesome. My room was partial oceanview but I saw so much more of the ocean which was wonderful. Enjoyed my stay!!!

title: Nice hotel with good location
comment: This hotel eas very clean, located on the Riverwalk and clost to Navy Pier and Michigan ave.

title: wonderful stay
comment: We had a wonderful stay . They staff was very helpful the rooms were clean and the swimming pool was great for the girls. The guys in the valet parking are wonderful.They helped us and told us where to go the entire trip. We will be coming back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Walls are paper thin!! Get ready to hear EVERYTHING! No exaggeration, everything!
title: Never again
comment: To begin, the guy who checked us in was extremely rude. Then did not give us any direction to where the parking garage was. Then when we did find the right place to park there was a 'lot full' sign that we thought was accurate not just a detour. When we finally got to our room it had no mini fridge, which okay, that's fine. But no full length mirror either. Just a little annoying. The walls of the room were paper thin. We heard everything from door opening and closing, slamming, the ice machine, other peoples conversations in the hallways, and most importantly we could hear full conversations in the room next to us. Not only could we hear their conversations but we could hear all kinds of innapropriate adult noises. Not to mention our bed was shaking thru the walls! If that's not enough the room never cooled off to reach our requested 70 degrees Fahrenheit. The only plus was that we could change the fan to continuous which helped blocked out SOME of the noises. We were celebrating our 5 year anniversary, so we kept our spirits high and tried to use this awkard situation to the best we could. Next time we stay down town OKC we will definitely stay elsewhere in the city. Too bad because we had such great expectations.

title: pleasant surprise
comment: Knew nothing about Tampa area, needed a suite after family member had surgery at Tampa General and we needed to be in area for 4 weeks. Got lucky picking this property - easy on the eye with live plants in atrium and as I was alone for a while, the setup of all rooms opening into atrium made me feel safe. Staff was just lovely, always eager to assist. Restaurant was pleasant surprise too with above average hotel food. Only criticism was carpet very dirty and needed cleaning and bed mattresses need flipping or even replacing.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is perfect, just one block away from the piers.
title: Not 100% positive
comment: We stayed for two nights in room 4111. The room was spacious and clean. The kingsize bed was very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. The check-in was very efficient. The location is perfect, just one block away from the piers. And from me no complaints about the price of the parking, I knew upfront that the prices are high in San Francisco.

title: Very nice hotel
comment: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.

title: Great location, service sub par
comment: We stayed in the Bay Tower. The staff was horrible. The facilities in the Marina Tower were extremely useful, the food was delicious, gym was impeccable, and the staff were much more friendly. However, due to my experience in the Bay Tower, I would not recommend the hotel to anyone.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice staff, location too far north of the city's action, $50 to park car over night through 6 pm following day.
title: Time to refurbish
comment: I guess considering it was San Francisco, the price was perhaps in line with the accommodations. The bedroom area was large and modern, but the bathroom was teeny tiny, and the hallways were in poor condition; scraped paint, worn carpeting. For example, with one bathroom light switch, I couldn't turn on the light in the toilet area without also turning on the light in the outer sink area, which lit up the bedroom in the middle of the night. Only one set of of towels provided. Location is okay, but the Fisherman's Wharf is old style fishing wharf, away from the real action down on the Market Street wharf area.

title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: Beautiful hotel located within walking distance of the Anaheim Convention Center. Great amenities and good restaurants. Very enjoyable stay. Thank you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful views, lovely location, beautiful hotel
title: Shuttle to hotel
comment: This was the most difficult part of our stay. We tried to call the hotel when we were ready at the airport for pick-up and it rang and rang with no answer. We finally saw a van after waiting 30 minutes and trying to call several times, as well as watching shuttles from every other hotel arrive. We thought the shuttle was there to pick us up, but it was picking up a dozen attendents from the airline. They did let us on the shuttle, but made it clear that they were contracted to pick up the attendants, who had not been waiting at all. We were not impressed with the pick up that night. It felt like only the airline attendants were important and they didn't care when we got picked up at all. In talking to the hotel staff on duty, they seemed to re-iterate that the attendants were contracted and we had to just wait for a shuttle to come along and maybe it would be longer than 30 minutes. That is a long time to wait when the hotel is less than 5 minutes from the airport.

title: everything I needed for a tough trip
comment: I got more support than I expected from your busy staff. California to L I -N Y for a family funeral. Result of recent Brentwood house explosion. My niece. Very prompt assistance. This old Brooklyn boy was impressed. My thanks to all especially STACY. Thanks Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Renovations at the property are most welcome and have improved the hotel.
title: Staff needs training on Platinum benefits
comment: Renovations at the property are most welcome and have improved the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's close to Sesame Place. Provides shuttle bus service to/from Sesame Place - very convenient!
title: Queens NY to Langhorne
comment: Bathroom needs to be painted, spruced up.

title: Not as advertised
comment: For a room that advertises "oversized rooms" and a large selection of suites, I was extremely disappointed. The only room that was even potentially smaller that I have ever stayed in was in NYC. Particularly disappointing for an BPG platinum member.

title: Feels like home away from home...
comment: Each time I visit my daughter in Boston, I stay at the Belvoir. The staff has always made me feel comfortable and is very accomodating. When I stay at the Belvoir Boston, I feel like I'm visiting old friends...from Kate in the valet area to Brenda in room service, everyone is friendly and approachable. The rooms are very well furnished and quieter than most hotels. The location could not be any better and it is very easy to go anywhere with the Belvoir Boston as a base. I could stay at another hotel, but I don't want to because I always know how my stay will go before I get there. It's just overall a great hotel with wonderful staff!

title: I liked this place
comment: This was my first time staying at the Belvoir in Needham. It was a nice experience. My room on the club level was excellent and in great condition. I ate dinner at the sports bar; the food was good, and the service was good too. It looked to be some college students moving on or a group of young people planning to stay for a while, but everything was orderly. There was a bit of construction going on the morning of the 27th when I checked out, but there was no inconvenience at all. This hotel made my business trip a good experience.

title: A+ for everything!
comment: . Everyone we met from the time we pulled up to registration had a smile on their face. The check in person was most gracious and accommodating. Our room was spotless and we never had a better night sleep. The hotel location was perfect with lots of food choices nearby. Would definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are very clean there isn't a lot of noisy guests.
title: Very pleased with our stay
comment: I was very concerned with finding a family-friendly place to stay while my family and I were vacationing in Atlantic City. I was very pleased with the Sheration and it exceeded my expectations. The distance from the hotel to the boardwalk is a short enough distance that you can walk there easily with a child. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Good place to stay.
comment: Some of the furniture covers in the hotel room were becoming a bit frayed.

title: Very convenient airport hotel
comment: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel when picking up/dropping off family and friends on International flights. Shuttle service was the best! Beds were comfortable and Club Lounge was nice. Would stay here again.

title: Jet plane volume noise from Air Conditioner
comment: I've slept in a lot of hotels, but I've never slept (or tried to sleep) in one with such an incredibly loud AC system. Unfortunately it was hot during our stay so we couldn't sleep with it off. If we had the unit set to Auto, the sound difference would wake me up every time it turned on. And having it constantly on Low setting was like trying to sleep on a run way at an airport. I don't know what can be done to fix this, but it is definitely a problem.

title: Can't resist the Heavenly Bed!!!
comment: I enjoyed my stay at the Belvoir Suites Philadelphia Airport. I stayed there for a meeting. When I got the travel info for my meeting and I read that our host hotel was a Belvoir, my immediate response was, "YAAAAYYY! I get my Heavenly Bed!!!"

title: this hotel is dated and need upgrade
comment: This hotel is dated and needs an upgrade. Wegot three rooms and one the sheets were not changed, the other had many small bugs crawling between the door that connects the to rooms,and the third room had black ants!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is next to the Prudential Center (great shopping) and very close to the Subway. It's only a 15 minute walk to Fenway as well.
title: Good location
comment: We were in Boston for two days and one night and checked in to the Belvoir for our stay. The hotel was conveniently located close to Fenway Park, Subway stations and within walking distance to shops and restaurants. Room was small for two double beds but it was very clean and the staff was very friendly. I would stay at this Belvoir again and would recommend it to anyone visiting Boston.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location in the Epcot resorts area is great.
title: Location, location, location
comment: We were a bit apprehensive about staying at a non-Disney resort for our first ever trip to Disney, but there were very few ways that our stay at the Dolphin could not have been better. Great room(Epcot fireworks), wonderful pool area, and a helpful staff. Other than Downtown Disney, travel was quick and easy. Especially to Hollywood Studios and Epcot via the boat. Shula's was awesome and the credit for Camp Dolphin made it even better. The resort fee ,however, was a bit ridiculus. It was for health club(closed), wi-fi(terrible, not worth connecting) and 2 bottles of water. So I essentially paid this fee for 2 bottles of water. The wi-fi would have been nice because 4g/3g is spotty at best throughout Disney world.

title: Pretty good value
comment: I was cautioned from the review site, but abnormal things were not appeared for my staying. Rather more fun to meet a lady at club lounge who was one of the most friendly staffs I ever met. Also I had a AAA rate room, so the value stand point of the hotel, Thumbs UP! I would not hesitate to give 5.

title: Overall
comment: The hotel needs refurbishing. the outside sign is partially broken and crowded by trees. could be a little cleaner..odor in lobby either from the water features or the restaurant

title: The staff here is the best
comment: The staff really went out of their way to make my stay great. The only complaint I had was the plumbing. When I called the front desk, maintenance was there in in 5 minutes. Everyone works very well together to make you feel at home and cared for.

title: Excellent hotel central to everything
comment: Having stayed here before I was always impressed by the location, it's a busy hotel and you don't get the attenTion with bags etc but the hotel itself is very comfortable and the rooms are modern.

everyoneShouldKnow: How peaceful and tranquil the surroundings are.
title: gorgeous setting and surroundings
comment: I always enjoy the beauty of this resort, it's exceptional service is constant. The pool area, spa, golf course and stables are fantastic.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service at the front desk and if you are a golfer they can set you up at a private golf course nearby.
title: Pool and Spa
comment: The heated pool was nice, but there was no whirlpool/spa. Please add one if possible.

title: Great trip!
comment: We checked in on a Monday and were initially disappointed with our room location and called the desk to see if we could be moved. They personally came to our room with new keys and offered to move our luggage. Our rooms were great. Also, the concierge was so helpful with any excursions we wanted to do and the staff was always courteous and eager to meet our needs. Would definitely go back!

title: Continues to be a bad experience 2 months later
comment: We arrived at the hotel on July 5th for a dance convention that my daughter was attending. I had made reservations in JAN for this hotel. Upon checking in I was told that they did not have a double bed room that I reserved that they only had a king bed with a chaise; so started my horrible experience. I told the girl that would not do and she went and got her manager Kenny. Kenny and basically says the same thing and I ask HOW if I reserved a room 6 months ago and you not have it. He told me he could try and explain it but it didnt matter because they didnt have it. He said it with such attitude and condensation that caused me to get angrier at this situation. He then tried to blame it on the dance convention we were attending and I told him that wasnt going to work since it was Belvoir I had booked with. He told me it would be the next day before they would have a room with a double bed and that I would need to contact them in the morning and be in my room so they could get us moved over. We took the room they had and I left to join the group. Upon talking to another mom in my group she was told they didnt have a room ready but that the housekeeping staff was behind and it would be ready soon and they offered her $50 off per night she was there. She and I went back to the desk so someone could tell me why I was told something different and why nothing was offered to me as a discount. Spoke with Kenny AGAIN and got the same answer with the same attitude that the other mothers witnessed as well. Lucky for me another mom in our group said that the room we got would be better for them and we were able to switch, NOTE I FIXED THE ISSUE NOT Belvoir!!!!!! The following say I called down to find out the status of the fridge we had requested since as well that had not been received. I had been told the night before that there was a waiting list and I should get one soon. Of course when I called down and spoke to an agent who got me manager on duty Luke he didnt have me on the waiting list. He and I spoke at length about the previous night and how I fixed the problem myself and he told me they would allow me to keep my credit of $50/ per night. I laughed ALLOW ME that wasnt even a question anymore. He told me he would call me back in 15 minutes about the refrigerator. He did and told me it would be brought to our room in 15 minutes. 45 minutes later I call back down and get someone in guest services I asked to speak to Luke she asked if she could help and I said no I need to speak to Luke, She transferred me and I got his voicemail. I called back got the same lady and she gave me her manager who got on the phone and was yelling (the other mother with us in the room could hear her across the room) at me about how Luke shouldnt have promised me anything. I said he did and she said well she would just get me the General Manager Finally I thought No, I got his VM so I called back to ask to have him paged or something and I again got the same guest services lady who told me, Ms we cannot just get him out of a meeting to talk to you I will leave a message with his secretary and she HUNG UP ON ME!!!! I grabbed me hotel key and set off to find the manager myself I was directed to the 4th floor and got to talk to him face to face.. He apologized and spoke very frank which I appreciated and I thought things were solved. We enjoyed the rest of our trip, got my bill before we left and saw that they would credit me and home we came Its now 2 months later and I HAVE YET TO RECEIVE THE CREDIT ON MY BILL!!! GO FIGURE I would not recommend this hotel at all.

title: Great Stay1
comment: The staff knew that it was my first time staying at the hotel, so they gave me a room on the 10th floor with a balcony that allowed me a view of the fireworks at Disneyland.

title: Poor Service 7-24
comment: Hotel staff informed me upon check-in that no rooms were availabe with King Size bed, although I had pre-paid for one. Why does your system let you pre-pay for a room thats not available??? After me going round and round with them, they did have rooms with KS beds available and put me in the north tower. Room did not have adequate towels, room service had to be contacted twice before anyone brought more towels. Bathtub did not drain (at all) after showering, I was standing in 3 or 4 inches of water. No one informed me of a $21 Parking fee. Poor all the way around. I would not and will not recommend this Hotel.

title: Tropical storm visit
comment: We stopped at the Yankee Clipper during Isaac which, obviously, limited use of outside facilities. The view from our balcony was dramatic and the hotel must have gigantic generators because loss of power wasn't more than a second. The food options are somewhat limited -- but everything was very good, especially the Mexican (not Texican) dinner. The only disappointment was the very restricted space around the media center where free Wi-Fi was available. Fifteen feet from the center and my iPad couldn't connect. The fitness center has modern equipment and enough of it.

title: I was not happy
comment: You have a white, tall, male bartender who uses his head to give direstions to guests in a rude manner and asks like he is going out of his way to help you. I went to the restranant to order some food and stood there for about 5 mins, I walked to the back and the manager was there, I told him that I was standing at the front, could someone help me, he stated yes she will be with you. 10 mins more and a lady came to help me, I told her I wanted to order some food

everyoneShouldKnow: They charge for rooms with a view.
title: Renovated, but not fully
comment: When inquiring, we were told that the entire hotel was renovated last year, well it looks like only the linens, bed, carpet and drapes were but the bathroom looks like it was the original. The grout was stained and the area behind the door was dusty and dirty. Looked like it wasn't swept or vacuumed in weeks. In a way I don't blame the housekeeping staff, the bathroom is tiny and hard to get in unless you step right between the toilet and the tub. So when you're cleaning in a rush, its an area you could easily miss.

title: Great location
comment: Chose this hotel due to proximity to Wash U. Perfect location; gorgeous neighborhood (perfect for walks), good access to great restaurants and convenient shopping.

title: wonderful staff
comment: Hotel is a great place to stay when flying out or into jfk. We arrived from a long flight delay and reached the hotel at 3A.M. and was greeted with warmth and consideration by the front desk. The staff is so well trained and look out for the guests comfort.

everyoneShouldKnow: Front desk staff seemed a bit junior and disorganized.
title: Close to SoHo, The Village, Tribeca. Canal is a little sketchy...
comment: This is a great, consistent property on Canal St on the boarder of Tribeca (as it is on the South side of Canal street, it *is* technically "below Canal"). Easy walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, SoHo, NoHo, The Village, NYU. Canal St, with all of the knock-off designer watch, sunglass, and handbag hawkers, can be a bit intimidating if you are not expecting it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, both winter and summer.
title: Good location; meets all BPG criteria
comment: We have used this hotel as a base for skiing in the winter as well as for shopping in the summer for many years. The staff are good and the service consistent. The club lounge is on the small side but there is always an attendant there during breakfast and evening hours to clean up, bring additional food etc.

title: Manhattan
comment: My room on the 43rd floor seemed newly remodeled and very nice. Everything worked and was clean, the floor was quite quiet.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff and the location are outstanding
title: The staff is outstanding
comment: The Greeting was outstanding - we love Grandbourne - it makes us feel at home. Mr McKnight at the desk was awesome and so was Ed in the Club Lounge. Kudos to the staff!!!!

title: This hotel lacks features
comment: We were very disappointed in the "free" wireless access in the lobby area. Very unreliable. We also spoke w/others who paid for wireless service in their room and they kept getting kicked off. I've stayed in hotels that were lower in cost and had better ammenities.

title: Good, clean & friendly hotel
comment: This was a good, clean hotel with a great fitness center. Restaurant is undergoing a renovation, but the food is still good in the temporary room upstairs. The girls at the front desk were super friendlyt.

title: Lost Trust
comment: The concierge team provided inept recommendations. The first day I was sent to a restaurant that had already closed & then sent me to a nail salon that was a rip off. When I went back the evening team was surprised I had been sent to that place sine the one the one they recommend Is cheaper & friendly. As a gold member, I expect the concierge service to be competent & they were not.

title: Excellent visit to Belvoir Universal
comment: We have visited LA many times and have stayed at several hotels. The Belvoir exceeded our expectations in every way.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not near anything. Plan on walking if you are without a car.
title: Nice Stay
comment: Always a nice stay. Rooms are comfortable and clean though becoming outdated. Parking can be a challenge if you stay during a function.

title: Very pleasant staff and comfortable, clean beds, also an abundance of computers to check you e-mails.
comment: Everyone very pleasant and conveniently located.

title: This is a nice hotel
comment: I would recommend this hotel.

title: Internet in the room not worked
comment: My internet (both wire and wireless) in the room did not work. After working over the phone with tech team, the problem did not get solved. Tech team escalated to the 2nd tier support, but no one ever called me back. I had to attend my morning conference calls without any slide deck since I could not get to my emails. This is too bad. As a business traveler, without internet in the hotel room, you are pretty much dead in the water. Then I reliazied my hair dryer did not work after coming out of shower!!Later I found out all the wall sockets in the bathroom did not have power!! Not a pleasant stay by any means!!

title: Always a great stay
comment: The Belvoir Gateway Atlanta is always great with a professional, friendly staff. Tristan was fantastic - we really appreciate his proactive support of our various needs.

title: This hotel could write the book on hospitality.....
comment: It was a pleasure to be a recent guest of the Belvoir Suites Chicago Elk Grove.

title: Great service
comment: Great service and location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Daily Early/Late Entry to Disney Parks. Free Boat Service to Disney Epcot, Disney Hollywood Studios, The Boardwalk and Free Buses to All Disney Waterparks and Theme Parks.
title: Dolphin Delivers Disney to Doorstep
comment: We've stayed at this hotel several times. Each time it proves to be one of the best experiences of our Disney vacation. Cocktails at the lobby bar are top notch and always quick to relax at the indoor fountains. There are GREAT restaurants, our favorite is Kimonos Sushi Bar-- never disappoints. They even have Karaoke late nite. The boat service is free and runs to The Boardwalk-- where you can buy food, pizza, and there are restaurants including ESPN and a Dancehall. More importantly the boats run to Disney Hollywood Studios and Epcot-- which is always a fun way to arrive. And as a Disney hotel you get free early/late access to the parks. Free buses to all the other Disney Parks. The Mandara Spa is always a relaxing experience-- with specials often available. The Pool is huge (there are actually several pools) has a waterslide, and at least 3 Whirlpools/Hot Tubs. The Cabanas Bar offers great poolside drinks and snacks. Check out the basement restaurant which also has sundries like candy, snacks, sandwiches and dinner specials you can take to go -- cheaper than room service. Usually a bit higher priced than other BPG hotels in Orlando, but it's WORTH IT-- the convenience, the location, the pool, the restaurants, and the DISNEY DAILY EXTRA ACCESS to Early Park Entry and Late Park Stays.

title: Miami Style: Renovated Resort Remade
comment: Much more Miami than Orlando now that the hotel has been renovated into a "resort." Very close to Disney. Nice restaurant and excellent food with great service-- though it was really large and not many of the touristy families seemed to be eating there. The hotel is walking distance to lots of restaurants.

everyoneShouldKnow: Private beach is great for collecting shells. Warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico.
title: Beachfront Beauty Brings It.
comment: Even in the rain this hotel delivered. We arrived during hurricane season. The staff really liked working at this great hotel-- who wouldnt? The location is right on the beach.

title: Excellent place to stay
comment: Found this hotel a fabulous place to attend a conference, as well as a place to stay,

everyoneShouldKnow: The qualiity of the food and drinks at your restaurants / bars// VIEWS !!!!!!!!!!!
title: Excellent location
comment: Overall excellent location. Easy access to the Marina.
